m

ma 1.1

letter. (gram) letter m; 31st letter of the alphabet; nasal consonant ~

Grammar letter, masc
Meaning (gram) letter m; 31st letter of the alphabet; nasal consonant
Sanskrit ma
ma 2.1

masc. moon [ma1] ✗
ma 3.1

ve. (gram) ma; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person plural ✓

Grammar ve, masc
Meaning (gram) ma; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person plural
Sanskrit ma

Examples

482, 508. dā'd'antass'aṃ mi mesu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 482

492, 499. asasmā mi mānaṃ mhi mhā'ntalopo ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 492
ma 4.1

abbrev. abbreviation of Majjhima (Nikāya) ✓

Grammar abbrev
Meaning abbreviation of Majjhima (Nikāya)
Sanskrit madhyama

Example

sukhaṃ {so sukhaṃ (sī. syā. kaṃ. pī.) ma. ni. 3.364 aṭṭhakathāṭīkā oloketabbā} ce vedanaṃ vedayati, visaṃyutto naṃ vedayati.

SN 54.8 padīpopamasuttaṃ

makara

masc. sea-monster; shark; sword-fish ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning sea-monster; shark; sword-fish
Sanskrit makara

Example

ālokasandhiparikammāyā'ti vātapānaparikammāya setavaṇṇaṃ kāḷavaṇṇaṃ gerukaparikammaṃ mālākammaṃ latākammaṃ makaradantakaṃ pañcapaṭikaṃ.

VIN 2.5.2.9 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
makaradantaka

nt. (of interior decoration) sword-fish tooth pattern; shark’s tooth pattern [makara + danta + ka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (of interior decoration) sword-fish tooth pattern; shark’s tooth pattern
Construction makara + danta + ka
makaradanta + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit makaradaṃṣṭrā

Example

ālokasandhiparikammāyā'ti vātapānaparikammāya setavaṇṇaṃ kāḷavaṇṇaṃ gerukaparikammaṃ mālākammaṃ latākammaṃ makaradantakaṃ pañcapaṭikaṃ.

VIN 2.5.2.9 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
makaranda

masc. nectar of a flower ✗
makasa

masc. mosquito; gnat [√mas + aka] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning mosquito; gnat
Root Family √mas
Root √mas×1 a (buzz, hum)
Construction √mas + aka
masaka > makasa
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change masaka > makasa (metathesis)
Commentary (MNa) makasā'ti sabbamakkhikā
Sanskrit maśaka
Sanskrit Root √maś √miś 1 (buzz, hum)

Examples

khamā bhavissāma sītassa uṇhassa jighacchāya pipāsāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīsapa-samphassānaṃ duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ

AN 4.157 rogasuttaṃ

andhakamakasā na vijjare,
kacche rūḷhatiṇe caranti gāvo,
vuṭṭhim'pi saheyyum'āgataṃ,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
makasajātaka

nt. Jātaka 44 (JA 44) ✗
makasavāraṇa

nt. mosquito net ✗
makāra

masc. (gram) letter m; 41st letter of the alphabet; nasal consonant [ma + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, letter, comp
Meaning (gram) letter m; 41st letter of the alphabet; nasal consonant
Construction ma + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (ma + kāra)
Sanskrit makāra

Examples

gamu'icc'etassa dhātussa anto makāro ccho hoti vā sabbāsu paccayavibhattīsu. gacchamāno, gacchanto. gacchati, gameti. gacchatu, gametu. gaccheyya. gameyya. agacchā, agamā. agacchī, agamī. gacchissati, gamissati. agacchissā, agamissā. gamisse'ti kim'atthaṃ? icchati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 476

byañjanānaṃ k'ādayo makār'antā pañcapañcaso akkharavanto vaggā.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
makāranta

adj. (gram) ending with the letter m [ma + kāra + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) ending with the letter m
Construction ma + kāra + anta
Synonym manta
Sanskrit makāra + anta

Examples

abyayībhāvam'icc'anena kv'attho? aṃvibhattīna makār'antā abyayībhāvā.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 319

byañjanānaṃ k'ādayo makār'antā pañcapañcaso akkharavanto vaggā.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa

makkaṭa

masc. monkey; ape ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning monkey; ape
Sanskrit markaṭa

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

ahiṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. suṃsumāraṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. pakkhiṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. kukkuraṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. siṅgālaṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya. makkaṭaṃ gahetvā daḷhāya rajjuyā bandheyya.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
makkaṭaka

masc. spider [makkaṭa + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from makkaṭa
Meaning spider
Construction makkaṭa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym uṇṇanābhi
Sanskrit markaṭaka

Example

ye rāgaratt'ānupatanti sotaṃ,
sayaṃkataṃ makkaṭako'va jālaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna vajanti dhīrā,
anapekkhino sabbadukkhaṃ pahāya.

DHP 347 taṇhāvaggo
makkaṭacchāpaka

masc. young male monkey; baby boy monkey [makkaṭa + chāpaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning young male monkey; baby boy monkey
Construction makkaṭa + chāpaka
Compound kammadhāraya (makkaṭa + chāpaka)
Commentary (MNa) makkaṭacchāpakan'ti makkaṭapotakaṃ.
Sanskrit markaṭa + śāvaka

Example

atha kho, bhante, sā māṇavikā taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca, gaccha tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpakaṃ kiṇitvā ānehi, yo me kumārakassa kīḷāpanako bhavissatī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
makkaṭacchāpikā

fem. young female monkey; baby girl monkey [makkaṭa + chāpikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning young female monkey; baby girl monkey
Construction makkaṭa + chāpikā
Compound kammadhāraya (makkaṭa + chāpikā)
Sanskrit markaṭa + śāvaka

Example

sace pana tvaṃ, bhoti, kumārikaṃ vijāyissasi, tassā te ahaṃ āpaṇā makkaṭacchāpikaṃ kiṇitvā ānessāmi, yā te kumārikāya kīḷāpanikā bhavissatī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
makkaṭajātaka

nt. Jātaka 173 (JA 173) ✗
makkaṭavīthi

fem. track of a monkey; monkey's path [makkaṭa + vīthi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning track of a monkey; monkey's path
Construction makkaṭa + vīthi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (makkaṭānaṃ + vīthi)
Sanskrit markaṭa + vīthi

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, luddā makkaṭavīthīsu lepaṃ oḍḍenti makkaṭānaṃ bādhanāya.

SN 47.7 makkaṭasuttaṃ
makkaṭasannibha

adj. like a monkey [makkaṭa + sannibha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a monkey
Construction makkaṭa + sannibha
Compound kammadhāraya (makkaṭa + sannibha)
Sanskrit markaṭa + saṃnibha

Example

suyuttavādī dvipadānam'uttamo,
mahābhisakko naradammasārathi,
cittaṃ calaṃ makkaṭasannibhaṃ iti,
avītarāgena sudunnivārayaṃ.

masc. cane; bamboo ~

makkha

masc. depreciating; denigrating; smirching; lit. smearing [√makkh + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from makkheti
Meaning depreciating; denigrating; smirching; lit. smearing
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym amakkha
Commentary (MNa) paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇo makkho, tesaṃ vināsanaraso, tadavacchādanapaccupaṭṭhāno.
Notes see BHS mrakṣa for discussion on meaning
Sanskrit mrakṣa
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Examples

yassa rāgo ca doso ca,
māno makkho ca pātito,
sāsapo'r'iva ār'aggā,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 407 brāhmaṇavaggo

aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.

DHP 150 jarāvaggo
makkhagaru

adj. valuing denigrating others; who gives weight to smirching [makkha + garu] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning valuing denigrating others; who gives weight to smirching
Construction makkha + garu
Commentary (NPa) kodhamakkhagarū'ti kujjhanalakkhaṇaṃ kodhaṃ, paraguṇamakkhanalakkhaṇaṃ makkhañ'ca garuṃ katvā uddhaṃ katvā ukkhipitvā caranto.

Meaning fact of valuing denigrating others; fact of giving weight to smirching

makkhaṇa

nt. smearing, anointing with [√makkh] ✗
makkhati

pr. (+acc) smears; dirties [√makkh + *e + ti] ~

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning smears; dirties
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Base √makkh + e > makkhe > makkha (irreg)
Construction makkha + ti
Synonym sammakkheti
Notes usual form is makkheti
Sanskrit mrakṣati

makkhana 2

nt. depreciating; denigrating; smirching [√makkh] ✗
makkhapariññāsutta

nt. Itivuttaka 13 (ITI 13) ✗
makkhapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by contempt; being consumed by smearing [makkha + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by contempt; being consumed by smearing
Construction makkha + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (makkhena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit mrakṣa + paryavasthāna

Example

makkhī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, makkhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. makkhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ
makkhapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by denigration; consumed by smearing [makkha + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by denigration; consumed by smearing
Construction makkha + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (makkhena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Sanskrit mrakṣa + paryavasthita

Example

makkhī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, makkhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. makkhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ
makkhappahāna

nt. giving up deprecation; abandoning denigration; rejecting disparagement [makkha + pahāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning giving up deprecation; abandoning denigration; rejecting disparagement
Construction makkha + pahāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (makkhaṃ + pahāna)
Sanskrit mrakṣa + prahāṇa

Example

app'icchatā sappurisehi vaṇṇitā,
makkhappahānaṃ vūpasamo dukhassa,
itissu maṃ citta tadā niyuñjasi,
idāni tvaṃ gacchasi pubbaciṇṇaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
makkhali

masc. name of a ascetic teacher; Makkhali Gosāla; lit. who carries a bamboo cane ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a ascetic teacher; Makkhali Gosāla; lit. who carries a bamboo cane
Commentary (SNa) makkhalī'ti tassa nāmaṃ.
Notes (MW) maskarin m. a religious mendicant, a Brāhman in the fourth order (who carries a bamboo cane)
Sanskrit maskarin

Examples

atha kho sahali devaputto makkhaliṃ gosālaṃ ārabbha bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

ayam'pi kho makkhali gosālo saṅghī c'eva gaṇī ca gaṇ'ācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.

SN 44.9 kutūhalasālāsuttaṃ
makkhaligosālavāda

masc. doctrine of Makkhali Gosāla ✗
makkhalipūraṇā

masc. Makkhali Gosāla and Pūraṇa Kassapa [makkhali + pūraṇa + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning Makkhali Gosāla and Pūraṇa Kassapa
Construction makkhali + pūraṇa + ā
makkhalipūraṇa + ā
Compound dvanda (makkhali ca pūraṇa ca)
Commentary (SNa) makkhalipūraṇāse'ti makkhali ca pūraṇo ca.
Sanskrit maskarin + pūraṇa

Example

pakudhako kātiyāno nigaṇṭho,
ye c'āp'ime makkhalipūraṇāse,
gaṇassa satthāro sāmaññappattā,
na hi nūna te sappurisehi dūre'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
makkhalivāda

masc. doctrine of Makkhali (Gosāla) [makkhali + vāda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning doctrine of Makkhali (Gosāla)
Construction makkhali + vāda
makkhavinaya

masc. removal of denigration; dispelling of deprecation [makkha + vinaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of denigration; dispelling of deprecation
Construction makkha + vinaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (makkhassa + vinaya)
Sanskrit mrakṣa + vinaya

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu makkhī hoti, makkhavinayassa na vaṇṇavādī. yam'pi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu makkhī hoti makkhavinayassa na vaṇṇavādī, ayam'pi dhammo na piyatāya na garutāya na bhāvanāya na sāmaññāya na ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
makkhasutta

nt. Itivuttaka 5 (ITI 5) ✗
makkhikā 1

fem. fly; lit. smearer [√makkh + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from makkheti
Meaning fly; lit. smearer
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Sanskrit makṣikā
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Examples

na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo. kiṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo? tā uppatitvā uppatitvā khādanti, taṃkāraṇā adhipātakā vuccanti sabbā'pi makkhikāyo.

NIDD1 16 sāriputta sutta niddeso
makkhikā 2

fem. honey-bee; lit. smearer [√makkh + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from makkheti
Meaning honey-bee; lit. smearer
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Sanskrit makṣikā
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Example

madhu nāma makkhikāmadhu. phāṇitaṃ nāma ucchumhā nibbattaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ
makkhikānupatati

Meaning flies plague (one); flies attack (one)
Construction makkhikā + anupatati
makkhikāmadhu

nt. bee honey; lit. fly honey [makkhikā + madhu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bee honey; lit. fly honey
Construction makkhikā + madhu
Compound kammadhāraya (makkhikā + madhu)

Sanskrit makṣikā + madhu

Example

madhu nāma makkhikāmadhu. phāṇitaṃ nāma ucchumhā nibbattaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ
makkhita

pp. (+instr) smeared (with); stained (with) [√makkh + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of makkheti (+instr)
Meaning smeared (with); stained (with)
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym amakkhita
Synonym litta, saṃlitta
Sanskrit mrakṣita
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu seyyathā'pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikasaṅkhalikaṃ nimaṃsalohitamakkhitaṃ nhārusambandhaṃ

DN 22.7 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak'antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upasumbheyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ
makkhitvā

abs. (+acc) having smeared; having stained [√makkh + itvā] ~

Meaning having smeared; having stained
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + itvā

Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)
makkhī

adj. who slanders; who denigrates; lit. smearer [√makkh + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from makkheti
Meaning who slanders; who denigrates; lit. smearer
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Construction √makkh + ī
Derivative kita (ī)
Antonym amakkhī
Sanskrit mrakṣin
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Examples

kodhano upanāhī ca,
pāpamakkhī ca yo naro,
vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7

upanāhissa upanāho appahīno hoti, makkhissa makkho appahīno hoti, paḷāsissa paḷāso appahīno hoti, issukissa issā appahīnā hoti, maccharissa macchariyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
makkheti 1

pr. (+acc) smears; rubs off [√makkh + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning smears; rubs off
Root Family √makkh
Root √makkh･8 *e (smear)
Base √makkh + e > makkhe
Construction makkhe + ti
Sanskrit mrakṣayati
Sanskrit Root √mṛkṣ √mrakṣ 1, 6 (stroke)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, ahi gūthagato kiñ'c'āpi na ḍaṃsati, atha kho naṃ makkheti.

AN 3.27 jigucchitabbasuttaṃ
makkheti 2

pr. anoints [√makkh] ✗
makkhetvā

abs. having smeared, having anointed, having rubbed off [√makkh] ✗
makkhesi

aor. smeared, anointed, rubbed off [√makkh] ✗

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning epithet of Sakka
Construction makhā + deva
Synonym māgha, vāsava, sujampati
Variant magghadeva, maghadeva

maga 1

masc. deer; antelope ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning deer; antelope
Variant miga
Sanskrit mṛga

Examples

te hi sotthiṃ gamissanti,
kacche'v'āmakase magā,
jhānāni upasampajja,
ekodi nipakā satā'ti.

SN 2.11 candimasasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sāriputta, āraññako mago manusse disvā vanena vanaṃ gahanena gahanaṃ ninnena ninnaṃ thalena thalaṃ saṃpatati

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
maga 2

masc. beast; brute; wild animal ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning beast; brute; wild animal
Variant miga
Commentary (MNa) mago vā āgacchatī'ti siṅgāni vā khurāni vā koṭṭento gokaṇṇa-khagga-dīpi-varāh'ādibhedo mago vā āgacchati, sabbacatuppadānañ'hi idha mago'ti nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit mṛga

Examples

yo papañcam'anuyutto,
papañc'ābhirato mago,
virādhayī so nibbānaṃ,
yogakkhemaṃ anuttaraṃ.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

parassa ce dhammam'anānujānaṃ,
bālo mago hoti nihīnapañño,
sabb'eva bālā sunihīnapaññā,
sabb'ev'ime diṭṭhiparibbasānā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
magadha

masc. name of a country; modern day Bihar ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a country; modern day Bihar
Sanskrit magadha

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
magadhanāḷi

fem. measure of volume (1 magadhanāḷi = 12 1/2 pala) ✗
magadhamahāmatta

masc. chief minister of Magadha [magadha + mahāmatta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning chief minister of Magadha
Construction magadha + mahāmatta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (magadhassa + mahāmatta)
Variant māgadhamahāmatta
Commentary (VINa) magadhamahāmatto'ti magadharaṭṭhe mahāmatto, mahatiyā issariyamattāya samannāgato, magadharañño vā mahāmatto, mahāamacco'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit magadha + mahāmātya

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā magadhesu viharati dakkhiṇāgirismiṃ ekanāḷāyaṃ brāhmaṇagāme.

uragavaggo 4
magavisāṇa

nt. deer horn [maga + visāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning deer horn
Construction maga + visāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (maga + visāṇa)
Sanskrit mṛga + viṣāṇa

Example

so puratthimena nagarassa navaṃ santh'āgāraṃ kārāpetvā kesamassuṃ ohāretvā khar'ājinaṃ nivāsetvā sappitelena kāyaṃ abbhañjitvā magavisāṇena piṭṭhiṃ kaṇḍuvamāno navaṃ santh'āgāraṃ pavisati, saddhiṃ mahesiyā brāhmaṇena ca purohitena.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
magasira

masc. constellation of Orion ✗
magga 1

masc. road; path; track; way [√magg + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning road; path; track; way
Root Family √magg
Root √magg･8 *e (seek, search)
Construction √magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym amagga
Synonym gamanamagga, pajja, patha, pantha
Sanskrit mārga
Sanskrit Root √mārg 1, 10 (chase)

Examples

vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.

DHP 123 pāpavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, puriso araññe pavane caramāno passeyya purāṇaṃ maggaṃ purāṇ'añjasaṃ pubbakehi manussehi anuyātaṃ.

SN 12.65 nagarasuttaṃ
magga 2

masc. way; means; method [√magg + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning way; means; method
Root Family √magg
Root √magg･8 *e (seek, search)
Construction √magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym amagga
Synonym upakkama, upāya, ñāya, niyāma, patha, pariyāya
Sanskrit mārga
Sanskrit Root √mārg 1, 10 (chase)

Examples

katamo c'ānanda maggo katamā paṭipadā pañcannaṃ oram'bhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ pahānāya

MN 64 mahāmālukyasuttaṃ

sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā'ti,
yadā paññāya passati,
atha nibbindati dukkhe,
esa maggo visuddhiyā.

DHP 277 maggavaggo
magga 3

masc. coat; layering; lit. way [√magg + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning coat; layering; lit. way

Root √magg･8 *e (seek, search)
Construction √magg + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mārga
Sanskrit Root √mārg 1, 10 (chase)

Example

maggena chādentassa dve magge adhiṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṃ maggaṃ āṇāpetvā pakkamitabbaṃ. pariyāyena chādentassa dve pariyāye adhiṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṃ pariyāyaṃ āṇāpetvā pakkamitabbaṃ.

maggaṭṭha 2

adj. who is on the road ✗
maggaṭṭhaṅgikayānayāyī

adj. travelling along in the vehicle of the eightfold path [magga + aṭṭhaṅgika + yāna + yāyī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning travelling along in the vehicle of the eightfold path
Construction magga + aṭṭhaṅgika + yāna + yāyī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maggaṭṭhaṅgikayānena + yāyī)
Commentary (THIa) magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī'ti aṭṭh'aṅgikamaggasaṅkhātena ariyayānena nibbānapuraṃ yāyinī upagatā.
Sanskrit mārga + aṣṭāṅga + yāna + yāyin

Example

s'āhaṃ sugatassa sāvikā,
magg'aṭṭh'aṅgikayānayāyinī,
uddhaṭasallā anāsavā,
suññ'āgāragatā ramām'ahaṃ.

maggati

pr. seeks, tracks, traces out [√magg] ✗
maggadūsī

masc. highway robber; lit. spoiler of the path [magga + dūsī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning highway robber; lit. spoiler of the path
Construction magga + dūsī
Compound kammadhāraya (magga + dūsī)
Sanskrit mārga + dūṣin, dūṣaka

Example

caturo samaṇā na pañcam'atthi,
te te āvikaromi sakkhipuṭṭho,
maggajino maggadesako ca,
magge jīvati yo ca maggadūsī.

maggamūḷha

adj. who has lost the way ✗
maggayati

pr. (+acc) desires; seeks; wants to get [√magg + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning desires; seeks; wants to get
Root Family √magg
Root √magg･8 *aya (seek, search)
Base √magg + aya > maggaya
Construction maggaya + ti
Commentary (THIa) maggayasi patthesi
Sanskrit mārgayati
Sanskrit Root √mārg 1, 10 (chase)

Example

apathena payātum'icchasi,
candaṃ kīḷanakaṃ gavesasi,
meruṃ laṅghetum'icchasi,
yo tvaṃ buddhasutaṃ maggayasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
maggayamāna

prp. (+acc) hunting (for); searching (for); seeking (for) [√magg + *aya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of maggeti, trans (+acc)
Meaning hunting (for); searching (for); seeking (for)
Root Family √magg
Root √magg･8 *aya (seek, search)
Base √magg + aya > maggaya
Construction maggaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym anvesanta, esanta, esamāna, esāna, gavesanta, pariyesamāna
Commentary (MNa) mūsikaṃ maggayamāno'ti sāyaṃ gocaratthāya susirarukkhato nikkhantaṃ rukkhasākhāya mūsikaṃ pariyesanto.
Sanskrit mārgayamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √mārg 1, 10 (chase)

Examples

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma ulūko rukkhasākhāyaṃ mūsikaṃ maggayamāno jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.

Sanskrit mārga + amārga

Examples

gambhīrapaññaṃ medhāviṃ,
magg'āmaggassa kovidaṃ,
uttam'attham'anuppattaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 403 brāhmaṇavaggo

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
maggāmaggakathā

fem. discussion about what is and what is not the path ✗
maggāmaggañāṇadassana

nt. understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road; total understanding of what is and what is not the path [magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road; total understanding of what is and what is not the path
Construction magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maggāmaggassa + ñāṇadassana)
Sanskrit mārga + amārga + jñānadarśana

Example

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhattha

masc. for the sake of purity of understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; for the purpose of purification of knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road [magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana + visuddhi + attha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning for the sake of purity of understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; for the purpose of purification of knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road
Construction magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana + visuddhi + attha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhiyā + attha)
Sanskrit mārga + amārga + jñānadarśana + viśuddhi + artha

Examples

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, āvuso ... kaṅkhāvitaraṇavisuddhi yāva'd'eva magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthā, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi yāva'd'eva paṭipadāñāṇadassanavisuddh'atthā

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
maggāmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi

fem. purity of understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; purification of knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road [magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana + visuddhi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning purity of understanding and insight into what is the right and the wrong way; purification of knowledge and vision of the correct and the incorrect road
Construction magga + amagga + ñāṇa + dassana + visuddhi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maggāmaggañāṇadassanassa + visuddhi)
Sanskrit mārga + amārga + jñānadarśana + viśuddhi

Examples

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddh'atthaṃ bhagavati brahmacariyaṃ vussatī'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

kiṃ nu kho, āvuso, magg'āmaggañāṇadassanavisuddhi anupādāparinibbānan'ti? no h'idaṃ, āvuso.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
maggāmaggañāṇadassanahetu

ind. due to knowledge and vision of what is and what is not the path [maggāmagga + ñāṇadassana + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to knowledge and vision of what is and what is not the path
Construction maggāmagga + ñāṇadassana + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (maggāmaggañāṇadassana + hetu)
Sanskrit mārga + amārga + jñānadarśana + hetu

Example

tadabhiññāya bhagavā assādam'addasa ādīnavam'addasa nissaraṇam'addasa magg'āmaggañāṇadassanam'addasa. tassa assādadassanahetu ādīnavadassanahetu nissaraṇadassanahetu magg'āmaggañāṇadassanahetu atthassa patti hadayassa santi viditā hoti.

AN 10.26 kāḷīsuttaṃ
maggāraha

adj. who should be given right of way; lit. worthy of the road [magga + araha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who should be given right of way; lit. worthy of the road
Construction magga + araha
maggi

aor. sought, tracked, traced out [√magg] ✗
maggika

masc. wayfarer [√magg] ✗
maggita

pp. sought, tracked, traced out [√magg] ✗
maggitvā

abs. having sought, having tracked, having traced out [√magg] ✗
maggeti

pr. (+acc) seeks, tracks, traces out [√magg] ✗
magghadeva

masc. epithet of Sakka [maggha + deva] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning epithet of Sakka
Construction maggha + deva
Synonym māgha, vāsava, sujampati
Variant makhādeva, maghadeva
magghadevaambavana

nt. name of a monastery; lit. Magghadeva's mango grove [magghadeva + ambavana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a monastery; lit. Magghadeva's mango grove
Construction magghadeva + ambavana
Variant maghadevaambavana, makhādevaambavana
magha

masc. name of Sakka during a human life ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of Sakka during a human life
Commentary (SNt) magho'ti sakkass'etaṃ nāmaṃ purimajātianugataṃ.
maghadeva

masc. epithet of Sakka; lit. bountiful god [magha + deva] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning epithet of Sakka; lit. bountiful god
Construction magha + deva
Compound kammadhāraya (magha + deva)
Synonym māgha, vāsava, sujampati
Variant makhādeva, magghadeva
Sanskrit magha + deva

Example

atha kho bhagavā videhesu anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena mithilā tadavasari. tatra sudaṃ bhagavā mithilāyaṃ viharati maghadev'ambavane.

DHP 30 appamādavaggo

Construction maṅku + karoti

Sanskrit maṅku + karoti

Examples

VIN 2.5.4.6 dutiyapavāraṇāsikkhāpadaṃ

upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyyā'ti imesaṃ sutvā codessāmi sāressāmi paṭicodessāmi paṭisāressāmi maṅkū karissāmī'ti

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
maṅku 1

adj. humiliated; embarrassed; ashamed; chagrined; despondent ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning humiliated; embarrassed; ashamed; chagrined; despondent
Sanskrit maṅku

Examples

atthi nu kho me uttari manussadhammo alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso adhigato, yen'āhaṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ

yutto kathāyaṃ parisāya majjhe,
pasaṃsam'icchaṃ vinighāti hoti,
apāhatasmiṃ pana maṅku hoti,
nindāya so kuppati randhamesī.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
maṅku 2

masc. humiliation; embarrassment; shame; despondency ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning humiliation; embarrassment; shame; despondency
Sanskrit maṅku

Example

VIN 2.5.2.3 ujjhāpanakasikkhāpadaṃ
maṅku 3

adj. troubled; upset; disturbed ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning troubled; upset; disturbed
Synonym parittāsī
Variant maṃku, maṅkuta
Sanskrit maṅku

Example

dadāti ve yathāsaddhaṃ,
yathāpasādanaṃ jano,
tattha yo maṅku bhavati,
paresaṃ pānabhojane,
na so divā vā rattiṃ vā,
samādhim'adhigacchati.

DHP 249 malavaggo

idiom. (+loc) is troubled (with); is upset (with); is disturbed (by); is despondent (about) [maṅku + bhavati] ✓

Example

yathāpasādanaṃ jano,
tattha yo maṅku bhavati,
paresaṃ pānabhojane,
na so divā vā rattiṃ vā,
samādhim'adhigacchati.

VIN 2.5.2.3 ujjhāpanakasikkhāpadaṃ

evaṃ vadeyyā'ti upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ bhikkhun'ovādakaṃ avaṇṇaṃ kattu'kāmo ayasaṃ kattu'kāmo maṅkukattu'kāmo evaṃ vadeti

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
maṅkubhāva

masc. humiliation; embarrassment; despondency [maṅku + bhāva] ✓

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning humiliation; embarrassment; despondency
Construction maṅku + bhāva
Compound kammadhāraya (maṅku + bhāva)
Commentary (ANa) maṅkubhāvo'ti nittejatā domanassatā.
Sanskrit maṅku + bhāva

Example

iti'ssa alābhena maṅkubhāvo, maṅkubhūtassa uddhaccaṃ, uddhatassa asaṃvaro, asaṃvutassa ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
maṅkubhūta

adj. dumbstruck; humiliated; embarrassed; despondent [maṅku + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dumbstruck; humiliated; embarrassed; despondent
Construction maṅku + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (maṅku + bhūta)
Antonym visārada, amaṅkubhūta
Commentary (MNa) maṅkubhūto'ti nittejabhūto.
Sanskrit maṅku + bhūta

Examples

evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy'antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

maṅkuṃ karoti

idiom. shames; humiliates; embarrasses; lit. makes humiliation [maṅkuṃ + karoti] ✓

Construction maṅkuṃ + karoti
Variant maṅku karoti
Sanskrit maṅku + karoti

Example

VIN 2.5.7.4 duṭṭhullasikkhāpadaṃ
maṅgala 1

adj. auspicious; sacred; blessed [√maṅg + ala] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning auspicious; sacred; blessed
Root Family √maṅg
Root √maṅg×1 a (be auspicious)
Construction √maṅg + ala
Derivative kita (ala)
Synonym bhaddikā, bhadra, siva
Sanskrit maṅgala
Sanskrit Root √maṅg 1 (go)

Example

dvinnaṃ pana nagarānaṃ antare ubhayanagaravāsīnam'pi lumbinīvanaṃ nāma maṅgalasālavanaṃ atthi, tasmiṃ samaye mūlato paṭṭhāya yāva aggasākhā sabbaṃ ekapāliphullaṃ ahosi

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo
maṅgura 2

masc. walking catfish; Clarias batrachus ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning walking catfish; Clarias batrachus
Commentary (MNa) maṅguracchavī'ti maṅguramacchacchavi.
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walking_catfish
Sanskrit maṅgura, madgura

Example

kāḷo samaṇo gotamo'ti. ekacce manussā evam'āhaṃsu, na kāḷo samaṇo gotamo, sāmo samaṇo gotamo'ti. ekacce manussā evam'āhaṃsu, na kāḷo samaṇo gotamo, na'pi sāmo, maṅguracchavi samaṇo gotamo'ti.

Construction maṅgura + chavi + ī
maṅguracchavi + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Compound kammadhāraya (maṅgura + chavī)
Sanskrit madgura (bsk) + chavi

Example

jānāsi taṃ janapadakalyāṇiṃ evaṃnāmā evaṃgottā'ti vā, dīghā vā rassā vā majjhimā vā kāḷī vā sāmā vā maṅguracchavī vā'ti, amukasmiṃ gāme vā nigame vā nagare vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo
maṅgula

nt. bed bug ✗
maṅguli

adj. hideously ugly; repulsive in appearance; lit. as ugly as sin ~

Grammar adj
Meaning hideously ugly; repulsive in appearance; lit. as ugly as sin
Commentary (SNa) maṅgulin'ti virūpaṃ duddasikaṃ bībhacchaṃ.
Sanskrit maṅgula (sin)
maṅgulitthisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 19.14 (SN19.14) ✗
maṅgulitthī

fem. hideously ugly woman [maṅguli + itthī] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning hideously ugly woman
Construction maṅguli + itthī
Commentary (SNa) maṅgulin'ti virūpaṃ duddasikaṃ bībhacchaṃ.
macalappatta

adj. certain; confirmed; lit. reached non shaking [[m] + acala + patta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning certain; confirmed; lit. reached non shaking
Construction [m] + acala + patta
Phonetic Change +m
Variant acalappatta
Commentary (ANa) macalappatto'ti rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa puttabhāvena c'eva puttesu jeṭṭhakabhāvena ca na tāva abhisittabhāvena ca abhisekappattiatthāya acalappatto niccalapatto. makāro nipātamattaṃ.
macalavagga

masc. Chapter 9 of Catukkanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.81-90 ✗
macca

masc. man; mortal man; lit. to be killed [√mar + tya] ✓

Grammar masc, ptp of marati
Meaning man; mortal man; lit. to be killed
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Variant mātiya
Sanskrit martya
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

accayanti ahorattā,
jīvitaṃ uparujjhati,
āyu khīyati maccānaṃ,
kunnadīnaṃ'va odakaṃ.

TH 133 heraññakānittheragāthā

ubho puññañ'ca pāpañ'ca,
yaṃ macco kurute idha,
tañ'hi tassa sakaṃ hoti,
tañ'ca ādāya gacchati,
tañ'c'assa anugaṃ hoti,
chāyā'va anapāyinī.

SN 3.4 piyasuttaṃ
maccāna

masc. of men; of mortal men [√mar + tya + āna(ṃ)] ~

Grammar masc gen pl of macca
Meaning of men; of mortal men
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + tya + āna(ṃ) > āna
macca + āna
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)
maccu

masc. death; Death [√mar + tyu] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning death; Death
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + tyu
Derivative kita (tyu)
Phonetic Change ty > cc
Synonym māra
Sanskrit mṛtyu
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

yā tesaṃ tesaṃ sattānaṃ tamhā tamhā sattanikāyā cuti cavanatā bhedo antaradhānaṃ maccu maraṇaṃ kālakiriyā khandhānaṃ bhedo kaḷevarassa nikkhepo jīvitindriyassa upacchedo, idaṃ vuccati maraṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.

DHP 150 jarāvaggo
maccujarā

fem. death and old age [maccu + jarā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning death and old age
Construction maccu + jarā
Compound dvanda (maccu ca jarā ca)
Sanskrit mṛtyu + jarā

Example

kadā aniccaṃ vadharoganīḷaṃ,
kāyaṃ imaṃ maccujarāy'upaddutaṃ,
vipassamāno vītabhayo vihassaṃ,
eko vane taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
maccujaha

adj. abandoned death [maccu + jaha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning abandoned death
Construction maccu + jaha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (maccuṃ + jaha)
Commentary (SNa) maccujaho'ti tayo maccū jahitvā ṭhito.
maccutara

adj. who surpasses death; who passes beyond death [maccu + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who surpasses death; who passes beyond death
Construction maccu + tara
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (maccuṃ + tara)
Sanskrit mṛtyu + tara

Example

suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ,
maccurājā na passatī'ti.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15
maccudheyya

nt. realm of death; sphere of death; power of death [maccu + dheyya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning realm of death; sphere of death; power of death
Construction maccu + dheyya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maccuno + dheyya)
Antonym amaccudheyya
Commentary (SNa) maccudheyyassā'ti tebhūmakavaṭṭassa. tañ'hi maccuno patiṭṭhān'aṭṭhena maccudheyyan'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit mṛtyu + dheya

Examples

ye ca kho samma'd'akkhāte,
dhamme dhamm'ānuvattino,
te janā pāram'essanti,
maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

DHP 86 paṇḍitavaggo

tasmā pajānaṃ na upādiyetha,
bhikkhu sato kiñcanaṃ sabbaloke,
ādānasatte iti pekkhamāno,
pajaṃ imaṃ maccudheyye visattan'ti.

SNP 67 bhadrāvudha māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 12
maccunābbhāhata

adj. afflicted with death; assailed by death; attacked by death [maccunā + abbhāhata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with death; assailed by death; attacked by death
Construction maccunā + abbhāhata
Compound alutta tatiyā tappurisa (maccunā + abbhāhata)
Sanskrit mṛtyunā + abhyāhata

Example

maccun'ābbhāhato loko,
jarāya parivārito.
taṇhāsallena otiṇṇo,
icchādhūpāyito sadā'ti.

SN 1.66 attahatasuttaṃ
maccuparāyaṇa

adj. subject to death; destined to die; lit. ending in death [maccu + parāyaṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subject to death; destined to die; lit. ending in death
Construction maccu + parāyaṇa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (maccunaṃ + parāyaṇa)

Example

yo'pi vassasataṃ jīve,
so'pi maccuparāyaṇo,
na kiñci parivajjeti,
sabbam'ev'ābhimaddatī'ti.

SN 48.41 jarādhammasuttaṃ
maccuparāyana

adj. destined for death ✗
maccupareta

adj. subject to death ✗
maccupāsa

masc. death's snare; noose of death; death's trap [maccu + pāsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning death's snare; noose of death; death's trap
Construction maccu + pāsa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maccuno + pāsa)
Sanskrit mṛtyu + pāśa

Examples

piṇḍikāya paviṭṭho'haṃ,
gacchanto naṃ udikkhisaṃ,
alaṅ'kataṃ suvasanaṃ,
maccupāsaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ.

TH 186 nāgasamālattheragāthā

it'āyaṃ kodharūpena,
maccupāso guhāsayo,
taṃ damena samucchinde,
paññāvīriyena diṭṭhiyā.

maccumukha

Sanskrit mṛtyu + mukha

Examples

passāmi loke pariphandamānaṃ,
pajaṃ imaṃ taṇhagataṃ bhavesu,
hīnā narā maccumukhe lapanti,
avītataṇhāse bhav'ābhavesu.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2

evaṃ dhammā apakkamma,
adhammam'anuvattiya,
mando maccumukhaṃ patto,
akkhacchinno'va jhāyatī'ti.

SN 2.22 khemasuttaṃ
maccurāja

Examples

uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha,
daḷhaṃ sikkhatha santiyā,
mā vo pamatte viññāya,
maccurājā amohayittha vas'ānuge.

SNP 22 uṭṭhānasuttaṃ
cūḷavaggo 10

ṭhitena kāyena ṭhitena cetasā,
tiṭṭhaṃ nisinno uda vā sayāno,
etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno,
labhetha pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ,
laddhāna pubb'āpariyaṃ visesaṃ,
adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche'ti.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11

adj. under the power of death; under the death's domain; lit. going with the control of death [maccu + vasa + ga] ✓

SN 2.12 veṇḍusuttaṃ

Example

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
maccha

masc. fish ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fish
Synonym ambuja, mīna, vārija
Sanskrit matsya

Examples

phandamānaṃ pajaṃ disvā,
macche app'odake yathā,
aññam'aññehi byāruddhe,
disvā maṃ bhayam'āvisi.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena,
yo naro upanayhati,
kusā'pi pūtī vāyanti,
evaṃ bāl'ūpasevanā.

JA 546 vidhura jātakaṃ
macchaghātaka

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo orabbhiko hoti sūkariko sākuṇiko māgaviko luddo macchaghātako coro coraghātako goghātako bandhan'āgāriko, ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, orabbhikā sūkarikā sākuṇikā māgavikā luddā macchaghātakā corā coraghātakā bandhan'āgārikā ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

macchara 1

nt. envy; jealousy; hostility ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning envy; jealousy; hostility
Antonym vītamacchara
Sanskrit matsara

Example

kutopahūtā kalahā vivādā,
paridevasokā sahamaccharā ca,
mān'ātimānā sahapesuṇā ca,
kutopahūtā te tadiṅgha brūhi.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
macchara 2

nt. avarice, niggardliness [macchara] ✗
macchara 3

nt. elation; excitement; (comm) stinginess ✓

Grammar nt, abstr
Meaning elation; excitement; (comm) stinginess
Antonym parideva
Synonym uppilāvitatta, ubbilla, pāmujja, pāmojja, somanassa
Commentary (NIDD1) macchariyan'ti pañca macchariyāni, āvāsamacchariyaṃ, kulamacchariyaṃ, lābhamacchariyaṃ, vaṇṇamacchariyaṃ, dhammamacchariyaṃ. yaṃ evarūpaṃ macchariyaṃ maccharāyanā maccharāyitattaṃ vevicchaṃ kadariyaṃ kaṭukañcukatā aggahitattaṃ cittassa, idaṃ vuccati macchariyaṃ.
Notes (MW) matsara mfn. exhilarating, intoxicating. cheerful, joyous, gay
Sanskrit matsara

Example

sabbattha munī anissito,
na piyaṃ kubbati no'pi appiyaṃ,
tasmiṃ paridevamaccharaṃ,
paṇṇe vāri yathā na limpati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
maccharāyati 1

pr. becomes envious; is jealous [macchara + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of macchara, intrans
Meaning becomes envious; is jealous
Construction macchara + āya + ti
Sanskrit matsara +

Example

guṇavantānañ'hi guṇaṃ buddhā eva pākaṭaṃ kātuṃ sakkonti, avasesajano guṇavantānaṃ guṇaṃ kathento maccharāyati

DHPa 1.5.9 sumanamālākāra vatthu
maccharāyati 2

pr. is selfish, greedy or miserly [macchara] ✗
maccharāyanta

prp. being selfish; being stingy [macchara + āya + nta] ~

Grammar prp of maccharāyati, deno, intrans
Meaning being selfish; being stingy
Construction macchara + āya + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Commentary (VVt) maccharāyantī'ti maccharaṃ karontī, attano paccayadāyakakulassa aññehi sādhāraṇabhāvaṃ asahantī'ti attho.
Sanskrit matsara +
maccharinīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.115 (AN5.115) ✗
macchariya

nt. selfishness; stinginess; meanness; tight-fistedness [macchara + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from macchara
Meaning selfishness; stinginess; meanness; tight-fistedness
Construction macchara + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Antonym amacchariya
Variant macchera
Commentary (ANa) pañcamaccherabhāvo macchariyaṃ. taṃ sabbam'pi maccharāyanalakkhaṇaṃ.
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara

Examples

macchariyaṃ cittassa upakkileso'ti, iti viditvā macchariyaṃ cittassa upakkilesaṃ pajahati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

nindāya nappavedheyya,
na uṇṇameyya pasaṃsito bhikkhu,
lobhaṃ saha macchariyena,
kodhaṃ pesuṇiyañ'ca panudeyya.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
macchariyanirodha

masc. end of selfishness; cessation of stinginess ✗
macchariyappahānasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.255 (AN5.255) ✗
macchariyasaṃyojana

nt. bond of selfishness; fetter of stinginess; chain of tight-fistedness [macchariya + saṃyojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bond of selfishness; fetter of stinginess; chain of tight-fistedness
Construction macchariya + saṃyojana
Compound catutthī tappurisa (macchariyassa + saṃyojana)
Commentary (DNa) issāmacchariyasaṃyojanā'ti parasampattikhīyanalakkhaṇā issā, attasampattiyā parehi sādhāraṇabhāvassa asahanalakkhaṇaṃ macchariyaṃ, issā ca macchariyañca saṃyojanaṃ etesan'ti issāmacchariyasaṃyojanā. ayam'ettha saṅkhepo. vitthārato pana issāmacchariyāni abhidhamme vuttān'eva.
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara + saṃyojana

Example

anunayasaṃyojanaṃ, paṭighasaṃyojanaṃ, diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ, vicikicchāsaṃyojanaṃ, mānasaṃyojanaṃ, issāsaṃyojanaṃ, macchariyasaṃyojanaṃ. imāni kho, bhikkhave, satta saṃyojanānī'ti.

AN 7.10 macchariyasuttaṃ
macchariyasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.10 (AN7.10) ✗
macchariyasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 9.69 (AN9.69) ✗
maccharisutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.32 (SN1.32) ✗
maccharisutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.49 (SN1.49) ✗
maccharī 1

adj. selfish; stingy; covetous; envious [macchara + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from macchara
Meaning selfish; stingy; covetous; envious
Construction macchara + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym amaccharī
Sanskrit matsarin

Examples

na vākkaraṇamattena,
vaṇṇapokkharatāya vā,
sādhurūpo naro hoti,
issukī maccharī saṭho.

DHP 262 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

rosako kadariyo ca,
pāpiccho maccharī saṭho,
ahiriko anottappī,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
maccharī 2

masc. miser; cheapskate; stingy person [macchara + ī] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from macchara
Meaning miser; cheapskate; stingy person
Construction macchara + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Antonym amaccharī
Commentary (SNa) maccharino'ti maccherena samannāgatā.
Sanskrit matsarin

Examples

yass'eva bhīto na dadāti maccharī,
tadev'ādadato bhayaṃ,
jighacchā ca pipāsā ca,
yassa bhāyati maccharī,
tam'eva bālaṃ phusati,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ

ye'dha maccharino loke,
kadariyā paribhāsakā,
aññesaṃ dadamānānaṃ,
antarāyakarā narā.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ
maccharīsutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.8 (SN37.8) ✗
maccharīsutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.224 (AN5.224) ✗
macchavilopa

masc. catch of fish; haul of fish [maccha + vilopa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning catch of fish; haul of fish
Construction maccha + vilopa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (macchānaṃ + vilopa)
Commentary (ANa) kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope'ti kevaṭṭā viya macchavilope. tesañ'hi macchapacchiṃ gahetvā āgatānaṃ vikkiṇanaṭṭhāne, mayhaṃ detha mayhaṃ dethā'ti vadato mahājanassa evarūpo saddo hoti.
Sanskrit matsya + vilopa

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgito bhagavato upaṭṭhāko hoti. atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ nāgitaṃ āmantesi, ke pana kho, nāgita, uccāsaddamahāsaddā, kevaṭṭā maññe macchavilope'ti?

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
macchasurasenā

masc. people of Maccha and Surasena ✗
macchasūrasenā

masc. people of Maccha and Sūrasena ✗
macchā

masc. name of a people ✗
macchika

masc. fisherman [maccha + ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from maccha
Meaning fisherman
Construction maccha + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym kevaṭṭa, macchaghātaka, macchabandha
Commentary (THIa) macchikā'ti kevaṭṭā. (JAa) macchikā'ti macchaghātakā.
Sanskrit mātsyika

Example

orabbhikā sūkarikā,
macchikā migabandhakā,
corā ca vajjhaghātā ca,
ye c'aññe pāpakammino,
dak'ābhisecanā te'pi,
pāpakammā pamuccare.

THI 65 puṇṇātherīgāthā
macchikāpatta

nt. ?? fish scale ✗
macchikāsaṇḍa

masc. name of a forest in Kāsi; lit. Macchikā's grove [macchikā + saṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a forest in Kāsi; lit. Macchikā's grove
Construction macchikā + saṇḍa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (macchikāya + saṇḍa)
Commentary (SNa) macchikāsaṇḍe'ti evaṃnāmake vanasaṇḍe.
Sanskrit mrakṣaṣaṇḍā (bsk)

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ sambahulā therā bhikkhū macchikāsaṇḍe viharanti ambāṭakavane.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
macchikāsaṇḍika

adj. of Macchikā's grove; living in Macchikā's grove [macchikā + saṇḍa + ika] ~

Grammar adj, comp, from macchikāsaṇḍa
Meaning of Macchikā's grove; living in Macchikā's grove
Construction macchikā + saṇḍa + ika
macchikāsaṇḍa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit mrakṣaṣaṇḍā (bsk)
macchī

fem. she-fish [maccha] ✗
macchuddānajātaka

nt. Jātaka 288 (JA 288) ✗
macchera

nt. selfishness; stinginess; meanness; tight-fistedness [macchara + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from macchara
Meaning selfishness; stinginess; meanness; tight-fistedness
Construction macchara + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Variant macchariya
Commentary (MNa) attano sampattinigūhanalakkhaṇaṃ maccheraṃ, attano sampattiyā parehi sādhāraṇabhāv'āsukhāyanarasaṃ, saṅkocanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ.
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara

Examples

mal'itthiyā duccaritaṃ,
maccheraṃ dadato malaṃ,
malā ve pāpakā dhammā,
asmiṃ loke paramhi ca.

DHP 242 malavaggo

maccherā ca pamādā ca,
evaṃ dānaṃ na dīyati,
puññaṃ ākaṅkhamānena,
deyyaṃ hoti vijānatā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
maccherapariyuṭṭhāna

nt. being obsessed by stinginess; being consumed by selfishness [macchera + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning being obsessed by stinginess; being consumed by selfishness
Construction macchera + pariyuṭṭhāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maccherena + pariyuṭṭhāna)
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara + paryavasthāna

Example

maccharī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, maccherapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. maccherapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ
maccherapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by stinginess; consumed by selfishness [macchera + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by stinginess; consumed by selfishness
Construction macchera + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maccherena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara + paryavasthita

Example

maccharī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, maccherapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. maccherapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

AN 10.84 byākaraṇasuttaṃ
maccheramala

nt. stain of stinginess [macchera + mala] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning stain of stinginess
Construction macchera + mala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maccherassa + mala)
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara + mala
maccheramalapariyuṭṭhita

adj. obsessed by the stain of stinginess [maccheramala + pariyuṭṭhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning obsessed by the stain of stinginess
Construction maccheramala + pariyuṭṭhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maccheramalena + pariyuṭṭhita)
Commentary (SNa) maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitenā'ti pubbaṇhasamayasmiñ'hi mātugāmo khīra-dadhi-saṅgopana-randhana-pacan'ādīni kātuṃ āraddho, puttakehi'pi yāciyamāno kiñci dātuṃ na icchati. ten'etaṃ vuttaṃ pubbaṇhasamayaṃ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā'ti.
Sanskrit mātsarya, matsara + mala + paryavasthita

Example

lābhā vata me, suladdhaṃ vata me! yo'haṃ maccheramalapariyuṭṭhitāya pajāya vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasāmi muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato'ti.

AN 6.10 mahānāmasuttaṃ
maccherayutta

adj. connected with selfishness; tied up with meanness [macchera + yutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning connected with selfishness; tied up with meanness
Construction macchera + yutta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maccherena + yutta)
Sanskrit mātsarya + yukta

Example

piyappahūtā kalahā vivādā,
paridevasokā sahamaccharā ca,
mān'ātimānā sahapesuṇā ca,
maccherayuttā kalahā vivādā,
vivādajātesu ca pesuṇāni.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11
maccheravinaya

masc. removal of stinginess; dispelling selfishness [macchera + vinaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of stinginess; dispelling selfishness
Construction macchera + vinaya
majja

nt. intoxicant; drug; alcohol [√mad + ya] ✓

Grammar nt, from majjati
Meaning intoxicant; drug; alcohol
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change dy > jj
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit madya
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinn'ādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti

AN 3.80 gandhajātasuttaṃ

kukkuccaṃ upadaheyyā'ti ūnavīsativasso maññe tvaṃ upasampanno, vikāle maññe tayā bhuttaṃ, majjaṃ maññe tayā pītaṃ, mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho maññe tayā nisinnan'ti kukkuccaṃ upadahati, āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.8.7 sañciccasikkhāpadaṃ
majjagandha

masc. smell of alcohol [majja + gandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning smell of alcohol
Construction majja + gandha
Commentary (VINa) amajjañ'ca hoti majjavaṇṇaṃ majjagandhaṃ majjarasan'ti loṇasovīrakaṃ vā suttaṃ vā hoti.
majjati 1.1

pr. (+instr or +loc) is intoxicated (by); is stupefied (by); is befuddled (by) [√mad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+instr or +loc)
Meaning is intoxicated (by); is stupefied (by); is befuddled (by)
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Base √mad + ya > majja (pass)
Construction majja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit mādyati
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

rajanīye rajjati, dussanīye dussati, mohanīye muyhati, kuppanīye kuppati, madanīye majjati.

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ

phassena phuṭṭho na sukhena majje,
dukkhena phuṭṭho'pi na sampavedhe,
phassadvayaṃ sukhadukkhe upekkhe,
anānuruddho aviruddha kenaci.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ
majjati 1.2

pr. becomes arrogant; (comm) becomes intoxicated with self-importance; lit. is intoxicated [√mad + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans
Meaning becomes arrogant; (comm) becomes intoxicated with self-importance; lit. is intoxicated
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Base √mad + ya > majja (pass)
Construction majja + ti
Phonetic Change dy > jj
Commentary (SNa) majjantī'ti mānamajjanena majjanti.
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit mādyati
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

appakā te sattā lokasmiṃ ye uḷāre uḷāre bhoge labhitvā na c'eva majjanti, na ca pamajjanti, na ca kāmesu gedhaṃ āpajjanti, na ca sattesu vippaṭipajjanti.

SN 3.6 appakasuttaṃ

aham'asmi lābhasakkārasilokavā, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū appaññātā appesakkhā'ti. so tena lābhasakkārasilokena majjati pamajjati pamādaṃ āpajjati, pamatto samāno dukkhaṃ viharati.

MN 29 mahāsāropamasuttaṃ
majjati 2.1

pr. polishes, wipes, cleans [√majj] ✗

nt. intoxicant, negligence [√mad] ✗

Construction √majj + ana

fem. polishing, wiping, stroking [√majj] ✗

prp. polishing [√majj] ✗
majjanta 2.1

prp. intoxicating [√mad] ✗
majjapa

masc. who drinks liquor; drunk [majja + pa] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning who drinks liquor; drunk
Construction majja + pa
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (majjaṃ + pa)
Sanskrit madyapa

Example

pāṇaṃ na haññe na c'adinnam'ādiye,
musā na bhāse na ca majjapo siyā,
abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,
rattiṃ na bhuñjeyya vikālabhojanaṃ.

appamādo ca dhammesu,
etaṃ maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.

majjapāyī

Sanskrit madya + vaṇijyā

majjhe yathā samuddassa,

ussadaṃ bhikkhu na kareyya kuhiñci.

Examples

atha rājā majjh'anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kathaṃ so puriso'ti?

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

yāya vihārasamāpattiyā ākaṅkhati majjh'anhikasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tāya vihārasamāpattiyā majjh'anhikasamayaṃ viharati.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
majjhanhikasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 9.12 (SN9.12) ✗
majjhanhikāla

masc. noon; midday [majjhanha + kāla] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning noon; midday
Construction majjhanha > majjhanhi + kāla
Phonetic Change a > i
Synonym majjhantika, majjhanha
majjhasūrasenā

masc. people of Majjha and Sūrasena ✗
majjhā

masc. name of a people [majjha] ✗
majjhārañña

nt. name of a forest [majjha + arañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a forest
Construction majjha + arañña
Compound kammadhāraya (majjha + arañña)
Sanskrit madhya + araṇya

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sutaṃ te daṇḍakī'raññaṃ kāliṅg'āraññaṃ majjh'āraññaṃ mātaṅg'āraññaṃ araññaṃ araññabhūtan'ti?

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
majjhima 1

adj. middle; middling; medium; medium-sized; moderate [majjha + ima] ✓

Grammar adj, from majjha
Meaning middle; middling; medium; medium-sized; moderate
Construction majjha + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Sanskrit madhyama

Examples

iti kho, ānanda, kammaṃ khettaṃ, viññāṇaṃ bījaṃ, taṇhā sneho. avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ majjhimāya dhātuyā viññāṇaṃ patiṭṭhitaṃ evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti hoti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ evaṃ vadeyyuṃ, ambho purisa, yassa tvaṃ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṃ karosi, jānāsi taṃ pāsādaṃ puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā'ti?

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ
majjhima 2

adj. medium strength [majjha + ima] ✓

Grammar adj, from majjha
Meaning medium strength
Construction majjha + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Commentary (VINa) majjhimassā'ti thāmamajjhimassa, no pamāṇamajjhimassa, n'eva appathāmassa, na mahāthāmassa, majjhimathāmassā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit madhyama

Examples

gām'ūpacāro nāma parikkhittassa gāmassa indakhīle ṭhitassa majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupāto, aparikkhittassa gāmassa ghar'ūpacāre ṭhitassa majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupāto.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ

anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyyā'ti bhikkhuṃ vā sāmaṇeraṃ vā ārāmikaṃ vā anāpucchā majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupātaṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
majjhima 3

masc. (vinaya) monk of five to ten years standing; lit. middle [majjha + ima] ✓

Grammar masc, from majjha
Meaning (vinaya) monk of five to ten years standing; lit. middle
Construction majjha + ima
Derivative taddhita (ima)
Antonym thera, nava
Commentary (VINa) thero vā'ti ādīsu vayovuḍḍh'ādīsu yo vā so vā hotu, paripuṇṇadasavassatāya thero vā ūnapañcavassatāya navo vā atirekapañcavassatāya majjhimo vā'ti attho. (SNa) navo'ti aparipuṇṇapañcavasso hi bhikkhu navo nāma hoti, pañcavassato paṭṭhāya majjhimo, dasavassato paṭṭhāya thero.
Sanskrit madhyama

Examples

tatr'āvuso, majjhimā bhikkhū tīhi ṭhānehi pāsaṃsā bhavanti. satthu pavivittassa viharato sāvakā vivekam'anusikkhantī'ti

MN 3 dhammadāyādasuttaṃ

yo panā'ti yo yādiso yathāyutto yathājacco yathānāmo yathāgotto yathāsīlo yathāvihārī yathāgocaro thero vā navo vā majjhimo vā. eso vuccati, yo panā'ti.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

tumhe payujjamāne'pi appayujjamāne'pi tuly'ādhikaraṇe majjhimapuriso hoti. tvaṃ yāsi, tumhe yātha. appayujjamāne'pi yāsi, yātha.

majjhe 1

ind. (+gen) in the middle; in the midst (of) [majjha + e] ✓

Construction majjha + e

Examples

majjhe mantā na lippati,
taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso'ti,
so'dha sibbinim'accagā'ti.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

daḷhāya rajjuyā bandhitvā majjhe gaṇṭhiṃ karitvā ossajjeyya. atha kho, te, bhikkhave, chappāṇakā nānāvisayā nānāgocarā sakaṃ sakaṃ gocaravisayaṃ āviñcheyyuṃ

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
majjhe 2

ind. (+gen) in the present; lit. in the middle [majjha + e] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, loc sg of majjha (+gen)

Construction majjha + e
Antonym pure, pacchato
Synonym paccuppannamaddhānaṃ
Sanskrit madhye

Example

muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

mañca

masc. bed [√mañc + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning bed
Root Family √mañc
Root √mañc×1 a (hold up, support)
Construction √mañc + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SDM) mañcati puggalaṃ dhāretī'ti mañco. (VIN 2.5.2.4) mañco nāma cattāro mañcā, masārako, bundik'ābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.
Sanskrit mañca
Sanskrit Root √mac √mañc 1 (purify)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya, na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 14 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

mañju

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

sunīlagīvā susikhā supekhunā,
sucittapattacchadanā vihaṅgamā,
sumañjughosatthanit'ābhigajjino,
te taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinaṃ.

mañña

masc. thought; conception; imagination [√man + ya] ✓

Grammar masc, from maññāti
Meaning thought; conception; imagination
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Synonym kappa, saṅkappa
Sanskrit manya
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

chadhāturo ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso chaphass'āyatano aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro catur'ādhiṭṭhāno, yattha ṭhitaṃ maññ'assavā nappavattanti, maññ'assave kho pana nappavattamāne muni santo'ti vuccati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
maññata

nt. conception; thinking; imagination; supposition; (comm) conceit [√man + ya + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, from maññati
Meaning conception; thinking; imagination; supposition; (comm) conceit
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Base √man + ya > mañña
Construction mañña + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Variant mānanā, maññīta
Commentary (SNa) maññatan'ti maññanaṃ. tividham'pi taṇhā-diṭṭhi-māna-maññanaṃ so vītivatto, atikkanto'ti attho.
Sanskrit manya, manyanā (bsk)
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

pahīnamānassa na santi ganthā,
vidhūpitā mānaganth'assa sabbe,
sa vītivatto maññataṃ sumedho,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
loke samaññaṃ kusalo viditvā
vohāramattena so vohareyyā'ti.

SN 1.25 arahantasuttaṃ
maññati 1

pr. (+acc) thinks; imagines; conceives: presumes; supposes [√man + ya + ti] ~

Meaning thinks; imagines; conceives: presumes; supposes

Root √man･3 ya (think)
Base √man + ya > mañña
Construction mañña + ti
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Synonym vicinteti
Sanskrit manyat
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)
maññati 2

pr. (+acc) knows; is convinced; is sure [√man + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning knows; is convinced; is sure
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Base √man + ya > mañña
Construction mañña + ti
Phonetic Change ny > ññ
Sanskrit manyate
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

yo bālo maññati bālyaṃ,
paṇḍito v'āpi tena so,
bālo ca paṇḍitamānī,
sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

DHP 63 bālavaggo
maññati 3

pr. (+acc) considers (to be); takes as; regards as; views as; deems as [√man + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning considers (to be); takes as; regards as; views as; deems as

Base √man + ya > mañña

Phonetic Change ny > ññ

Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati,
karaṃ purisakiccāni,
so sukhā na vihāyati.

TH 174 mātaṅgaputtattheragāthā

tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsissanti na sotaṃ odahissanti na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṃ pariyāpuṇitabbaṃ maññissanti.

aṭṭhakavaggo 10

kattari ca attanopadāni honti. maññate, rocate, socate, bujjhate, jāyate.

maññanā 1

anupādiseso'ti maññamāno so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho purisa, ubbhataṃ kho te sallaṃ, apanīto visadoso anupādiseso.

evaṃ vutte, ahaṃ, bhikkhave, māraṃ pāpimantaṃ etadavocaṃ, jānāmi kho t'āhaṃ, pāpima, mā tvaṃ maññittho, na maṃ jānātī'ti. māro tvam'asi, pāpima.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno māraṃ pāpimantaṃ etadavoca, evam'pi kho t'āhaṃ, pāpima, jānāmi, mā tvaṃ maññittho, na maṃ jānātī'ti.

Examples

hīno na maññetha visesi v'āpi.

Construction maṃ + eva + ettha
Sanskrit mām + eva + atra

Example

nt. fine cloth ✗

DHP 161 attavaggo

nappaṭiggaṇhanti samaṇā sakyaputtiyā jātarūparajataṃ, nikkhittamaṇisuvaṇṇā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā apetajātarūparajatā'ti.

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ
maṇi 2

masc. name of a spirit; lit. jewel ~

Meaning name of a spirit; lit. jewel
maṇi 3

masc. stone; rock; crystal ~

Grammar masc
Meaning stone; rock; crystal
Synonym asma, pāsāṇa, sela
Commentary (SNa) maṇī'ti pāsāṇo.
maṇika 1.1

masc. water jar; water pitcher [maṇi + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from maṇi
Meaning water jar; water pitcher
Construction maṇi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit maṇika

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ādhāre ṭhapito pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo. tam'enaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āvajjeyya, āgaccheyya udakan'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

AN 5.28 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
maṇika 2.1

masc. bracelet made of glass, etc. [maṇi] ✗
maṇikaṇṭha

masc. name of a dragon; lit. jewelled-throat [maṇi + kaṇṭha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a dragon; lit. jewelled-throat
Construction maṇi + kaṇṭha
Commentary (VINa) tattha maṇikaṇṭho'ti so kira nāgarājā sabbakāmadadaṃ mah'agghaṃ maṇiṃ kaṇṭhe pilandhitvā carati, tasmā maṇikaṇṭho'tv'eva paññāyittha.
maṇikaṇṭhajātaka

nt. Jātaka 253 (JA 253) ✗
maṇikāra

masc. gem-cutter ✗
maṇikuṇḍala 1

masc. jewels and jewellery; gems and rings [maṇi + kuṇḍala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning jewels and jewellery; gems and rings
Construction maṇi + kuṇḍala
Compound dvanda (maṇi ca kuṇḍala ca)
Commentary (DHPa) maṇikuṇḍalesū'ti maṇīsu c'eva kuṇḍalesu ca, maṇivicittesu vā kuṇḍalesu.
Sanskrit maṇi + kuṇḍala

Example

na taṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā,
yadāyasaṃ dārujapabbajañ'ca,
sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu,
puttesu dāresu ca yā apekkhā.

DHP 345 taṇhāvaggo
maṇikuṇḍala 2

nt. jewels and jewellery; gems and rings [maṇi + kuṇḍala] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning jewels and jewellery; gems and rings
Construction maṇi + kuṇḍala
Compound dvanda (maṇi ca kuṇḍala ca)
Commentary (MNa) pavara-maṇikuṇḍalan'ti nānappakāraṃ uttamamaṇiñ'ca kuṇḍalañ'ca.
Sanskrit maṇi + kuṇḍala

Example

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, puriso yācitakaṃ bhogaṃ yācitvā yānaṃ vā poriseyyaṃ pavaramaṇikuṇḍalaṃ. so tehi yācitakehi bhogehi purakkhato parivuto antar'āpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyya.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
maṇikuṇḍalajātaka

nt. Jātaka 351 (JA 351) ✗

maṇḍa 1

Example

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
maṇḍanaka

adj. adorning; embellishing [√maṇḍ + ana + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from maṇḍana
Meaning adorning; embellishing
Root Family √maṇḍ
Root √maṇḍ･1 a (adorn)
Construction √maṇḍ + ana + ka
maṇḍana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (MNa) maṇḍanakajātiko'ti alaṅkārakasabhāvo.
Non IA maṇṇu (Tamil)
Sanskrit maṇḍana
Sanskrit Root √maṇḍ 1 (deck)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ
maṇḍanakajātika

adj. who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type [maṇḍanaka + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type
Construction maṇḍanaka + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (maṇḍanaka + jātika)
Variant maṇḍanakajātiya, maṇḍanajātika
Commentary (MNa) maṇḍanakajātiko'ti alaṅkārakasabhāvo.
Sanskrit maṇḍanaka + jātimat

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte acche vā udakapatte sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno

AN 10.51 sacittasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭiyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
maṇḍanakajātiya

adj. who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type [maṇḍanaka + jātiya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type
Construction maṇḍanaka + jātiya
Compound kammadhāraya (maṇḍanaka + jātiya)
Variant maṇḍanakajātika, maṇḍanajātika
Commentary (VINt) maṇḍanakajātiyo'ti maṇḍanasabhāvo, maṇḍanasīlo'ti attho.
Sanskrit maṇḍana + jātika

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante ānanda, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiyo sīsaṃnhāto uppalamālaṃ vā vassikamālaṃ vā adhimuttakamālaṃ vā labhitvā ubhohi hatthehi paṭiggahetvā uttam'aṅge sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhāpeyya, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante ānanda, ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāmi yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīye'ti.

AN 8.51 gotamīsuttaṃ
maṇḍanajātika

adj. who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type [maṇḍana + jātika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is fond of adornment; who likes beautifying oneself; lit. adornment type
Construction maṇḍana + jātika
Compound kammadhāraya (maṇḍana + jātika)
Variant maṇḍanakajātika, maṇḍanakajātiya
Sanskrit maṇḍana + jātimat

Example

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, itthī vā puriso vā, daharo yuvā maṇḍanajātiko, ādāse vā parisuddhe pariyodāte, acche vā udakapatte, sakaṃ mukhanimittaṃ paccavekkhamāno, sace tattha passati rajaṃ vā aṅgaṇaṃ vā, tass'eva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.

maṇḍetvā

abs. having adorned, having decorated [√maṇḍ] ✗
maṇḍesi

aor. adorned, decorated [√maṇḍ] ✗
mata 1.1

pp. dead; deceased; departed [√mar + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of marati
Meaning dead; deceased; departed
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Antonym amata
Synonym kālaṅkata
Sanskrit mṛta
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

appamādo amatapadaṃ,
pamādo maccuno padaṃ,
appamattā na mīyanti,
ye pamattā yathā matā.

DHP 21 appamādavaggo

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
mata 1.2

nt. death; dying; lit. dead [√mar + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, pp of marati
Meaning death; dying; lit. dead
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change rt > t
Synonym kālakiriyā, maraṇa
Sanskrit mṛta
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

ambho purisa kiṃ tuyh'iminā pāpakena dujjīvitena, mataṃ te jīvitā seyyo'ti, iti cittamano cittasaṅkappo anekapariyāyena maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya

Compound pañcamī tappurisa (matasmā + ja)
Synonym āvudhajāta
Commentary (MNa) matajaṃ nāmā'ti manussā tikhiṇaṃ ayaṃ ayena sughaṃsitvā taṃ ayacuṇṇaṃ maṃsena saddhiṃ madditvā koñcasakuṇe khādāpenti. te uccāraṃ kātuṃ asakkontā maranti. no ce maranti, paharitvā mārenti. atha tesaṃ kucchiṃ phāletvā naṃ udakena dhovitvā cuṇṇaṃ gahetvā maṃsena saddhiṃ madditvā puna khādāpentī'ti evaṃ satta vāre khādāpetvā gahitena ayacuṇṇena āvudhaṃ karonti. susikkhitā ca naṃ ayakārā bahuhatthakammamūlaṃ labhitvā karonti. taṃ matasakuṇato jātattā matajan'ti vuccati, atitikhiṇaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit mṛta + ja

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, matajaṃ nāma āvudhajātaṃ ubhatodhāraṃ pītanisitaṃ. tadassa saṅghāṭiyā sampārutaṃ sampaliveṭhitaṃ. tath'ūpam'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa bhikkhuno pabbajjaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
matantara

nt. another's opinion; someone else's idea [mata + antara] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning another's opinion; someone else's idea
Construction mata + antara

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning widow; lit. whose husband is dead
Construction mata + pati + kā
matapati + kā
Synonym vidhavā
Commentary (THIa) matapatikā'ti vidhavā.
mataputta

adj. whose son has died; with a dead child [mata + putta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning whose son has died; with a dead child
Construction mata + putta
Commentary (SNa) accantaṃ mataputtāmhī'ti ettha antaṃ atītaṃ accantaṃ, bhāvanapuṃsakam'etaṃ. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, yathā puttamaraṇaṃ antaṃ atītaṃ hoti, evaṃ mataputtā ahaṃ, idāni mama puna puttamaraṇaṃ nāma n'atthi.

matarodanajātaka

nt. Jātaka 317 (JA 317) ✗

Meaning dead body; corpse
Construction mata + sarīra
Synonym kuṇapa, sarīra, sarīraka
mati 1

fem. wisdom; intelligence; mind [√man + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from maññati
Meaning wisdom; intelligence; mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Synonym paṇḍiccā, buddhi, medhā
Sanskrit mati
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

paññāpāramitaṃ patto,
mahābuddhi mahāmati,
ajaḷo jaḷasamāno,
sadā carati nibbuto.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

Sanskrit mati
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

VIN PAT SA 5 sañcarittasikkhāpadaṃ

itthiyā vā purisamatin'ti purisassa matiṃ itthiyā āroceti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
matta 2.1

pp. intoxicated; drunk; besotted [√mad + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of majjati
Meaning intoxicated; drunk; besotted
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > t
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit matta
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

atthi, bhikkhave, sattānaṃ yobbane yobbanamado, yena madena mattā kāyena duccaritaṃ caranti, vācāya duccaritaṃ caranti, manasā duccaritaṃ caranti.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

atisāradiṭṭhiyā'va so samatto,
mānena matto paripuṇṇamānī,
sayam'eva sāmaṃ manas'ābhisitto,
diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
matta 2.2

adj. (of an elephant) in rut; sexually inflamed; on heat; lit. intoxicated [√mad + ta] ✓

Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change d > t
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit matta
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Example

yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
vīriyena taṃ mayha vas'ānayissaṃ,
gajaṃ'va mattaṃ kusal'aṅkusaggaho.

mattaññutā

fem. (+loc) moderation (in); knowing the correct amount (of); temperance (in); lit. measuring knowing state [matta + ñū + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mattaññu (+loc)
Meaning moderation (in); knowing the correct amount (of); temperance (in); lit. measuring knowing state
Construction matta + ñū + tā
mattaññu + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mattaṃ + ññutā)
Commentary (DNa) mattaññutā'ti paṭiggahaṇaparibhogavasena pamāṇaññutā. (DHPa) mattaññutā'ti mattaññubhāvo pamāṇajānanaṃ.
Sanskrit mātrā + jñā +

Example

anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ,
pantañ'ca sayan'āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo,
etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

DHP 185 buddhavaggo
mattaññū

adj. (+loc) knowing the correct measure (in); knowing the limit (in); moderate (in); lit. measure knowing [matta + ñū] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning knowing the correct measure (in); knowing the limit (in); moderate (in); lit. measure knowing
Construction matta + ñū
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mattaṃ + ñū)
Antonym amattaññū
Commentary (MNa) mattaññū'ti pariyesanapaṭiggahaṇaparibhogesu mattaññū, yuttaññū, pamāṇaññū. (THa) mattaññū'ti pariyesanapaṭiggahaṇaparibhogavissajjanesu pamāṇaññū.
Sanskrit mātrā + jñā

Examples

asubh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ,
indriyesu susaṃvutaṃ,
bhojanamhi ca mattaññuṃ,
saddhaṃ āraddhavīriyaṃ,
taṃ ve nappasahati māro,
vāto selaṃ'va pabbataṃ.

DHP 8 yamakavaggo

bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
mattaṭṭhaka

adj. short-lived; brief-standing; remaining only for a short time; lit. measure standing [matta + ṭha + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from mattaṭṭha
Meaning short-lived; brief-standing; remaining only for a short time; lit. measure standing
Construction matta + ṭha + ka
mattaṭṭha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (matta + ṭṭhaka)
Commentary (MNa) mattaṭṭhakassā'ti parittaṭṭhitikassa, tattha dvīhākārehi imassa kāyassa parittaṭṭhititā veditabbā ṭhitiparittatāya ca sarasaparittatāya ca.
Sanskrit mātrā + stha + ka

Example

kiṃ pan'imassa mattaṭṭhakassa kāyassa taṇh'upādinnassa ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā? atha khv'āssa no't'ev'ettha hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
mattaṭṭhiyaṃ

ind. in moderation; moderately; lit. measure seeking [matta + aṭṭhiya + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc of mattaṭṭhiya
Meaning in moderation; moderately; lit. measure seeking
Construction matta + aṭṭhiya + aṃ
mattaṭṭhiya + aṃ
Commentary (THa) matt'aṭṭhiyan'ti taṃ mattaṃ payojanaṃ. yāva'd'eva sītavātaparittāṇaṃ, yāva'd'eva hirīkopīnapaṭicchādanaṃ katvā cīvaraṃ paribhuñjiṃsu.
Sanskrit mātra + arthika

Example

sītavātaparittānaṃ,
hirikopīnachādanaṃ,
matt'aṭṭhiyaṃ abhuñjiṃsu,
santuṭṭhā itarītare.

TH 257 pārāpariyattheragāthā
mattamaññāsi

aor. knew the limit; understood the boundary; recognized the line [mattaṃ + aññāsi] ✓

Grammar aor of mattaṃ jānāti, comp vb
Meaning knew the limit; understood the boundary; recognized the line
Construction mattaṃ + aññāsi
Compound comp verb (mattaṃ + aññāsi)
Commentary (SNa) na v'āyaṃ kumārako mattam'aññāsī'ti ayaṃ kumārako attano pamāṇaṃ na jānātī'ti theraṃ tajjento āha.
Sanskrit mātrām + ajñāsīt

Example

atha kho, pāpima, kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesi, na v'āyaṃ dūsī māro mattam'aññāsī'ti. sah'āpalokanāya ca pana, pāpima, dūsī māro tamhā ca ṭhānā cavi mahānirayañ'ca upapajji.

Examples

yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṃ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti, ayaṃ vuccati dhamm'ānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṃ, sappurisabhūmiṃ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṃ

SN 25.1 cakkhusuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlesu paripūrakārī hoti samādhismiṃ mattaso kārī paññāya mattaso kārī.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

passe ce vipulaṃ sukhaṃ,
caje mattāsukhaṃ dhīro,
sampassaṃ vipulaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP21 pakiṇṇakavaggo
matti

fem. mother [mātā + i] ✓

Grammar fem, in comps
Meaning mother
Construction mātā + i
Synonym ammā, jananī, mātar, māti, mātu
Sanskrit mātṛ

Example

na c'āhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūmi,
yonijaṃ mattisambhavaṃ,
bhovādi nāma so hoti,
sace hoti sakiñcano,
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

mattikā

Meaning clay; earth
Root Family √madd
Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Construction √madd > matt + ikā
Derivative kita (ikā)
Phonetic Change dd > tt
Sanskrit mṛttikā, mārttika
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)

Examples

yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 20 sappāṇakasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṭṭhañ'ca paṭicca valliñ'ca paṭicca tiṇañ'ca paṭicca mattikañ'ca paṭicca ākāso parivārito agāraṃ tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
mattikākuṇḍala

masc. clay ring; earthen earring [mattikā + kuṇḍala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning clay ring; earthen earring
Construction mattikā + kuṇḍala
Compound kammadhāraya (mattikā + kuṇḍala)
Commentary (SNa) patirūpako mattikākuṇḍalo'vā'ti suvaṇṇakuṇḍalapatirūpako mattikākuṇḍalo'va.
Sanskrit mārttika + kuṇḍala

Example

patirūpako mattikākuṇḍalo'va,
loh'aḍḍhamāso'va suvaṇṇachanno,
caranti loke parivārachannā,
anto asuddhā bahi sobhamānā'ti.

patto nāma dve pattā ayopatto mattikāpatto'ti.

AN 9.36 jhānasuttaṃ

adaḍḍhā'pi vuccati jātā pathavī. yo'pi paṃsupuñjo vā mattikāpuñjo vā atirekacātumāsaṃ ovaṭṭho, ayam'pi vuccati jātā pathavī.

VIN 2.5.1.10 pathavīkhaṇanasikkhāpadaṃ

masc. matricide ✗

adj. born from a mother [matti + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born from a mother
Construction matti + sambhava

Example

na c'āhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūmi,
yonijaṃ mattisambhavaṃ,
bhovādi nāma so hoti,
sace hoti sakiñcano,
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 396 brāhmaṇavaggo
matteyya

adj. respecting one's mother [mātar] ✗

Example

sukhā matteyyatā loke,
atho petteyyatā sukhā,
sukhā sāmaññatā loke,
atho brahmaññatā sukhā.

DHP 332 nāgavaggo
matteyyasutta

Meaning head
Synonym uttamaṅga, muddha, siras, sīsa

Construction mattha + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit mastaka

Examples

seyyathā'pi, anuruddhā, tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo punavirūḷhiyā

sattiyā viya omaṭṭho,
ḍayhamāno'va matthake,
kāmarāgappahānāya,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje'ti.

matthu

Root Family √math
Root √math･1 a (churn, stir)
Construction √math + a
Derivative kita (a)

Examples

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502
mathati

pr. shakes about, churns, disturbs [√math] ✗
mathana

nt. churning, disturbance [√math] ✗
mathi

aor. shook about, churned, disturbed [√math] ✗
mathita

pp. (+instr) churned (by); stirred (by); shaken (by); tossed about (by); disturbed (by) [√math + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of mathati (+instr)
Meaning churned (by); stirred (by); shaken (by); tossed about (by); disturbed (by)
Root Family √math
Root √math･1 a (churn, stir)
Construction √math + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym erita, kampita
Sanskrit mathita
Sanskrit Root √math √manth 1, 9 (shake)

Example

vitakkamathitassa jantuno,
tibbarāgassa subh'ānupassino,
bhiyyo taṇhā pavaḍḍhati,
esa kho daḷhaṃ karoti bandhanaṃ.

mathitvā

Grammar pr, caus of mathati, trans (+acc)
Meaning churns; stirs; disturbs; agitates; lit. causes to churn

Root √math･1 *e (churn, stir)

Example

vipassato lokam'imaṃ parañ'ca,

mada 1

English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit mada

Examples

bhojane mattaññuno bhavissāma paṭisaṅkhā yoniso āhāraṃ āharissāma n'eva davāya na madāya na maṇḍanāya na vibhūsanāya yāva'd'eva imassa kāyassa ṭhitiyā yāpanāya

Example

madassa ca pahānāya pamādassa ca pahānāya, atthi majjhimā paṭipadā cakkhukaraṇī ñāṇakaraṇī upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
madana 1

masc. God of love [√mad] ✗
madana 2

nt. intoxication [√mad] ✗
madanimmadana 1

nt. removing vanity; crushing conceit; subduing pride; lit. de-intoxicating intoxicating [mada + nimmadana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning removing vanity; crushing conceit; subduing pride; lit. de-intoxicating intoxicating
Construction mada + nimmadana
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (madaṃ + nimmadana)
Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana taṃ āgamma mānamada-purisamadādayo madā nimmadā amadā honti vinassanti, tasmā madanimmadanan'ti vuccati. (ITIa) madanimmadano'tiādīni sabbāni nibbānavevacanāni'y'eva. tathā hi taṃ āgamma mānamadapurisamad'ādiko sabbo mado nimmadīyati pamaddīyati
Notes nimmadana "de-intoxicating" is homophonous with ni-maddana "crushing down", an intended double meaning noted in the commentary
Sanskrit mada + nirmada

Example

madanimmadanāya pipāsavinayāya ālayasamugghātāya vaṭṭ'upacchedāya taṇhakkhayāya virāgāya nirodhāya nibbānāya dhammo desito?

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhi sikkhāpada
madanimmadana 2

masc. removing vanity; crushing conceit; subduing pride; lit. de-intoxicating intoxicating [mada + nimmadana] ~

Grammar masc, act, comp
Meaning removing vanity; crushing conceit; subduing pride; lit. de-intoxicating intoxicating
Construction mada + nimmadana

Commentary (VINa) yasmā pana taṃ āgamma mānamada-purisamadādayo madā nimmadā amadā honti vinassanti, tasmā madanimmadanan'ti vuccati. (ITIa) madanimmadano'tiādīni sabbāni nibbānavevacanāni'y'eva. tathā hi taṃ āgamma mānamadapurisamad'ādiko sabbo mado nimmadīyati pamaddīyati
Notes nimmadana "de-intoxicating" is homophonous with ni-maddana "crushing down", an intended double meaning noted in the commentary
Sanskrit mada + nirmada

Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + anīya

English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit madanīya
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā vīṇāya saddo assutapubbo assa. so vīṇāsaddaṃ suṇeyya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kassa nu kho eso saddo evaṃrajanīyo evaṃkamanīyo evaṃmadanīyo evaṃmucchanīyo evaṃbandhanīyo'ti?

AN 8.61 icchāsuttaṃ
madetvā
