English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit mādayitvā
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)
madda

adj. crushing; grinding; rubbing [√madd + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from maddati
Meaning crushing; grinding; rubbing
Root Family √madd
Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Construction √madd + a
Derivative kita (a)
Commentary (SNa) maddakucchismin'ti evaṃnāmake uyyāne. tañ'hi ajātasattumhi kucchigate tassa mātarā, ayaṃ mayhaṃ kucchigato gabbho rañño sattu bhavissati. kiṃ me iminā'ti? gabbhapātan'atthaṃ kucchi maddāpitā. tasmā maddakucchī'ti saṅkhaṃ gataṃ.
Sanskrit marda
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati maddakucchismiṃ migadāye.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
maddakucchi

masc. name of a park; lit. abortion; belly crushing [madda + kucchi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a park; lit. abortion; belly crushing
Construction madda + kucchi
Compound kammadhāraya (madda + kucchi)
Commentary (SNa) maddakucchismin'ti evaṃnāmake uyyāne. tañ'hi ajātasattumhi kucchigate tassa mātarā, ayaṃ mayhaṃ kucchigato gabbho rañño sattu bhavissati. kiṃ me iminā'ti? gabbhapātan'atthaṃ kucchi maddāpitā. tasmā maddakucchī'ti saṅkhaṃ gataṃ.
Sanskrit marda + kukṣi

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati maddakucchismiṃ migadāye.

SN 1.38 sakalikasuttaṃ
maddati 1

pr. (+acc) crushes; tramples; squashes [√madd + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning crushes; tramples; squashes
Root Family √madd
Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Base √madd + a > madda
Construction madda + ti
Synonym nicchoṭeti
Sanskrit mardati
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)

Example

atha naṃ āha, amma, kāḷi imasmiṃ nagare pañca sakaṭasatāni paccūsakāle uṭṭhāya vāṇijjāya gacchanti, tvaṃ imaṃ netvā cakkamagge nipajjāpehi, goṇā vā naṃ maddissanti, cakkā vā chindissanti, pavattiṃ c'assa ñatvāva āgaccheyyāsī'ti.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
maddati 2

pr. subjugates [√madd] ✗

pr. squeezes, presses [√madd] ✗
maddana 1

Meaning crushing; trampling

Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Construction √madd + ana

Sanskrit mardana

maddanta 1

prp. (+acc) crushing; trampling [√madd + a + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of maddati, trans (+acc)
Meaning crushing; trampling
Root Family √madd
Root √madd･1 a (crush, grind)
Base √madd + a > madda
Construction madda + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym sammaddanta
Sanskrit mradat
Sanskrit Root √mṛd √mrad 1, 9 (rub, crush)

Example

abalā naṃ balīyanti,
maddanta-enaṃ parissayā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
nāvaṃ bhinnam'iv'odakaṃ.

aṭṭhakavaggo 1

maddava 1

adj. withered; shrivelled; lit. soft [√mud + u + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, from mudu
Meaning withered; shrivelled; lit. soft
Root Family √mud
Root √mud･1 a (be soft, happy)
Construction √mud > madd + u > av + *a
mudu + *a

Variant majjava, paccava
Commentary (DHPa) maddavānī'ti milātāni.

Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Example

maddavāni pamuñcati,
evaṃ rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca,
vippamuñcetha bhikkhavo.

maddi

aor. crushed, trampled on, subjugated [√madd] ✗

pp. rubbed; smoothed [√madd + ita] ✓

Meaning rubbed; smoothed

Example

madhu 1

nt. honey ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning honey
Commentary (VIN 1.4.3.3) madhu nāma makkhikāmadhu.
Non IA maṭṭu (Old Tamil)
Sanskrit madhu

Examples

madhu'vā maññati bālo,
yāva pāpaṃ na paccati,
yadā ca paccati pāpaṃ,
bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.

seyyathā'pi nāma gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nānābhesajjāni seyyath'idaṃ sappi navanītaṃ telaṃ madhu phāṇitaṃ

madhura 1.1

adj. sweet; lovely [madhu + ra] ✓

Grammar adj, from madhu
Meaning sweet; lovely
Construction madhu + ra
Derivative taddhita (ra)
Synonym mañju
Sanskrit madhura

Examples

kāmā hi citrā madhurā manoramā,
aviddasū yattha sitā puthujjanā,
te dukkham'icchanti punabbhav'esino,
cittena nītā niraye nirākatā.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.

Meaning sweet smell; beautiful fragrance

Commentary (THIa) madhuran'ti subhaṃ, sugandhan'ti attho.
Sanskrit madhura

Example

madhurañ'ca pavanti sabbaso,
kusumarajena samuṭṭhitā dumā,
paṭhamavasanto sukho utu,
ehi ramāma supupphite vane.

Meaning intoxicated; doped; drowsy; (comm) become lazy

madhura + ka

madhuvant

adj. sweet; as sweet as honey; lit. having honey quality [madhu + vant] ✓

Grammar adj, from madhu
Meaning sweet; as sweet as honey; lit. having honey quality
Construction madhu + vant
Derivative taddhita (vant)
Commentary (DHPa) tattha madhuvā'ti bālassa hi pāpaṃ akusalakammaṃ karontassa taṃ kammaṃ madhu viya madhurarasaṃ viya iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ manāpaṃ viya upaṭṭhāti. iti naṃ so madhuṃ'va maññati.

Phonetic Change u > v
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (madhuno + āsava)
Commentary (VINa) madhv'āsavo nāma muddikānaṃ jātirasena kato, makkhikamadhunā'pi kariyatī'ti vadanti. (VINt) muddikāraso madhv'āsavo.
Sanskrit madhvāsava

Example

merayo nāma pupph'āsavo phal'āsavo madhv'āsavo guḷ'āsavo sambhārasaṃyutto.

VIN 2.5.6.1 surāpānasikkhāpadaṃ
madhvāsava 2

masc. wine from the flowers of Bassia ✗
mana

adj. having such a mind; -minded; -hearted [√man + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from maññati
Meaning having such a mind; -minded; -hearted
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mana
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

atha kho māro pāpimā, jānāti maṃ uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī'ti dukkhī dummano tatth'ev'antaradhāyī'ti.

SN 5.5 uppalavaṇṇāsuttaṃ
manakkāra

masc. ideation, consideration ✗
manacchaṭṭha

adj. with mind as the sixth [mana + chaṭṭha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mind as the sixth
Construction mana + chaṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (mana + chaṭṭha)
Synonym manochaṭṭha
Sanskrit mano + ṣaṣṭhama
manatā

fem. mentality; mindset; mental attitude; lit. mind state [√man + as + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, in comps, abstr, from manas
Meaning mentality; mindset; mental attitude; lit. mind state
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + tā
manas + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit manastva
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

nivāto nāma nīcamanatā nivātavuttitā, yāya samannāgato puggalo nihatamāno nihatadappo pādapuñchanakacoḷasadiso chinnavisāṇausabhasamo uddhaṭadāṭhasappasamo ca hutvā saṇho sakhilo sukhasambhāso hoti, ayaṃ nivāto.

KHPa 5 maṅgala suttavaṇṇanā
manato

masc. from mind; with regard to mind [√man + as + to] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of vacas, mano group
Meaning from mind; with regard to mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + to
manas + to
Sanskrit manasaḥ
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

manato cepi naṃ, bhikkhave, paṇḍito byatto medhāvī upaparikkhati rittakaññ'eva khāyati, tucchakaññ'eva khāyati, suññakaññ'eva khāyati.

SN 35.238 āsīvisopamasuttaṃ

yathā pana dāruādīhi nipphannāni tāni tāni bhaṇḍāni dārumay'ādīni nāma honti, tathā te'pi manato nipphannattā manomayā nāma.

DHPa 1.11 cakkhupālattheravatthu
manana

nt. thinking [√man] ✗
manayati

pr. causes to think [√man] ✗
manas

masc. mind; mental faculty; intellect [√man + as] ✓

Grammar masc, mano group, from maññati
Meaning mind; mental faculty; intellect
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as
Derivative kita (as)
Commentary (VIN 1.1.3) iti cittamano'ti yaṃ cittaṃ taṃ mano, yaṃ mano taṃ cittaṃ.
Notes mano in comps
Sanskrit manas
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

santaṃ tassa manaṃ hoti,
santā vācā ca kamma ca,
samma'd'aññā vimuttassa,
upasantassa tādino.

DHP 96 arahantavaggo

yañ'ca kho etaṃ bhikkhave vuccati cittaṃ iti'pi mano iti'pi viññāṇaṃ iti'pi tatr'āssutavā puthujjano n'ālaṃ nibbindituṃ n'ālaṃ virajjituṃ n'ālaṃ vimuccituṃ

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ
manasa 1

adj. intent on; set on; focused on; inclining towards; lit. with such a mind [√man + as + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from manas
Meaning intent on; set on; focused on; inclining towards; lit. with such a mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + a
manas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym abhimana
Sanskrit manasa
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

niddaṃ tandiṃ sahe thīnaṃ,
pamādena na saṃvase,
atimāne na tiṭṭheyya,
nibbānamanaso naro.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
manasa 2

adj. with mind; having a mind [√man] ✗
manasaṅkappa

masc. mental intention; desire of the heart [mana + saṅkappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mental intention; desire of the heart
Construction mana + saṅkappa
Compound kammadhāraya (mana + saṅkappa)
Sanskrit manaḥsaṃkalpa

Examples

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā byāpannacittā paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, byāpannacittapaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
manasaññā

fem. mental perception ✗
manasā

masc. by mind; with mind; mentally [√man + as + ā] ✓

Grammar masc, instr sg of manas, mano group
Meaning by mind; with mind; mentally
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + ā
manas + ā
Synonym cetasā
Commentary (SNa) manasā'ti tividhaṃ manosucaritaṃ gahitaṃ.

Examples

manopakopaṃ rakkheyya,
manasā saṃvuto siyā,
manoduccaritaṃ hitvā,
manasā sucaritaṃ care.

DHP 233 kodhavaggo

manasā dhammaṃ viññāya piyarūpe dhamme adhimuccati, appiyarūpe dhamme byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhitakāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
manasākaṭa

nt. name of a Brahman village in Kosala ✗
manasākari

aor. (+acc) paid attention; applied one’s mind (to); lit. made in mind [manasi + akari] ~

Grammar aor of manasikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning paid attention; applied one’s mind (to); lit. made in mind
Construction manasi + akari
Compound comp verb (manasi + akari)
Synonym manasākāsi
manasākāsi

aor. (+acc) paid attention; applied one’s mind (to); lit. made in mind [manasi + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor of manasikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning paid attention; applied one’s mind (to); lit. made in mind
Construction manasi + akāsi
Compound comp verb (manasi + akāsi)
Synonym manasākari
Variant manasikāsi
Sanskrit manaḥ + √kṛ

Examples

tasmā't'iha, moggallāna, yathāsaññissa te viharato taṃ middhaṃ okkamati taṃ saññaṃ mā manas'ākāsi taṃ saññaṃ mā bahulam'akāsi

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

nisajja kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno paccattaṃ yoniso manas'ākāsi. addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno māraṃ pāpimantaṃ kucchigataṃ koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭhaṃ.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
manasānukampī

adj. (+acc) compassionate (towards); sympathetic (towards); lit. compassionate with mind [manasā + anukampī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+acc)
Meaning compassionate (towards); sympathetic (towards); lit. compassionate with mind
Construction manasā + anukampī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manasā + anukampī)
Synonym anukampī, anuddaya, kāruṇika, dayāpanna
Commentary (ITIa) manas'ānukampan'ti cittena anukampanto.
Sanskrit manasā + anukampin

Example

ekam'pi ce pāṇam'aduṭṭhacitto,
mettāyati kusalī tena hoti,
sabbe ca pāṇe manas'ānukampī,
pahūtam'ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

AN 8.1 mettāsuttaṃ
manasānupekkhati

pr. (+acc) mentally recollects; mentally investigates; lit. reconsiders in mind [manasā + anupekkhati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning mentally recollects; mentally investigates; lit. reconsiders in mind
Construction manasā + anupekkhati
Compound comp verb (manasā + anupekkhati)
Sanskrit manasā + anuvīkṣate

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhu yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manas'ānupekkhati.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
manasānupekkhanta

prp. mentally re-examining; carefully considering [manasā + anupekkhanta] ~

Grammar prp, comp vb
Meaning mentally re-examining; carefully considering
Construction manasā + anupekkhanta
Sanskrit manasā + anuvīkṣat
manasānupekkhamāna

prp. (+acc) considering; thinking about; lit. reconsidering in mind [manasā + anupekkhamāna] ~

Grammar prp of manasānupekkhati, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning considering; thinking about; lit. reconsidering in mind
Construction manasā + anupekkhamāna
Compound comp verb (manasā + anupekkhamāna)
Sanskrit manasā + anuvīkṣamāṇa
manasānupekkhita

pp. mentally recollected; reconsidered; rechecked; re-investigated [manasā + anupekkhita] ✓

Grammar pp of manasānupekkhati, comp vb
Meaning mentally recollected; reconsidered; rechecked; re-investigated
Construction manasā + anupekkhita
Compound comp verb (manasā + anupekkhita)
Commentary (ANa) manas'ānupekkhitā'ti cittena anupekkhitā. yassa vācāya sajjhāyitaṃ buddhavacanaṃ manasā cintentassa tattha tattha pākaṭaṃ hoti, mahādīpaṃ jāletvā ṭhitassa rūpagataṃ viya paññāyati, taṃ sandhāyetaṃ vuttaṃ. (ANa) manas'ānupekkhitā'ti cittena olokitā.
Sanskrit manas + anuvīkṣita

Examples

tathārūpā'ssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manas'ānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, sutadhanaṃ

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

sot'ānugatānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ, vacasā paricitānaṃ, manas'ānupekkhitānaṃ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṃ cattāro ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā. katame cattāro?

AN 4.191 sotānugatasuttaṃ
manasi

masc. in mind [√man + as + i] ✓

Grammar masc, loc sg of manas, mano group
Meaning in mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + i
manas + i
Sanskrit manasi
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha. bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho therā bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
manasi katvā

idiom. (+acc) having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind [manasi + katvā] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + abs, abs of manasi karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind
Construction manasi + katvā
Synonym manasi karitvā
Commentary (SNa) manasi katvā'ti citte ṭhapetvā.
Sanskrit manasi + kṛtvā

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo yam'enaṃ hatthidammasārathi kāraṇaṃ kāreti, yadi vā katapubbaṃ yadi vā akatapubbaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto suṇāti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, rañño nāgo sotā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne aṭṭhiṃkatvā manasi katvā sabbaṃ cetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sotā hoti.

AN 5.140 sotasuttaṃ
manasi karitvā

idiom. (+acc) having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind [manasi + karitvā] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + abs, abs of manasi karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind
Construction manasi + karitvā
Antonym amanasikaritvā
Synonym manasi katvā
Commentary (MNa) manasi karitvā'ti manamhi katvā paccavekkhitvā upadhāretvā.
Sanskrit manasi + kṛtvā

Examples

rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappessāma pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ

manasi karohi, aggivessana, manasi karitvā kho, aggivessana, byākarohi. na kho te sandhiyati purimena vā pacchimaṃ pacchimena vā purimaṃ.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
manasi karoti

idiom. (+acc) pays attention; bears in mind; lit. makes in mind [mansi + karoti] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning pays attention; bears in mind; lit. makes in mind
Construction mansi + karoti
Variant manasikaroti
Sanskrit manasi + karoti

Examples

tatra bhikkhave sutavā ariyasāvako paṭiccasamuppādaṃ'y'eva sādhukaṃ yoniso manasi karoti

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ. bhagavā etadavoca.

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
manasi karonta

idiom. (+acc) paying attention; bearing in mind; lit. making in mind [mansi + karonta] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + prp, prp of manasi karoti, trans (+acc)
Meaning paying attention; bearing in mind; lit. making in mind
Construction mansi + karonta
Sanskrit manasi + kurvat

Examples

yoniso, bhikkhave, bhikkhu manasi karonto akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāvetī'ti. etam'atthaṃ bhagavā avoca. tatth'etaṃ iti vuccati

ITI 16 paṭhamasekhasuttaṃ

rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
manasi kātabba

idiom. should be paid attention to; should be kept in mind; lit. to be made in mind [mansi + kātabba] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + ptp, ptp of manasi karoti
Meaning should be paid attention to; should be kept in mind; lit. to be made in mind
Construction mansi + kātabba
Sanskrit manasi + kartavya

Examples

evam'evaṃ khv'āvuso, yv'āyaṃ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro parisuddhavacīsamācāro, y'āssa aparisuddhakāyasamācāratā na s'āssa tasmiṃ samaye manasi kātabbā, yā ca khv'āssa parisuddhavacīsamācāratā s'āssa tasmiṃ samaye manasi kātabbā.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno yaṃ nimittaṃ āgamma yaṃ nimittaṃ manasikaroto uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi, tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tamhā nimittā aññaṃ nimittaṃ manasi kātabbaṃ kusal'ūpasaṃhitaṃ.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
manasi kātuṃ

idiom. (+acc) to pay attention; to keep in mind; lit. to make in mind [manasi + kātuṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + inf, inf of manasikaroti, trans (+acc)
Meaning to pay attention; to keep in mind; lit. to make in mind
Construction manasi + kātuṃ
Sanskrit manasi + kartum

Example

kammaṃ kho me kattabbaṃ bhavissati. kammaṃ kho mayā karontena na sukaraṃ buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ manasi kātuṃ. hand'āhaṃ paṭikacc'eva vīriyaṃ ārabhāmi appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāyā'ti.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ
manasikata

pp. kept in mind, thought over ✗
manasikatvā

abs. (+acc) having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind [manasi + katvā] ✓

Grammar abs of manasi karoti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind
Construction manasi + katvā
Compound comp verb (manasi + katvā)
Antonym amanasikatvā
Synonym manasikaritvā
Commentary (MNa) manasikatvā'ti manasmiṃ karitvā.
Sanskrit manasi + kṛtvā

Example

balatā esā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa yaṃ tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne aṭṭhiṃkatvā manasikatvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ
manasikaraṇīya

ptp. should be attended to; should be kept in mind; lit. to be made in mind [manasi + karaṇīya] ✓

Grammar ptp of manasikaroti, comp vb
Meaning should be attended to; should be kept in mind; lit. to be made in mind
Construction manasi + karaṇīya
Compound alutta sattamī tappurisa (manasi + karaṇīya)
Antonym amanasikaraṇīya
Sanskrit manasi + karaṇīya

Example

idha, bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano manasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti, amanasikaraṇīye dhamme nappajānāti

MN 2.2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
manasikari

aor. (+acc) kept in mind, thought over ✗
manasikaritvā

abs. (+acc) having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind [manasi + karitvā] ~

Grammar abs of manasi karoti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning having paid attention; having applied the mind; lit. having made in mind
Construction manasi + karitvā
Compound comp verb (manasi + karitvā)
Antonym amanasikaritvā
Synonym manasikatvā
Sanskrit manasi + kṛtvā
manasikaroti

pr. (+acc) pays attention; brings to mind [manasi + karoti] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning pays attention; brings to mind
Construction manasi + karoti
Compound comp verb (manasi + karoti)
Antonym amanasikaroti
Sanskrit manasi + kṛ

Examples

taṃ suṇātha sādhukaṃ manasi karotha bhāsissāmī'ti

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ

kull'ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desessāmi nittharaṇ'atthāya, no gahaṇ'atthāya. taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
manasikaronta

prp. (+acc) paying attention; lit. making in mind [manasi + karonta] ✓

Grammar prp of manasikaroti, comp vb, trans (+acc)
Meaning paying attention; lit. making in mind
Construction manasi + karonta
Compound comp verb (manasi + karonta)
Antonym amanasikaronta
Sanskrit manasi + kurvat

Examples

yoniso ca kho, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppannā c'eva āsavā na uppajjanti, uppannā ca āsavā pahīyanti

MN 2 sabbāsavasuttaṃ

saṃvāsena kho, mahārāja, sīlaṃ veditabbaṃ. tañ'ca kho dīghena addhunā, na ittaraṃ, manasikarotā, no amanasikarotā, paññavatā, no duppaññena.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
manasikātabba

ptp. should be paid attention to; should be carefully attended to; mind should be applied to; lit. to be made in mind [manasi + kātabba] ✓

Grammar ptp of manasikaroti, comp vb
Meaning should be paid attention to; should be carefully attended to; mind should be applied to; lit. to be made in mind
Construction manasi + kātabba
Compound alutta sattamī tappurisa (manasi + kātabba)
Antonym amanasikātabba
Sanskrit manasi + kartavya

Example

tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ vitakkasaṅkhārasaṇṭhānaṃ manasikātabbaṃ.

MN 20 vitakkasaṇṭhānasuttaṃ
manasikātuṃ

inf. (+acc) to think about ✗
manasikāra

masc. attention; bringing-to-mind; observation; noticing; focussing; lit. making in mind [manasi + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, from manasikaroti
Meaning attention; bringing-to-mind; observation; noticing; focussing; lit. making in mind
Construction manasi + kāra
Compound alutta sattamī tappurisa (manasi + kāra)
Antonym amanasikāra
Sanskrit manasikāra

Examples

ayoniso manasikārā,
maṇḍanaṃ anuyuñjisaṃ,
uddhato capalo c'āsiṃ,
kāmarāgena aṭṭito.

TH 139 nandattheragāthā

ko pana, bhante, hetu ko paccayo kalyāṇassa kammassa kiriyāya kalyāṇassa kammassa pavattiyā'ti? ... yoniso manasikāro kho, mahāli, hetu, yoniso manasikāro paccayo kalyāṇassa kammassa kiriyāya kalyāṇassa kammassa pavattiyā.

AN 10.47 mahālisuttaṃ
manasikārakusalatā

fem. skill in paying attention; (comm) knowing the three characteristics of impermanence etc. [manasikāra + kusalatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning skill in paying attention; (comm) knowing the three characteristics of impermanence etc.
Construction manasikāra + kusalatā
Commentary (ANa) manasikārakusalatā'ti tāsaṃ'y'eva dhātūnaṃ anicc'ādivasena lakkhaṇattayaṃ āropetvā jānanaṃ.
manasikāranirodha

masc. ending of attention; cessation of noticing [manasikāra + nirodha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ending of attention; cessation of noticing
Construction manasikāra + nirodha
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (manasikārā + nirodha)
Sanskrit manasikāra + nirodha

Example

nāmarūpasamudayā cittassa samudayo, nāmarūpanirodhā cittassa atthaṅ'gamo. manasikārasamudayā dhammānaṃ samudayo, manasikāranirodhā dhammānaṃ atthaṅ'gamo'ti.

SN 47.42 samudayasuttaṃ
manasikārabahulīkāra

masc. frequently paying attention to; regularly bringing-to-mind [manasikāra + bahulīkāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning frequently paying attention to; regularly bringing-to-mind
Construction manasikāra + bahulīkāra
manasikārasamudaya

masc. source of attention; arising from noticing [manasikāra + samudaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning source of attention; arising from noticing
Construction manasikāra + samudaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manasikārassa + samudaya)
Commentary (SNa) manasikārasamudayā'ti ettha pana yonisomanasikārasamudayā bojjh'aṅgadhammānaṃ samudayo, ayonisomanasikārasamudayā nīvaraṇadhammānaṃ.
Sanskrit manasikāra + samudaya

Example

nāmarūpasamudayā cittassa samudayo, nāmarūpanirodhā cittassa atthaṅ'gamo. manasikārasamudayā dhammānaṃ samudayo, manasikāranirodhā dhammānaṃ atthaṅ'gamo'ti.

SN 47.42 samudayasuttaṃ
manasikārasambhava

adj. produced by attention; born from attention; come into being from attention [manasikāra + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by attention; born from attention; come into being from attention
Construction manasikāra + sambhava
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manasikārena + sambhava)
Commentary (ANa) manasikārato sambhavantī'ti manasikārasambhavā.
Sanskrit manasikāra + sambhava

Example

chandamūlakā, āvuso, sabbe dhammā, manasikārasambhavā sabbe dhammā, phassasamudayā sabbe dhammā, vedanāsamosaraṇā sabbe dhammā

AN 10.58 mūlakasuttaṃ
manasikārasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 11.8 (AN11.8) ✗
manasicchati

pr. one's heart desires; your mind wants; lit. wants by mind [manasā + icchati] ✓

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning one's heart desires; your mind wants; lit. wants by mind
Construction manasā + icchati
Compound comp verb (manasā + icchati)
Commentary (SNPa) manas'icchasī'ti manasā icchasi.
Sanskrit manasā + icchati

Example

puccha maṃ sabhiya pañhaṃ,
yaṃ kiñci manas'icchasi,
tassa tass'eva pañhassa,
ahaṃ antaṃ karomi te'ti.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
manaso

masc. of mind; mental [√man + as + o] ✓

Grammar masc, gen sg of manas, mano group
Meaning of mind; mental
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + o
manas + o
Sanskrit manasaḥ
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
manaṃ

ind. nearly; almost; well-nigh ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning nearly; almost; well-nigh
Sanskrit manāk

Example

te evam'āhaṃsu, manaṃ vata, bho, anassāma, manaṃ vata, bho, panassāma.

MN 27 cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṃ
manaṃ padosaye

idiom. (+loc) get angry (with); thinks badly (of); lit. defile the mind ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + opt (+loc)
Meaning get angry (with); thinks badly (of); lit. defile the mind
Sanskrit manam + dūṣayati

Examples

disvāna rūpāni manoramāni,
atho'pi disvāna amanoramāni,
manorame rāgapathaṃ vinodaye,
na c'āppiyaṃ me'ti manaṃ padosaye.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

yo sugatesu manaṃ padosaye,
sataṃ sahassānaṃ nirabbudānaṃ,
chattiṃsatī pañca ca abbudāni,
yam'ariyagarahī nirayaṃ upeti,
vācaṃ manañ'ca paṇidhāya pāpakan'ti.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ
manāniccatā

fem. impermanence of the mind [mano + aniccatā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning impermanence of the mind
Construction mano + aniccatā
manāpa 1

adj. pleasant; likeable; attractive; agreeable; lit. obtained by mind ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning pleasant; likeable; attractive; agreeable; lit. obtained by mind
Antonym amanāpa
Synonym apaṭikūla, appaṭikūla, appaṭikkūla, kanta, kantiya, nikāma, piya, manāpika, manāpiya, manorama, sāta, sundara
Commentary (MNa) manāpo'ti manavaḍḍhanako.
Sanskrit mana + āpa

Examples

ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.

AN 10.71 ākaṅkhasuttaṃ

pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
manāpa 2

nt. something pleasant; something nice; lit. obtained by mind ~

Grammar nt
Meaning something pleasant; something nice; lit. obtained by mind
Antonym amanāpa
Commentary (SNa) manāpaṃ nābhijjhatī'ti iṭṭh'ārammaṇaṃ n'ābhijjhāyati.
Sanskrit mana + āpa
manāpakāyika

adj. belonging to the group of pleasing (gods) [manāpa + kāyika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning belonging to the group of pleasing (gods)
Construction manāpa + kāyika
Commentary (SNt) manāpakāye devanikāye jātā manāpakāyikā.
manāpacārī

adj. acting kindly; behaving pleasantly; charming in conduct [manāpa + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from manāpaṃ carati
Meaning acting kindly; behaving pleasantly; charming in conduct
Construction manāpa + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (manāpa + cārī)
Commentary (SNa) manāpaṃ caratī'ti manāpacārī.
Sanskrit manāpa + cārin

Example

so taṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatiputtaṃ vā upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadeyya, upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante'ti. tam'enaṃ so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upaṭṭhāpeyya. so upaṭṭhaheyya pubb'uṭṭhāyī pacchānipātī kiṃkārapaṭissāvī manāpacārī piyavādī.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
manāpatā

fem. pleasantness; loveliness; attractiveness; agreeableness; lit. obtained by mind state [manāpa + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from manāpa
Meaning pleasantness; loveliness; attractiveness; agreeableness; lit. obtained by mind state
Construction manāpa + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym amanāpatā
Sanskrit mana + āpa +

Example

tam'enaṃ uṭṭhahitvā apāpuritvā olokeyya. tassa saha dassanena manāpatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, appāṭikulyatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, ajegucchatā ca saṇṭhaheyya, suhitānam'pi bhottu'kamyatā assa, pag'eva jighacchitānaṃ.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

manāpadāyī

adj. who gives something pleasant; offering something nice [manāpa + dāyī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who gives something pleasant; offering something nice
Construction manāpa + dāyī
manāpadāyīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.44 (AN5.44) ✗
manāpapariyanta

adj. which results in pleasure; which pleases; lit. ending with pleasant [manāpa + pariyanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which results in pleasure; which pleases; lit. ending with pleasant
Construction manāpa + pariyanta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manāpena + pariyanta)
Commentary (MNa) manāpapariyantan'ti manāpanipphattikaṃ manāpakoṭikaṃ.
Sanskrit mana + āpa + paryanta

Example

manāpapariyantaṃ khv'āhaṃ, mahārāja, pañcasu kāmaguṇesu aggan'ti vadāmi. t'eva, mahārāja, rūpā ekaccassa manāpā honti, t'eva rūpā ekaccassa amanāpā honti.

SN 3.12 pañcarājasuttaṃ
manāpamanāpena

ind. extremely pleasantly; very agreeably [manāpa + manāpa + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, instr sg of manāpa
Meaning extremely pleasantly; very agreeably
Construction manāpa + manāpa + ena
manāpamanāpa + ena
Variant manāpāmanāpena
Commentary (ANa) manāpena paccupaṭṭhitā assū'ti manāpena upaṭṭhānavidhānena paccupaṭṭhitā bhaveyyuṃ.
Sanskrit manāpa + manāpena

Example

telappadīpo c'ettha jhāyeyya, catasso ca pajāpatiyo manāpamanāpena paccupaṭṭhitā assu. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, kumāra, sukhaṃ vā so sayeyya no vā? kathaṃ vā te ettha hotī'ti?

Meaning pleasant sound; nice noise

manāpasavana

Meaning flowing to the pleasant; streaming towards the attractive

Example

yassa chattiṃsati sotā,
manāpasavanā bhusā,
vāhā vahanti duddiṭṭhiṃ,
saṅkappā rāganissitā.

DHP 339 taṇhāvaggo
manāpaṃ

ind. kindly; pleasantly; nicely [manāpa + aṃ] ✓

Meaning kindly; pleasantly; nicely
Construction manāpa + aṃ
Sanskrit manāpa

Example

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
manāpaṃ carati

idiom. (+dat) acts kindly (towards); behaves pleasantly (towards); is nice (to) ✓

Meaning acts kindly (towards); behaves pleasantly (towards); is nice (to)
Sanskrit manāpa + carati

Example

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
manāpāmanāpa

adj. pleasant and unpleasant; agreeable and disagreeable [manāpa + amanāpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pleasant and unpleasant; agreeable and disagreeable
Construction manāpa + amanāpa
Compound dvanda (manāpa ca amanāpa ca)
Synonym iṭṭhāniṭṭha
Commentary (MNa) manāp'āmanāpā'ti ettha aṭṭha lobhasahagatacittasampayuttā manāpā nāma, dve domanassacittasampayuttā amanāpā nāma. (Mnt) ettha manāpaggahaṇena somanassayuttakusalākusalānaṃ, amanāpaggahaṇena domanassayuttaakusalānaṃ, manāpāmanāpaggahaṇena tabbidhurupekkhāyuttānaṃ saṅgahitattā paṭhamanaye saṃkilesaṃ vaṭṭati, nikkilesaṃ vaṭṭatī'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit mana + āpa + amana + āpa

Examples

pathavīsamaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. pathavīsamañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato uppannā manāp'āmanāpā phassā cittaṃ na pariyādāya ṭhassanti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, ānanda, bhikkhuno jivhāya rasaṃ sāyitvā uppajjati manāpaṃ, uppajjati amanāpaṃ, uppajjati manāp'āmanāpaṃ.

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ
manāpika

adj. likeable; pleasant; attractive [manāpa + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from manāpa
Meaning likeable; pleasant; attractive
Construction manāpa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Antonym amanāpika
Synonym manāpa
Variant manāpiya
Sanskrit manāpa + ika

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpikesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
manāpiya

adj. likeable; pleasant; attractive [manāpa + iya] ✓

Grammar adj, from manāpa
Meaning likeable; pleasant; attractive
Construction manāpa + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Antonym amanāpiya
Synonym manāpa
Variant manāpika
Sanskrit manāpa + iya

Examples

taṇhā avijjā ca piy'āpiyañ'ca,
subhāni rūpāni sukhā ca vedanā,
manāpiyā kāmaguṇā ca vantā,
vante ahaṃ āvamituṃ na ussahe.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci bhikkhuno kāyagatāsati abhāvitā abahulīkatā, taṃ cakkhu āviñchati manāpiyesu rūpesu, amanāpiyā rūpā paṭikūlā honti

SN 35.247 chappāṇakasuttaṃ
manāpena

ind. pleasantly; agreeably [manāpa + ena] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg of manāpa
Meaning pleasantly; agreeably
Construction manāpa + ena
Antonym amanāpena
Sanskrit manāpena

Example

api ca me, āvuso, satthā pariciṇṇo dīgharattaṃ manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. etañ'hi, āvuso, sāvakassa patirūpaṃ yaṃ satthāraṃ paricareyya manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. anupavajjaṃ channo bhikkhu satthaṃ āharissatī'ti, evam'etaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, dhārehī'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
manāpeneva

sandhi. only pleasantly; only nicely; lit. only with agreeable [manāpena + eva] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + ind
Meaning only pleasantly; only nicely; lit. only with agreeable
Construction manāpena + eva
Sanskrit manāpena + eva

Example

api ca me, āvuso, satthā pariciṇṇo dīgharattaṃ manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. etañ'hi, āvuso, sāvakassa patirūpaṃ yaṃ satthāraṃ paricareyya manāpen'eva, no amanāpena. anupavajjaṃ channo bhikkhu satthaṃ āharissatī'ti, evam'etaṃ, āvuso sāriputta, dhārehī'ti.

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
manāyatana

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning field of the mind; mental sphere
Construction manas + āyatana

Sanskrit manas + āyatana

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, saḷ'āyatanaṃ? cakkh'āyatanaṃ, sot'āyatanaṃ, ghān'āyatanaṃ, jivh'āyatanaṃ, kāy'āyatanaṃ, man'āyatanaṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saḷ'āyatanaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkh'āyatanaṃ sot'āyatanaṃ ghān'āyatanaṃ jivh'āyatanaṃ kāy'āyatanaṃ man'āyatanaṃ

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yatv'ādhikaraṇam'enaṃ man'indriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
manindriyanirodha

Meaning ending of mind; cessation of the mental faculty

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the ending of mind; going to the cessation of the mental faculty

manindriyasaṃvara

masc. restraint of the mental faculty; lit. mind faculty restraint [manindriya + saṃvara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning restraint of the mental faculty; lit. mind faculty restraint
Construction manindriya + saṃvara
Compound sattamī tappurisa (manindriye + saṃvara)
Sanskrit manaḥ + indriya + saṃvara

Example

yañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhave, man'indriyasaṃvaraṃ asaṃvutassa viharato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, man'indriyasaṃvaraṃ saṃvutassa viharato evaṃsa te āsavā vighātapariḷāhā na honti.

MN 2.3 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
manindriyasaṃvarasaṃvuta

adj. with the mental faculty restrained [manindriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the mental faculty restrained
Construction manindriya + saṃvara + saṃvuta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manindriyasaṃvarena + saṃvuta)
Sanskrit manaḥ + indriya + saṃvara + saṃvṛta

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cakkhu'ndriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... sot'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... ghān'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... jivh'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... kāy'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto ... man'indriyasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati.

MN 2.3 sabbāsavasuttaṃ
manu

masc. primordial man; archetypal man ~

Grammar masc
Meaning primordial man; archetypal man
Sanskrit manu
manuja

masc. human being; person; lit. born from Manu [manu + ja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human being; person; lit. born from Manu
Construction manu + ja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (manusmā + ja)
Synonym manussa
Commentary (MNa) manujassā'ti lokavohāravasena ekassa sattassa. (SNa) manujassā'ti sattassa.
Sanskrit manuja

Examples

manujassa sadā satīmato,
mattaṃ jānato laddhabhojane,
tanu tassa bhavanti vedanā,
saṇikaṃ jīrati āyupālayan'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ

manujassa pamattacārino,
taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.

DHP 334 taṇhāvaggo
manujādhipa

masc. ruler of men; king; prince [manuja + adhipa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ruler of men; king; prince
Construction manuja + adhipa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manujānaṃ + adhipa)
Synonym narinda, manujinda
Sanskrit manujādhipa

Example

pañcavīsasahassamhi,
kappānaṃ manuj'ādhipā,
abbudanirabbudāni,
aṭṭhaṭṭhāsiṃsu khattiyā.

APA 329 nigguṇḍipupphiya therāpadānaṃ
manujādhipati

masc. ruler of men; lord of human beings [manuja + adhipati] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ruler of men; lord of human beings
Construction manuja + adhipati
manujinda

masc. prince; king; (comm) foremost of men; lit. lord of men [manuja + inda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning prince; king; (comm) foremost of men; lit. lord of men
Construction manuja + inda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manujānaṃ + inda)
Synonym manujādhipa
Commentary (MNa) manuj'indo'ti manuss'ādhipati param'issaro hutvā. (SNa) manuj'indo'ti manussajeṭṭhako.
Sanskrit manujendra

Example

ṭhānañ'hi so manuj'indo,
rajjaṃ laddhāna khattiyo,
so kuddho rājadaṇḍena,
tasmiṃ pakkamate bhusaṃ,
tasmā taṃ parivajjeyya,
rakkhaṃ jīvitam'attano.

SN 3.1 daharasuttaṃ
manuñña 1

adj. (of food) lovely; delicious [mano + ña] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (of food) lovely; delicious
Construction mano + ña
Sanskrit manojña

Example

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso manuññabhojanaṃ bhuttāvī chaḍḍeyya. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu tassa purisassa tasmiṃ vante puna bhottu'kamyatā assā'ti?

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
manuñña 2

adj. beautiful [mano + ña] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning beautiful
Construction mano + ña
Synonym suvaṇṇa
Sanskrit manojña
manuñña 3

adj. delightful, pleasant ✗
manuññabhojana

nt. delicious food [manuñña + bhojana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning delicious food
Construction manuñña + bhojana
manuññasadda

masc. the word "beautiful" [manuñña + sadda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning the word "beautiful"
Construction manuñña + sadda
manussa

masc. human being; man; person [manu + ssa] ✓

Grammar masc, from manu
Meaning human being; man; person
Construction manu + ssa
Derivative taddhita (ssa)
Antonym amanussa
Synonym jana, jantu, nara, purisa, manuja, mānusa
Sanskrit manuṣya

Examples

appakā te manussesu,
ye janā pāragāmino,
ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā,
tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.

DHP 85 paṇḍitavaggo

tattha cakkhumā puriso majjhe ṭhito passeyya manusse gehaṃ pavisante'pi nikkhamante'pi

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
manussaka

adj. human [manu + ssa + ka] ~

Grammar adj, from manussa
Meaning human
Construction manu + ssa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym mānusa, mānussaka
manussakanta

adj. agreeable to humans; liked by humans; pleasing to people [manussa + kanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning agreeable to humans; liked by humans; pleasing to people
Construction manussa + kanta
Compound catutthī tappurisa (manussānaṃ + kanta)
Sanskrit manuṣya + kānta

Example

seyyathā'pi, aggivessana, hatthidamako mahantaṃ thambhaṃ pathaviyaṃ nikhaṇitvā āraññakassa nāgassa gīvāyaṃ upanibandhati āraññakānañ'c'eva sīlānaṃ abhinimmadanāya ... gām'ante abhiramāpanāya manussakantesu sīlesu samādapanāya.

MN 125 dantabhūmisuttaṃ
manussakapaṇa

masc. wretched person; impoverished man [manussa + kapaṇa] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wretched person; impoverished man
Construction manussa + kapaṇa
Commentary (SNa) manussakapaṇo'ti manussakāruññataṃ patto. (SNt) manussakapaṇo'ti manussesu vā paramanihīno.
manussakamya

adj. desiring humans; wanting humans; (comm) wishing to harm humans [manussa + kamya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning desiring humans; wanting humans; (comm) wishing to harm humans
Construction manussa + kamya
Commentary (SNa) manussakamyā'ti manussakāmatāya, manusse viheṭhetukāmatāyā'ti attho.
manussakasaṭa

masc. human vileness; nastiness of men [manussa + kasaṭa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human vileness; nastiness of men
Construction manussa + kasaṭa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussānaṃ + kasaṭa)
Notes see manussagahana
Sanskrit manuṣya + sakaṭa

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā evaṃ manussagahane evaṃ manussakasaṭe evaṃ manussasāṭheyye vattamāne sattānaṃ hit'āhitaṃ jānāti. gahanañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ manussā, uttānakañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ pasavo.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
manussakāya

masc. human body [manussa + kāya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human body
Construction manussa + kāya
manussakuṇapa

masc. human corpse; man's dead body [manussa + kuṇapa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human corpse; man's dead body
Construction manussa + kuṇapa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussassa + kuṇapa)
Sanskrit manuṣya + kuṇapa

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhante, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭīyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, kaṃsapāti ābhatā āpaṇā vā kammārakulā vā parisuddhā pariyodātā. tam'enaṃ sāmikā ahikuṇapaṃ vā kukkurakuṇapaṃ vā manussakuṇapaṃ vā racayitvā aññissā kaṃsapātiyā paṭikujjitvā antarāpaṇaṃ paṭipajjeyyuṃ.

Construction manussa + khippa
Commentary (ANa) manussakhippaṃ maññe loke uppanno'ti mahājanassa saggamokkhagamanamagge tattha gamananivāraṇ'atthaṃ manussakuminaṃ viya loke uppanno. (ANt) manussakhippaṃ maññe'ti manussā patitvā byasanappattiatthaṃ oṭṭitaṃ kuminaṃ viya. ten'āha, mahājanassā'tiādi.
manussagandha

masc. human smell; human scent [manussa + gandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human smell; human scent

manussagahana

nt. human complexity; complicatedness of men [manussa + gahana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning human complexity; complicatedness of men
Construction manussa + gahana
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussānaṃ + gahana)
Commentary (MNa) manussagahane'ti manussānaṃ ajjhāsayagahanena gahanatā, ajjhāsayassā'pi nesaṃ kilesagahanena gahanatā veditabbā. kasaṭasāṭheyyesu'pi eseva nayo.
Sanskrit manuṣya + gahana

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā evaṃ manussagahane evaṃ manussakasaṭe evaṃ manussasāṭheyye vattamāne sattānaṃ hit'āhitaṃ jānāti. gahanañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ manussā, uttānakañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ pasavo.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
manussaggāha

masc. clutch of humans; capture by human beings [manussa + gāha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning clutch of humans; capture by human beings
Construction manussa + gāha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manussehi + gāha)
Commentary (SNa) na manussaggāho gahessatī'ti mahā vat'āyaṃ dārukkhandho'ti disvā, uḷumpena taramānā gantvā, gopānasīādīnaṃ atthāya manussā na gaṇhissanti.
Sanskrit manuṣya + grāha

Example

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, sace tumhe'pi ... na manussaggāho gahessati, na amanussaggāho gahessati, na āvaṭṭaggāho gahessati, na antopūtī bhavissatha, evaṃ tumhe, bhikkhave, nibbānaninnā bhavissatha nibbānapoṇā nibbānapabbhārā.

SN 35.241 paṭhamadārukkhandhopamasuttaṃ
manussacutitiracchānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.103 (SN56.103) ✗
manussacutidevanirayādisutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.105-107 (SN56.105-107) ✗
manussacutinirayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.102 (SN56.102) ✗
manussacutipettivisayasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 56.104 (SN56.104) ✗
manussatta 1

nt. human existence; human state [manu + ssa + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from manussa
Meaning human existence; human state
Construction manu + ssa + tta
manussa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit manuṣyatā

Examples

nirayaṃ tiracchānayoniṃ,
yamalokaṃ upapajjare,
sace enti manussattaṃ,
dalidde jāyare kule.

SN 1.49 maccharisuttaṃ

evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ manussattaṃ labhati. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho. evaṃ adhiccam'idaṃ, bhikkhave, yaṃ tathāgatappavedito dhammavinayo loke dibbati.

SN 56.48 dutiyachiggaḷayugasuttaṃ
manussatta 2

nt. fact of being a human [manu] ✗
manussattappaṭilābha

masc. becoming a human being; acquiring the human state [manussatta + paṭilābha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning becoming a human being; acquiring the human state
Construction manussatta + paṭilābha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussattassa + paṭilābha)
Synonym manussapaṭilābha
Sanskrit manuṣyatā + pratilābha

Example

yaṃ pan'etaṃ, mahārāja, bhagavatā kāṇakacchap'opamaṃ upadassitaṃ manussattappaṭilābhāya, tath'ūpamaṃ, mahārāja, imesaṃ samāgamaṃ dhārehi.

manussadobhagga

nt. wretched human state; human misfortune; personal failure [manussa + dobhagga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wretched human state; human misfortune; personal failure
Construction manussa + dobhagga
Commentary (ANa) manussadobhagyan'ti manussesu sampattirahitaṃ pañcavidhaṃ nīcakulaṃ. (KVt) manussadobhaggena vā'ti kāṇā homi, kuṇī homi, itarā vā īdisā hotū'tiādinā manussavirūpabhāvena.
manussadobhagya

nt. unfortunate human state; wretched human condition [manussa + dobhagya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning unfortunate human state; wretched human condition
Construction manussa + dobhagya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (manussesu + dobhagya)
Commentary (ANa) manussadobhagyan'ti manussesu sampattirahitaṃ pañcavidhaṃ nīcakulaṃ.
Sanskrit manuṣya + daurbhāgya

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa dānamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu parittaṃ kataṃ hoti, sīlamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu parittaṃ kataṃ hoti, bhāvanāmayaṃ puññakiriyavatthuṃ n'ābhisambhoti. so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā manussadobhagyaṃ upapajjati.

AN 8.36 puññakiriyavatthusuttaṃ
manussadhamma

masc. human state; normal condition; lit. human nature [manussa + dhamma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human state; normal condition; lit. human nature
Construction manussa + dhamma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussassa + dhamma)
Commentary (MNa) uttari manussadhammā'ti manussadhammato uttari
Sanskrit manuṣya + dharma

Example

n'atthi samaṇassa gotamassa uttari manussadhammā alam'ariyañāṇadassanaviseso. takkapariyāhataṃ samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ deseti vīmaṃs'ānucaritaṃ sayaṃpaṭibhānaṃ. yassa ca khv'āssa atthāya dhammo desito so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
manussantarāya

masc. danger posed by human beings ✗
manussapaṭilābha

masc. becoming a human being; acquiring the human state [manussa + paṭilābha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning becoming a human being; acquiring the human state
Construction manussa + paṭilābha
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (manussaṃ + paṭilābha)
Synonym manussattappaṭilābha
Sanskrit manuṣya + pratilābha

Example

kiccho manussapaṭilābho,
kicchaṃ maccāna jīvitaṃ,
kicchaṃ saddhammassavanaṃ,
kiccho buddhānam'uppādo.

DHP 182 buddhavaggo
manussapaṇḍaka

Construction manussa + paṇḍaka
Commentary (VINa) paṇḍakā'ti ussannakilesā avūpasantapariḷāhā napuṃsakā, te pariḷāhaveg'ābhibhūtā yena kenaci saddhiṃ mittabhāvaṃ patthenti.

manussaphassa

masc. human contact; human encounter [manussa + phassa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human contact; human encounter
Construction manussa + phassa
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + phassa)
Commentary (NIDD1) manussaphassā vuccanti corā vā assu mānavā vā katakammā vā akatakammā vā. te bhikkhuṃ pañhaṃ vā puccheyyuṃ vādaṃ vā āropeyyuṃ akkoseyyuṃ paribhāseyyuṃ roseyyuṃ viroseyyuṃ hiṃseyyuṃ vihiṃseyyuṃ heṭheyyuṃ viheṭheyyuṃ ghāteyyuṃ upaghāteyyuṃ upaghātaṃ vā kareyyuṃ. yo koci manussato upaghāto, manussaphasso.
Sanskrit manuṣya + sparśa

Example

pañcannaṃ dhīro bhayānaṃ na bhāye,
bhikkhu sato sapariyantacārī,
ḍaṃs'ādhipātānaṃ sarīsapānaṃ,
manussaphassānaṃ catuppadānaṃ.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
manussabhāva

masc. state of human being ✗
manussabhāvasaṅkhāta

adj. what is called human state ✗
manussabhūta 1

adj. in human form; of human birth; lit. become human [manussa + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning in human form; of human birth; lit. become human
Construction manussa + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + bhūta)
Commentary (THa) manussabhūtan'ti manussesu bhūtaṃ, nibbattaṃ, manuss'attabhāvaṃ vā pattaṃ. (ANa) manussabhūtan'ti dev'ādibhāvaṃ anupagantvā manussam'eva bhūtaṃ.
Sanskrit manuṣya + bhūta

Example

manussabhūtaṃ sambuddhaṃ,
attadantaṃ samāhitaṃ,
iriyamānaṃ brahmapathe,
cittass'ūpasame rataṃ.

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā
manussabhūta 2

masc. human birth; human state; lit. become human [manussa + bhūta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human birth; human state; lit. become human
Construction manussa + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + bhūta)
Sanskrit manuṣya + bhūta

Example

yam'pi bhikkhave tathāgato purimaṃ jātiṃ purimaṃ bhavaṃ purimaṃ niketaṃ pubbe manussabhūto samāno micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappesi

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
manussabhūta 3

masc. human being; lit. become human [manussa + bhūta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human being; lit. become human
Construction manussa + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + bhūta)
Synonym manussapāṇa
Sanskrit manuṣya + bhūta

Examples

ime ce'pi, bhaddiya, mahāsālā imāya āvaṭṭaniyā āvaṭṭeyyuṃ akusaladhammappahānāya kusaladhamm'ūpasampadāya, imesam'pi'ssa mahāsālānaṃ dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāya, ko pana vādo manussabhūtassā'ti!

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ

thūṇaṃ ce'p'āhaṃ acetanaṃ vādena vādaṃ samārabheyyaṃ, sā'pi mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddhā saṅkampeyya sampakampeyya sampavedheyya. ko pana vādo manussabhūtassā'ti?

AN 8.29 akkhaṇasuttaṃ
manussaloka

masc. human world; world of men; human realm [manussa + loka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human world; world of men; human realm
Construction manussa + loka
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + loka)
Sanskrit manuṣya + loka

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ

loko'ti nirayaloko tiracchānaloko pettivisayaloko manussaloko devaloko khandhaloko dhātuloko āyatanaloko ayaṃ loko paro loko brahmaloko devaloko, ayaṃ vuccati loko.

NIDD2 2.1 ajita māṇava pucchā niddesa
manussalokagamanīya

adj. which leads to the human realm; which is conducive to human rebirth [manussaloka + gamanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which leads to the human realm; which is conducive to human rebirth
Construction manussaloka + gamanīya
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (manussalokaṃ + gamanīya)
Sanskrit manuṣya + loka + gamanīya

Example

katamā ca, bhikkhave, āsavānaṃ vemattatā? atthi, bhikkhave, āsavā nirayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā tiracchānayonigamanīyā, atthi āsavā pettivisayagamanīyā, atthi āsavā manussalokagamanīyā, atthi āsavā devalokagamanīyā.

AN 6.63 nibbedhikasuttaṃ
manussalokagāmī

adj. leading to the human realm; conducive to human rebirth [manussaloka + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to the human realm; conducive to human rebirth
Construction manussaloka + gāmī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (manussalokaṃ + gāmī)
Sanskrit manuṣya + loka + gāmin

Example

manusse c'āhaṃ, sāriputta, pajānāmi, manussalokagāmiñ'ca maggaṃ, manussalokagāminiñ'ca paṭipadaṃ, yathā paṭipanno ca kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā manussesu upapajjati tañ'ca pajānāmi.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
manussalokavedanīya

adj. to be experienced in the human realm [manussalokavedanīya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning to be experienced in the human realm
Construction manussalokavedanīya
Commentary (ANa) nirayavedanīyan'ti niraye vipākadāyakaṃ. sesesu'pi es'eva nayo.
manussavarāka

masc. wretched person; pitiful man [manussa + varāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wretched person; pitiful man
Construction manussa + varāka
Commentary (SNa) manussavarāko'ti manussalāmako. (UDa) manussavarāko'ti manussānaṃ hīḷitaparibhūtatāya ativiya dīno.
manussaviggaha

masc. human being; human individual; lit. taken human form [manussa + viggaha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human being; human individual; lit. taken human form
Construction manussa + viggaha
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + viggaha)
Commentary (VIN 1.1.3) manussaviggaho nāma yaṃ mātukucchismiṃ paṭhamaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, yāva maraṇakālā etth'antare eso manussaviggaho nāma.
Sanskrit mānuṣavigraha

Example

yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, satthahārakaṃ v'āssa pariyeseyya, maraṇavaṇṇaṃ vā saṃvaṇṇeyya, maraṇāya vā samādapeyya

VIN PAT PA 3 manussaviggahasikkhāpadaṃ
manussaviggahapārājika

nt. offence involving defeat related to humans [manussaviggaha + pārājika] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning offence involving defeat related to humans
Construction manussaviggaha + pārājika
manussaviggahapārājikāpatti

fem. expellable offence of (killing a) human being [manussaviggaha + pārājikāpatti] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning expellable offence of (killing a) human being
Construction manussaviggaha + pārājikāpatti
manussaviggahitthi

adj. which has taken the form of a human female [manussaviggaha + itthi] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning which has taken the form of a human female
Construction manussaviggaha + itthi
manussasaññā

fem. perception of people; concept of humans [manussa + saññā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning perception of people; concept of humans
Construction manussa + saññā
manussasāṭheyya

nt. human deviousness; treachery of men [manussa + sāṭheyya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning human deviousness; treachery of men
Construction manussa + sāṭheyya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussānaṃ + sāṭheyya)
Notes see manussagahana
Sanskrit manuṣya + śāṭhya

Example

yāvañ'c'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā evaṃ manussagahane evaṃ manussakasaṭe evaṃ manussasāṭheyye vattamāne sattānaṃ hit'āhitaṃ jānāti. gahanañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ manussā, uttānakañ'h'etaṃ, bhante, yadidaṃ pasavo.

MN 51 kandarakasuttaṃ
manussasobhagya

nt. fortunate human state; prosperous human condition [manussa + sobhagya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning fortunate human state; prosperous human condition
Construction manussa + sobhagya
Compound sattamī tappurisa (manussesu + sobhagya)
Antonym manussadobhagya
Commentary (ANa) manussasobhagyan'ti manussesu subhagabhāvaṃ tividhakulasampattiṃ.
Sanskrit manuṣya + saubhāgya

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, ekaccassa dānamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu mattaso kataṃ hoti, sīlamayaṃ puññakiriyavatthu mattaso kataṃ hoti, bhāvanāmayaṃ puññakiriyavatthuṃ n'ābhisambhoti. so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā manussasobhagyaṃ upapajjati.

AN 8.36 puññakiriyavatthusuttaṃ
manussādhipati

masc. lord of men; ruler of men [manussa + adhipati] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lord of men; ruler of men
Construction manussa + adhipati
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manussānaṃ + adhipati)
Synonym narinda
Sanskrit manuṣya + adhipati, manujādhipati

Example

cakkavattī ahuṃ rājā,
jambumaṇḍassa issaro,
muddh'āvasitto khattiyo,
manuss'ādhipatī ahuṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
manussāsurasakkarakkhasā

masc. humans, demons, Sakka and goblins [manussa + asura + sakka + rakkhasa + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning humans, demons, Sakka and goblins
Construction manussa + asura + sakka + rakkhasa + ā
manussāsurasakkarakkhasa + ā
Commentary (DNa) manuss'āsurasakkarakkhasā'ti manussā ca asurā ca sakkā ca rakkhasā ca.
manussitthī

fem. human woman; human female [manussa + itthī] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning human woman; human female
Construction manussa + itthī
Compound kammadhāraya (manussa + itthī)
Commentary (VINa) pag'eva manuss'itthiyā'ti paṭhamataraṃ manussajātikāya itthiyā
Sanskrit manuṣya + strī

Examples

antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pī'ti tiracchānagat'itthiyā'pi methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo, pag'eva manuss'itthiyā. tena vuccati, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pī'ti.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī na petī, na tiracchānagatā. antamaso tadahujātā'pi dārikā, pag'eva mahattarī.

VIN 1.2.2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ
manussinda

masc. lord of men; ruler of men ✗
manussindaseṭṭha

masc. foremost lord of men ✗
manussubhatobyañjanaka

masc. human hermaphrodite; human androgyne [manussa + ubhatobyañjanaka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning human hermaphrodite; human androgyne
Construction manussa + ubhatobyañjanaka
Commentary (VINa) ubhatobyañjanā'ti itthinimittena ca purisanimittena cā'ti ubhohi byañjanehi samannāgatā.
manussesu

masc. among men; among human beings [manu + ssa + esu] ✓

Grammar masc, loc pl of manussa
Meaning among men; among human beings
Construction manu + ssa + esu
manussa + esu
Sanskrit manuṣyeṣu

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, appakā te sattā ye manussesu paccājāyanti. atha kho ete'y'eva bahutarā sattā ye aññatra manussehi paccājāyanti.

SN 20.2 nakhasikhasuttaṃ

appakā te manussesu,
ye janā pāragāmino,
ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā,
tīram'eva anudhāvati.

DHP 85 paṇḍitavaggo
maneja

adj. unperturbed; unmoved; unruffled; unshakeable [[m] + na + √ej + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from na ejati, neg
Meaning unperturbed; unmoved; unruffled; unshakeable
Root Family √ej
Root √ej･1 a (move, shake)
Construction [m] + na > an + √ej + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change +m
Compound kammadhāraya (na + eja)
Antonym eja
Synonym akuppa, niccalika
Variant aneja
Commentary (SNa) ūhacca manejā'ti ete taṇhāejāya anejā bhikkhū indakhīlaṃ ūhacca samūhanitvā catūsu disāsu appaṭihatacārikaṃ caranti.
Sanskrit anejat
Sanskrit Root √ej 1 (stir)

Example

chetvā khīlaṃ chetvā palighaṃ,
indakhīlaṃ ūhacca manejā,
te caranti suddhā vimalā,
cakkhumatā sudantā susunāgā'ti.

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ
manesikā

fem. thought-reading ✗
mano 1

masc. mind; mental [√man + o] ✓

Grammar masc, in comps, mano group, from manas
Meaning mind; mental
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + o
Sanskrit mano, manas
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
mano 2

masc. mind; mental (object) [√man + as + o] ✓

Grammar masc acc sg of manas, mano group
Meaning mind; mental (object)
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man + as + o
manas + o
Commentary (MNa) yo mano padūseyyā'ti yo bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā mano padūseyya, taṃ kakacena okantanaṃ n'ādhivāseyya.
Sanskrit mano, manas
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
mano padūseyya

idiom. has ill-will; gets angry; lit. causes to spoil the mind ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + pr
Meaning has ill-will; gets angry; lit. causes to spoil the mind
Commentary (MNa) yo mano padūseyyā'ti yo bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā mano padūseyya, taṃ kakacena okantanaṃ n'ādhivāseyya.
Sanskrit manum + pradūṣayati

Examples

ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsanakaro.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

vuttaṃ kho pan'etaṃ bhagavatā kakac'ūpam'ovāde, ubhatodaṇḍakena ce'pi, bhikkhave, kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam'aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatr'āpi yo mano padūseyya na me so tena sāsanakaro'ti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
manokamma

nt. mental action; thought; intention; lit. mind action [mano + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mental action; thought; intention; lit. mind action
Construction mano + kamma
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + kamma)
Synonym aḍḍhakamma, citta
Sanskrit manas + karman

Examples

kusalaṃ idaṃ manokammaṃ sukh'udrayaṃ sukhavipākan'ti, ten'eva tvaṃ, rāhula, pītipāmojjena vihareyyāsi ahoratt'ānusikkhī kusalesu dhammesu.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu visamena kāyakammena samannāgato hoti, visamena vacīkammena samannāgato hoti, visamena manokammena samannāgato hoti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ
manokammanta

masc. thought; mental action [mano + kammanta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thought; mental action
Construction mano + kammanta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manaso + kammanta)
Sanskrit manas + karmānta

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
manokammantasandosabyāpatti

fem. corruption and failure of mental action [manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning corruption and failure of mental action
Construction manokammanta + sandosa + byāpatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manokammantassa + sandosabyāpatti)
Commentary (ANa) kāyakammantasandosabyāpattī'ti kāyakammantasaṅkhātā vipatti. iminā nayena sabbapadāni veditabbāni.
Sanskrit manas + karmānta + saṃdoṣa (bsk) + vyāpatti

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasandosabyāpatti akusalasañcetanikā dukkh'udrayā dukkhavipākā hoti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
manokammantasampatti

fem. successful accomplishment of mental action [manokammanta + sampatti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning successful accomplishment of mental action
Construction manokammanta + sampatti
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manokammantassa + sampatti)
Sanskrit manas + karmānta + sampatti

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, tividhā kāyakammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, catubbidhā vacīkammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti, tividhā manokammantasampatti kusalasañcetanikā sukh'udrayā sukhavipākā hoti.

AN 10.217 paṭhamasañcetanikasuttaṃ
manokasāva

Meaning (gram) mano group of masculine nouns

manochaṭṭha

adj. with mind as the sixth [mano + chaṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mind as the sixth
Construction mano + chaṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + chaṭṭha)
Synonym manacchaṭṭha
Sanskrit mano + ṣaṣṭhama

Example

pañca kāmaguṇā loke,
manochaṭṭhā paveditā,
ettha chandaṃ virājetvā,
evaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

SN 1.30 eṇijaṅghasuttaṃ
manojajātaka

nt. Jātaka 397 (JA 397) ✗
manojava

adj. swift as thought ✗
manodaṇḍa

masc. (Jain) mental action [mano + daṇḍa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning (Jain) mental action
Construction mano + daṇḍa
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + daṇḍa)
Commentary (MNa) kāyadaṇḍaṃ vacīdaṇḍaṃ manodaṇḍan'ti ettha purimadaṇḍadvayaṃ te acittakaṃ payyapenti. yathā kira vāte vāyante sākhā calati, udakaṃ calati, na ca tattha cittaṃ atthi, evaṃ kāyadaṇḍo'pi acittako'va hoti. yathā ca vāte vāyante tālapaṇṇ'ādīni saddaṃ karonti, udakāni saddaṃ karonti, na ca tattha cittaṃ atthi, evaṃ vacīdaṇḍo'pi acittako'va hotī'ti imaṃ daṇḍadvayaṃ acittakaṃ paññapenti. cittaṃ pana manodaṇḍan'ti paññapenti.
Sanskrit mano + daṇḍa

Example

tīṇi kho, āvuso gotama, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto daṇḍāni paññapeti pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyāti, seyyath'idaṃ, kāyadaṇḍaṃ, vacīdaṇḍaṃ, manodaṇḍan'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
manoduccarita

nt. mental misconduct; misbehaviour by mind [mano + duccarita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mental misconduct; misbehaviour by mind
Construction mano + duccarita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manasā + duccarita)
Antonym manosucarita
Commentary (VINa) manoduccaritan'ti abhijjhābyāpādamicchādiṭṭhiyo veditabbā. (ANa) manoduccaritan'ti abhijjhādi tividhaṃ akusalakammaṃ.
Sanskrit manas + duścarita

Examples

manopakopaṃ rakkheyya,
manasā saṃvuto siyā,
manoduccaritaṃ hitvā,
manasā sucaritaṃ care.

DHP 233 kodhavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako hirīmā hoti, hirīyati kāyaduccaritena vacīduccaritena manoduccaritena, hirīyati pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ samāpattiyā. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, hirīdhanaṃ

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ
manoduccaritasamaṅgī

manodhātu

fem. mind; mind element; mentality; lit. mind state [mano + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning mind; mind element; mentality; lit. mind state
Construction mano + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manaso + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu ... tisso manodhātuyo manodhātu, vedanādayo tayo khandhā sukhumarūpāni nibbānañca dhammadhātu, sabbampi manoviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇadhātūti.
Sanskrit manodhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

DHP 233 kodhavaggo
manopaṭibaddha

adj. mentally attached; mind-bound [mano + paṭibaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mentally attached; mind-bound
Construction mano + paṭibaddha
Compound sattamī tappurisa (manamhi + paṭibaddha)

Sanskrit mano + pratibandha

Example

asu hi, bhante, manopaṭibaddho kālaṅ'karotī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
manopaṇidhi

masc. heart's aspiration; mind's resolve ✗
manopadosa 1

masc. ill-will; aversion; hatred [mano + padosa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ill-will; aversion; hatred
Construction mano + padosa
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + padosa)
Synonym dosa, byāpāda, sampadosa
Commentary (SNPa) akkuṭṭho manopadosaṃ rakkheyya
Sanskrit manas + pradveṣa

Examples

samānabhāgaṃ kubbetha,
gāme akkuṭṭhavanditaṃ,
manopadosaṃ rakkheyya,
santo anuṇṇato care.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, isīnaṃ manopadosena taṃ daṇḍakī'raññaṃ kāliṅg'āraññaṃ majjh'āraññaṃ mātaṅg'āraññaṃ araññaṃ araññabhūtan'ti.

manopavicāra

masc. mental exploration; mental probing [mano + upavicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mental exploration; mental probing
Construction mano + upavicāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + upavicāra)

Examples

cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha bāhirāni āyatanāni veditabbāni, cha viññāṇakāyā veditabbā, cha phassakāyā veditabbā, aṭṭhārasa mano'pavicārā veditabbā, chattiṃsa sattapadā veditabbā

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā somanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, domanassaṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati, upekkhāṭṭhānīyaṃ rūpaṃ upavicarati.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ
manopasāda

masc. devotional feeling ✗
manopubbaṅgama

adj. led by mind; preceded by mind; headed by mind; with mind as forerunner [mano + pubbaṅgama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning led by mind; preceded by mind; headed by mind; with mind as forerunner
Construction mano + pubbaṅgama
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + pubbaṅgama)
Commentary (DHPa) dhammā'ti vedan'ādayo tayo khandhā. ete hi uppādapaccay'aṭṭhena somanassasampayuttamano pubbaṅ'gamo etesan'ti manopubbaṅgamā nāma.
Sanskrit manas + pūrva + gama

Example

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo
manobhāvaniya

adj. who are worthy of respect; worthy of esteem; lit. who should be developed in mind [mano + bhāvaniya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who are worthy of respect; worthy of esteem; lit. who should be developed in mind
Construction mano + bhāvaniya
Variant manobhāvanīya
manobhāvanīya

adj. who are worthy of respect; worthy of esteem; lit. who should be developed in mind [mano + bhāvanīya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who are worthy of respect; worthy of esteem; lit. who should be developed in mind
Construction mano + bhāvanīya
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + bhāvanīya)
Variant manobhāvaniya
Commentary (SNa) manobhāvanīyānan'ti manavaḍḍhakānaṃ. yesu hi diṭṭhesu kusalavasena cittaṃ vaḍḍhati, te sāriputtamoggallānādayo mahātherā manobhāvanīyā nāma.
Sanskrit manas + bhāvanīya

Examples

aniccadassāvī kho pan'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato manobhāvanīyānañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

so khv'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ vā payirupāsitvā manobhāvanīye vā bhikkhū sāyanhasamayaṃ kapilavatthuṃ pavisanto, bhantena'pi hatthinā samāgacchāmi, bhantena'pi assena samāgacchāmi

SN 55.21 paṭhamamahānāmasuttaṃ
manomaya 1

adj. mind made; mentally produced [mano + maya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning mind made; mentally produced
Construction mano + maya
Commentary (MNa) manomayā'ti jhānacittamayā.
Sanskrit manomaya

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

papañcasaññā itarītarā narā,
papañcayantā upayanti saññino,
manomayaṃ gehasitañ'ca sabbaṃ,
panujja nekkhammasitaṃ irīyati.

SN 35.94 adantāguttasuttaṃ

Grammar masc, comp

Construction mano + maya
Sanskrit manomaya
manomayiddhiñāṇa

nt. knowledge of the supernatural power of mental creation ✗

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mental sage-hood

manoratha

masc. heart’s desire; object of interest; wish [mano + ratha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heart’s desire; object of interest; wish
Construction mano + ratha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manaso + ratha)
Sanskrit manoratha

Example

sabbattha sukhito hutvā,
saṃsaritvā bhav'ābhave,
anāgatamhi addhāne,
lacchase taṃ manorathaṃ.

APA 539 mahākoṭṭhika therāpadānaṃ
manorathapūraṇī

fem. commentary on the Aṅguttara Nikāya compiled by Buddhaghosa; lit. fulfiller of the heart's desire [manoratha + pūraṇī] ~

Meaning commentary on the Aṅguttara Nikāya compiled by Buddhaghosa; lit. fulfiller of the heart's desire
Construction manoratha + pūraṇī
manorama

adj. delightful; pleasant; attractive; lit. mind pleasing [mano + rama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning delightful; pleasant; attractive; lit. mind pleasing
Construction mano + rama
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + rama)
Antonym amanorama
Synonym manāpa, rāmaṇeyyaka
Sanskrit manorama

Examples

yathā saṅkāraṭhānasmiṃ,
ujjhitasmiṃ mahāpathe,
padumaṃ tattha jāyetha,
sucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ.

DHP 58 pupphavaggo

dhī taṃ jammi jare atthu,
dubbaṇṇakaraṇī jare,
tāva manoramaṃ bimbaṃ,
jarāya abhimadditaṃ.

SN 48.41 jarādhammasuttaṃ
manoramaṃ bhāsaṃ

idiom. delightful language; Magadha language; Pāḷi language ✗
manovaṅka

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning crookedness of mind
Construction mano + vaṅka
manovicāra

masc. mind wandering; daydreaming; imagining [mano + vicāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mind wandering; daydreaming; imagining
Construction mano + vicāra
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manaso + vicāra)
Commentary (THa) manovicāre uparundha cetaso'ti manovicārasaññino gehasitasomanass'upavicār'ādike aṭṭhārasa cetaso uparundha vārehi nirodhehi.
Sanskrit manas + vicāra

Example

aniccaṃ dukkhan'ti vipassa yoniso,
suññaṃ anattā'ti aghaṃ vadhan'ti ca,
manovicāre uparundha cetaso,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
manoviññāṇa

nt. thinking and knowing; mind consciousness; mental awareness; sentience; lit. mind knowing [mano + viññāṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning thinking and knowing; mind consciousness; mental awareness; sentience; lit. mind knowing
Construction mano + viññāṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + viññāṇa)
Sanskrit manas + vijñāna

Examples

nissaṭṭhena āvuso, pañcahi indriyehi parisuddhena manoviññāṇena ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, anantaṃ viññāṇan'ti viññāṇ'añc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ

MN 43 mahāvedallasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, viññāṇakāyā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, viññāṇaṃ.

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ
manoviññāṇadhātu

fem. knowing; mind consciousness element; mental awareness; lit. mind consciousness state [manoviññāṇa + dhātu] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning knowing; mind consciousness element; mental awareness; lit. mind consciousness state
Construction manoviññāṇa + dhātu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (manoviññāṇassa + dhātu)
Commentary (SNa) cakkhudhātū'tiādīsu ... tisso manodhātuyo manodhātu, vedanādayo tayo khandhā sukhumarūpāni nibbānañca dhammadhātu, sabbampi manoviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇadhātūti.
Sanskrit manas + vijñāna + dhātu

Example

evaṃ, bhante. idaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā, cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu … manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu.

SN 41.2 paṭhamaisidattasuttaṃ
manoviññāṇanissita

adj. dependent on mental awareness [manoviññāṇa + nissita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning dependent on mental awareness
Construction manoviññāṇa + nissita
manoviññāṇaviññātabba

adj. knowable by awareness; lit. to be known by mind knowing [mano + viññāṇa + viññātabba] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning knowable by awareness; lit. to be known by mind knowing
Construction mano + viññāṇa + viññātabba
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manoviññāṇena + viññātabba)
Sanskrit manas + vijñāna + vijñātavya

Example

manaṃ, āvuso channa, manoviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇaviññātabbe dhamme etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti samanupassasī'ti?

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
manoviññeyya

adj. knowable; known by the mind; lit. to be known by the mind [mano + viññeyya] ✓

Grammar adj, ptp, comp
Meaning knowable; known by the mind; lit. to be known by the mind
Construction mano + viññeyya
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (manasā + viññeyya)
Sanskrit manas + vijñeya

Examples

ye te manoviññeyyā dhammā aviññātā aviññātapubbā, na ca vijānāsi, na ca te hoti vijāneyyan'ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

bhusā ce'pi manoviññeyyā dhammā manassa āpāthaṃ āgacchanti, n'ev'assa cittaṃ pariyādiyanti. amissīkatam'ev'assa cittaṃ hoti ṭhitaṃ āneñjappattaṃ vayañ'c'ass'ānupassati.

AN 6.55 soṇasuttaṃ
manovitakka

masc. thought; (comm) thought arisen in the mind; lit. thought in mind [mano + vitakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning thought; (comm) thought arisen in the mind; lit. thought in mind
Construction mano + vitakka
Compound sattamī tappurisa (manamhi + vitakka)
Commentary (SNa) manovitakke'ti manamhi uppannavitakke.
Sanskrit manas + vitarka

Example

kummo aṅgāni sake kapāle,
samodahaṃ bhikkhu manovitakke,
anissito aññam'aheṭhayāno,
parinibbuto n'ūpavadeyya kañcī'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
manosaṅkhāra

masc. intention which results in mental action [mano + saṅkhāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning intention which results in mental action
Construction mano + saṅkhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + saṅkhāra)
Commentary (MNa) ubhayacopanaṃ appattā raho cintayantassa manodvāre pavattā manosaṅkhāro nāma.
Sanskrit mano + saṃskāra

Example

katamañ'ca, puṇṇa, kammaṃ kaṇhaṃ kaṇhavipākaṃ? idha, puṇṇa, ekacco sabyābajjhaṃ kāyasaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ vacīsaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṃ manosaṅkhāraṃ abhisaṅkharoti.

MN 57 kukkuravatikasuttaṃ

Sanskrit manas + saṃcetanā

Example

kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

Example

vācāya vā h'ānanda, sati vacīsañcetanāhetu uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ. mane vā h'ānanda, sati manosañcetanāhetu uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ avijjāpaccayā ca.

SN 12.25 bhūmijasuttaṃ
manosatta

Sanskrit mano + sajjita

atthi, bhante, manosattā nāma devā tattha so upapajjati.

Sanskrit mano + śastra

SN 12.2 vibhaṅgasuttaṃ

cakkhusamphasso... sotasamphasso... ghānasamphasso... jivhāsamphasso... kāyasamphasso... manosamphasso loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā uppajjamānā uppajjati, ettha nivisamānā nivisati

Sanskrit manas + saṃsparśa + ja

Examples

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, domanassaṃ? yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, cetasikaṃ dukkhaṃ cetasikaṃ asātaṃ manosamphassajaṃ dukkhaṃ asātaṃ vedayitaṃ, idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, domanassaṃ

DN 22.15 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, vedanākāyā, cakkhusamphassajā vedanā, sotasamphassajā vedanā, ghānasamphassajā vedanā, kāyasamphassajā vedanā, manosamphassajā vedanā.

kāyasmiṃ sati kāyasamphassapaccayā uppajjati ajjhattaṃ sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ. manasmiṃ sati manosamphassapaccayā

SN 35.236 paṭhamahatthapādopamasuttaṃ
manosamphassaviññāṇāyatana

nt. contact with the mind and the corresponding field of consciousness; mental impression and the associated dimension of knowing [manosamphassa + viññāṇāyatana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning contact with the mind and the corresponding field of consciousness; mental impression and the associated dimension of knowing
Construction manosamphassa + viññāṇāyatana
Commentary (SNa) cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanan'ti cakkhuviññāṇena sampayutto cakkhusamphasso'pi viññāṇ'āyatanam'pi mam'evā'ti. ettha ca cakkhusamphassena viññāṇasampayuttakā dhammā gahitā, viññāṇ'āyatanena sabbāni'pi cakkhudvāre uppannāni āvajjan'ādiviññāṇāni. sotadvār'ādīsu'pi eseva nayo.

Meaning field of mental experience; lit. mind contact field

manosilā

fem. red arsenic ✗
manosucarita

nt. good mental conduct; wholesome thought [mano + sucarita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning good mental conduct; wholesome thought
Construction mano + sucarita
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + sucarita)
Antonym manoduccarita
Sanskrit manas + sucarita

Examples

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā

VIN 1.0 verañjakaṇḍaṃ
manosucaritasamaṅgī

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has the quality of ethical thought; endowed with the quality of virtuous mental behaviour
Construction manosucarita + samaṅgī
manoseṭṭha

adj. with mind as chief; ruled by mind; lit. mind foremost [mano + seṭṭha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with mind as chief; ruled by mind; lit. mind foremost
Construction mano + seṭṭha
Compound kammadhāraya (mano + seṭṭha)
Commentary (DHPa) evaṃ adhipativasena pana mano seṭṭho etesan'ti manoseṭṭhā. yathā hi gaṇ'ādīnaṃ adhipati puriso gaṇaseṭṭho seṇiseṭṭh'oti vuccati, tathā tesam'pi mano'va seṭṭho.
Sanskrit mano + śreṣṭha

Example

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.
