Sanskrit manohara
manoharadassana

adj. visually appealing; visually captivating ✗
manta 1.1

masc. mantra; scripture; sacred hymn; Veda; chant [√mant + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from manteti
Meaning mantra; scripture; sacred hymn; Veda; chant
Root Family √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)
Construction √mant + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mantra
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Examples

asajjhāyamalā mantā,
anuṭṭhānamalā gharā,
malaṃ vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ,
pamādo rakkhato malaṃ.

DHP 241 malavaggo

ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu, ko paccayo yen'ekadā dīgharattaṃ sajjhāyakatā'pi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pag'eva asajjhāyakatā?

SN 46.55 saṅgāravasuttaṃ
manta 1.2

masc. incantation of spells [√mant + a] ✓

Grammar masc, from manteti
Meaning incantation of spells
Root Family √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)
Construction √mant + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mantra
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Example

yathā, mahārāja, mahiyā rājaputtānaṃ hatthi-assa-ratha-dhanu-tharu-lekha-muddā-sikkhā-khagga-manta-suti-sammuti-yuddha-yujjhāpana-kiriyā karaṇīyā, avasesānaṃ puthu-vessa-suddānaṃ kasi vaṇijjā gorakkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
manta 2.1

adj. (gram) ending with the letter m [ma + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (gram) ending with the letter m
Construction ma + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (ma + anta)
Synonym makāranta
Sanskrit ma + anta

Example

7. vaggā pañcapañcaso m'antā.

bālāvatāra sandhi kaṇḍa
mantajjhāyaka

masc. who masters the Vedas; reciter of the Vedas [manta + ajjhāyaka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning who masters the Vedas; reciter of the Vedas
Construction manta + ajjhāyaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mantānaṃ + ajjhāyaka)
Sanskrit mantra + adhyāyaka

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
mantajjhāyakamatta

nt. mere fact of being a reciter of the Vedas [mantajjhāyaka + matta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning mere fact of being a reciter of the Vedas
Construction mantajjhāyaka + matta
Sanskrit mantra + adhyāyaka + mātra

Example

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, ubbhaṭṭhakassa ubbhaṭṭhakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, pariyāyabhattikassa pariyāyabhattikamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi. n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, mantajjhāyakassa mantajjhāyakamattena sāmaññaṃ vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
mantajjhena

nt. recitation of mantras [manta + ajjhena] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning recitation of mantras
Construction manta + ajjhena
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mantānaṃ + ajjhena)
Sanskrit mantra + adhyayana
mantatthika

adj. wanting (to learn) the mantras ✗
mantadhara

adj. counsellor; advisor; bearer of the Vedas [manta + dhara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning counsellor; advisor; bearer of the Vedas
Construction manta + dhara
Compound kammadhāraya (manta + dhara)
Sanskrit mantradhara

Example

uppātesu nimittesu,
lakkhaṇesu ca kovidaṃ,
ajjhāyakaṃ mantadharaṃ,
porohicce ṭhapeti so.

APA 8 upāli therāpadānaṃ
mantana

nt. consultation, discussion [√mant] ✗
mantanā

fem. discussing; counselling; consulting [√mant + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from manteti
Meaning discussing; counselling; consulting
Root Family √mant
Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)
Construction √mant + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Sanskrit mantra
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Examples

etadatthā, bhikkhave, kathā, etadatthā mantanā, etadatthā upanisā, etadatthaṃ sot'āvadhānaṃ, yadidaṃ anupādā cittassa vimokkho'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ,
sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti,
esā ariyāna mantanā,
etadaññāya medhāvī,
na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

Construction manta + pada

Example

brāhmaṇā mantabandhavā,
te ca pāpesu kammesu,
abhiṇham'upadissare.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
mantabhāṇī

masc. wise speaker; sage counsellor; lit. who recites the Vedas [manta + bhāṇī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wise speaker; sage counsellor; lit. who recites the Vedas
Construction manta + bhāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (manta + bhāṇī)
Variant mantābhāṇī, mattabhāṇī
Sanskrit mantra + bhāṇin

Examples

upasanto uparato,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
dhunāti pāpake dhamme,
dumapattaṃ'va māluto'ti.

TH 2 mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā

akkodhano asantāsī,
avikatthī akukkuco,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
sa ve vācāyato muni.

SNP 48 purābhedasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 10

Construction manta + bhāsā

Commentary (ANa) mantabhāsā'ti mantasaṅkhātāya paññāya paricchinditvā kathitakathā.

esā ariyāna mantanā,

na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

AN 3.68 kathāvatthusuttaṃ

kim'idaṃ kusalaṃ kim'ācarema,
icc'eke hi samecca mantayanti,
te mayaṃ puna'r'eva laddha mānusattaṃ,
paṭipannā viharemu sīlavanto.

VV 53 chattamāṇavaka vimānavatthu

Meaning discussing (with); consulting (with)

satthukappena vata kira, bho, sāvakena saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha, āyasmā sāriputto'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ
mantayi

aor. consulted; discussed; took counsel; deliberated [√mant + *aya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of mantayati, intrans
Meaning consulted; discussed; took counsel; deliberated
Root Family √mant
Root √mant･8 *aya (counsel, invite)
Base √mant + aya > mantaya
Construction mantaya + i
Sanskrit mantr
Sanskrit Root √mantr 10 (speak)

Example

ayaṃ pan'ettha saṅkhepo, bhagavato kira bhikkhusaṅghassa ca pañcannaṃ mahānadīnaṃ mah'oghasadise lābhasakkāre uppanne hatalābhasakkārā aññatitthiyā sūriy'uggamanakāle khajjopanakā viya nippabhā hutvā ekato sannipatitvā mantayiṃsu.

mantayitvā

Meaning diplomatic battle; war of wits
Construction manta + yuddha

masc. thinker; knower; self; agent [√man + tar] ✓

Root √man･3 ya (think)

Examples

yo ubho'nte viditvāna,

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

mūlaṃ papañcasaṅkhāya,
mantā asmī'ti sabbam'uparundhe,
yā kāci taṇhā ajjhattaṃ,
tāsaṃ vinayā sadā sato sikkhe.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

mantaṃ

sandhi. that to me [maṃ + taṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning that to me
Construction maṃ + taṃ
Phonetic Change ṃ > n
Variant maṃ taṃ, mattaṃ
Sanskrit mām + tam

Examples

m'āvamaññetha pāpassa,

udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
bālo pūrati pāpassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

m'āvamaññetha puññassa,
na man'taṃ āgamissati,
udabindunipātena,
udakumbho'pi pūrati,
dhīro pūrati puññassa,
thokaṃ thokam'pi ācinaṃ.

DHP 122 pāpavaggo
mantā

fem. (comm) wisdom; understanding; intelligence [√mant] ✗
mantāṇiputta

masc. family name of a Sakyan monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in giving Dhamma talks; lit. son of Mantāṇī [mantāṇi + putta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, matr
Meaning family name of a Sakyan monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in giving Dhamma talks; lit. son of Mantāṇī
Construction mantāṇi + putta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mantāṇissa + putta)
Variant mantāniputta
Commentary (MNa) mantāṇiyā pana so putto, tasmā mantāṇiputto'ti vuccati. (MNa) mantāṇiputto'ti mantāṇiyā brāhmaṇiyā putto. (AN1.196) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammakathikānaṃ yadidaṃ puṇṇo mantāṇiputto.

Examples

puṇṇo nāma, bhante, āyasmā mantāṇiputto jātibhūmiyaṃ jātibhūmakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ evaṃ sambhāvito, attanā ca app'iccho app'icchakathañ'ca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

evaṃ vutte, āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ puṇṇaṃ mantāṇiputtaṃ etadavoca, konāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? puṇṇo'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, mantāṇiputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.

MN 24 rathavinītasuttaṃ

mantādhiṭṭhāna

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning relying on mantras; supported by scripture
Construction manta + adhiṭṭhāna
Commentary (ANa) sesapadesu pan'ettha ayam'adhippāyo, brāhmaṇā tāva mante labhitvā laddhapatiṭṭhā nāma honti, gahapatikā yaṃkiñci sippaṃ, itthī kuladāyajjasāmikaṃ puttaṃ, corā yaṃkiñci āvudhasatthaṃ, samaṇā sīlaparipuṇṇā laddhapatiṭṭhā nāma honti. tasmā mant'ādhiṭṭhānā'tiādīni vuttāni.

Commentary (MNa) mantāṇiyā pana so putto, tasmā mantāṇiputto'ti vuccati. (MNa) mantāṇiputto'ti mantāṇiyā brāhmaṇiyā putto. (AN1.196) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammakathikānaṃ yadidaṃ puṇṇo mantāṇiputto.

uragavaggo 7

APA 14 ekatthambhika therāpadānaṃ
mantenta

prp. taking counsel; discussing; deliberating [√mant + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of manteti, intrans
Meaning taking counsel; discussing; deliberating

Root √mant･8 *e (counsel, invite)

Example

VIN 2.5.8.8 upassutisikkhāpadaṃ
mantesi

aor. consulted, took counsel, discussed [√mant] ✗
mantha 1

Meaning biscuit; (comm) sweat made with flour, sesame and rice for a journey

Root √manth･1 a (shake, crush)
Construction √manth + a

Commentary (KVa) manthehī'ti pātheyy'atthāya paṭiyattehi yehi kehici sattutilataṇḍul'ādīhi.

Sanskrit Root √math √manth 1, 9 (shake)

Example

bhikkhuṃ pan'eva kulaṃ upagataṃ pūvehi vā manthehi vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā dvattipattapūrā paṭiggahetabbā.

VIN PAT PC 34 kāṇamātusikkhāpadaṃ
mantha 2

masc. churning stick [√manth] ✗
manthara

masc. tortoise ✗
mantheti

pr. churns [√manth] ✗
manda 1

adj. dull; dull-witted; slow; stupid; not bright [√mad + na] ✓

Grammar adj, from majjati
Meaning dull; dull-witted; slow; stupid; not bright
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + na
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change dn > nd (metahtesis)
Synonym jaḷa, mudu
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit manda
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

tattha katamā cha gehasitā upekkhā? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā uppajjati upekkhā bālassa mūḷhassa mandassa puthujjanassa anodhijinassa avipākajinassa anādīnavadassāvino assutavato puthujjanassa.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

andhabālo'si, mahārāja, kiñ'c'āpi mahābhakkho'si, anekasūpabyañjanavikatikaṃ doṇapākaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñjasi, dvīsu raṭṭhesu rajjaṃ kāresi, paññā pana te mandā'ti

DHPa 1.5.1 aññatarapurisa vatthu
manda 2

masc. fool; idiot [√mad + na] ✓

Grammar masc, from majjati
Meaning fool; idiot
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + na
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change dn > nd (metahtesis)
Synonym aviddasu, duppañña, dummedha, bāla
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit manda
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Examples

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.

DHP 325 nāgavaggo

yo ve avidvā upadhiṃ karoti,
punappunaṃ dukkham'upeti mando,
tasmā pajānaṃ upadhiṃ na kayirā,
dukkhassa jātippabhav'ānupassī.

SNP 59 mettagū māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 4
manda 3

Meaning (of eyes) soft; tender; charming; (comm) wide

Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + na

Phonetic Change dn > nd (metahtesis)

ahaṃ tava vas'ānugo siyaṃ,

na hi m'atthi tayā piyattaro,
pāṇo kinnarimandalocane.

MN 48 kosambiyasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena daharo kumāro mando uttānaseyyako abhayassa rājakumārassa aṅke nisinno hoti.

mandatta

Grammar nt, abstr, from manda
Meaning ignorance; stupidity; confusion; (comm) state of being stupid and not knowing

Sanskrit mandatā

Examples

AN 5.93 byākaraṇasuttaṃ

mandattā momūhattā paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, pāpiccho icchāpakato paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, paribhavaṃ paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, aññātu'kāmo paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati

AN 5.165 pañhapucchāsuttaṃ
mandapuñña

adj. who has little merit; unfortunate [manda + puñña] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has little merit; unfortunate
Construction manda + puñña
mandaputhuvilocana

adj. with soft wide eyes ✗
mandamanda

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very dull; extremely slow
Construction manda + manda
Commentary (VINa) mandamando'ti abhikkant'ādīnaṃ anuddhatatāya atimando. atisaṇho'ti evaṃ guṇam'eva dosato dassenti.
mandamandaṃ

ind. slowly, little by little ✗

Meaning soft eyes; tender gaze

mandārava

masc. coral tree [mandāru + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from mandāra
Meaning coral tree
Construction mandāru > mandārav + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > av
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erythrina
Sanskrit mandārava

Example

dibbāni'pi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṃ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.

mandāravapuppha

mandiya 1

nt. doziness; dullness; stupidity; lit. stupid state [√mad + na + iya] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from manda
Meaning doziness; dullness; stupidity; lit. stupid state
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + na + iya
manda + iya
Derivative taddhita (iya)
Phonetic Change dn > nd (metahtesis)
English Cognate mad, madness
Sanskrit māndya
Sanskrit Root √mad 1, 2, 3, 4 (be exhilarated)

Example

na mandiyā sayāmi n'āpi kāveyyamatto,
atthaṃ samecc'āham'apetasoko,
eko vivitte sayan'āsanamhi,
sayām'ahaṃ sabbabhūt'ānukampī.

SN 4.13 sakalikasuttaṃ

Meaning name of a deity; lit. drunkenness
Root Family √mad
Root √mad･3 ya (be mad, intoxicated)
Construction √mad + na + iya
manda + iya

Meaning name of a king
mandhātujātaka

nt. Jātaka 258 (JA 258) ✗
mama 1

pron. to me; for me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st dat sg of ahaṃ
Meaning to me; for me
Antonym amama
Variant mayhaṃ, me, mamaṃ
Sanskrit mahyam, me

Examples

mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, aham'p'āyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, viramath'āyasmanto mama vacanāyā'ti.

VIN PAT SA 12 dubbacasikkhāpadaṃ

ehi tvaṃ, tāta sudassana, bhagavato santike imaṃ gāthaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā mama bhatt'ābhihāre bhāsa. ahañ'ca te devasikaṃ kahāpaṇasataṃ bhikkhaṃ pavattayissāmī'ti.

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
mama 2

pron. my; mine; of me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st gen sg of ahaṃ
Meaning my; mine; of me
Antonym amama
Variant mamaṃ, mayha, mayhaṃ, me
Sanskrit mama, me

Examples

yaṃ pan'āniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ, etaṃ mama, eso'ham'asmi, eso me attā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante

SN 22.79 khajjanīyasuttaṃ

rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ, attani vā rūpaṃ, rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ, ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan'ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
mama vacanena

idiom. in my name; lit. by my word ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + nt
Meaning in my name; lit. by my word
Sanskrit mama + vacena

Examples

atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena ariṭṭhaṃ bhikkhuṃ gaddhabādhipubbaṃ āmantehi, satthā taṃ, āvuso ariṭṭha, āmantetī'ti.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ

atha kho bhagavā aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena theraṃ bhikkhuṃ āmantehi, satthā taṃ, āvuso thera, āmantetī'ti.

SN 21.10 theranāmakasuttaṃ
mama santike

idiom. in my presence; into my presence; to me; lit. near of me ✓

Grammar idiom, pron + prep
Meaning in my presence; into my presence; to me; lit. near of me
Sanskrit mama + samantikam

Examples

ye te, sunakkhatta, bhikkhū mama santike aññaṃ byākaṃsu ... sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu, santi pan'idh'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena'pi aññaṃ byākaṃsu.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ

sace, mārisā, dev'āsurasaṅgāme samupabyūḷhe asurā jineyyuṃ devā parājineyyuṃ, yena naṃ sakkaṃ devānam'indaṃ kaṇṭhapañcamehi bandhanehi bandhitvā mama santike āneyyātha asurapuran'ti.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
mamaṅkāra

masc. my making; possessiveness; attachment; self-interest [mamaṃ + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning my making; possessiveness; attachment; self-interest
Construction mamaṃ + kāra
Phonetic Change ṃ > ṅ
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (mamaṃ + kāra)
Variant mamaṃkāra
Sanskrit mamakāra

Examples

siyā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhuno tathārūpo samādhipaṭilābho yathā imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'ānusayā n'āssu, bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'ānusayā n'āssu, yañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ upasampajja viharato ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'ānusayā na honti tañ'ca cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ upasampajja vihareyyā'ti?

AN 3.32 ānandasuttaṃ

sabbaloke ca atam'mayo bhavissāmi, ahaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti, mamaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti

Phonetic Change ṃc > ñc
Sanskrit mām + ca

Sanskrit mām + eva

AN 8.63 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
mamatta

nt. possession; ownership; lit. mine state [mama + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from mama
Meaning possession; ownership; lit. mine state
Construction mama + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit mamatva

Examples

tiṇakaṭṭhasamaṃ lokaṃ,
yadā paññāya passati,
mamattaṃ so asaṃvindaṃ,
n'atthi me'ti na socati.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

maraṇena'pi taṃ pahīyati,
yaṃ puriso mam'idan'ti maññati,
etam'pi viditvā paṇḍito,
na mamattāya nametha māmako.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
mamattha

adj. useful for me; of use to me [mama + attha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning useful for me; of use to me
Construction mama + attha
Commentary (VINa) na mam'attho'ti n'atthi mama attho.
mamanti

sandhi. "mine"; "belonging to me" [mamaṃ + iti] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning "mine"; "belonging to me"
Construction mamaṃ + iti
Sanskrit mām + iti

Examples

tassa rūpaṃ ... vedanaṃ ... saññaṃ ... saṅkhāre ... viññāṇaṃ samanvesato yāvatā viññāṇassa gati, yam'pi'ssa taṃ hoti ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā tam'pi tassa na hotī'ti.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

kiṃ pan'imassa mattaṭṭhakassa kāyassa taṇh'upādinnassa ahan'ti vā maman'ti vā asmī'ti vā? atha khv'āssa no't'ev'ettha hoti.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

Meaning to me then
Construction mama + api
Sanskrit mahyam + api

Example

mamassa

sandhi. it could be my; it would be for me [mama + assa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + opt, impers
Meaning it could be my; it would be for me
Construction mama + assa
Sanskrit mama + syāt

Examples

yaṃ, bhikkhave, sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā, tam'ahaṃ na jānāmī'ti vadeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā.

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ

ovadatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, anusāsatu maṃ, bhante, bhagavā, yaṃ mam'assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā'ti.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ
mamaṃ 1

pron. me (object); about me [[m] + amha + aṃ] ✓

Phonetic Change +m
Variant maṃ
Commentary (MNa) mamaṃ uddissā'ti maṃ uddissa.
Sanskrit mām

Examples

yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.

SN 21.1 kolitasuttaṃ

yo hoti bhikkhu arahaṃ katāvī,
khīṇ'āsavo antimadehadhārī,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyyā'ti?

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ
mamāyati

pr. (+acc) takes as mine; makes one's own; treasures; cherishes; possesses [mama + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of mama, trans (+acc)
Meaning takes as mine; makes one's own; treasures; cherishes; possesses
Construction mama + āya + ti
Synonym kelāyati
Commentary (MNa) mamāyethā'ti taṇhādiṭṭhīhi mamattaṃ uppādeyyātha.

Examples

gāmakathāya āvaraye sotaṃ,
rase ca n'ānugijjheyya,
na ca mamāyetha kiñci lokasmiṃ.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14

imaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiṃ evaṃ parisuddhaṃ evaṃ pariyodātaṃ allīyetha kelāyetha dhanāyetha mamāyetha, api nu me tumhe, bhikkhave, kull'ūpamaṃ dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājāneyyātha nittharaṇ'atthāya no gahaṇ'atthāyā'ti?

evaṃvihārī sato appamatto,

jātiṃ jaraṃ sokapariddavañ'ca,
idh'eva vidvā pajaheyya dukkhaṃ.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
mamāyitvā

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

DHP 74 bālavaggo
mamevārabbha

sandhi. especially for me; for me alone; on my account [maṃ + eva + ārabbha] ✓

Commentary (MNa) ārabbhā'ti sandhāya.
Sanskrit mama + eva + ārabhya

Example

abhijānāmi kho pan'āhaṃ, aggivessana, anekasatāya parisāya dhammaṃ desetā. apissu maṃ ekam'eko evaṃ maññati, mam'ev'ārabbha samaṇo gotamo dhammaṃ desetī'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
mamevettha

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + adv
Meaning in this case just (ask) me
Construction maṃ + eva + ettha
Sanskrit mām + eva + atra

Example

sace me tvaṃ, vappa, anuññeyyañ'c'eva anujāneyyāsi, paṭikkositabbañ'ca paṭikkoseyyāsi, yassa ca me bhāsitassa atthaṃ na jāneyyāsi mam'ev'ettha uttari paṭipuccheyyāsi, idaṃ, bhante, kathaṃ, imassa ko attho'ti, siyā no ettha kathāsallāpo'ti.

AN 4.195 vappasuttaṃ
mamma

nt. vital spot of the body, nerve centre ✗
mammacchedaka

adj. wounding a vital spot, very harsh or fatal ✗
mammaṭṭhāna

nt. vital spot of the body, nerve centre ✗
mammana

adj. stuttering; who stammers ✗
maya

adj. made of; constructed by [√mā + ya] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from miṇāti
Meaning made of; constructed by
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā + ya
Derivative kita (ya)
Sanskrit maya
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

manopubbaṅ'gamā dhammā,
manoseṭṭhā manomayā,
manasā ce paduṭṭhena,
bhāsati vā karoti vā,
tato naṃ dukkham'anveti,
cakkaṃva vahato padaṃ.

DHP 1 yamakavaggo

na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tam'mayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
mayañhi

sandhi. we indeed [mayaṃ + hi] ✓

Meaning we indeed
Construction mayaṃ + hi
Sanskrit vayam + hi

Examples

mayañ'hi, bho gotama, antevāsiṃ labhitvā paṭhamaṃ evaṃ gaṇāpema, ekaṃ ekakaṃ, dve dukā, tīṇi tikā, cattāri catukkā, pañca pañcakā, cha chakkā, satta sattakā, aṭṭha aṭṭhakā

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

mayañ'hi, bhante, pubbe aññatitthiye paribbājake anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyā'ti amaññimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyabhojanaṃ bhojimha, anājānīy'eva samāne ājānīyaṭhāne ṭhapimha.

MN 54 potaliyasuttaṃ
mayamettha

sandhi. in this case we [mayaṃ + ettha] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + adv
Meaning in this case we
Construction mayaṃ + ettha
Sanskrit vayam + atra

Example

pare micchāvimuttī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāvimuttī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
mayampi

sandhi. we too [mayaṃ + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning we too
Construction mayaṃ + api
Sanskrit vayam + api

Examples

suppaṭipann'āttha, mārisā, ujuppaṭipann'āttha, mārisā, ek'antasukhassa lokassa sacchikiriyāya. mayam'pi hi, mārisā, evaṃpaṭipannā ek'antasukhaṃ lokaṃ upapannā'ti? iti puṭṭhā no'ti vadanti.

DN 9.6 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, ekaṃsikadhammo

mayam'pi kho, āvuso, sāvakānaṃ evaṃ dhammaṃ desema, etha tumhe, āvuso, pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe satta bojjh'aṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvethā'ti.

SN 46.53 aggisuttaṃ
mayampetaṃ

sandhi. we too this [mayaṃ + api + etaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pron
Meaning we too this
Construction mayaṃ + api + etaṃ
Sanskrit vayam + api + etam

Example

nissaṃsayena tvaṃ buddho bhavissasi, mayam'p'etaṃ jānāma, yass'etāni nimittāni paññāyanti, ek'antena so buddho hoti

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
mayaṃ

pron. we; I (royal plural) ✓

Grammar pron, 1st nom pl of ahaṃ
Meaning we; I (royal plural)
Variant amhe
Sanskrit vayam

Examples

pare ca na vijānanti,
mayam'ettha yamāmase,
ye ca tattha vijānanti,
tato sammanti medhagā.

DHP 6 yamakavaggo

yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
mayaṃ tu

idiom. we however; I however ~

Grammar idiom, pron + ind
Meaning we however; I however
mayā 1

pron. by me; with me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st instr sg of ahaṃ
Meaning by me; with me
Variant me
Sanskrit mayā

Examples

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, lokena vivadāmi, loko'va mayā vivadati. na, bhikkhave, dhammavādī kenaci lokasmiṃ vivadati.

SN 22.94 pupphasuttaṃ

attadaṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ,
janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ,
saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi,
yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
mayā 2

pron. from me; than me [ahaṃ] ✗
mayāpi

sandhi. by me too; with me too [mayā + api] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind
Meaning by me too; with me too
Construction mayā + api
Sanskrit mayā + api

Example

mayā'pi kho etaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, n'eva diṭṭhaṃ na sutaṃ rājā vā rājamahāmatto vā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricārayamāno kāmataṇhaṃ appahāya kāmapariḷāhaṃ appaṭivinodetvā vigatapipāso ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto vihāsi vā viharati vā viharissati vā.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
mayi 1

pron. in me; towards me [me + i] ✓

Grammar pron, 1st loc sg of ahaṃ
Meaning in me; towards me
Construction me + i
Sanskrit mayi

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ āpattiyā codenti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno evam'āha, kiṃ nu kho tumhe āyasmanto atibāḷhaṃ mayi byāvaṭā yāva idān'āhaṃ sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya hīnāy'āvattissāmī'ti.

AN 8.14 assakhaḷuṅkasuttaṃ

yehi manussā āgataṃ bhikkhuṃ na manasi karonti, tatra bhikkhussa evaṃ hoti, kosu nāma idāni maṃ imasmiṃ kule paribhindi, virattarūpā dān'ime mayi manussā'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
mayi 2

pron. when I; as I; while I [me + i] ✓

Grammar pron, 1st loc sg of ahaṃ, loc abs
Meaning when I; as I; while I
Construction me + i
Sanskrit mayi

Example

ayañ'hi so udapāno mayi upasaṅkamante sabbaṃ taṃ tiṇañ'ca bhusañ'ca mukhato ovamitvā acchassa udakassa anāvilassa vippasannassa yāva mukhato pūrito vissandanto maññe ṭhito'ti!

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ
mayūkha

masc. ray of light ✗
mayūra

masc. peacock ✓

Grammar masc, onom
Meaning peacock
Sanskrit mayūra

Examples

kadā mayūrassa sikhaṇḍino vane,
dijassa sutvā girigabbhare rutaṃ,
paccuṭṭhahitvā amatassa pattiyā,
saṃcintaye taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

mayūrakoñc'ābhirutamhi kānane,
dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhato vasaṃ,
kāye apekkhaṃ jaha mā virādhaya,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
mayūrakoñcābhiruda

adj. resounding with peacocks and herons [mayūra + koñca + abhiruda] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning resounding with peacocks and herons
Construction mayūra + koñca + abhiruda
mayha 1

pron. to me; for me [ahaṃ] ✗
mayha 2

pron. my; mine; of me [mayha(ṃ)] ✓

Grammar pron, 1st gen sg of ahaṃ, abbrev of mayhaṃ
Meaning my; mine; of me
Construction mayha(ṃ) > mayha
Variant mama, mamaṃ, mayhaṃ, me
Sanskrit mama, me

Examples

kulamhi mitte ca piye ca ñātake,
khiḍḍāratiṃ kāmaguṇañ'ca loke,
sabbaṃ pahāya imam'ajjhupāgato,
atho'pi tvaṃ citta na mayha tussasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

tathā tu kassāmi yathā'pi issaro,
yaṃ labbhati tena'pi hotu me alaṃ,
vīriyena taṃ mayha vas'ānayissaṃ,
gajaṃ'va mattaṃ kusal'aṅkusaggaho.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
mayhakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 390 (JA 390) ✗
mayhaṃ 1

pron. to me; for me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st dat sg of ahaṃ
Meaning to me; for me
Variant mama, me, mamaṃ
Sanskrit mahyam, me

Examples

evaṃ vutte tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva ārabbha sati udapādi, aho nūna bhagavā, aho nūna sugato, yo imesaṃ dhammānaṃ sukusalo'ti. bhagavā, bhante, kusalo, bhagavā pakataññū abhisaññānirodhassa.

DN 9.2 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, abhisaññānirodhakathā

tassa mayhaṃ bhikkhave etadahosi, kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṃ hoti kiṃpaccayā jarāmaraṇan'ti

SN 12.65 nagarasuttaṃ
mayhaṃ 2

pron. my; mine ✓

Grammar pron, 1st gen sg of ahaṃ
Meaning my; mine
Variant mama, mamaṃ, mayha, me
Sanskrit mama, me

Examples

atha kho, bhikkhave, kāḷiyā dāsiyā etadahosi, mayhaṃ kho ayyāya evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato, soratā vedehikā gahapatānī, nivātā vedehikā gahapatānī, upasantā vedehikā gahapatānī'ti.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ

uttam'aṅgaruhā mayhaṃ,
ime jātā vayoharā,
pātubhūtā devadūtā,
pabbajjāsamayo mamā'ti.

JA 9 maghadeva jātakaṃ
mayhaṃpatthi

sandhi. I also have; lit. for me too there is [mayhaṃ + api + atthi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + pr
Meaning I also have; lit. for me too there is
Construction mayhaṃ + api + atthi
Sanskrit mahyam + api + asti

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi saddhā, mayhaṃ'p'atthi saddhā, na kho āḷārasseva kālāmassa atthi vīriyaṃ, mayhaṃ'p'atthi vīriyaṃ

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
mayhevekassa

sandhi. for me alone [mayhaṃ + eva + ekassa] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + ind + adj
Meaning for me alone
Construction mayhaṃ + eva + ekassa
Sanskrit mahyam + eva + ekasya

Example

sa kho so bhikkhave ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho mayh'ev'ekassa sabbehi piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
mara

root. (gram) √mar (die) [√mar + a] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √mar (die)
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mṛ
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

505, 482. jara marānaṃ jīra jiyya miyyā vā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 505

jara mara'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ jīra jiyya miyy'ādesā honti vā. jīrati, jīranti, jiyyati, jiyyanti, miyyati, miyyanti, marati, maranti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 505
maraṇa

nt. death; dying [√mar + aṇa] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from marati
Meaning death; dying
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + aṇa
Derivative kita (aṇa)
Antonym jīvita, amaraṇa
Synonym kālakiriyā, mata
Sanskrit maraṇa
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

evañ'hi, bhikkhave, tassa purisassa hoti, imaṃ c'āhaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ papatissāmi, tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchāmi maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhan'ti

SN 12.63 puttamaṃsūpamasuttaṃ

maraṇena'pi taṃ pahīyati,
yaṃ puriso mamidanti maññati,
etam'pi viditvā paṇḍito,
na mamattāya nametha māmako.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
maraṇakāraṇa

nt. weapon; means of killing; instrument of death [maraṇa + kāraṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning weapon; means of killing; instrument of death
Construction maraṇa + kāraṇa
Sanskrit maraṇa + kāraṇa
maraṇakāla

masc. time of death [maraṇa + kāla] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning time of death
Construction maraṇa + kāla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + kāla)
Synonym cavanakāla, maraṇasamaya
Sanskrit maraṇa + kāla

Examples

katame satta phalā satt'ānisaṃsā? diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti. no ce diṭṭh'eva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, atha maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.

SN 46.3 sīlasuttaṃ

manussaviggaho nāma yaṃ mātukucchismiṃ paṭhamaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, yāva maraṇakālā etth'antare eso manussaviggaho nāma.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
maraṇacetana

adj. intention of killing [maraṇa + cetanā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning intention of killing
Construction maraṇa + cetanā + a
maraṇacetanā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + cetana)
Synonym maraṇasaññī, maraṇādhippāya
Commentary (VINa) tathā hi'ssa tam'ev'ātthaṃ dassento, maraṇasaññī'tiādim'āha. yasmā c'ettha saṅkappo'ti na'y'idaṃ vitakkassa nāmaṃ. atha kho saṃvidahanamattass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit maraṇa + cetana

Example

cittasaṅkappo'ti maraṇasaññī maraṇacetano maraṇ'ādhippāyo.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
maraṇacetanā

fem. intention to kill ✗
maraṇadhamma

adj. subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. death nature [maraṇa + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. death nature
Construction maraṇa + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (maraṇa + dhamma)
Synonym maraṇadhammika, maraṇadhammī
Commentary (MNa) maraṇadhammo'ti maraṇasabhāvo.
Sanskrit maraṇadharman

Examples

maraṇadhammo'mhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ

maraṇadhammaṃ mā mīyī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ

AN 4.182 pāṭibhogasuttaṃ
maraṇadhammika

Meaning subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. with death nature
Construction maraṇa + dhamma + ika
maraṇadhamma + ika

Synonym maraṇadhamma, maraṇadhammī
Sanskrit maraṇadharman
maraṇadhammī

adj. subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. death nature [maraṇa + dhammī] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning subject to death; liable to die; of the nature to die; lit. death nature
Construction maraṇa + dhammī
Compound kammadhāraya (maraṇa + dhammī)
Synonym maraṇadhamma, maraṇadhammika
Sanskrit maraṇadharman
maraṇadhammomhi

sandhi. I am liable to die; I am subject to death [maraṇa + dhamma + amhi] ✓

Meaning I am liable to die; I am subject to death

Sanskrit maraṇadharman + asmi

Example

maraṇadhammo'mhi, maraṇaṃ anatīto'ti abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ itthiyā vā purisena vā gahaṭṭhena vā pabbajitena vā.

AN 5.57 abhiṇhapaccavekkhitabbaṭhānasuttaṃ
maraṇanta

adj. ending in death; culminating in death [maraṇa + anta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ending in death; culminating in death
Construction maraṇa + anta
Compound kammadhāraya (maraṇa + anta)
Commentary (DHPa) maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ yasmā sabbasattānaṃ jīvitaṃ maraṇapariyosānam'evā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit maraṇa + anta

Example

parijiṇṇam'idaṃ rūpaṃ,
roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ,
bhijjati pūtisandeho,
maraṇ'antañ'hi jīvitaṃ.

Examples

evarūpe mahabbhaye'ti edise mahati maraṇabhaye upaṭṭhite. hetuatthe vā etaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.

THa 248 adhimuttattheragāthāvaṇṇanā

mige anto paviṭṭhe dvāraṃ pidahiṃsu. migo manusse disvā kampamāno maraṇabhayatajjito antonivesanaṅgaṇe ādhāvati paridhāvati.

JAa 14 vātamiga jātakavaṇṇanā
maraṇabhaya 2

nt. peril of death; danger of dying [maraṇa + bhaya] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning peril of death; danger of dying
Construction maraṇa + bhaya
Commentary (ANa) tattha jarābhayan'ti jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjanakabhayaṃ. itaresu'pi es'eva nayo. vuttam'pi c'etaṃ, jaraṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso. byādhiṃ paṭicca, maraṇaṃ paṭicca uppajjati bhayaṃ bhayānakaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso cetaso utrāso'ti (vibha. 921).
maraṇabhayatajjita

adj. startled by fear of death [maraṇa + bhaya + tajjita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning startled by fear of death
Construction maraṇa + bhaya + tajjita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maraṇabhayena + tajjita)
Sanskrit maraṇabhaya + tarjita

Example

mige anto paviṭṭhe dvāraṃ pidahiṃsu. migo manusse disvā kampamāno maraṇabhayatajjito antonivesanaṅgaṇe ādhāvati paridhāvati.

JAa 14 vātamiga jātakavaṇṇanā
maraṇamañcaka

Construction maraṇa + matta

maraṇamukha

maraṇavasa

masc. power of the death ✗
maraṇasaññā

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning recognition of death; perception of death
Construction maraṇa + saññā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + saññā)
Sanskrit maraṇa + saṃjñā

Examples

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, saññā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā honti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā. katamā pañca? asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, ādīnavasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.

AN 5.61 paṭhamasaññāsuttaṃ

maraṇasaññā, bhikkhave, bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā amat'ogadhā amatapariyosānā'ti, iti kho pan'etaṃ vuttaṃ kiñ'c'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ?

AN 7.49 dutiyasaññāsuttaṃ
maraṇasaññāparicita

adj. fortified by the perception of death [maraṇasaññā + paricita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fortified by the perception of death
Construction maraṇasaññā + paricita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (maraṇasaññaṃ + paricita)
Sanskrit maraṇa + saṃjñā + paricita

Example

maraṇasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato jīvitanikantiyā cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

AN 7.49 dutiyasaññāsuttaṃ
maraṇasaññī

adj. percipient of killing; conscious of killing [maraṇa + saññī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning percipient of killing; conscious of killing
Construction maraṇa + saññī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + saññī)
Synonym maraṇacetana, maraṇādhippāya
Commentary (VINa) tathā hi'ssa tam'ev'ātthaṃ dassento, maraṇasaññī'tiādim'āha. yasmā c'ettha saṅkappo'ti na'y'idaṃ vitakkassa nāmaṃ. atha kho saṃvidahanamattass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit maraṇa + saṃjñin

Example

cittasaṅkappo'ti maraṇasaññī maraṇacetano maraṇ'ādhippāyo.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
maraṇasati

fem. meditation on death ✗
maraṇasabhaya

adj. with fear of death; with danger of dying [maraṇa + sabhaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with fear of death; with danger of dying
Construction maraṇa + sabhaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + sabhaya)
Sanskrit maraṇa + sabhaya

Example

tesaṃ vo, sakkā, alābhā tesaṃ dulladdhaṃ, ye tumhe evaṃ sokasabhaye jīvite maraṇasabhaye jīvite app'ekadā aṭṭhaṅgasamannāgataṃ uposathaṃ upavasatha, app'ekadā na upavasatha.

Sanskrit maraṇa + samaya

adj. leading to death [maraṇa + saṃvattanika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning leading to death
Construction maraṇa + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (maraṇāya + saṃvattanika)
Sanskrit maraṇa + saṃvartanīya

Example

maraṇasutta

Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maraṇassa + adhippāya)
Antonym namaraṇādhippāya
Synonym maraṇasaññī, maraṇacetana
Commentary (VINa) tathā hi'ssa tam'ev'ātthaṃ dassento, maraṇasaññī'tiādim'āha. yasmā c'ettha saṅkappo'ti na'y'idaṃ vitakkassa nāmaṃ. atha kho saṃvidahanamattass'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit maraṇa + abhiprāya

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ
maraṇābhibhū

adj. conquered death; defeated death; master of death [maraṇa + abhibhū] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning conquered death; defeated death; master of death
Construction maraṇa + abhibhū
Commentary (THa) uppanno maraṇ'ābhibhū'ti loke uppanno hutvā maraṇaṃ abhibhavitvā ṭhito.
marati

pr. dies; is killed [√mar + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning dies; is killed
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Base √mar + a > mara
Construction mara + ti
Synonym byāpajjati, miyyati, mīyati
Sanskrit mriyate, marati
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

añña'd'atthu, ayaṃ varāko idāni marissati, yaṃ yadeva hi ayaṃ padaṃ nikkhipati, tena tena santike maraṇassa hotī'ti taṃ jano karuṇāyati.

VISM 1.9.2 karuṇābhāvanākathā

deva, idāni ṭhapetvā saccakiriyaṃ añño mama sakkhi n'atthi, sac'āyaṃ dārako tumhe paṭicca jāto, ākāse tiṭṭhatu, no ce, bhūmiyaṃ patitvā maratū'ti bodhisattassa pāde gahetvā ākāse khipi.

mala 1

nt. (+gen) dirt; impurity; stain; dross; filth; grime; tarnish; grunge; contaminant [√mal + a] ✓

Grammar nt (+gen)
Meaning dirt; impurity; stain; dross; filth; grime; tarnish; grunge; contaminant
Root Family √mal
Root √mal×1 a (dirty, stain)
Construction √mal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym vītamala, nimmala, amala
Synonym kāḷaka
Sanskrit mala
Sanskrit Root √mlai √mlā 1, 2, 4 (relax)

Examples

anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malam'attano.

DHP 239 malavaggo

imesaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, samaṇamalānaṃ samaṇadosānaṃ samaṇakasaṭānaṃ āpāyikānaṃ ṭhānānaṃ duggativedaniyānaṃ appahānā, na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno'ti vadāmi.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
mala 2

nt. rust [√mal + a] ✓

Meaning rust
Root Family √mal
Root √mal×1 a (dirty, stain)
Construction √mal + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mala
Sanskrit Root √mlai √mlā 1, 2, 4 (relax)

Example

tat'uṭṭhāya tam'eva khādati,
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ,
sakakammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

malaggahita 1

adj. stained; dirtied; lit. grabbed dirt [mala + gahita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning stained; dirtied; lit. grabbed dirt
Construction mala + gahita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (malaṃ + gahita)
Commentary (MNa) saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ malaggahitan'ti āgantukena paṃsuraj'ādinā saṃkilesena saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ, sedajallik'ādinā malena gahitattā malaggahitaṃ.
Sanskrit mala + gṛhīta

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vatthaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ malaggahitaṃ acchodakaṃ āgamma parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ, ukkāmukhaṃ vā pan'āgamma jātarūpaṃ parisuddhaṃ hoti pariyodātaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, āvuso, vatthaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ malaggahitaṃ. tam'enaṃ sāmikā rajakassa anupadajjuṃ. tam'enaṃ rajako ūse vā khāre vā gomaye vā sammadditvā acche udake vikkhāleti.

SN 22.89 khemakasuttaṃ
malaggahita 2

adj. rusted; tarnished; lit. grabbed dirt [mala + gahita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning rusted; tarnished; lit. grabbed dirt
Construction mala + gahita
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (malaṃ + gahita)
Sanskrit mala + gṛhīta

Example

tam'enaṃ sāmikā na c'eva paribhuñjeyyuṃ na ca pariyodapeyyuṃ, rajāpathe ca naṃ nikkhipeyyuṃ. evañ'hi sā, āvuso, kaṃsapāti aparena samayena saṃkiliṭṭhatarā assa malaggahitā'ti?

Construction √mal + a + tara
mala + tara

Example

tato malā malataraṃ,
avijjā paramaṃ malaṃ,

nimmalā hotha bhikkhavo.

DHP 54 pupphavaggo

tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako samayappavādake tinduk'ācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṃ tiṃsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
mallikā 2

fem. name of a queen; wife of King Pasenadi; lit. jasmine ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a queen; wife of King Pasenadi; lit. jasmine
Commentary (ANa) mallikā devī'ti pasenadirañño devī.
Sanskrit mallikā

Examples

tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ uparipāsādavaragato hoti. atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikaṃ deviṃ etadavoca, atthi nu kho te, mallike, koc'añño attanā piyataro'ti?

SN 3.8 mallikāsuttaṃ

atha kho mallikā devī yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi. ekam'antaṃ nisinnā kho mallikā devī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca

AN 4.197 mallikādevīsuttaṃ
mallikādevīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.197 (AN4.197) ✗
mallikāvimānavatthu

nt. Vimānavatthu 36 (VV 36) ✗
mallikāsutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 3.8 (SN3.8) ✗
mallikāsutta 2

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 3.16 (SN3.16) ✗
masāṇa

nt. (comm) mixed cloth ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (comm) mixed cloth
Synonym missakacoḷa
Commentary (MNa) masāṇānī'ti missakacoḷāni.

Example

so sāṇāni'pi dhāreti masāṇāni'pi dhāreti chavadussāni'pi dhāreti paṃsukūlāni'pi dhāreti tirīṭāni'pi dhāreti ajinam'pi dhāreti ajinakkhipam'pi dhāreti kusacīram'pi dhāreti vākacīram'pi dhāreti phalakacīram'pi dhāreti kesakambalam'pi dhāreti vāḷakambalam'pi dhāreti ulūkapakkham'pi dhāreti

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ
masāraka

masc. type of couch [masāra + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, from masāra
Meaning type of couch
Construction masāra + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VINa) masārako'ti mañcapāde vijjhitvā tattha aṭaniyo pavesetvā kato.

Example

mañco nāma cattāro mañcā, masārako, bundik'ābaddho, kuḷīrapādako, āhaccapādako.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
masāragalla

nt. emerald; sapphire; crystal ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning emerald; sapphire; crystal
Sanskrit musāragalva (bsk)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo bahuratano anekaratano. tatr'imāni ratanāni, seyyath'idaṃ muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavāḷaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohitaṅgo masāragallaṃ

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

ratanaṃ nāma muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavālaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohit'aṅko masāragallaṃ.

VIN 2.5.9.2 ratanasikkhāpadaṃ
masāragallamaya

adj. made of emerald ✗
masi

masc. soot; charcoal dust; fine ash ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning soot; charcoal dust; fine ash
Sanskrit maṣi

Examples

so taṃ vīṇaṃ … sakalikaṃ sakalikaṃ karitvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya. masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuneyya, nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

vāt'ātape visosetvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya, masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.

yaṃnūn'āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan'ti.

massuka

adj. having a beard [massu] ✗

Examples

502, 493. yamhi dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha math'ādīnam'ī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502

yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha matha icc'evam'ādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ anto īkāram'āpajjate. dīyati, dhīyati, mīyati, ṭhīyati, hīyati, pīyati, mahīyati, mathīyati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502
maha 2

adj. great; venerable; honourable; respected [√mah + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from mahati
Meaning great; venerable; honourable; respected
Root Family √mah
Root √mah･1 a (venerate)
Construction √mah + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit maha
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

taggha'si, tāta kumma, khato, taggha upahato. etena hi te, tāta kumma, suttakena pitaro ca pitāmahā ca anayaṃ āpannā byasanaṃ āpannā. gaccha dāni tvaṃ, tāta kumma, na dāni tvaṃ amhākan'ti.

SN 17.3 kummasuttaṃ

khattiyo nāma ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca saṃsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakuṭṭho jātivādena.

SN 41.4 mahakapāṭihāriyasuttaṃ
mahakapāṭihāriyasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 41.4 (SN41.4) ✗
mahaggata 1

adj. enlarged; exalted; lofty; grand; impressive; lit. become great [mahā + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enlarged; exalted; lofty; grand; impressive; lit. become great
Construction mahā + gata
Phonetic Change āg > agg
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mahantaṃ + gata)
Antonym amahaggata, paritta
Commentary (MNa) mahaggatan'ti rūp'ārūp'āvacaraṃ. (SNa) mahaggato'ti mahattaṃ gato, vipulass'etaṃ vevacanaṃ (ANa) mahaggatenā'ti mahantabhāvaṃ gatena.
Sanskrit mahadgata

Examples

iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

mahaggataṃ vā cittaṃ, mahaggataṃ cittan'ti pajānāti, amahaggataṃ vā cittaṃ, amahaggataṃ cittan'ti pajānāti

DN 2.28 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

mahaggata + tara

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā videhesu cārikaṃ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.

aniccato addhuvato asārato,
pakkhanda maṃ citta jinassa sāsane,
tārehi oghā mahatā suduttarā.

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi, api nu so puriso mahato janakāyassa āyācanahetu vā thomanahetu vā pañjalikā anuparisakkanahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjeyyā'ti? no h'etaṃ, bhante.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
mahatta 1

maha + tta

Variant mahattā
Commentary (ANa) mahatto'ti attabhāve paritte'pi guṇamahantatāya mahatto.
Sanskrit mahattva
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo bhāvitakāyo hoti bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño aparitto mahatto appamāṇavihārī.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
mahatta 2

nt. greatness; illustriousness [√mah + a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from mahā
Meaning greatness; illustriousness
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + a + tta
maha + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym mahantabhāva
Sanskrit mahattva
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

yasmā ca saṅgahā ete,
samavekkhanti paṇḍitā,
tasmā mahattaṃ papponti,
pāsaṃsā ca bhavanti te'ti.

AN 4.32 saṅgahasuttaṃ

ko sutvā nappasīdeyya,
api kaṇh'ābhijātiyo,
tasmā hi attakāmena,
mahattam'abhikaṅkhatā,
saddhammo garukātabbo,
saraṃ buddhāna'sāsanan'ti.

VIN 1.2.2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ

VIN 1.2.2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ
mahatthasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.57 (SN46.57) ✗
mahatthika

adj. enormously beneficial; highly advantageous [mahā + atthika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enormously beneficial; highly advantageous
Construction mahā + atthika
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + atthika)
Commentary (VINa) mah'atthiko'ti mahāupakāro. (KPa) mahanto attho assā'ti mah'atthikā, mahato atthāya saṃvattatī'ti vuttaṃ hoti, mah'iddhikā'ti'pi pāṭho.
Sanskrit mahā + arthika

Example

evaṃ mah'atthikā esā,
yadidaṃ puññasampadā,
tasmā dhīrā pasaṃsanti,
paṇḍitā katapuññatan'ti.

KHP8 nidhikaṇḍasuttaṃ
mahatthiya

adj. enormously beneficial; of great advantage [mahā + atthiya] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning enormously beneficial; of great advantage
Construction mahā + atthiya
Commentary (SNa) mah'atthiyo'ti mahato atthassa nipphādako.
mahaddhana

adj. having much money; rich; wealthy [mahā + dhana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having much money; rich; wealthy
Construction mahā + dhana
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + dhana)
Antonym appassaka
Synonym aḍḍha, aḍḍhī, adalidda, adaḷidda, dhanavant, bhogavant, bhogī, sadhana
Commentary (SNa) nidhānagataṃ muttasār'ādi mahantaṃ dhanam'etesan'ti mahaddhanā. (ANa) mahaddhanā'ti vaḷañjanakadhanena mahaddhanā.
Sanskrit mahādhana

Examples

vāṇijo'va bhayaṃ maggaṃ,
appasattho mahaddhano,
visaṃ jīvitu'kāmo'va,
pāpāni parivajjaye.

DHP 123 pāpavaggo

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo. evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
mahaddhanatara

adj. wealthier; richer; lit. great wealth more [mahā + dhana + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahaddhana
Meaning wealthier; richer; lit. great wealth more
Construction mahā + dhana + tara
mahaddhana + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Phonetic Change ād > add
Commentary (UDa) mahaddhanataro vā'tiādīsu pathaviyaṃ nikhaṇitvā ṭhapitaṃ sattaratananicayasaṅkhātaṃ mahantaṃ dhanaṃ etassā'ti mahaddhano, dvīsu ayaṃ atisayena mahaddhano'ti mahaddhanataro. vāsaddo vikappattho.
Sanskrit mahā + dhana +

Example

ko nu kho, āvuso, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ rājūnaṃ mahaddhanataro vā mahābhogataro vā mahākosataro vā mahāvijitataro vā mahāvāhanataro vā mahabbalataro vā mahiddhikataro vā mahānubhāvataro vā rājā vā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro, rājā vā pasenadi kosalo'ti?

UD12 rājasuttaṃ
mahaddhanasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.28 (SN1.28) ✗
mahanīya

adj. respectable ✗
mahanta 1

adj. big; great; large; grand; vast; extensive [√mah + a + nta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning big; great; large; grand; vast; extensive
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Base √mah + a > maha
Construction maha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Antonym paritta
Synonym uḷāra, oḷāra, bahu, brahanta, bhūri, mahantaka, mahallaka, mahallikā, mahā, vipula, visāla
Commentary (ANa) mahantan'ti ārohasampannaṃ.
Sanskrit mahat
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

eko ahaṃ sakka mahantam'oghaṃ,
anissito no visahāmi tārituṃ,
ārammaṇaṃ brūhi samantacakkhu,
yaṃ nissito ogham'imaṃ tareyyaṃ.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṃ desento nisinno hoti.

AN 5.159 udāyīsuttaṃ
mahanta 2

adj. great; powerful; mighty; eminent; distinguished; noble [√mah + a + nta] ✓

Grammar adj
Meaning great; powerful; mighty; eminent; distinguished; noble
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Base √mah + a > maha
Construction maha + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym ariya, ugga, ucca, balasampanna, bhusa, vaccasī
Variant mahatta
Sanskrit mahat
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

saṃvar'atthaṃ pahān'atthaṃ,
brahmacariyaṃ anītihaṃ,
adesayi so bhagavā,
nibbān'ogadhagāminaṃ,
esa maggo mahantehi,
anuyāto mah'esibhi.

Meaning large and small

Meaning bigger (than); greater (than)

SN 56.42 papātasuttaṃ

appamatto ayaṃ kali,
yo akkhesu dhanaparājayo,
sabbassā'pi sahā'pi attanā,
ayam'eva mahantataro kali.

AN 4.3 paṭhamakhatasuttaṃ

Meaning greatness; immensity; enormity

mahantatta

nt. (of size) largeness; greatness [√mah + a + nta + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from mahanta
Meaning (of size) largeness; greatness
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Base √mah + a > maha
Construction maha + nta + tta
mahanta + tta

Commentary (MNa) yadidaṃ mahantattenā'ti mahantabhāvena aggaṃ akkhāyati, na guṇavasenā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mahattva
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, yāni kānici jaṅgalānaṃ pāṇānaṃ padajātāni, sabbāni tāni hatthipade samodhānaṃ gacchanti, hatthipadaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati, yadidaṃ mahantattena

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ
mahantattasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.80 (AN6.80) ✗
mahantabhāva

masc. greatness; illustriousness [mahanta + bhāva] ~

mahantara

adj. greater, more extensive [√mah] ✗
mahantī

adj. great; large; powerful; grand; mighty; vast; extensive [√mah + a + nta + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of mahanta
Meaning great; large; powerful; grand; mighty; vast; extensive
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Base √mah + a > maha
Construction maha + nta + ī
mahanta + ī
Sanskrit mahatī
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

mahanto ca so puriso cā'ti mahāpuriso, mahantī ca sā devī cā'ti mahādevī, mahantañ'ca taṃ balañ'cā'ti mahābalaṃ, mahanto ca so nāgo cā'ti mahānāgo, mahanto ca so yaso cā'ti mahāyaso

kaccāyana samāsakappa 330
mahapphala

adj. of great fruit; yielding good results [mahā + phala] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of great fruit; yielding good results
Construction mahā + phala
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + phala)
Commentary (MNa) mahapphalā mah'ānisaṃsā'ti ubhayam'etaṃ atthato ekaṃ, byañjanam'eva nānaṃ. mahantaṃ vā lokiyasukhaṃ phalantīti mahapphalā. mahato lokuttarasukhassa ca paccayā hontī'ti mah'ānisaṃsā.
Sanskrit maha + phala

Examples

tiṇadosāni khettāni,
rāgadosā ayaṃ pajā,
tasmā hi vītarāgesu,
dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ.

DHP 356 taṇhāvaggo

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
mahapphalatara

adj. (+abl) even more fruitful (than); yielding better results (than) [mahā + phala + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, compar of mahapphala, comp (+abl)
Meaning even more fruitful (than); yielding better results (than)
Construction mahā + phala + tara
mahapphala + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Sanskrit mahāphala + tara

Example

yo vā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ antamaso gadduhanamattam'pi mettacittaṃ bhāveyya … idaṃ tato mahapphalataraṃ.

mahapphalatā

bahuvacanaggahaṇena kvaci mahantasaddassa mah'ādeso hoti. mahantañ'ca taṃ phalañ'cā'ti mahapphalaṃ, mahabbalaṃ, evaṃ mahaddhanaṃ, mahabbhaya

UD12 rājasuttaṃ
mahabbhaya 1

nt. great fear; great danger; enormous risk [mahā + bhaya] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning great fear; great danger; enormous risk
Construction mahā + bhaya
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhaya)
Sanskrit mahābhaya

Examples

tassa te n'atthi bhītattaṃ,
bhiyyo vaṇṇo pasīdati,
kasmā na paridevesi,
evarūpe mahabbhaye.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

taṇhā janeti purisaṃ,
cittam'assa vidhāvati,
satto saṃsāram'āpādi,
dukkham'assa mahabbhayan'ti.

SN 1.55 paṭhamajanasuttaṃ
mahabbhaya 2

adj. very dangerous; frightfully fearful; extremely perilous [mahā + bhaya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very dangerous; frightfully fearful; extremely perilous
Construction mahā + bhaya
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhaya)
Sanskrit mahābhaya

Example

arūpa dūraṅ'gama ekacāri,
na te karissaṃ vacanaṃ idāni'haṃ,
dukkhā hi kāmā kaṭukā mahabbhayā,
nibbānam'ev'ābhimano carissaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
mahamattasambhavaṃ

sandhi. I (having seen that) self generation; I (having seen that) I am self-begotten [[m] + ahaṃ + attasambhavaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, letter + pron + adj
Meaning I (having seen that) self generation; I (having seen that) I am self-begotten
Construction [m] + ahaṃ + attasambhavaṃ
Phonetic Change +m
Commentary (THa) taṃ viditvā mahamattasambhavan'ti taṃ yathāvuttaṃ saṅkhatasabhāvaṃ attasambhavaṃ attani sambhūtaṃ attāyattaṃ issar'ādivasena aparāyattaṃ pariññ'ābhisamayavasena ahaṃ viditvā tappaṭipakkhabhūtaṃ
Sanskrit aham + ātmasambhava

Example

sambhavā suviditā asārakā,
saṅkhatā pacalitā sad'eritā,
taṃ viditvā m'aham'attasambhavaṃ,
santim'eva satimā samajjhagan'ti.

TH 183 gotamattheragāthā
mahayuga

nt. generation of elders; lit. venerable generation [maha + yuga] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning generation of elders; lit. venerable generation
Construction maha + yuga
mahallaka 1

adj. old; aged; ancient [√mah + ā + la + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from mahā
Meaning old; aged; ancient
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + ā + la + ka
mahalla + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change āl > all
Antonym taruṇa
Synonym jiṇṇa, jiṇṇaka, mahallikā
Commentary (MNa) mahallako'ti jātimahallako.
Sanskrit mahallaka
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

aham'asmi, bhante, jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto āturakāyo abhikkhaṇ'ātaṅko.

SN 22.1 nakulapitusuttaṃ

yato ca kho ayaṃ bhavaṃ puriso jiṇṇo hoti vuddho mahallako addhagato vayoanuppatto, āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, atha tamhā paññāveyyattiyā, parihāyatī'ti.

MN 12 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ
mahallaka 2

masc. old man; senior citizen [√mah + ā + la + ka] ✓

Meaning old man; senior citizen

mahalla + ka

Example

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggaḷaṭṭhapanāya ālokasandhiparikammāya dvatticchadanassa pariyāyaṃ appaharite ṭhitena adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ

Meaning very satisfying; giving great gratification

adj. breathing heavily; panting loudly; gasping for breath [mahā + assāsa + ī] ✓

Meaning breathing heavily; panting loudly; gasping for breath
Construction mahā + assāsa + ī
mahassāsa + ī

Commentary (SNa) mah'assāsī'ti tassa gacchato balavā bhattaparīḷāho udapādi, tasmā mahantehi assāsehi assasati, gattato'pi'ssa sedabindūni muccanti, tam'enaṃ ubhosu passesu ṭhatvā yamakatālavaṇṭehi bījanti, buddhagāravena pana nipajjituṃ na ussahatī'ti idaṃ sandhāya mah'assāsī'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit maha + āśvāsin

Example

atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ bhuttāviṃ mah'assāsiṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

SN 3.13 doṇapākasuttaṃ
mahā 1

adj. great; large; powerful; grand; vast; extensive [√mah + nta + ā] ✓

Grammar adj, masc nom sg of mahanta
Meaning great; large; powerful; grand; vast; extensive
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + nta + ā
mahanta + ā
Synonym oḷāra, bahu, mahanta, mahallaka, mahallikā
Sanskrit mahant
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

laddhā hi so upādānaṃ,
mahā hutvāna pāvako,
so āsajja ḍahe bālaṃ,
naraṃ nāriñ'ca ekadā.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ

taṃ kissa hetu? asu hi bhante gaṅgāya nadiyā mahā udakakkhandho so amunā loṇaphalena loṇo na assa apeyyo'ti.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
mahā 2

adj. great; large; powerful; grand; vast; extensive [√mah + nta + ā] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, masc nom sg of mahanta
Meaning great; large; powerful; grand; vast; extensive
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + nta + ā
mahanta + ā
Synonym oḷāra, bahu, mahanta, mahallaka, mahallikā
Sanskrit mahā
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

ayaṃ kho me kāyo rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettika-sambhavo odana-kummāsa-upacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

DN 2.24 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ
mahāakālamegha

masc. enormous out of season rain shower; massive unseasonal downpour [mahā + akāla + megha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enormous out of season rain shower; massive unseasonal downpour
Construction mahā + akāla + megha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + akālamegha)
Sanskrit mahā + akāla + megha

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajojallaṃ, tam'enaṃ mahāakālamegho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti.

mahāudakaṇṇava

masc. great sea; great ocean; great body of water [mahā + udaka + aṇṇava] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great sea; great ocean; great body of water
Construction mahā + udaka + aṇṇava
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + udakaṇṇava)
Sanskrit mahā + udaka + arṇava

Example

tassa evam'assa, ayaṃ kho mahāudak'aṇṇavo, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ, n'atthi ca nāvā santāraṇī uttarasetu vā apārā pāraṃ gamanāya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
mahāudakarahada

masc. great lake; large body of water; lit. great water pool [mahā + udakarahada] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great lake; large body of water; lit. great water pool

Commentary (MNt) mahāudakarahado'ti mahāudakabharitaṃ pallalaṃ.
Sanskrit mahā + udaka + hrada

Example

seyyathā'pi, upāli, mahāudakarahado. atha āgaccheyya hatthināgo sattaratano vā aḍḍh'aṭṭharatano vā.

mahākaccāna

masc. name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in explaining a brief instruction in detail; lit. great descendant of Kati [mahā + kaccāna] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in explaining a brief instruction in detail; lit. great descendant of Kati
Construction mahā + kaccāna
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + kaccāna)
Variant mahākaccāyana
Commentary (AN 1.197) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ saṃkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajantānaṃ yadidaṃ mahākaccāno'ti
Sanskrit mahākātyāyana

Examples

addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ avidūre nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṃ parimukhaṃ sūpaṭṭhitāya.

UD 68 kaccānasuttaṃ

ayaṃ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu c'eva saṃvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ. pahoti c'āyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṃkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṃ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṃ vibhajituṃ.

mahākaccānabhaddekarattasutta

mahākaccāyana

Meaning great aeon; great age

mahākappa + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Commentary (MNa) mahākappino'ti mahākappānaṃ.
Sanskrit mahākalpa

Example

satta devā, satta mānusā, satta pesācā, satta sarā, satta pavuṭā, satta papātā, satta papātasatāni, satta supinā, satta supinasatāni, cullāsīti mahākappino satasahassāni, yāni bāle ca paṇḍite ca sandhāvitvā saṃsaritvā dukkhass'antaṃ karissanti.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno sāy'anhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yen'āyasmā mahākassapo ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākassapaṃ etadavoca, āyām'āvuso, kassapa, yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkamissāma dhammassavanāyā'ti.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
mahākassapattheragāthā

mahākassapattheravatthu

nt. the story of the elder Mahākassapa ✗
mahākassapasutta

nt. Udāna 6 (UD 6) ✗
mahākāya

adj. having a fat or big body ✗
mahākāruṇika

adj. of great compassion; enormously compassionate [mahā + karuṇā + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from mahākaruṇā
Meaning of great compassion; enormously compassionate
Construction mahā + karuṇā > kāruṇā + *ika
mahākaruṇā + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (THa) pañcannam'pi mārānaṃ vijayato jino, hīn'ādivibhāgabhinne sabbasmiṃ sattanikāye adhimuttavuttitāya mahatiyā karuṇāya samannāgatattā mahākāruṇiko
Sanskrit mahākaruṇā

Example

sabbaññū sabbadassāvī,
jino ācariyo mama,
mahākāruṇiko satthā,
sabbalokatikicchako.

mahākula

nt. great family; prominent family [mahā + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning great family; prominent family
Construction mahā + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + kula)
Sanskrit mahākula

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso asappuriso mahākulā pabbajito hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi mahākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na mahākulā pabbajitā'ti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
mahākulīnatā

fem. fact of belonging to a prominent family [mahā + kulīna + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahākulīna
Meaning fact of belonging to a prominent family
Construction mahā + kulīna + tā
mahākulīna + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + kulīnatā)
Sanskrit mahākulīnatā

Example

ahaṃ kho'mhi mahākulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na mahākulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya mahākulīnatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
mahākoṭṭhika

masc. name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in analytical understanding; lit. great Koṭṭhika [mahā + koṭṭhika] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in analytical understanding; lit. great Koṭṭhika
Construction mahā + koṭṭhika
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + koṭṭhika)
Variant mahākoṭṭhita
Commentary (AN 1.218) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭisambhidāpattānaṃ yadidaṃ mahākoṭṭhito'ti
Sanskrit mahākauṣṭhila

Examples

āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 2 (TH2) ✗
mahākoṭṭhikasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.173 (AN4.173) ✗

mahākosatara

adj. having a greater treasury [mahā + kosa + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahākosa
Meaning having a greater treasury
Construction mahā + kosa + tara
mahākosa + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Commentary (UDa) devasikaṃ pavisanaāyabhūto mahanto koso etassā'ti mahākoso.
Sanskrit mahākośa +

Example

ko nu kho, āvuso, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ rājūnaṃ mahaddhanataro vā mahābhogataro vā mahākosataro vā mahāvijitataro vā mahāvāhanataro vā mahabbalataro vā mahiddhikataro vā mahānubhāvataro vā rājā vā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro, rājā vā pasenadi kosalo'ti?

TH 247 udāyittheragāthā

mahāgūthapuñja

masc. massive pile of dung; large heap of excrement [mahā + gūtha + puñja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning massive pile of dung; large heap of excrement

Sanskrit mahā + gūtha + puñja

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
mahāgedha

masc. great blunder; great problem; lit. great greed [mahā + gedha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great blunder; great problem; lit. great greed
Construction mahā + gedha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + gedha)
Commentary (NIDD1) eso tassa mahāgedho mahāvanaṃ mahāgahanaṃ mahākantāro mahāvisamo mahākuṭilo mahāpaṅko mahāpalipo mahāpalibodho mahābandhanaṃ, yadidaṃ sampajānamusāvādo'ti
Sanskrit mahā + gṛdhyā

Example

atha satthāni kurute,
paravādehi codito,
esa khv'assa mahāgedho,
mosavajjaṃ pagāhati.

mahācariya

mah'ācariyena vata kira, bho, saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha, āyasmā ānando'ti. sace hi mayaṃ jāneyyāma, ayaṃ āyasmā ānando'ti, ettakam'pi no nappaṭibhāyeyya. khamatu ca me āyasmā ānando'ti.

AN 10.96 kokanudasuttaṃ
mahācunda

masc. name of a monk; lit. great Cunda [mahā + cunda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; lit. great Cunda

Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + cunda)
Commentary (MNa) mahācundo'ti tassa therassa nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit mahācunda

Examples

āyasmatā ca mahācundena āyasmatā ca anuruddhena āyasmatā ca revatena āyasmatā ca ānandena, aññehi ca abhiññātehi abhiññātehi therehi sāvakehi saddhiṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmā mahācundo sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
mahācundattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 131 (TH131) ✗
mahācundasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.46 (AN6.46) ✗
mahācundasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.24 (AN10.24) ✗
mahācora

masc. master thief; criminal mastermind [mahā + cora] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning master thief; criminal mastermind
Construction mahā + cora
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + cora)
Sanskrit mahā + cora

Example

tīhi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato mahācoro sandhim'pi chindati, nillopam'pi harati, ek'āgārikam'pi karoti, paripanthe'pi tiṭṭhati. katamehi tīhi?

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ
mahācorasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.51 (AN3.51) ✗
mahācorasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.103 (AN5.103) ✗
mahājana

masc. people; public; populace; lit. great people [mahā + jana] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning people; public; populace; lit. great people
Construction mahā + jana
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + jana)
Sanskrit mahājana

Examples

atha kho jīvako komārabhacco seṭṭhiṃ gahapatiṃ mañcake nipātetvā sambandhitvā sīsacchaviṃ uppāṭetvā sibbiniṃ vināmetvā dve pāṇake nīharitvā mahājanassa dassesi.

VIN 4.8.205 rājagahaseṭṭhi vatthu

mahājano attano attano puttadhītuñātīnaṃ atthāya paridevamāno mahāsaddam'akāsi, mahāpathavīundriyanasaddo viya ahosi.

mahājāniya

adj. who has incurred a great loss; very unfortunate [mahā + jāniya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has incurred a great loss; very unfortunate
Construction mahā + jāniya
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + jāniya)
Commentary (MNa) mahājāniyo'ti sattadivas'abbhantare pattabbamaggaphalato parihīnattā mahatī jāni assā'ti mahājāniyo.
Sanskrit mahā + hāni +

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, mahājāniyo kho āḷāro kālāmo. sace hi so imaṃ dhammaṃ suṇeyya, khippam'eva ājāneyyā'ti.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
mahātaṇha

adj. with great greed; having enormous ambition [mahā + taṇhā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with great greed; having enormous ambition
Construction mahā + taṇhā + a
mahātaṇhā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahantī + taṇhā)
Sanskrit mahā + tṛṣṇā

Example

appabhogo mahātaṇho,
khattiye jāyate kule,
so ca rajjaṃ patthayati,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

SNP 6 parābhavasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 6
mahātaṇhājālataṇhāsaṅghāṭappaṭimukka

adj. caught in a vast net of craving, a mass of craving [mahātaṇhājāla + taṇhāsaṅghāṭa + paṭimukka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning caught in a vast net of craving, a mass of craving
Construction mahātaṇhājāla + taṇhāsaṅghāṭa + paṭimukka
Compound sattamī tappurisa (mahātaṇhājālataṇhāsaṅghāṭe + paṭimukka)
Commentary (MNa) mahātaṇhājālataṇhāsaṅghāṭapaṭimukkan'ti taṇhā'va saṃsibbit'aṭṭhena mahātaṇhājālaṃ, saṅghaṭit'aṭṭhena saṅghāṭan'ti vuccati. iti imasmiṃ mahātaṇhājāle taṇhāsaṅghāṭe ca imaṃ sātiṃ bhikkhuṃ kevaṭṭaputtaṃ paṭimukkaṃ dhāretha. anupaviṭṭho antogadho'ti naṃ dhārethā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mahā + tṛṣṇā + jāla + tṛṣṇā + saṃghāṭa + pratimukta

Example

imaṃ kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttiṃ dhāretha, sātiṃ pana bhikkhuṃ kevaṭṭaputtaṃ mahātaṇhājālataṇhāsaṅghāṭappaṭimukkan'ti.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

mahātala

nt. large flat roof on the top of a palace ✗
mahātūriyatāḷitavādita

nt. mass of drumming and instrumental music; lit. great instruments beaten and sounded [mahā + tūriya + tāḷita + vādita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning mass of drumming and instrumental music; lit. great instruments beaten and sounded

Commentary (ANa) mahātūriyatāḷitavāditenā'ti mahantena tūriyatāḷitavāditena. tattha paṭhamaṃ saṅghaṭṭanaṃ tāḷitaṃ nāma hoti, tato paraṃ vāditaṃ.
Sanskrit māhā + tūrya + tāḍita + vādita

Example

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa seto nāma nāgo mahātūriyatāḷitavāditena pubbakoṭṭhakā paccuttarati.

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño paccantime nagare bahubalakāyo paṭivasati, seyyath'idaṃ, hatth'ārohā ass'ārohā rathikā dhanuggahā celakā calakā piṇḍadāyakā uggā rājaputtā pakkhandino mahānāgā sūrā cammayodhino dāsakaputtā.

kathañ'ca, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlasampanno hoti? idha, mahānāma, ariyasāvako sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.

MN 130 devadūtasuttaṃ

atha kho, pāpima, kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho nāg'āpalokitaṃ apalokesi, na v'āyaṃ dūsī māro mattam'aññāsī'ti. sah'āpalokanāya ca pana, pāpima, dūsī māro tamhā ca ṭhānā cavi mahānirayañ'ca upapajji.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
mahānisaṃsa

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning of great benefit (to); highly profitable (for)
Construction mahā + ānisaṃsa
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + ānisaṃsa)
Sanskrit mahā + anuśaṃsa

Examples

yesañ'ca mayaṃ cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhāraṃ paribhuñjāma, tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mah'ānisaṃsā

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ

disvāna āyasmantaṃ rāhulaṃ āmantesi, ānāpānassatiṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. ānāpānassati, rāhula, bhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā mahapphalā hoti mah'ānisaṃsā'ti.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
mahānisaṃsatara

adj. of greater benefit; more profitable ✗
mahānubbāva

adj. of great majesty ✗
mahānubhāva

adj. of mighty power; of mighty splendour; of great majesty; of great magnificence; lit. great splendour [mahā + ānubhāva] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of mighty power; of mighty splendour; of great majesty; of great magnificence; lit. great splendour
Construction mahā + ānubhāva
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + ānubhāva)
Sanskrit mahānubhāva

Examples

api ca te ahaṃ, brahme, gatiñ'ca pajānāmi, jutiñ'ca pajānāmi, evaṃ mah'iddhiko bako brahmā, evaṃ mah'ānubhāvo bako brahmā, evaṃ mahesakkho bako brahmā'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

imesaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, dasannaṃ kathāvatthūnaṃ upādāy'upādāya kathaṃ katheyyātha, imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃ mah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃ mah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ
mahānubhāvatara

adj. of greater majesty; of greater magnificence; of superior splendour [mahā + ānubhāva + tara] ~

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahānubhāva
Meaning of greater majesty; of greater magnificence; of superior splendour
Construction mahā + ānubhāva + tara
mahānubhāva + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
mahānubhāvatā

fem. mighty power; mighty splendour; great majesty; great magnificence; lit. great splendour state [mahā + ānubhāva + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahānubhāva
Meaning mighty power; mighty splendour; great majesty; great magnificence; lit. great splendour state
Construction mahā + ānubhāva + tā
mahānubhāva + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + ānubhāvatā)
Sanskrit mahānubhāvatā

Examples

atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi, acchariyaṃ vata, bho, abbhutaṃ vata, bho, tathāgatassa mah'iddhikatā mah'ānubhāvatā!

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

samaṇassa gotamassa mah'iddhikatā mah'ānubhāvatā, na ca vata no ito pubbe diṭṭho vā, suto vā, añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ mah'iddhiko evaṃ mah'ānubhāvo yathāyaṃ samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito

fem. Therīgāthā 55 (THI55) ✗
mahāpañña

adj. of great wisdom; very wise; extremely intelligent [mahā + paññā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of great wisdom; very wise; extremely intelligent
Construction mahā + paññā + a
mahāpaññā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + paññā)
Commentary (MNa) mahāpaññā'ti mahante atthe mahante dhamme mahantā niruttiyo mahantāni paṭibhānāni pariggaṇhanasamatthāya paññāya samannāgatā.
Sanskrit mahā + prajñā

Examples

vītataṇho anādāno,
niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ,
jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,
sa ve antimasārīro mahāpañño,
mahāpuriso'ti vuccati.

DHP 352 taṇhāvaggo

evaṃ vutte, bhagavā visākhaṃ upāsakaṃ etadavoca, paṇḍitā, visākha, dhammadinnā bhikkhunī, mahāpaññā, visākha, dhammadinnā bhikkhunī.

mahāpaññāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 55.62 (SN55.62) ✗
mahāpañhā

fem. the great questions; in reference to Nigaṇṭhanāṭaputtasuttaṃ Saṃyutta Nikāya 41.8 (SN41.8) [mahā + pañhā] ✓

Grammar fem pl, comp
Meaning the great questions; in reference to Nigaṇṭhanāṭaputtasuttaṃ Saṃyutta Nikāya 41.8 (SN41.8)
Construction mahā + pañhā
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + pañhā)
Synonym mahāpañhāni
Variant mahāpañha
Sanskrit mahā + praśna

Example

iti kho, āvuso, yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitāsu mahāpañhāsu, eko pañho eko uddeso ekaṃ veyyākaraṇaṃ .. dasa pañhā dasuddesā dasa veyyākaraṇānīti, imassa kho ahaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena atthaṃ ājānāmi.

AN 10.28 dutiyamahāpañhāsuttaṃ
mahāpañhāni

mahāpañha + āni

Synonym mahāpañhā
Sanskrit mahā + praśna

Example

devayānaṃ abhiruyha,

na naṃ jāti nivāresi,

Examples

Meaning having a large following; with a great congregation

mahāparisā + a

Commentary (ANa) mahāparisānan'ti mahāparivārānaṃ uruvelakassapo aggo'ti dasseti. aññesañ'hi therānaṃ kañci kālaṃ parivāro mahā hoti kañci kālaṃ appo, imassa pana therassa dvīhi bhātikehi saddhiṃ ekaṃ samaṇasahassaṃ nibaddhaparivāro'va ahosi. tesu ek'ekasmiṃ ek'ekaṃ pabbājente dve samaṇasahassāni honti, dve dve pabbājente tīṇi sahassāni honti. tasmā so mahāparivārānaṃ aggo nāma jāto.
mahāpariḷāha

adj. blazing hot; scorching hot; lit. great burning [mahā + pariḷāha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp

Synonym mahābhitāpa
Sanskrit mahā + paridāha

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so puriso iti c'itic'eva kāyaṃ sannāmeyyā'ti? evaṃ, bho gotama. taṃ kissa hetu? asu hi, bho gotama, aggi dukkhasamphasso c'eva mah'ābhitāpo ca mahāpariḷāho cā'ti.

masc. name of king Mahāsudassana's peak-roofed hall; lit. great array [mahā + byūha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
