Variant mahāviyūha
Sanskrit mahāvyūha

Examples

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītikūṭ'āgārasahassāni ahesuṃ mahābyūhakūṭ'āgārappamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

tesaṃ kho pana, bhikkhu, caturāsītiyā kūṭ'āgārasahassānaṃ ekaññ'eva taṃ kūṭ'āgāraṃ hoti yam'ahaṃ tena samayena ajjhāvasāmi, mahābyūhaṃ kūṭ'āgāraṃ.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
mahābyūhakūṭāgārappamukha

adj. with the peaked-roof hall called Mahābyūha as foremost (among them) [mahābyūha + kūṭāgāra + pamukha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with the peaked-roof hall called Mahābyūha as foremost (among them)
Construction mahābyūha + kūṭāgāra + pamukha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahābyūhakūṭāgāra + pamukha)
Variant mahāviyūhakūṭāgārappamukha
Sanskrit mahāvyūha + kūṭa + āgāra + pramukha

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītikūṭ'āgārasahassāni ahesuṃ mahābyūhakūṭ'āgārappamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ
mahābyūhasutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 4.13 (SNP 51) ✗
mahābrahma 1

masc. great God almighty; supreme spirit [mahā + brahma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, atta group, irreg
Meaning great God almighty; supreme spirit
Construction mahā + brahma
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + brahma)
Commentary (ITIa) brahmapārisajjabrahmapurohitehi mahanto brahmā'ti mahābrahmā.
Sanskrit mahābrahma

Examples

mahābrahmuno'pi kho, bhikkhave, atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati. tasmiṃ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pag'eva hīnasmiṃ.

AN 10.29 paṭhamakosalasuttaṃ

sattakkhattuṃ mahābrahmā,
vasavattī tadā ahuṃ,
chattiṃsakkhattuṃ dev'indo,
devarajjam'akārayiṃ.

AN 7.62 mettasuttaṃ
mahābrahma 2

masc. mighty Brahman [mahā + brahma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, atta group, irreg
Meaning mighty Brahman
Construction mahā + brahma
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + brahma)
Commentary (VINa) paribbaja mahābrahme'ti mahābrāhmaṇa ito disā sīghaṃ palāyassu.
Sanskrit mahābrahma

Example

paribbaja mahābrahme,
pacant'aññe'pi pāṇino,
mā tvaṃ adhammo ācarito,
asmā kumbham'iv'ābhidā'ti.

VIN 2.7.7 pādukavaggo
mahābhaya

nt. great fear ✗
mahābhayabheravasadda

masc. enormous fearful and terrifying sound [mahā + bhayabherava + sadda] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning enormous fearful and terrifying sound
Construction mahā + bhayabherava + sadda
mahābhāra 1

masc. heavy burden; great load [mahā + bhāra] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning heavy burden; great load
Construction mahā + bhāra
Synonym garubhāra
mahābhāra 2

adj. carrying a heavy burden; weighed under [mahā + bhāra] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning carrying a heavy burden; weighed under
Construction mahā + bhāra
mahābhāravaha

adj. carrying a heavy burden; transporting a great load [mahābhāra + vaha] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning carrying a heavy burden; transporting a great load
Construction mahābhāra + vaha
mahābhikkhusaṅgha

masc. large community of monks ✗
mahābhiñña

adj. with powerful direct knowledge; having substantial realization [mahā + abhiñña] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with powerful direct knowledge; having substantial realization
Construction mahā + abhiñña
Commentary (SNt) mahāvisayattā mahatiyo abhiññā etassā'ti mah'ābhiñño, tassa bhāvo'ti sabbaṃ vattabbaṃ.
mahābhiññatā

fem. profound higher knowledge; great higher understanding; lit. great knowledge state [mahā + abhiññā + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahābhiññā
Meaning profound higher knowledge; great higher understanding; lit. great knowledge state
Construction mahā + abhiññā + tā
mahābhiññā + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Sanskrit mahā + abhijñatā

Example

yañ'hi taṃ, āvuso, sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti, mamaṃ taṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya, satthārā anuggahito sāvako mah'ābhiññataṃ patto'ti.

SN 21.1 kolitasuttaṃ
mahābhiññappatta

adj. attained powerful direct knowledge; reached substantial realization [mahābhiñña + patta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attained powerful direct knowledge; reached substantial realization
Construction mahābhiñña + patta
Variant mahābhiññāpatta
Commentary (ANa) mahābhiññāppattānan'ti mahatiyo abhiññāyo pattānaṃ, bhaddā kaccānā, nāma aggā'ti dasseti. ekassa hi buddhassa cattāro'va janā mahābhiññā honti, na avasesasāvakā. avasesasāvakā hi kappasatasahassam'eva anussarituṃ sakkonti, na tato paraṃ. mahābhiññāppattā pana kappasatasahassādhikaṃ asaṅkhyeyyaṃ anussaranti.
mahābhiññāpatta

adj. attained powerful direct knowledge; reached substantial realization; (comm) recollection of more than one hundred thousand aeons of previous existences [mahābhiñña + patta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attained powerful direct knowledge; reached substantial realization; (comm) recollection of more than one hundred thousand aeons of previous existences
Construction mahābhiñña + patta
Variant mahābhiññappatta
Commentary (ANa) mahābhiññāppattānan'ti mahatiyo abhiññāyo pattānaṃ, bhaddā kaccānā, nāma aggā'ti dasseti. ekassa hi buddhassa cattāro'va janā mahābhiññā honti, na avasesasāvakā. avasesasāvakā hi kappasatasahassam'eva anussarituṃ sakkonti, na tato paraṃ. mahābhiññāppattā pana kappasatasahassādhikaṃ asaṅkhyeyyaṃ anussaranti.
mahābhitāpa

adj. extremely hot; scorching hot; blazing hot [mahā + abhitāpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning extremely hot; scorching hot; blazing hot
Construction mahā + abhitāpa
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + abhitāpa)
Synonym mahāpariḷāha
Commentary (PVa) mah'ābhitāpan'ti mahādukkhaṃ, mahāaggisantāpaṃ vā.
Sanskrit mahā + abhitāpa

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, māgaṇḍiya, api nu so puriso iti c'itic'eva kāyaṃ sannāmeyyā'ti? evaṃ, bho gotama. taṃ kissa hetu? asu hi, bho gotama, aggi dukkhasamphasso c'eva mah'ābhitāpo ca mahāpariḷāho cā'ti.

MN 75 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
mahābhisakka

masc. mighty doctor; great physician; great healer [mahā + bhisakka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mighty doctor; great physician; great healer
Construction mahā + bhisakka
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanata + bhisakka)
Sanskrit mahā + bhiṣaj

Example

suyuttavādī dvipadānam'uttamo,
mahābhisakko naradammasārathi,
cittaṃ calaṃ makkaṭasannibhaṃ iti,
avītarāgena sudunnivārayaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
mahābhisma

adj. extremely terrifying; dreadful [mahā + bhismā + a] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning extremely terrifying; dreadful
Construction mahā + bhismā + a
mahābhismā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym mahābhiṃsa
mahābhiṃsa

adj. extremely terrifying; dreadful [mahā + bhiṃsā + a] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning extremely terrifying; dreadful
Construction mahā + bhiṃsā + a
mahābhiṃsā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Synonym mahābhisma
mahābhūta

nt. four great elements ✗
mahābhūtā

masc. primary states; great elements; earth, water, fire and wind [mahā + bhūta + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning primary states; great elements; earth, water, fire and wind
Construction mahā + bhūta + ā
mahābhūta + ā
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhūta)
Synonym mahābhūtāni
Commentary (MNa) mahābhūtānī'ti pathavīāpatejavāyānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit mahābhūta

Examples

yato kho, āvuso, bhikkhu catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ samudayañ'ca atthaṅ'gamañ'ca yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ettāvatā kho, āvuso, bhikkhuno dassanaṃ suvisuddhaṃ hotī'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ

katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ? cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ.

SN 22.57 sattaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
mahābhūtāni

nt. primary states; great elements; earth, water, fire and wind [mahā + bhūta + āni] ✓

Grammar nt pl, comp
Meaning primary states; great elements; earth, water, fire and wind
Construction mahā + bhūta + āni
mahābhūta + āni
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhūta)
Synonym mahābhūtā
Commentary (MNa) mahābhūtānī'ti pathavīāpatejavāyānam'etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Sanskrit mahābhūta

Example

katamo c'āvuso, rūp'upādānakkhandho? cattāri ca mahābhūtāni, catunnañ'ca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.

MN 28 mahāhatthipadopamasuttaṃ
mahābhūmicāla

masc. massive earthquake ✗
mahābhūmicālahetu

masc. cause of massive earthquakes ✗
mahābhoga

adj. wealthy; with many possessions; with great property; lit. great wealth [mahā + bhoga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wealthy; with many possessions; with great property; lit. great wealth
Construction mahā + bhoga
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhoga)
Antonym appabhoga
Commentary (SNa) suvaṇṇarajatabhājan'ādi mahābhogo etesan'ti mahābhogā (ANa) mahābhogā'ti upabhogaparibhogabhaṇḍabhogena mahābhogā.
Sanskrit mahābhoga

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco aḍḍho hoti mahaddhano mahābhogo. evarūpo, bhikkhave, aḍḍhakahāpaṇena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati, kahāpaṇasatena'pi na bandhanaṃ nigacchati.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ

mahaddhanā mahābhogā,
raṭṭhavanto'pi khattiyā,
aññam'aññ'ābhigijjhanti,
kāmesu analaṅ'katā.

SN 1.28 mahaddhanasuttaṃ
mahābhogakula

nt. wealthy family; rich family; lit. great wealth family [mahā + bhoga + kula] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wealthy family; rich family; lit. great wealth family
Construction mahā + bhoga + kula
Compound kammadhāraya (mahābhoga + kula)
Sanskrit mahābhoga + kula

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asappuriso mahābhogakulā pabbajito hoti. so iti paṭisañcikkhati, ahaṃ kho'mhi mahābhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na mahābhogakulā pabbajitā'ti.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
mahābhogatara

adj. richer; with more property and possessions [mahā + bhoga + tara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahābhoga
Meaning richer; with more property and possessions
Construction mahā + bhoga + tara
mahābhoga + tara
Derivative taddhita (tara)
Commentary (UDa) ayaṃ pana viseso, niccaparibbayavasena mahanto bhogo etassā'ti mahābhogo.
Sanskrit mahābhoga +

Example

ko nu kho, āvuso, imesaṃ dvinnaṃ rājūnaṃ mahaddhanataro vā mahābhogataro vā mahākosataro vā mahāvijitataro vā mahāvāhanataro vā mahabbalataro vā mahiddhikataro vā mahānubhāvataro vā rājā vā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro, rājā vā pasenadi kosalo'ti?

UD12 rājasuttaṃ
mahābhogatā

fem. fact of having great wealth; fact of having vast resources; lit. great wealth state [mahā + bhoga + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahābhoga
Meaning fact of having great wealth; fact of having vast resources; lit. great wealth state
Construction mahā + bhoga + tā
mahābhoga + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + bhogatā)
Antonym appabhogatta
Sanskrit mahābhoga + tā

Example

ahaṃ kho'mhi mahābhogakulā pabbajito, ime pan'aññe bhikkhū na mahābhogakulā pabbajitā'ti. so tāya mahābhogatāya attān'ukkaṃseti, paraṃ vambheti. ayaṃ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ
mahābhogatta

nt. fact of having great wealth [mahā + bhoga + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning fact of having great wealth
Construction mahā + bhoga + tta
mahābhoga + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)

Meaning leading to vast wealth; conducive to having many possessions
Construction mahābhoga + saṃvattanika
Compound catutthī tappurisa (mahābhogāya + saṃvattanika)

masc. main road; highway [mahā + magga] ~

Meaning main road; highway
Construction mahā + magga

Synonym addhānamagga, mahāpatha
mahāmaṅgala

nt. great blessing ✗
mahāmaṅgalajātaka

nt. Jātaka 453 (JA 453) ✗
mahāmacca

masc. chief minister ✗
mahāmaṇi

masc. great jewel; precious gem [mahā + maṇi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great jewel; precious gem
Construction mahā + maṇi
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + maṇi)
Sanskrit mahāmaṇi

Example

mahantañ'ca taṃ padumavanañ'cā'ti mahāpadumavanaṃ, mahantī ca sā nadī cā'ti mahānadī, mahanto ca so maṇi cā'ti mahāmaṇi, mahanto ca so gahapatiko cā'ti mahāgahapatiko, mahantañ'ca taṃ dhanañ'cā'ti mahādhanaṃ, mahanto ca so puñño cā'ti mahāpuñño.

kaccāyana samāsakappa 330
mahāmati

adj. very intelligent; having a great understanding; great-minded [mahā + mati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning very intelligent; having a great understanding; great-minded
Construction mahā + mati
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + mati)
Sanskrit mahāmati

Example

paññāpāramitaṃ patto,
mahābuddhi mahāmati,
ajaḷo jaḷasamāno,
sadā carati nibbuto.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
mahāmatta

masc. chief minister; chancellor; cabinet member [mahā + amā + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning chief minister; chancellor; cabinet member
Construction mahā + amā + ta
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + matta)
Commentary (VINa) mahāmattā'ti ṭhān'antarappattā mahāamaccā, te'pi tattha tattha gāme vā nigame vā nisīditvā rājakiccaṃ karonti
Sanskrit mahāmātya

Examples

evaṃ, devā'ti kho so mahāmatto rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa paṭissutvā āyasmato pilindavacchassa pañca ārāmikasatāni pādāsi, pāṭiyekko gāmo nivisi

VIN 4.6.162 pilindavaccha vatthu

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami

AN 4.183 sutasuttaṃ
mahāmattakathā

fem. talk about ministers; discussion about politicians [mahāmatta + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about ministers; discussion about politicians
Construction mahāmatta + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mahāmattānaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit mahāmātya + kathā

Example

seyyath'idaṃ, rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
mahāmahadivasa

masc. festival day ✗
mahāmahinda

masc. Mahinda Mahāthera who brought the Dhamma to Sri Lanka ✗

fem. great world; mighty earth [mahā + mahī] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning great world; mighty earth
Construction mahā + mahī
Sanskrit mahā + mahī
mahāmahī 2

fem. great Mahī river [mahā + mahī] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning great Mahī river
Construction mahā + mahī
Sanskrit mahā + mahī
mahāmāyā

fem. (comm) mother of the Bodhisatta [mahā + māyā] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning (comm) mother of the Bodhisatta
Construction mahā + māyā
Notes only found in commentaries
mahāmālukyasutta

nt. Majjhima Nikāya 64 (MN64) ✗
mahāmigasaṅgha

masc. large herd of deer [mahā + migasaṅgha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning large herd of deer
Construction mahā + migasaṅgha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + migasaṅgha)
Sanskrit mahā + mṛga + saṃgha

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, araññe pavane mahantaṃ ninnaṃ pallalaṃ. tam'enaṃ mahāmigasaṅgho upanissāya vihareyya. tassa kocideva puriso uppajjeyya anatthakāmo ahitakāmo ayogakkhemakāmo.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
mahāmuni

masc. great sage; mighty seer [mahā + muni] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great sage; mighty seer
Construction mahā + muni
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + muni)
Synonym mahesi, mahesī
Sanskrit mahā + muni

Examples

catubbipallāsavasaṃ adhiṭṭhitaṃ,
gāmaṇḍalaṃ'va parinesi citta maṃ,
nanu saṃyojanabandhanacchidaṃ,
saṃsevase kāruṇikaṃ mahāmuniṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

kikī'va aṇḍaṃ rakkheyya,
cāmarī viya vāladhiṃ,
nipako sīlasampanno,
mamaṃ rakkhi mahāmuni.

APA 18 rāhula therāpadānaṃ
mahāmūḷhatā

Meaning state of great confusion; fact of enormous ignorance
Construction mahā + mūḷha + tā
mahāmūḷha + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
mahāmegha

masc. great downpour; massive shower ✗
mahāmeru

masc. name of a mountain; lit. great mount Meru [mahā + meru] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a mountain; lit. great mount Meru
Construction mahā + meru
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + meru)
Sanskrit mahāmeru

Example

yo mahāmeruno kūṭaṃ,
vimokkhena aphassayi,
vanaṃ pubbavidehānaṃ,
ye ca bhūmisayā narā.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
mahāmoggalāna

masc. name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. great descendent of Muggala [mahā + moggalāna] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. great descendent of Muggala
Construction mahā + moggalāna
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + moggalāna)
Synonym moggallāna
Variant mahāmoggallāna
Sanskrit mahāmaudgalyāyana
mahāmoggallāna

masc. name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. great descendent of Muggala [mahā + moggallāna] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. great descendent of Muggala
Construction mahā + moggallāna
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + moggallāna)
Synonym moggallāna
Variant mahāmoggalāna
Commentary (AN 1.190) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ iddhimantānaṃ yadidaṃ mahāmoggallāno (UDa) mahāmoggallāno'ti pūjāvacanaṃ. guṇavisesehi mahanto moggallāno'ti hi mahāmoggallāno.
Sanskrit mahāmaudgalyāyana

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ avidūre nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṃ sūpaṭṭhitāya.

UD 25 mahāmoggallānasuttaṃ
mahāmoggallānattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 263 (TH263) ✗
mahāmoggallānasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.167 (AN4.167) ✗
mahāmoggallānasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 6.34 (AN6.34) ✗
mahāmoggallānasutta 3

nt. Udāna 25 (UD 25) ✗
mahāmorajātaka

nt. Jātaka 491 (JA 491) ✗
mahāmoha

masc. great delusion; great illusion; enormous confusion [mahā + moha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great delusion; great illusion; enormous confusion
Construction mahā + moha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + moha)
Sanskrit mahāmoha

Example

avijjā h'āyaṃ mahāmoho,
yen'idaṃ saṃsitaṃ ciraṃ,
vijjāgatā ca ye sattā,
n'āgacchanti punabbhavan'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
mahāya

masc. great income; high revenue ✗
mahāyakkha

masc. great spirit [mahā + yakkha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great spirit
Construction mahā + yakkha
mahāyañña 1

masc. great sacrifice; great sacrificial offering [mahā + yañña] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning great sacrifice; great sacrificial offering
Construction mahā + yañña
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + yañña)
Sanskrit mahāyajña

Examples

siyā kho pana bhoto rañño mahāyaññaṃ yajamānassa koci'd'eva vippaṭisāro, mahā vata me bhogakkhandho vigacchatī'ti, so bhotā raññā vippaṭisāro na karaṇīyo

DN 5.8 kūṭadantasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa mahāyañño paccupaṭṭhito hoti, pañca ca usabhasatāni pañca ca vacchatarasatāni pañca ca vacchatarisatāni pañca ca ajasatāni pañca ca urabbhasatāni thūṇ'ūpanītāni honti yaññ'atthāya.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
mahāyañña 2

nt. great sacrifice; great sacrificial offering [mahā + yañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning great sacrifice; great sacrificial offering
Construction mahā + yañña
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + yañña)
Commentary (ANa) tāni mahāyaññānī'ti tāni sappinavanītadadhimadhuphāṇit'ādīhi niṭṭhānaṃ gatāni mahādānāni.
Notes occurs in masc and nt
Sanskrit mahāyajña

Example

na'pi yathā tesaṃ pubbakānaṃ isīnaṃ tāni mahāyaññāni ahesuṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, aṭṭhakassa vāmakassa vāmadevassa vessāmittassa yamadaggino aṅgīrasassa bhāradvājassa vāseṭṭhassa kassapassa bhaguno, evaṃ me ayaṃ dānasaṃvibhāgo bhavissatī'ti dānaṃ deti

AN 7.52 dānamahapphalasuttaṃ
mahāyaññavagga

masc. Chapter 5 of Sattakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 7.44-53 ✗

adj. of great fame; of wide renown [mahā + yasa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning of great fame; of wide renown
Construction mahā + yasa

Sanskrit mahāyaśas

Example

mahanto ca so puriso cā'ti mahāpuriso, mahantī ca sā devī cā'ti mahādevī, mahantañ'ca taṃ balañ'cā'ti mahābalaṃ, mahanto ca so nāgo cā'ti mahānāgo, mahanto ca so yaso cā'ti mahāyaso

kaccāyana samāsakappa 330
mahāyāga

masc. great sacrifice ✗
mahārajakkha

adj. with much dirt in the eye [mahā + rajakkha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with much dirt in the eye
Construction mahā + rajakkha
Compound kammadhāraya (mahā + rajakkha)
Antonym apparajakkha
Commentary (MNa) yesaṃ vuttanayen'eva paññācakkhumhi rāg'ādirajaṃ appaṃ, te apparaj'akkhā. yesaṃ taṃ mahantaṃ, te mahāraj'akkhā.
Sanskrit mahā + rajas + akṣa

Example

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokento satte apparaj'akkhe mahāraj'akkhe, tikkh'indriye mudindriye, svākāre dvākāre, suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, app'ekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, app'ekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.

Meaning great act of violence; mass murder
Construction mahā + ārambha

Sanskrit mahā + rabhas, ālambha

Example

na te honti mahapphalā.

masc. name of a Licchavi man [√mah + nta + ā + li] ✓

Construction √mah + nta + ā + li
mahā + li

Example

mahāvana 1

nt. name of a forest outside Vesālī; lit. great forest [mahā + vana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a forest outside Vesālī; lit. great forest
Construction mahā + vana
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + vana)
Sanskrit mahāvana

Examples

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ

atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena mahāvanaṃ kūṭ'āgārasālā ten'upasaṅkami.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
mahāvana 2

nt. name of a forest outside Kapilavatthu; lit. great forest [mahā + vana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a forest outside Kapilavatthu; lit. great forest
Construction mahā + vana
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + vana)
Sanskrit mahāvana

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ mahāvane mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sabbeh'eva arahantehi

SN 1.37 samayasuttaṃ

kapilavatthusmiṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena mahāvanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā beluvalaṭṭhikāya mūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ

vāt'ātape visosetvā agginā ḍaheyya, agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya, masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahāvāhana

UD12 rājasuttaṃ
mahāvikaṭa

nt. incredibly disgusting thing [mahā + vikaṭa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning incredibly disgusting thing
Construction mahā + vikaṭa
Variant mahāvikata
Commentary (VMVt) apakatibhesajjattā vikaṭāni virūpāni visaharaṇato mahāvisayattā mahantāni cā'ti mahāvikaṭāni. (KVt) cattāri mahāvikaṭānī'ti gūthaṃ, muttaṃ, chārikā, mattikā ca āsayādivasena virūpāni jātānī'ti katvā vikaṭānī'ti vā apakatibhojanattā vikaṭāni virūpāni jātānī'ti vā attho.
mahāvikaṭabhojana

nt. extremely perverse eating habit; hideous way of eating [mahā + vikaṭa + bhojana] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning extremely perverse eating habit; hideous way of eating
Construction mahā + vikaṭa + bhojana
Compound kammadhāraya (mahāvikaṭa + bhojana)
Commentary (MNa) mahāvikaṭabhojanasmin'ti mahante vikaṭabhojane, apakatibhojane'ti attho.
Sanskrit mahā + vikaṭa + bhojana

Example

yāvakīvañ'ca me, sāriputta, sakaṃ muttakarīsaṃ apariyādinnaṃ hoti, sakaṃ'y'eva sudaṃ muttakarīsaṃ āhāremi. idaṃsu me, sāriputta, mahāvikaṭabhojanasmiṃ hoti.

mahicchatā

fem. greediness; having many desires; lit. many wishes state [mahā + iccha + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahiccha
Meaning greediness; having many desires; lit. many wishes state
Construction mahā + iccha + tā
mahiccha + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Antonym appicchatā
Sanskrit maha + icchatā

Example

mah'icchatāya saṃvattanti no app'icchatāya

AN 8.53 saṃkhittasuttaṃ
mahita

pp. honoured; renowned; celebrated [√mah + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of mahati
Meaning honoured; renowned; celebrated
Root Family √mah
Root √mah･1 a (venerate)
Construction √mah + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym māhita, sammata
Commentary (THa) mahito'ti sadevakena lokena mahatiyā pūjāya pūjito.
Sanskrit mahita
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

cirassaṃ vata me mahito mahesī,
mahāvanaṃ samaṇo paccapādi,
so'haṃ cajissāmi sahassapāpaṃ,
sutvāna gāthaṃ tava dhammayuttaṃ.

TH 255 aṅgulimālattheragāthā
mahitthivaṇṇasata

Meaning appearance of one hundred senior women

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning old woman; senior women
Construction maha + itthī
mahitvā

abs. having honoured, having revered [√mah] ✗
mahiddhi

masc. name of a god ✗
mahiddhika

adj. of great supernatural power; magically powerful [mahā + iddhi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from iddhi
Meaning of great supernatural power; magically powerful
Construction mahā + iddhi + ka
mahiddhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + iddhika)
Sanskrit mahā + siddhika

Examples

imesaṃ ce tumhe, bhikkhave, dasannaṃ kathāvatthūnaṃ upādāy'upādāya kathaṃ katheyyātha, imesam'pi candimasūriyānaṃ evaṃ mah'iddhikānaṃ evaṃ mah'ānubhāvānaṃ tejasā tejaṃ pariyādiyeyyātha, ko pana vādo aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānan'ti!

AN 10.69 paṭhamakathāvatthusuttaṃ

suddhodano mahārājā,
gotamī ca pajāpatī,
abhiññātā mahātherā,
theriyo ca mah'iddhikā.

APA 28 yasodharātherīapadānaṃ
mahiddhikatara

adj. of greater supernatural power; more magically powerful [mahā + iddhi + ka + tara] ~

Grammar adj, comp, compar of mahiddhika
Meaning of greater supernatural power; more magically powerful
Construction mahā + iddhi + ka + tara
mahiddhika + tara

mahiddhikatā

fem. great supernatural ability; magical power; lit. great power state [mahā + iddhi + ka + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mahiddhika
Meaning great supernatural ability; magical power; lit. great power state
Construction mahā + iddhi + ka + tā
mahiddhika + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Compound kammadhāraya (mahanta + iddhikatā)
Sanskrit mahā + siddhika

Examples

samaṇassa gotamassa mah'iddhikatā mah'ānubhāvatā, na ca vata no ito pubbe diṭṭho vā, suto vā, añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ mah'iddhiko evaṃ mah'ānubhāvo yathāyaṃ samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi, acchariyaṃ vata, bho, abbhutaṃ vata, bho, tathāgatassa mah'iddhikatā mah'ānubhāvatā!

Example

giribbaje citrachadā vihaṅgamā,
mahindaghosatthanit'ābhigajjino,
te taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinaṃ.

VIN 1.4.3.3 bhesajjasikkhāpadaṃ
mahī 1

fem. mighty earth; vast world [√mah + a + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, from mahanta
Meaning mighty earth; vast world
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + a + ī
maha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit mahī
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

yathā, mahārāja, mahiyā rājaputtānaṃ hatthi-assa-ratha-dhanu-tharu-lekha-muddā-sikkhā-khagga-manta-suti-sammuti-yuddha-yujjhāpana-kiriyā karaṇīyā, avasesānaṃ puthu-vessa-suddānaṃ kasi vaṇijjā gorakkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho

maha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit mahī
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Examples

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, yā kāci mahānadiyo, seyyath'idaṃ gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tā mahāsamuddaṃ patvā jahanti purimāni nāmagottāni, mahāsamuddo'tv'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchanti

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

pakk'odano duddhakhīro'ham'asmi,
anutīre mahiyā samānavāso,
channā kuṭi āhito gini,
atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

SNP 2 dhaniyasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 2
mahī 3

fem. greatness; immensity; excellence [√mah + a + ī] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps, from mahanta
Meaning greatness; immensity; excellence
Root Family √mah
Root √mah×1 a (increase)
Construction √mah + a + ī
maha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Synonym mahantatā
Sanskrit mahī
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ
mahītala

nt. surface of the earth ✗
mahīdhara

masc. mountain ✗
mahīpati

masc. king ✗
mahīpāla

masc. king ✗
mahīyati

pr. is honoured; is revered [√mah + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of mahati, intrans
Meaning is honoured; is revered
Root Family √mah
Root √mah･1 īya (venerate)
Base √mah + īya > mahīya (pass)
Construction mahīya + ti
Phonetic Change a > ī (Kacc 502, 493)
Sanskrit mah
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)

Example

yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha matha icc'evam'ādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ anto īkāram'āpajjate. dīyati, dhīyati, mīyati, ṭhīyati, hīyati, pīyati, mahīyati, mathīyati.

mahesakkha

adj. renowned; of great influence; distinguished; important; (comm) with large retinues [mahā + yasas + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning renowned; of great influence; distinguished; important; (comm) with large retinues
Construction mahā + yasas + ka
mahāyasas > mahesas + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change āya > e
Antonym appesakkha
Commentary (MNa) evaṃ mahesakkho'ti evaṃ mahāyaso mahāparivāro. (SNa) mahesakkhāhī'ti mahāparivārāhi.
Notes CPD also suggests mahā + īsa + ākhya
Sanskrit maheśākhya (bsk)

Examples

api ca te ahaṃ, brahme, gatiñ'ca pajānāmi, jutiñ'ca pajānāmi, evaṃ mah'iddhiko bako brahmā, evaṃ mah'ānubhāvo bako brahmā, evaṃ mahesakkho bako brahmā'ti.

MN 49 brahmanimantanikasuttaṃ

na kho, bhikkhu, sukaro so bhagavā amhehi upasaṅkamituṃ, aññāhi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi parivuto.

khettaṃ hi taṃ puññapekkhassa hotī'ti.

mahesī 2.1

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
mahodadhi

masc. great river; sea; ocean; lit. great water container [mahā + udadhi] ✓

Sanskrit mahodadhi

Examples

sobbhesu padaresu ca,
saṇantā yanti kusobbhā,
tuṇhīyanti mah'odadhī.

mahāvaggo 11

mah'odadhiṃ aparimitaṃ mahāsaraṃ,
bahubheravaṃ ratanagaṇānam'ālayaṃ,
najjo yathā naragaṇasaṅghasevitā,
puthū savantī upayanti sāgaraṃ.

maṃsa 1

nt. meat; flesh ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning meat; flesh
Sanskrit māṃsa

Examples

yāni kho pana tāni paṇītabhojanāni, seyyath'idaṃ, sappi, navanītaṃ, telaṃ, madhu, phāṇitaṃ, maccho, maṃsaṃ, khīraṃ, dadhi. yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni agilāno attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 39 paṇītabhojanasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ

maṃsakhala

masc. mound of meat; pile of flesh [maṃsa + khala] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mound of meat; pile of flesh
Construction maṃsa + khala
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maṃsassa + khala)

Sanskrit māṃsa + khala

Examples

so evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ yāvatikā imissā nāḷandāya pāṇā te ekena khaṇena ekena muhuttena ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ karissāmī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

khurapariyantena ce'pi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kareyya, n'atthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, n'atthi pāpassa āgamo.

Meaning lump of flesh; meatball
Construction maṃsa + piṇḍa
Commentary (VINa) maṃsapiṇḍavatthusmiṃ so sākuṇiko sakuṇe gahetvā vikkiṇanakāle nippakkhacamme maṃsapiṇḍamatte katvā vikkiṇanto jīvikaṃ kappesi. ten'assa narakā cavanakāle maṃsapiṇḍo'va nimittaṃ ahosi. so maṃsapiṇḍapeto jāto.
maṃsapuñja

masc. pile of meat; heap of flesh [maṃsa + puñja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning pile of meat; heap of flesh
Construction maṃsa + puñja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maṃsassa + puñja)
Commentary (MNa) maṃsakhalan'ti ekaṃ maṃsarāsiṃ. puñjan'ti tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
Sanskrit māṃsa + puñja

Examples

so evaṃ vadeyya, ahaṃ yāvatikā imissā nāḷandāya pāṇā te ekena khaṇena ekena muhuttena ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ karissāmī'ti.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

khurapariyantena ce'pi cakkena yo imissā pathaviyā pāṇe ekaṃ maṃsakhalaṃ ekaṃ maṃsapuñjaṃ kareyya, n'atthi tatonidānaṃ pāpaṃ, n'atthi pāpassa āgamo.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
maṃsapesi

fem. lump of meat; chunk of meat; slice of meat [maṃsa + pesi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning lump of meat; chunk of meat; slice of meat
Construction maṃsa + pesi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maṃsassa + pesi)
Commentary (MNa) maṃsapesin'ti nisadapotappamāṇaṃ allamaṃsapiṇḍaṃ.
Sanskrit māṃsa + peśī

Examples

seyyathā'pi, gahapati, gijjho vā kaṅko vā kulalo vā maṃsapesiṃ ādāya uḍḍīyeyya.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

kīdiso, bho purisa, kiṃsuko'ti? so evaṃ vadeyya, lohitako kho, ambho purisa, kiṃsuko, seyyathā'pi maṃsapesī'ti.

SN 35.245 kiṃsukopamasuttaṃ
maṃsapesūpama

adj. like a lump of meat; similar to a piece of flesh [maṃsa + pesi + upama] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like a lump of meat; similar to a piece of flesh
Construction maṃsa + pesi + upama
Compound kammadhāraya (maṃsapesi + upama)
Commentary (MNa) maṃsapes'ūpamā bahusādhāraṇ'aṭṭhena.
Sanskrit māṃsa + peśī + upama

Examples

evam'eva kho, gahapati, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

MN 54.2 potaliyasuttaṃ

maṃsapes'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
maṃsaraṇa

adj. me (as their) refuge [maṃ + saraṇa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning me (as their) refuge
Construction maṃ + saraṇa
Commentary (SNa) ahaṃ saraṇaṃ bhayanāsanaṃ etesan'ti maṃsaraṇā.
maṃsalohita

nt. flesh and blood [maṃsa + lohita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning flesh and blood
Construction maṃsa + lohita
Compound dvanda (maṃsa ca lohita ca)
Sanskrit māṃsa + lohita

Examples

āraddhavīriyo viharati, kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ, yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pi kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ ākāsaṃ ākāsagataṃ, aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
maṃsalohitalepana

adj. smeared with flesh and blood; coated with meat and blood; lit. meat blood plastered [maṃsalohita + lepana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning smeared with flesh and blood; coated with meat and blood; lit. meat blood plastered
Construction maṃsalohita + lepana
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (maṃsalohitena + lepana)
Sanskrit māṃsa + lohita + lepana

Example

aṭṭhīnaṃ nagaraṃ kataṃ,
maṃsalohitalepanaṃ,
yattha jarā ca maccu ca,
māno makkho ca ohito.

DHP11 jarāvaggo
maṃsalohitācita

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning full of flesh and blood
Construction maṃsa + lohita + ācita
maṃsavaṇijjā

fem. trading in meat; (comm) animal trade [maṃsa + vaṇijjā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning trading in meat; (comm) animal trade
Construction maṃsa + vaṇijjā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (maṃsassa + vaṇijjā)
Commentary (SNa) maṃsavaṇijjā'ti sūkaramig'ādayo posetvā tesaṃ vikkayo ... iti sabbam'pi imaṃ vaṇijjaṃ n'eva attanā kātuṃ, na pare samādapetvā kāretuṃ vaṭṭati.
Sanskrit māṃsa + vaṇijyā

Example

pañc'imā, bhikkhave, vaṇijjā upāsakena akaraṇīyā. katamā pañca? satthavaṇijjā, sattavaṇijjā, maṃsavaṇijjā, majjavaṇijjā, visavaṇijjā.

AN 5.177 vaṇijjāsuttaṃ
maṃsasampāka

masc. meal cooked with meat [maṃsa + sampāka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning meal cooked with meat
Construction maṃsa + sampāka
Commentary (VINa) sūpasampāke'ti vāsagāhāpan'atthaṃ īsakaṃ majjaṃ pakkhipitvā sūpaṃ pacanti, tasmiṃ anāpatti. maṃsasampāke'pi es'eva nayo.
maṃsasūnakasaṇṭhāna

adj. fleshy, meaty ✗
maṃsika

adj. meat; flesh; lit. related to meat [maṃsa + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from maṃsa
Meaning meat; flesh; lit. related to meat
Construction maṃsa + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Sanskrit māṃsika

Example

tam'enaṃ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti ... cīrakavāsikam'pi karonti, eṇeyyakam'pi karonti, baḷisamaṃsikam'pi karonti, kahāpaṇikam'pi karonti, khārāpatacchikam'pi karonti, palighaparivattikam'pi karonti

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
mā avacuttha

idiom. (all of you) don’t say; don’t speak ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + aor
Meaning (all of you) don’t say; don’t speak

Example

tena kho pana samayena maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi tassaṃ parisāyaṃ nisinno hoti. atha kho maṇicūḷako gāmaṇi taṃ parisaṃ etadavoca, mā ayyā evaṃ avacuttha.

SN 42.10 maṇicūḷakasuttaṃ
mā ahuvattha

idiom. (you all) don’t be ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + aor
Meaning (you all) don’t be

Examples

mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha

MN 152 indriyabhāvanāsuttaṃ

cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhino ahuvattha, mā anubyañjanaggāhino.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
mā ahesuṃ

idiom. may they not be; may they not exist ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + aor, neg
Meaning may they not be; may they not exist
Commentary (MNa) mā vā ahesun'ti kiñci'pi mā ahesuṃ. idhā'pi kopamattakena kammapathabhedo na hoti. haññantū'tiādicintanen'eva hoti, tasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ.

Examples

byāpannacitto hoti paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo, ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun'ti.

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

SN 22.59 anattalakkhaṇasuttaṃ
mā ahosi

idiom. let it not be, may it not exist ✗
mā kadāci

idiom. (+dat) may I never have; lit. may there never be [mā + kadā + ci] ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + adv, neg (+dat)
Meaning may I never have; lit. may there never be
Construction mā + kadā + ci
Derivative taddhita (ci)
Antonym kadāci
Sanskrit mā + kadā + cit

Example

mā me kadāci pāpiccho,
kusīto hīnavīriyo,
appassuto anādaro,
kena lokasmi kiṃ siyā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
mā kho tumhe eso ajesi

idiom. don’t let this person defeat you ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + ind + pron + pron + aor
Meaning don’t let this person defeat you

Example

mā kho tumhe, āyasmanto, eso ajesi.

VIN 5.1.1 tajjanīya kammaṃ
mā 1.1

ind. (+aor or +imp) do not; may one not; don’t let ✓

Grammar ind, neg (+aor or +imp)
Meaning do not; may one not; don’t let
Sanskrit mā

Examples

sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

SN 10.5 sānusuttaṃ

etha tumhe, kālāmā, mā anussavena, mā paramparāya, mā itikirāya, mā piṭakasampadānena, mā takkahetu, mā nayahetu, mā ākāraparivitakkena, mā diṭṭhinijjhānakkhantiyā, mā bhabbarūpatāya, mā samaṇo no garū'ti.

AN 3.66 kesamuttisuttaṃ
mā 1.2

ind. (+acc) enough (of)!; stop (with)! ✓

Grammar ind, excl (+acc)
Meaning enough (of)!; stop (with)!
Sanskrit mā

Example

alaṃ, bhikkhave, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ mā kalahaṃ mā viggahaṃ mā vivādan'ti

MN 128 upakkilesasuttaṃ
mā 2.1

fem. moon [ma1] ✗
mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha

idiom. don't have remorse later!; don't regret it later ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + adv + adj + aor
Meaning don't have remorse later!; don't regret it later
Commentary (SNa) mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvatthā'ti ye hi pubbe daharakāle arogakāle sattasappāy'ādisampattikāle satthu sammukhībhāvakāle ca yonisomanasikārarahitā rattin'divaṃ maṅkulabhattaṃ hutvā seyyasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ anubhontā pamajjanti, te pacchā jarākāle rogakāle maraṇakāle vipattikāle satthu parinibbutakāle ca taṃ pubbe pamādavihāraṃ anussarantā sappaṭisandhikālakiriyañ'ca bhāriyaṃ sampassamānā vippaṭisārino honti.
Sanskrit mā + paścāt + vipratisaarin + bhū

Example

etāni, bhikkhu, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhu, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.

AN 5.73 paṭhamadhammavihārīsuttaṃ
mā pamādattha

idiom. you (all) mustn't be careless; don't be negligent [mā + pamāda + attha] ~

Grammar idiom, ind + masc + imp
Meaning you (all) mustn't be careless; don't be negligent
Construction mā + pamāda + attha
Commentary (MNa) mā pamād'atthā'ti mā pamajjittha.
Sanskrit mā + pramāda + asta
mā 3.1

root. (gram) √mā (measure) [√mā + ā] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √mā (measure)
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Sanskrit mā
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

502, 493. yamhi dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha math'ādīnam'ī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502

yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha matha icc'evam'ādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ anto īkāram'āpajjate. dīyati, dhīyati, mīyati, ṭhīyati, hīyati, pīyati, mahīyati, mathīyati.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 502
mā hevaṃ

idiom. don’t (say) that; don’t (speak) like that [mā + hi + evaṃ] ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + ind + adv
Meaning don’t (say) that; don’t (speak) like that
Construction mā + hi + evaṃ
Sanskrit mā + hi + evam

Examples

channaṃ, āvuso, phass'āyatanānaṃ asesavirāganirodhā n'ev'atthi no n'atth'aññaṃ kiñcī'ti? mā h'evaṃ, āvuso.

AN 4.173 mahākoṭṭhikasuttaṃ

mā h'evaṃ, āvuso ariṭṭha, avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
mākāsi

aor. (+acc) do not make; do not create; don't do; lit. do not made [mā + akāsi] ✓

Grammar aor, comp vb, neg, trans (+acc)
Meaning do not make; do not create; don't do; lit. do not made
Construction mā + akāsi
Compound comp verb (mā + akāsi)
Commentary (UDa) m'ākattha mā karittha, atha pana taṃ pāpakammaṃ etarahi karotha, āyatiṃ vā karissatha
Notes mā + aorist = imperative
Sanskrit mā + akṛthās, akrātām

Examples

sānuṃ pabuddhaṃ vajjāsi,
yakkhānaṃ vacanaṃ idaṃ,
m'ākāsi pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

SN 10.5 sānusuttaṃ

sace bhāyatha dukkhassa,
sace vo dukkham'appiyaṃ,
m'ākattha pāpakaṃ kammaṃ,
āvi vā yadi vā raho.

UD 44 kumārakasuttaṃ
māgaṇḍika

masc. follower of Māgaṇḍiya [maganda + *ika] ~

Meaning follower of Māgaṇḍiya
Construction maganda > māgaṇda + *ika

Phonetic Change a > ā
nd > ṇḍ
Sanskrit maganda +
māgaṇḍiya

masc. name of a wandering ascetic; lit. son of a usurer [maganda + *iya] ✓

Grammar masc, patr, from maganda
Meaning name of a wandering ascetic; lit. son of a usurer
Construction maganda > māgaṇda + *iya
Derivative taddhita (*iya)
Phonetic Change a > ā
nd > ṇḍ
Variant māgandiya
Sanskrit maganda +

Example

atha kho māgaṇḍiyo paribbājako jaṅghāvihāraṃ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yena bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agy'āgāraṃ ten'upasaṅkami.

Construction magadha > māgadha + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)

Examples

VIN 4.1.13 bimbisāra samāgama kathā

atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantassa rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassa bhikkhū āmantesi

DN 2.32 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
māgadhaka

adj. from Magadha; living in Magadha; Magadhan [magadha + *aka] ✓

Grammar adj, from magadha
Meaning from Magadha; living in Magadha; Magadhan
Construction magadha > māgadha + *aka
Derivative taddhita (*aka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant māgadhika
Commentary (MNa) māgadhako'ti magadharaṭṭhavāsī.
Sanskrit māgadhaka

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, māgadhako gopālako duppaññajātiko, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye, asamavekkhitvā gaṅgāya nadiyā orimaṃ tīraṃ, asamavekkhitvā pārimaṃ tīraṃ, atitthen'eva gāvo patāresi uttaraṃ tīraṃ suvidehānaṃ.

Sanskrit māgadha + mahāmātya

Example

atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vassakāraṃ brāhmaṇaṃ māgadhamahāmattaṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi

māgadhasutta

fem. language of Magadha [magadha] ✗

māgavika

masc. hunter; deer hunter; game hunter [maga + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from maga
Meaning hunter; deer hunter; game hunter
Construction maga > māga + [v] + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
+v
Synonym māgavi
Commentary (ANa) māgaviko'ti migaghātako.
Sanskrit mārgika

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo orabbhiko hoti sūkariko sākuṇiko māgaviko luddo macchaghātako coro coraghātako goghātako bandhan'āgāriko, ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 4.198 attantapasuttaṃ

tatr'idaṃ, bhante, pūraṇena kassapena kaṇh'ābhijāti paññattā, orabbhikā sūkarikā sākuṇikā māgavikā luddā macchaghātakā corā coraghātakā bandhan'āgārikā ye vā pan'aññe'pi keci kurūrakammantā.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
māgasira

masc. name of a lunar month; December-January ~

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a lunar month; December-January
Synonym phussa
Sanskrit mārgaśīrṣa
māgha 1

masc. (comm) epithet of Sakka ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (comm) epithet of Sakka
Synonym makhādeva, magghadeva, maghadeva, vāsava, sujampati
Commentary (SNa) māgho'ti sakkass'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Sanskrit magha

Example

atha kho māgho devaputto abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇo kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi.

māṇavā etadabravuṃ.

TH 248 adhimuttattheragāthā

bhavam'atthu bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ, rājā disampati bhavantaṃ jotipālaṃ māṇavaṃ āmantayati, rājā disampati bhoto jotipālassa māṇavassa dassanakāmo'ti

DN 19.7 mahāgovindasuttaṃ
māṇavaka

masc. (typically of a Brahman) youngster; young lad; young boy [manu + *a + ka] ✓

Grammar masc, dimin of māṇava
Meaning (typically of a Brahman) youngster; young lad; young boy
Construction manu > māṇav + *a + ka
māṇava + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
n > ṇ
u > av
Synonym kumāra
Sanskrit māṇavaka

Examples

atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo aññataraṃ māṇavakaṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, māṇavaka, yena samaṇo gotamo ten'upasaṅkama

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

yathā vā pana, mahārāja, brāhmaṇamāṇavakānaṃ iruvedaṃ yajuvedaṃ sāmavedaṃ athabbaṇavedaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ itihāsaṃ purāṇaṃ nighaṇḍu ... sikkhā karaṇīyā

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
māṇavakavaṇṇa

masc. appearance of a small boy; form of a young lad [māṇavaka + vaṇṇa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning appearance of a small boy; form of a young lad
Construction māṇavaka + vaṇṇa
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (māṇavakassa + vaṇṇa)
Commentary (UDa) māṇavakavaṇṇan'ti kumārakarūpaṃ.
Sanskrit māṇavaka + varṇa

Example

atha kho mucalindo nāgarājā viddhaṃ vigatavalāhakaṃ devaṃ viditvā bhagavato kāyā bhoge viniveṭhetvā sakavaṇṇaṃ paṭisaṃharitvā māṇavakavaṇṇaṃ abhinimminitvā bhagavato purato aṭṭhāsi pañjaliko bhagavantaṃ namassamāno.

UD11 mucalindasuttaṃ
māṇavakasata

nt. one hundred young Brahmans ✗
māṇavagāmiya

masc. name of a deity; lit. young village gentleman [māṇava + gāmiya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a deity; lit. young village gentleman
Construction māṇava + gāmiya
Compound kammadhāraya (māṇava + gāmiya)
Commentary (SNa) māṇavagāmiyo'ti ayaṃ kira devaputto buddh'upaṭṭhāko.
Sanskrit māṇava + grāmika

Examples

atha kho sambahulā nānātitthiyasāvakā devaputtā asamo ca sahali ca nīko ca ākoṭako ca vegabbhari ca māṇavagāmiyo ca abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ veḷuvanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ

atha kho māṇavagāmiyo devaputto bhagavantaṃ ārabbha bhagavato santike imā gāthāyo abhāsi

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
māṇavattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 73 (TH73) ✗
māṇavikā

fem. young Brahman girl; maiden [manu + *a + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from māṇava
Meaning young Brahman girl; maiden
Construction manu > māṇav + *a + ikā
māṇava + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
n > ṇ
u > av
Sanskrit māṇavikā

Example

māṇavī

māṇikā

fem. measure of volume (4 doṇa = 1 māṇikā) ✗

Construction maṇi > māṇi + vara + *a
maṇivara + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
mātaṅga 1

masc. elephant; lit. going at will ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning elephant; lit. going at will
Synonym gaja, hatthi, hatthī, kuñjara
Commentary (MNa) mātaṅgo'ti hatthi vuccati.
Sanskrit mataṃga

Example

no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅga-araññe'va nāgo.

DHP 329 nāgavaggo
mātaṅga 2

masc. low-caste man ✗

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha ~

Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha

nt. Jātaka 497 (JA 497) ✗
mātaṅgaputtattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 174 (TH174) ✗
mātaṅgarañña

nt. elephant in the forest [mātaṅga + arañña] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning elephant in the forest
Construction mātaṅga + arañña
Compound sattamī tappurisa (mātaṅga + araññe)
Commentary (MNa) mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo'ti mātaṅgo araññe nāgo'va. mātaṅgo'ti hatthi vuccati.
Sanskrit mataṃga + araṇya

Example

no ce labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ,
saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
rājā'va raṭṭhaṃ vijitaṃ pahāya,
eko care mātaṅg'araññ'eva nāgo.

mātaṅgārañña

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning name of a forest

Example

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, sutaṃ te daṇḍakī'raññaṃ kāliṅg'āraññaṃ majjh'āraññaṃ mātaṅg'āraññaṃ araññaṃ araññabhūtan'ti?

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
mātar

fem. mother ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning mother
Synonym ammā, jananī, māti, matti, mātu
Sanskrit mātar, mātṛ

Examples

na taṃ mātā pitā kayirā,
aññe v'āpi ca ñātakā,
sammāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
seyyaso naṃ tato kare.

DHP 43 cittavaggo

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ
mātaraṃ

fem. mother (object) [mātar] ✗
mātari

fem. in mother [mātar + i] ✓

Grammar fem, loc sg of mātar
Meaning in mother
Construction mātar + i
Sanskrit mātari

Example

yāva hi vanatho na chijjati,
aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so,
vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.

DHP 284 maggavaggo
mātalī

masc. name of Inda's charioteer ✗

masc. mother and father; parents [mātā + pitar] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mother and father; parents
Construction mātā + pitar

Examples

AN 4.63 brahmasuttaṃ

samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo akāmakānaṃ mātāpitūnaṃ assumukhānaṃ rudantānaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito

mātāpiturakkhita

adj. protected by a mother and father [mātāpitu + rakkhita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning protected by a mother and father
Construction mātāpitu + rakkhita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mātāpitarā + rakkhita)
Commentary (VIN) mātāpiturakkhitā nāma mātāpitaro rakkhanti gopenti issariyaṃ kārenti vasaṃ vattenti.
Sanskrit mātṛ + pitṛ + rakṣita

Example

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
mātāpitūnaṃ

masc. for mothers and fathers; for parents [mātā + pitar + ūnaṃ] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, dat pl of mātāpitar
Meaning for mothers and fathers; for parents
Construction mātā + pitar + ūnaṃ
Compound dvanda (mātūnaṃ ca pitūnaṃ ca)
Variant mātāpitunnaṃ
Commentary (VVt) puttānan'ti ca mātāpitūnan'ti ca sampadānavacanaṃ.
Sanskrit mātāpitṛbhyaḥ

Example

brahmā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. pubb'ācariyā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. pubbadevatā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ. āhuneyyā'ti, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṃ etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

mātāpetti

masc. mother and father [mātā + petti] ✓

Grammar masc, comp, in comps
Meaning mother and father
Construction mātā + petti
Compound dvanda (mātā ca petti ca)

Example

kumbhakāro pure āsiṃ,
vekaḷiṅge ghaṭīkaro,
mātāpettibharo āsiṃ,
kassapassa upāsako.

SN 1.50 ghaṭīkārasuttaṃ
mātāpettika

adj. from parents; from mother and father; lit. maternal and paternal [mātā + pettika] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning from parents; from mother and father; lit. maternal and paternal
Construction mātā + pettika
Compound dvanda (mātā ca pettika ca)
Sanskrit mātā + paitṛka

Example

cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo odanakummās'ūpacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

DN 2.24 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
mātāpettikasambhava

adj. origination from one’s parents; produced by one's mother and father [mātā + pettika + sambhava] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning origination from one’s parents; produced by one's mother and father
Construction mātā + pettika + sambhava
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mātāpettikena + sambhava)
Sanskrit mātā + paitṛka + sambhava

Examples

gaṇḍo'ti kho, bhikkhave, imass'etaṃ cātumahābhūtikassa kāyassa adhivacanaṃ mātāpettikasambhavassa odanakummās'ūpacayassa anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsanadhammassa.

AN 9.15 gaṇḍasuttaṃ

cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo odanakummās'ūpacayo anicc'ucchādana-parimaddana-bhedana-viddhaṃsana-dhammo, idañ'ca pana me viññāṇaṃ ettha sitaṃ ettha paṭibaddhan'ti

AN 7.63 bhariyāsuttaṃ
māti

fem. mother [mātar + i] ~

Grammar fem, in comps, from mātar
Meaning mother
Construction mātar + i
Derivative taddhita (i)
Synonym ammā, jananī, mātar, matti, mātu
Sanskrit mātṛ
mātika

adj. connected with mother [mātar] ✗
mātikā 1

fem. name for an early stage of the Abhidhamma in the suttapiṭaka and vinyapiṭaka; (comm) two Pātimokkhas; lit. matrix; array [mātar + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from mātar
Meaning name for an early stage of the Abhidhamma in the suttapiṭaka and vinyapiṭaka; (comm) two Pātimokkhas; lit. matrix; array
Construction mātar + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Commentary (ANa) mātikādharā'ti dvepātimokkhadharā.
Sanskrit mātṛkā

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ

AN 4.180 mahāpadesasuttaṃ
mātikā 2

fem. grounds; lit. matrix; array [mātar + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from mātar
Meaning grounds; lit. matrix; array
Construction mātar + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Commentary (VINa) aṭṭhimā, bhikkhave, mātikā kathinassa ubbhārāya, pakkamanantikā, niṭṭhānantikā, sanniṭṭhānantikā, nāsanantikā, savanantikā, āsāvacchedikā, sīmātikkantikā, sahubbhārā'ti
Sanskrit mātṛkā

Example

ubbhatasmiṃ kathine'ti aṭṭhannaṃ mātikānaṃ aññatarāya mātikāya ubbhataṃ hoti, saṅghena vā antarā ubbhataṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.1.1 paṭhamakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
mātikā 3

fem. water course; irrigation channel; water way; canal; lit. matrix [mātar + ikā] ✓

Grammar fem, from mātar
Meaning water course; irrigation channel; water way; canal; lit. matrix
Construction mātar + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Commentary (ANa) na mātikāsampannan'ti na khuddakamahantīhi udakamātikāhi sampannaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit mātṛkā

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

mātikādhara

masc. expert in the Abhidhamma; (comm) who knows the two Pātimokkha; who knows the summaries of the Dhamma and Vinaya; lit. bearer of the matrix [mātikā + dhara] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning expert in the Abhidhamma; (comm) who knows the two Pātimokkha; who knows the summaries of the Dhamma and Vinaya; lit. bearer of the matrix
Construction mātikā + dhara
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mātikaṃ + dhara)
Commentary (ANa) mātikādharā'ti dvepātimokkhadharā. (VISMa) tesaṃ'y'eva dhammavinayānaṃ mātikāya dhāraṇena mātikādharā.
Sanskrit mātṛkā + dhara

Example

idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, asukasmiṃ nāma āvāse sambahulā therā bhikkhū viharanti bahussutā āgat'āgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā. tesaṃ me therānaṃ sammukhā sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ

mātikāmukha

nt. canal inlet; water course opening [mātikā + mukha] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning canal inlet; water course opening
Construction mātikā + mukha
mātikāsampanna

adj. with irrigation channels; lit. succeeded with matrix [mātikā + sampanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with irrigation channels; lit. succeeded with matrix
Construction mātikā + sampanna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mātikāya + sampanna)
Commentary (ANa) na mātikāsampannan'ti na khuddakamahantīhi udakamātikāhi sampannaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit mātṛkā + sampanna

Example

idha, bhikkhave, khettaṃ unnāmaninnāmi ca hoti, pāsāṇasakkharikañ'ca hoti, ūsarañ'ca hoti, na ca gambhīrasitaṃ hoti, na āyasampannaṃ hoti, na apāyasampannaṃ hoti, na mātikāsampannaṃ hoti, na mariyādasampannaṃ hoti.

AN 8.34 khettasuttaṃ
mātito

ind. on the mother's side; lit. from the mother [mātar + ito] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of mātar
Meaning on the mother's side; lit. from the mother
Construction mātar + ito
Antonym pitito
Sanskrit mātṛpakṣa

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca. yassaṃ disāyaṃ aññe'pi bhaddā ass'ājānīyā jāyanti, tassaṃ disāyaṃ jāto hoti.

AN 8.13 assājānīyasuttaṃ

aññātikā nāma mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.

VIN 1.4.1.4 purāṇacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
mātipakkha

masc. mother's side ✗
mātiya

masc. man; mortal man; lit. to be killed [√mar + tya] ✓

Grammar masc, ptp of marati
Meaning man; mortal man; lit. to be killed
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar + tya
Derivative kicca (tya)
Phonetic Change art > āt
Variant macca
Commentary (SNa) mātiyā'ti maccā
Sanskrit martya
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

tapojigucchāya āyuttā,
pālayaṃ pavivekiyaṃ,
rūpe ca ye niviṭṭhāse,
devalok'ābhinandino,
te ve samm'ānusāsanti,
paralokāya mātiyā'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
mātisampatti

fem. excellence of the mother ✗
mātu 1

fem. for mother; to mother [mātar] ✗
mātu 2

fem. mother’s; of mother [mātar + u] ✓

Grammar fem, gen sg of mātar
Meaning mother’s; of mother
Construction mātar + u
Sanskrit mātuḥ

Example

ayaṃ me mātā, tassā me mātu ayaṃ mātā'ti, apariyādinnā'va bhikkhave, tassa purisassa mātumātaro assu, atha imasmiṃ jambudīpe tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya.

SN 15.1 tiṇakaṭṭhasuttaṃ
mātu 3

fem. mother [mātar + u] ✓

Grammar fem, in comps, from mātar
Meaning mother
Construction mātar + u
Synonym ammā, jananī, mātar, māti, matti
Sanskrit mātṛ

Examples

kāmesumicchācārī hoti. yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi, tathārūpāsu cārittaṃ āpajjitā hoti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ
mātukucchi 1

masc. mother’s belly; mother’s womb [mātu + kucchi] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mother’s belly; mother’s womb
Construction mātu + kucchi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mātuyā + kucchi)
Commentary (VINa) tattha gabbhaseyyakānaṃ vasena sabbasukhum'āttabhāvadassan'atthaṃ, yaṃ mātukucchismin'ti vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit mātā + kukṣi

Examples

manussaviggaho nāma yaṃ mātukucchismiṃ paṭhamaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ paṭhamaṃ viññāṇaṃ pātubhūtaṃ, yāva maraṇakālā etth'antare eso manussaviggaho nāma.

VIN 1.1.3 tatiyapārājikaṃ

yathā pana aññe sattā mātukucchito nikkhamantā paṭikūlena asucinā makkhitā nikkhamanti, na evaṃ bodhisatto.

JAa 1.N.2 avidūre nidānakathā
mātukucchi 2

fem. mother's belly; mother's womb ✗

Commentary (SNa) mātukucchigato naro'ti mātuyā tirokucchigato, kucchiyā abbhantaragato'ti attho.

nt. mother's milk [mātu + khīra] ~

Meaning mother's milk
Construction mātu + khīra
Synonym mātuthañña
mātugāma

masc. woman; female; women in general; womankind; lit. collection of mothers [mātu + gāma] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning woman; female; women in general; womankind; lit. collection of mothers
Construction mātu + gāma
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mātarānaṃ + gāma)
Commentary (VIN 1.2.2) mātugāmo nāma manuss'itthī, na yakkhī na petī, na tiracchānagatā. antamaso tadahujātā'pi dārikā, pag'eva mahattarī.
Notes masc in grammar, fem in meaning
Sanskrit mātṛgrāma

Examples

idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakamm'anto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.

AN 8.49 paṭhamaidhalokikasuttaṃ

so tattha passati mātugāmaṃ dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā. tassa mātugāmaṃ disvā dunnivatthaṃ vā duppārutaṃ vā rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti.

Sanskrit mātṛgrāma + upacāra

AN 10.72 kaṇṭakasuttaṃ
mātugoravaka

masc. mother's mooing; mother's lowing [mātu + goravaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mother's mooing; mother's lowing
Construction mātu + goravaka
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mātuyā + goravaka)
Commentary (MNa) mātugoravakena vuyhamāno'ti mātā purato purato huṃhun'ti goravaṃ katvā saññaṃ dadamānā urena udakaṃ chindamānā gacchati, vacchako tāya goravasaññāya dhenuyā vā urena chinn'odakena gacchamāno mātugoravakena vuyhamāno'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit mātuḥ + rava +

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, vacchako taruṇako tāva'd'eva jātako mātugoravakena vuyhamāno, so'pi tiriyaṃ gaṅgāya sotaṃ chetvā sotthinā pāraṃ agamāsi.

Example

DN 9.4 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, saññāattakathā

Construction madhurā > mādhurā + *a

Variant mathura
Sanskrit madhurā
māna 1.1

masc. pride; conceit; egotism; superiority; comparing oneself [√man + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from maññati
Meaning pride; conceit; egotism; superiority; comparing oneself
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym mada
Commentary (MNa) uṇṇatilakkhaṇo māno, ahaṃkāraraso, uddhumātabhāvapaccupaṭṭhāno.
Notes or √mā (measure)
Sanskrit māna
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

mam'eva kata maññantu,
gihīpabbajitā ubho,
mam'ev'ātivasā assu,
kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo,
icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

DHP 74 bālavaggo

dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3
māna 1.2

root. (gram) √man (think) [√man + *a] ✓

Grammar root, masc
Meaning (gram) √man (think)

Root √man･3 ya (think)

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit man

Examples

463, 532. māna kitānaṃ va tattaṃ vā.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 463

467, 533. tato pā mānānaṃ vā maṃ sesu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 467
māna 2.1

nt. measure; quantity; lit. measuring [√mā + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from mināti
Meaning measure; quantity; lit. measuring
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Sanskrit māna
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ

pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ, dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā'ti bāhirimena mānena.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ
mānakāma

adj. fond of conceit; who likes comparing oneself; who is proud [māna + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning fond of conceit; who likes comparing oneself; who is proud
Construction māna + kāma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mānaṃ + kāma)
Synonym mānakāmī
Commentary (SNa) mānakāmassā'ti mānaṃ kāmentassa icchantassa.
Sanskrit māna + kāma

Example

na mānakāmassa damo idh'atthi,
na monam'atthi asamāhitassa,
eko araññe viharaṃ pamatto,
na maccudheyyassa tareyya pāran'ti.

SN 1.9 mānakāmasuttaṃ
mānakāmasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 1.9 (SN1.9) ✗

Meaning fond of conceit; who likes comparing oneself; who is proud (in reference to SN 1.9 Mānakāmasutta)
Construction māna + kāmī
Synonym mānakāma
mānakūṭa

nt. false measure; fraud with measures [māna + kūṭa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning false measure; fraud with measures
Construction māna + kūṭa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mānena + kūṭa)
Commentary (MNa) mānakūṭaṃ nāma hadayabheda-sikhābheda-rajjubhedavasena tividhaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit kūṭamāna

Example

tulākūṭa kaṃsakūṭa mānakūṭa ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāciyoga chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sāhasākārā paṭivirato ahosi.

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
mānagata

nt. type of pride; occurrence of conceit; manifestation of ego; state of comparing [māna + gata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning type of pride; occurrence of conceit; manifestation of ego; state of comparing
Construction māna + gata
Compound kammadhāraya (māna + gata)
Commentary (SNa) mānagatavāre pana mānassa gataṃ mānagataṃ, mānapavattī'ti attho. māno'y'eva mānagataṃ gūthagataṃ muttagataṃ viya
Sanskrit māna + gata

Example

mānagataṃ, bhikkhave, rogo, mānagataṃ gaṇḍo, mānagataṃ sallaṃ. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, nihatamānena cetasā viharissāmā'ti, evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban'ti. ekādasamaṃ.

SN 35.248 yavakalāpisuttaṃ
mānagantha

masc. bond of ego; knot of conceit; fetter of comparison [māna + gantha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bond of ego; knot of conceit; fetter of comparison
Construction māna + gantha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mānassa + gantha)
Commentary (SNa) mānaganthassā'ti mānā ca ganthā ca assa.
Sanskrit māna + grantha

Example

pahīnamānassa na santi ganthā,
vidhūpitā mānaganth'assa sabbe,
sa vītivatto maññataṃ sumedho,
ahaṃ vadāmī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
mamaṃ vadantī'ti'pi so vadeyya,
loke samaññaṃ kusalo viditvā
vohāramattena so vohareyyā'ti.

SN 1.25 arahantasuttaṃ
mānacchida 1

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has cut through conceit
Construction māna + chida
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mānaṃ + chida)
Sanskrit māna + chida

Example

asaṃsayassa kusalassa,
venayikassa sārathivarassa,
anuttarassa ruciradhammassa,
nikkaṅkhassa pabhāsakassa,
mānacchidassa vīrassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

mānatta 1

nt. penance (imposed for saṅghādisesa offences); lit. paying respect state [√man + *a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from māna
Meaning penance (imposed for saṅghādisesa offences); lit. paying respect state
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + *a + tta
māna + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānatva
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

saṅghādiseso'ti saṅgho'va tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, mānattaṃ deti, abbheti, na sambahulā, na ekapuggalo. tena vuccati, saṅghādiseso'ti.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
mānatta 2

nt. deference; paying respect; winning favour; lit. paying respect state [√man + *a + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from māna
Meaning deference; paying respect; winning favour; lit. paying respect state
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + *a + tta
māna + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (VINa) bhikkhumānattāyā'ti bhikkhūnaṃ mānanabhāvāya, ārādhanatthāyā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit mānatva
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

parivutthaparivāsena bhikkhunā uttari chārattaṃ bhikkhumānattāya paṭipajjitabbaṃ, ciṇṇamānatto bhikkhu yattha siyā vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho, tattha so bhikkhu abbhetabbo.

VIN PAT SA saṅghādisesuddeso
mānattadāna

nt. (vinaya) giving penance [mānatta + dāna] ~

Grammar nt, act, comp
Meaning (vinaya) giving penance
Construction mānatta + dāna
mānatthaddha 1

masc. stubborn in pride ✗
mānatthaddha 2

masc. name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. stiff with conceit [māna + thaddha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a privately enlightened Buddha; lit. stiff with conceit
Construction māna + thaddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mānena + thaddha)
mānatthaddhasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 7.15 (SN7.15) ✗
mānathaddha

adj. arrogant; stuck-up ✗
mānada

adj. inspiring respect ✗
mānadinna

masc. name of a lay disciple; lit. give to conceit [māna + dinna] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a lay disciple; lit. give to conceit
Construction māna + dinna
mānadinnasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 47.30 (SN47.30) ✗
mānana

nt. paying respect; revering; honouring; esteeming [√man + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from māneti, caus
Meaning paying respect; revering; honouring; esteeming
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānana
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

idha chinditamārite,
hatajānīsu kassapo,
na pāpaṃ samanupassati,
puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.

SN 2.30 nānātitthiyasāvakasuttaṃ
mānanahetu

ind. for the sake of respect; for the sake of reverence; for honour [mānana + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning for the sake of respect; for the sake of reverence; for honour
Construction mānana + hetu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mānanassa + hetu)
Sanskrit mānana + hetu

Example

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ
mānanā

fem. respecting; revering; honouring; esteeming [√man + *e + anā] ✓

Grammar fem, act, from māneti, caus
Meaning respecting; revering; honouring; esteeming
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + anā
Derivative kita (anā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym sambhāvanā
Sanskrit mānanā
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

āmisahetū'ti cīvarahetu piṇḍapātahetu sen'āsanahetu gilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārahetu sakkārahetu garukārahetu mānanahetu vandanahetu pūjanahetu.

VIN 2.5.3.4 āmisasikkhāpadaṃ

Construction māna + patha
Commentary (SNa) mānapathan'ti mān'ārammaṇañ'c'eva mānasahabhuno ca dhamme.
mānapariññāsutta

nt. Itivuttaka 8 (ITI 8) ✗
mānamajjhagā

mānayati

pr. (+acc) honour; reveres; hold in high esteem [√man + *aya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, caus of maññati, trans (+acc)
Meaning honour; reveres; hold in high esteem
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *aya (think)
Base √man + *aya > mānaya (caus)
Construction mānaya + ti
Synonym māneti
Commentary (DNa) mānitā mānayantī'ti kālānukālaṃ balikammakaraṇena mānitā ete manussā amhākaṃ ñātakā'pi na honti, catumāsachamāsantare no balikammaṃ karontī'ti mānenti, mānentiyo uppannaṃ parissayaṃ haranti.
Sanskrit mānayati
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)
mānarata

adj. taking pleasure in pride; pleased with conceit [māna + rata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning taking pleasure in pride; pleased with conceit
Construction māna + rata
mānava

masc. young man; young gentleman; young Brahman [manu + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from manu
Meaning young man; young gentleman; young Brahman
Construction manu > mānav + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
n > ṇ
u > av
Variant māṇava
Sanskrit māṇava

Example

dummaṅkuyaṃ padasseti,
dhūmaṃ dhūmī'va pāvako,
yato patāyati kodho,
yena kujjhanti mānavā.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ
mānavāda

masc. matter of pride ✗
mānavādavinibaddha

adj. attached to matters of pride ✗
mānavinaya

masc. removal of pride; dispelling conceit [māna + vinaya] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of pride; dispelling conceit
Construction māna + vinaya
mānavinibaddha

adj. bound by pride; held captive by conceit [māna + vinibaddha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound by pride; held captive by conceit
Construction māna + vinibaddha
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mānena + vinibaddha)
Variant mānavinibandha
Commentary (UDa) mānaganthā mānavinibaddhā'ti tato eva tena apar'āparaṃ uppajjamānena yathā taṃ diṭṭhiṃ na paṭinissajjati, evaṃ attano santānassa ganthitattā vinibaddhattā ca mānaganthā mānavinibaddhā.
Sanskrit māna + vinibandha

Example

mān'upetā ayaṃ pajā,
mānaganthā mānavinibaddhā,
diṭṭhīsu sārambhakathā,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattatī'ti.

UD56 tatiyanānātitthiyasuttaṃ
mānavinibandha

adj. bound by pride; held captive by conceit [māna + vinibandha] ✓

saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattatī'ti.

UD56 tatiyanānātitthiyasuttaṃ
mānasa 1

adj. of such mind; with such a heart [√man + as + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from manas
Meaning of such mind; with such a heart
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + as + *a
manas + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānasa
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

susaṃvut'atto visikh'antare caraṃ,
kulesu kāmesu asaṅgamānaso,
cando yathā dosinapuṇṇamāsiyā,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ubbiggā tasitā bhītā,
bhantā byāthitamānasā,
mahājanā samāgamma,
dīpaṅkaram'upāgamuṃ.

BV 2.170 sumedha patthanā kathā
mānasa 2

nt. mind; heart; mentality; intention; lit. belonging to mind [√man + as + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from manas
Meaning mind; heart; mentality; intention; lit. belonging to mind
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + as + *a
manas + *a
Derivative taddhita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym citta
Sanskrit mānasa
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

mātā yathā niyaṃ puttaṃ,
āyusā ekaputtam'anurakkhe,
evam'pi sabbabhūtesu,
mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

nibbānapoṇañ'ca me mānasaṃ bhavissati, saṃyojanā ca me pahānaṃ gacchissanti, paramena ca sāmaññena samannāgato bhavissāmī'ti.

AN 6.102 anavatthitasuttaṃ
mānasa 3

nt. notion, thought [√man] ✗
mānasaññojana

Meaning bond of conceit; fetter of pride

mānasatta

Grammar nt, abstr, from mānasa
Meaning fact of having such mind; fact of having a certain mental state
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + as + *a + tta
mānasa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānasatva
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)
mānasamugghāta

masc. killing conceit; eradication of comparing oneself [māna + samugghāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning killing conceit; eradication of comparing oneself
Construction māna + samugghāta
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mānassa + samugghāta)
Commentary (ANa) asmī'ti mānasamugghāto'ti arahattamaggo. arahattamaggaphalavasena hi nibbāne diṭṭhe puna asmimāno n'atthī'ti arahattamaggo, asmī'ti mānasamugghāto'ti vutto.
Sanskrit māna + samudghāta

Example

nissaraṇañ'h'etaṃ, āvuso, vicikicchākathaṃkathāsallassa yadidaṃ asmī'ti mānasamugghāto'ti. imā kho, bhikkhave, cha nissāraṇīyā dhātuyo'ti.

AN 6.13 nissāraṇīyasuttaṃ
mānasambhūta

adj. produced by conceit; comes into being through egotism; proceeding from comparing [māna + sambhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning produced by conceit; comes into being through egotism; proceeding from comparing
Construction māna + sambhūta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mānena + sambhūta)
Sanskrit māna + sambhūta

Example

mānasambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo mānaṃ nissāya māno pahātabbo. methunasambhūto ayaṃ, bhagini, kāyo. methune ca setughāto vutto bhagavatā.

nt. Itivuttaka 6 (ITI 6) ✗

mānaṃ jappeti

idiom. works up conceit ✗
mānātimāna

masc. conceit and arrogance; comparison and self-importance [māna + atimāna] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning conceit and arrogance; comparison and self-importance
Construction māna + atimāna
Compound dvanda (māna ca atimāna ca)
Sanskrit māna + atimāna

Examples

kutopahūtā kalahā vivādā,
paridevasokā sahamaccharā ca,
mān'ātimānā sahapesuṇā ca,
kutopahūtā te tadiṅgha brūhi.

SNP 49 kalahavivādasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 11

yā uṇṇatī s'āssa vighātabhūmi,
mān'ātimānaṃ vadate pan'eso,
etam'pi disvā na vivādayetha,
na hi tena suddhiṃ kusalā vadanti.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8
mānātimānajātika

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having a very proud and arrogant nature
Construction māna + atimāna + jātika
mānānusaya

masc. underlying tendency towards conceit; inherent inclination towards comparison (in terms of I); lit. comparison sleeping alongside [māna + anusaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning underlying tendency towards conceit; inherent inclination towards comparison (in terms of I); lit. comparison sleeping alongside
Construction māna + anusaya
Compound catutthī tappurisa (mānassa + anusaya)
Sanskrit māna + anuśaya

Examples

kathaṃ jānato pan'āyasmato, kathaṃ passato imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṃkāramamaṃkāramān'ānusayā samūhatā'ti?

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

kāmarāg'ānusayassa ... paṭigh'ānusayassa ... diṭṭh'ānusayassa ... vicikicch'ānusayassa ... mān'ānusayassa ... bhavarāg'ānusayassa ... avijj'ānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.

AN 7.12 dutiānusayassayānusayasuttaṃ
mānānusayamujjahati

pr. gives up the underlying tendency towards conceit; abandons the inherent inclination towards comparison [mānānusayaṃ + ujjahati] ~

Grammar pr, comp vb
Meaning gives up the underlying tendency towards conceit; abandons the inherent inclination towards comparison
Construction mānānusayaṃ + ujjahati
Commentary (SNPa) mān'ānusayam'ujjahā'ti ... anukkamena mān'ānusayaṃ ujjaha pajaha pariccajāhī'ti attho.
mānābhisamaya

masc. complete comprehension of conceit; total understanding of comparison [māna + abhisamaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning complete comprehension of conceit; total understanding of comparison
Construction māna + abhisamaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mānassa + abhisamaya)
Commentary (SNa) mān'ābhisamayā'ti mānassa dassan'ābhisamayā, pahān'ābhisamayā ca. arahattamaggo hi kiccavasena mānaṃ sampassati, ayam'assa dassan'ābhisamayo. tena diṭṭho pana so tāva'd'eva pahīyati, diṭṭhavisena diṭṭhasattānaṃ jīvitaṃ viya. ayam'assa pahān'ābhisamayo.
Sanskrit māna + abhisamaya

Example

ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sabb'āsavasaṃvarasaṃvuto viharati, acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mān'ābhisamayā antam'akāsi dukkhassā'ti

mānicara

mānita

pp. esteemed; respected; highly regarded [√man + *e + ita] ✓

Grammar pp of māneti, caus
Meaning esteemed; respected; highly regarded

Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Antonym amānita
Synonym sakkata
Sanskrit mānita

Examples
