DN 16.27 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena bāhiyo dārucīriyo suppārake paṭivasati samuddatīre sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito lābhī cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānapaccaya-bhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
māniyati

pr. (+instr) is honoured; is revered; is held in high esteem [√man] ✗
māniyamāna

prp. (+instr) being honoured (by); being revered (by); being held in high esteem (by) [√man + *e + iya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of māniyati, caus, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being honoured (by); being revered (by); being held in high esteem (by)
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e + iya (think)
Base √man + *e + iya > māniya (caus, pass)
Construction māniya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Synonym garukariyamāna
Sanskrit mānyamāna
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

etha, tumhe bhikkhū sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme sakkarotha garuṃ karotha mānetha pūjetha, app'eva nāma tumhehi sakkariyamānānaṃ garukariyamānānaṃ māniyamānānaṃ pūjiyamānānaṃ siyā cittassa aññathattaṃ, yathā taṃ dūsī māro labhetha otāran'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
mānī 1

adj. imagining; thinking; conceiving [√man + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from maññati
Meaning imagining; thinking; conceiving
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant māna
Sanskrit mānin
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

anattani attamāniṃ,
passa lokaṃ sadevakaṃ,
niviṭṭhaṃ nāmarūpasmiṃ,
idaṃ saccan'ti maññati.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
mānī 2

adj. overestimating oneself to be; overrating oneself to be; lit. thinking; imagining [√man + *ī] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from maññati
Meaning overestimating oneself to be; overrating oneself to be; lit. thinking; imagining
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 ya (think)
Construction √man > mān + *ī
Derivative kita (*ī)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Variant māni
Sanskrit mānin
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

yo bālo maññati bālyaṃ,
paṇḍito v'āpi tena so,
bālo ca paṇḍitamānī,
sa ve bālo'ti vuccati.

DHP 63 bālavaggo

atisāradiṭṭhiyā'va so samatto,
mānena matto paripuṇṇamānī,
sayam'eva sāmaṃ manas'ābhisitto,
diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
mānī 3

adj. who is proud [√man] ✗
mānupeta

adj. possessed by pride; endowed with conceit; lit. approached comparing [māna + upeta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning possessed by pride; endowed with conceit; lit. approached comparing
Construction māna + upeta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mānena + upeta)
Commentary (UDa) mān'upetā ayaṃ pajā'ti ayaṃ sabbā'pi diṭṭhigatikasaṅkhātā pajā sattakāyo mayhaṃ diṭṭhi sundarā, mayhaṃ ādāno sundaro'ti attano gāhassa saṃpaggahalakkhaṇena mānena upetā samannāgatā.
Sanskrit māna + man + upeta

Example

mān'upetā ayaṃ pajā,
mānaganthā mānavinibaddhā,
diṭṭhīsu sārambhakathā,
saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattatī'ti.

UD56 tatiyanānātitthiyasuttaṃ
mānubyañjanaggāhī

adj. don’t be enticed by the details; don’t focus on the secondary characteristics [mā + anubyañjana + gāhī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning don’t be enticed by the details; don’t focus on the secondary characteristics
Construction mā + anubyañjana + gāhī
Antonym anubyañjanaggāhī
Variant nānubyañjanaggāhī, nānuvyañjanaggāhī
Sanskrit mā + anuvyañjana + gṛhāya

Example

tam'enaṃ tathāgato uttariṃ vineti, ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, indriyesu guttadvāro hohi, cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā mā nimittaggāhī hohi m'ānubyañjanaggāhī.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ
mānusa 1

adj. human [manu + *sa] ✓

Grammar adj, from manu
Meaning human
Construction manu > mānu + *sa
Derivative taddhita (*sa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym dibba, amānusa
Synonym manussaka, mānussaka
Sanskrit mānuṣa

Examples

tasmā hi bhūtā nisāmetha sabbe,
mettaṃ karotha mānusiyā pajāya,
divā ca ratto ca haranti ye baliṃ,
tasmā hi ne rakkhatha appamattā.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1

so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ, dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā'ti, tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ
mānusa 2

masc. human being; man [manu + *sa] ✓

Grammar masc, from manu
Meaning human being; man
Construction manu > mānu + *sa
Derivative taddhita (*sa)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym amānusa
Synonym manussa
Sanskrit mānuṣa

Examples

yo sahassaṃ sahassena,
saṅgāme mānuse jine,
ekañ'ca jeyya'm'attānaṃ,
sa ve saṅgāmaj'uttamo,
attā have jitaṃ seyyo,
yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.

DHP 103 sahassavaggo

khattiyo seṭṭho janetasmiṃ,
ye gottapaṭisārino,
vijjācaraṇasampanno,
so seṭṭho devamānuse'ti.

DN 27.16 aggaññasuttaṃ
mānusaka

adj. human; related to human [manu + *sa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from mānusa
Meaning human; related to human
Construction manu > mānu + *sa + ka
mānusa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Antonym dibba
Sanskrit mānuṣaka

Examples

khettāni viceyya kevalāni,
dibbaṃ mānusakañ'ca brahmakhettaṃ,
sabbakhettamūlabandhanā pamutto,
khettajino tādi pavuccate tathattā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ

hitvā mānusakaṃ yogaṃ,
dibbaṃ yogaṃ upaccagā,
sabbayogavisaṃyuttaṃ,
tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

DHP 417 brāhmaṇavaggo
mānusatta

nt. human state; human birth [manu + *sa + tta] ✓

Grammar nt, abstr, from manu
Meaning human state; human birth
Construction manu > mānu + *sa + tta
mānusa + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānuṣatva

Example

kim'idaṃ kusalaṃ kim'ācarema,
icc'eke hi samecca mantayanti,
te mayaṃ puna'r'eva laddha mānusattaṃ,
paṭipannā viharemu sīlavanto.

VV 53 chattamāṇavaka vimānavatthu

Grammar masc pl
Meaning name of a group of deities
Construction manu > mānu + *sa + ā
mānusa + ā
Phonetic Change a > ā
mānusika

adj. existing in the human world ✗
mānusikā

adj. human; related to human [manu + *sa + ikā] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of mānusaka
Meaning human; related to human
Construction manu > mānu + *sa + ikā
mānusa + ikā
Derivative taddhita (ikā)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mānuṣyaka

Examples

so sace ākaṅkhati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ, dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā'ti, tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.

AN 5.23 upakkilesasuttaṃ

yathā haritālena makkhitaṃ,
addasa cittikaṃ bhittiyā kataṃ,
tamhi te viparītadassanaṃ,
saññā mānusikā niratthikā.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
mānusiya

adj. of human state, of human world, belonging to the human world ✗

masc. female beauty ✗
mānusī

fem. woman; female [manu] ✗

Meaning name of a group of deities
Construction mānusa + uttama + ā
mānusuttama + ā
mānussaka

adj. human [manu + ssa + *ka] ~

Grammar adj, from manussa
Meaning human
Construction manu + ssa > mānussa + *ka
Derivative taddhita (*ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym manussaka, mānusa
mānussika

adj. human; in the world of men; lit. related to man [manu + ssa + *ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from manussa
Meaning human; in the world of men; lit. related to man
Construction manu > mānu + ssa + *ika
manussa + *ika
Derivative taddhita (*ika)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Commentary (KPa) tass'āyaṃ padavaṇṇanā, manussānaṃ ayan'ti mānussī, mānussī eva mānussikā. sampajjanaṃ sampatti.
Sanskrit mānuṣyaka

Example

mānussikā ca sampatti,
devaloke ca yā rati,
yā ca nibbānasampatti,
sabbam'etena labbhati.

KHP8 nidhikaṇḍasuttaṃ
mānussivaṇṇa

masc. female beauty ✗
mānetabba

ptp. should be honoured; should be revered; should be held in high esteem; lit. to be caused to think highly [√man + *e + tabba] ~

Grammar ptp of māneti, caus
Meaning should be honoured; should be revered; should be held in high esteem; lit. to be caused to think highly
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + tabba
Derivative kicca (tabba)
Synonym namassitabba
Sanskrit mānayitavya
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)
māneti

pr. (+acc) honour; reveres; hold in high esteem [√man + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of maññati, trans (+acc)
Meaning honour; reveres; hold in high esteem
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + ti
Synonym mānayati
Commentary (MNa) māneyyun'ti piyāyeyyuṃ.
Sanskrit mānayati
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Examples

ṭhānaṃ kho pan'etaṃ, āvuso, vijjati yaṃ idh'ekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata mam'eva bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyuṃ, na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ bhikkhū sakkareyyuṃ garuṃ kareyyuṃ māneyyuṃ pūjeyyun'ti.

MN 5 anaṅgaṇasuttaṃ

tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṃ sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa na hoti ānando na somanassaṃ na cetaso uppilāvitattaṃ.

MN 22 alagaddūpamasuttaṃ
mānetvā

abs. having honoured, having revered, having thought highly [√man] ✗
mānenta

prp. (+acc) honouring; revering; holding in high esteem [√man + *e + nta] ✓

Grammar prp of māneti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning honouring; revering; holding in high esteem
Root Family √man
Root √man･3 *e (think)
Base √man + *e > māne (caus)
Construction māne + nta
Derivative kita (nta)
Synonym garukaronta, namassanta
Commentary (MNa) mānento'ti manena piyaṃ karonto
Sanskrit mānayat
Sanskrit Root √man 3, 4, 8 (think)

Example

yo ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammaṃ'y'eva sakkaronto, dhammaṃ garuṃ karonto, dhammaṃ mānento, dhammaṃ pūjento, dhammaṃ apacāyamāno suvaco hoti, sovacassataṃ āpajjati, tam'ahaṃ suvaco'ti vadāmi.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
mānesi

aor. honoured, revered, thought highly [√man] ✗
māpaka

masc. Creator, constructor [√mā] ✗
māpana

nt. building; constructing [√mā] ✗
māpamādattha

sandhi. you mustn't be careless, don't be negligent ✗
māpika

pp. built, constructed, created [√mā] ✗
māpita

pp. built; constructed; lit. caused to measure [√mā + *āpe + ita] ~

Grammar pp of māpeti, caus
Meaning built; constructed; lit. caused to measure
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 *āpe (measure)
Base √mā + āpe > māpe (caus)
Construction māpe + ita
Derivative kita (ita)
Synonym kārāpita, kārita
Sanskrit māpayita
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)
māpitatta

nt. fact of being built; fact of being constructed [√mā + *āpe + ita + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, from māpita, caus
Meaning fact of being built; fact of being constructed
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 *āpe (measure)
Base √mā + āpe > māpe (caus)
Construction māpe + ita + tta
māpita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Sanskrit māpayita
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)
māpiyamāna

Grammar prp of māpiyati, caus, pass, intrans
Meaning is being built; is being constructed

Root √mā･5 *āpe + iya (measure)

Construction māpiya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Sanskrit māpyamāna
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)
māpeti 1

pr. (+acc) makes; builds; constructs [√mā + *āpe + ti] ✓

Meaning makes; builds; constructs

Root √mā･5 *āpe (measure)

Construction māpe + ti
Synonym karoti
Sanskrit māpayati
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

dīghato tiṃsayojanaṃ vitthārato pannarasayojanaṃ assamapadaṃ māpehī'ti āha

JAa 70 kuddāla jātakavaṇṇanā

alaṃ, bhaṇe jīvaka, tuyham'eva hotu. amhākaññ'eva antepure nivesanaṃ māpehī'ti.

VIN 4.8.203 seṭṭhibhariyā vatthu
māpeti 2

pr. causes to appear by supernatural power [√mā] ✗

so kho ahaṃ, mārisa moggallāna, taṃ saṅgāmaṃ abhivijinitvā vijitasaṅgāmo tato paṭinivattitvā vejayantaṃ nāma pāsādaṃ māpesiṃ. vejayantassa kho, mārisa moggallāna, pāsādassa ekasataṃ niyyūhaṃ.

MN 37 cūḷataṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ

ten'āha, caṅkamaṃ tattha māpesiṃ, pañcadosavivajjitan'ti.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
mābhinandi

sandhi. (+acc) do not delight (in); do not be pleased (with) [mā + abhinandi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + aor, neg (+acc)
Meaning do not delight (in); do not be pleased (with)
Construction mā + abhinandi
Sanskrit mā + abhinand

Example

so'pi pathaviṃ pathavito abhijānāti, pathaviṃ pathavito abhiññāya pathaviṃ mā maññi, pathaviyā mā maññi, pathavito mā maññi, pathaviṃ me'ti mā maññi, pathaviṃ m'ābhinandi. taṃ kissa hetu? pariññeyyaṃ tassā'ti vadāmi.

MN 1 mūlapariyāyasuttaṃ
māmaka

masc. follower; devotee; lit. one of mine [mama + *ka] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from mama
Meaning follower; devotee; lit. one of mine
Construction mama > māma + *ka
Derivative taddhita (*ka)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym upaṭṭhāka
Commentary (ANa) māmakā'ti te mayhaṃ bhikkhū mama santakā na honti. te mayhan'ti idaṃ pana satthāraṃ uddissa pabbajitattā vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit māmaka

Examples

maraṇena'pi taṃ pahīyati,
yaṃ puriso mam'idan'ti maññati,
etam'pi viditvā paṇḍito,
na mamattāya nametha māmako.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

āthabbaṇaṃ supinaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ,
no vidahe atho'pi nakkhattaṃ,
virutañ'ca gabbhakaraṇaṃ,
tikicchaṃ māmako na seveyya.

VIN PAT SA 11 bhedānuvattakasikkhāpadaṃ
māyasmā

sandhi. (+aor) venerable, don’t! [mā + āyasmā] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc (+aor)
Meaning venerable, don’t!
Construction mā + āyasmā
Sanskrit mā + āyuṣmān

Examples

so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āyasmā samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi

VIN PAT SA 10 saṅghabhedasikkhāpadaṃ

tam'enaṃ bhikkhū evam'āhaṃsu, m'āyasmā ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamī'ti. so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno evam'āha, ime hi nāma therā bhikkhū kulāni upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññissanti, kim'aṅgaṃ pan'āhan'ti?

SN 20.9 nāgasuttaṃ
māyaṃ 1

sandhi. don’t let this; may he not [mā + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg
Meaning don’t let this; may he not
Construction mā + ayaṃ
Sanskrit mā + ayam

Examples

m'āyaṃ puriso idh'eva anayabyasanaṃ āpajjī'ti!

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ

m'āyaṃ āyasmā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjī'ti! evaṃ tasmiṃ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.

AN 5.162 dutiyaāghātapaṭivinayasuttaṃ
māyaṃ 2

sandhi. this me; this person to me [me + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning this me; this person to me
Construction me + ayaṃ
Sanskrit ma, mām + ayam

Example

tassa na evaṃ hoti, sādhu vata m'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā paṇītena piṇḍapātena pariviseyyāti! aho vata m'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā āyatim'pi evarūpena paṇītena piṇḍapātena pariviseyyā'ti, evam'pi'ssa na hoti.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
māyaṃ vidaṃseti

idiom. demonstrates illusion, displays conjurer's trick; lit. causes to see magic ✗
māyā 1

fem. fraud; deceit; hypocrisy; lit. illusion ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning fraud; deceit; hypocrisy; lit. illusion
Commentary (MNa) katapāpapaṭicchādanalakkhaṇā māyā, tassa nigūhanarasā, tadāvaraṇapaccupaṭṭhānā. (NIDD1) māyā vuccati vañcanikā cariyā.
Sanskrit māyā

Examples

dhonassa hi n'atthi kuhiñci loke,
pakappitā diṭṭhi bhav'ābhavesu,
māyañ'ca mānañ'ca pahāya dhono,
sa kena gaccheyya anūpayo so.

SNP 41 duṭṭhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 3

yamhī na māyā vasatī na māno,
yo vītalobho amamo nirāso,
panuṇṇakodho abhinibbutatto,
so brāhmaṇo so samaṇo sa bhikkhū'ti.

UD 26 pilindavacchasuttaṃ
māyā 2

fem. magic; illusion; conjurer’s trick ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning magic; illusion; conjurer’s trick
Sanskrit māyā

Examples

pheṇapiṇḍ'ūpamaṃ rūpaṃ,
vedanā bubbuḷ'ūpamā,
marīcik'ūpamā saññā,
saṅkhārā kadal'ūpamā,
māyā-upamañ'ca viññāṇaṃ,
desit'ādiccabandhunā.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ

māyaṃ viya aggato kataṃ,
supinante'va suvaṇṇapādapaṃ,
upagacchasi andha rittakaṃ,
janamajjhe'r'iva rupparūpakaṃ.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
māyā 3

fem. sorcery; spell ~

Grammar fem
Meaning sorcery; spell
māyā 4

fem. name of the Buddha's mother [māyā] ✗
māyākata

nt. made of magic; created by illusion; imaginary [māyā + kata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning made of magic; created by illusion; imaginary
Construction māyā + kata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (māyāya + kāra)
Commentary (MNa) māyākatam'etan'ti yathā māyāya udakaṃ maṇī'ti katvā dassitaṃ, badaripaṇṇaṃ kahāpaṇo'ti katvā dassitaṃ, aññaṃ vā pana evarūpaṃ dassan'ūpacāre ṭhitass'eva tathā paññāyati, upacār'ātikkamato paṭṭhāya pākatikam'eva paññāyati.
Sanskrit māyā + kṛta

Example

aniccā, bhikkhave, kāmā tucchā musā mosadhammā. māyākatam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bālalāpanaṃ.

Sanskrit māyākāra

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, māyākāro vā māyākār'antevāsī vā cātummahāpathe māyaṃ vidaṃseyya.

nt. being obsessed by deceitfulness; being consumed by dishonesty [māyā + pariyuṭṭhāna] ✓

Sanskrit māyā + paryavasthāna

Example

māyāvī kho pana ayam'āyasmā, māyāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharati. māyāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānam'etaṃ.

Meaning by means of trickery

māyāvinaya

masc. removal of hypocrisy; dispelling deceit [māyā + vinaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning removal of hypocrisy; dispelling deceit
Construction māyā + vinaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (māyāya + vinaya)
Sanskrit māyā + vinaya

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu māyāvī hoti, māyāvinayassa na vaṇṇavādī. yam'pi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu māyāvī hoti māyāvinayassa na vaṇṇavādī, ayam'pi dhammo na piyatāya na garutāya na bhāvanāya na sāmaññāya na ekībhāvāya saṃvattati.

AN 10.87 nappiyasuttaṃ
māyāvī 1

adj. deceitful; hypocritical; fraudulent [māyā + vī] ✓

Grammar adj, from māyā
Meaning deceitful; hypocritical; fraudulent
Construction māyā + vī
Derivative taddhita (vī)
Antonym amāyāvī
Synonym kuha, kuhaka, ketabī
Commentary (MNa) saṭhā māyāvino'ti māyāsāṭheyyehi yuttā
Sanskrit māyāvin

Example

kodhano upanāhī ca,
pāpamakkhī ca yo naro,
vipannadiṭṭhi māyāvī,
taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.

SNP 7 vasalasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 7
māyāvī 2

masc. deceitful person; hypocrite; fraud [māyā + vī] ✓

Grammar masc, from māyā
Meaning deceitful person; hypocrite; fraud
Construction māyā + vī
Derivative taddhita (vī)
Antonym amāyāvī
Commentary (MNa) saṭhā māyāvino'ti māyāsāṭheyyehi yuttā
Sanskrit māyāvin

Example

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadaṃ paṭipanno hoti? yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno ... māyāvissa māyā appahīnā hoti, pāpicchassa pāpikā icchā appahīnā hoti, micchādiṭṭhikassa micchādiṭṭhi appahīnā hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
māyāvī 3

masc. magician; illusionist; conjurer [māyā + vī] ✓

Grammar masc, from māyā
Meaning magician; illusionist; conjurer
Construction māyā + vī
Derivative taddhita (vī)
Synonym māyākāra
Commentary (ANa) māyāvī'ti māyākāro.
Sanskrit māyāvī

Example

sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, māyāvī samaṇo gotamo āvaṭṭaniṃ māyaṃ jānāti yāya aññatitthiyānaṃ sāvake āvaṭṭetī'ti.

AN 4.193 bhaddiyasuttaṃ
māyāsadisa

adj. like an illusion; like a magic trick ✗
māyāsahadhammarūpa

adj. having the appearance of magic; same as a trick [māyā + sahadhammarūpa] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having the appearance of magic; same as a trick
Construction māyā + sahadhammarūpa
Commentary (ANa) māyāsahadhammarūpaṃ viya khāyatī'ti māyāya samānakāraṇajātikaṃ viya hutvā upaṭṭhāti. māyākāro'pi hi udakaṃ gahetvā telaṃ karoti, telaṃ gahetvā udakan'ti evaṃ anekarūpaṃ māyaṃ dasseti. idam'pi pāṭihāriyaṃ tathārūpam'evā'ti.
māyūpama

adj. like an illusion; similar to a magic trick [māyā + upama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning like an illusion; similar to a magic trick
Construction māyā + upama
māyoga

adj. governed by mā; syntactically related to mā [mā + yoga] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning governed by mā; syntactically related to mā
Construction mā + yoga
Compound kammadhāraya (mā + yoga)
Sanskrit mā + yoga

Examples

420, 471. māyoge sabbakāle ca.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 420

hiyyattanīajjatanī'icc'etā vibhattiyo yadā māyogā, tadā sabbakāle ca honti. mā gamā, mā vacā, mā gamī, mā vacī.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 420
māra

masc. death; Death; death personified [√mar + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, from mārati
Meaning death; Death; death personified
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 a (die)
Construction √mar > mār + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym maccu
Notes five māra 1. kilesamāra, 2. khandhamāra, 3. abhisaṅkhāramāra, 4. devaputtamāra, 5. maccumāra
Sanskrit māra
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

etadaññāya ye satā,
diṭṭhadhamm'ābhinibbutā,
na te māravas'ānugo,
na te mārassa paddhagū'ti.

SNP 65 kappa māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 10

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, tumhe'pi māro pāpimā satataṃ samitaṃ paccupaṭṭhito, app'eva nām'āhaṃ imesaṃ cakkhuto vā otāraṃ labheyyaṃ

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
māra pāpimant

idiom. Māra the wicked; evil death ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + adj
Meaning Māra the wicked; evil death
Sanskrit māra + pāpman

Example

yato tumhe, bhikkhave, indriyesu guttadvārā viharissatha, atha tumhehi'pi māro pāpimā nibbijja pakkamissati, otāraṃ alabhamāno, kummamhā'va siṅgālo'ti.

SN 35.240 kummopamasuttaṃ
māraka

adj. bringing death, who kills [√mar] ✗
mārakāyika

adj. belonging to the group of Mara deities ✗
māracakkhu

nt. Māra's eye; Māra's vision; death's sight [māra + cakkhu] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning Māra's eye; Māra's vision; death's sight
Construction māra + cakkhu
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mārassa + cakkhu)
Commentary (MNa) apadaṃ vadhitvā māracakkhun'ti ten'eva pariyāyena yathā mārassa cakkhu apadaṃ hoti nippadaṃ, appatiṭṭhaṃ, nirārammaṇaṃ, evaṃ vadhitvā'ti attho.
Sanskrit māra + cakṣu

Example

idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicc'eva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ vivekajaṃ pītisukhaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu andham'akāsi māraṃ, apadaṃ vadhitvā māracakkhuṃ adassanaṃ gato pāpimato.

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
mārañjaha

adj. who has left Death behind; (comm) who has abandoned the defilements [māraṃ + jaha] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has left Death behind; (comm) who has abandoned the defilements
Construction māraṃ + jaha
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (māraṃ + jaha)
Variant mārajaha, mānajaha, mānaṃ jaha
Commentary (ITIa) kilesamār'ādīnaṃ samma'd'eva pariccattattā mārañjahaṃ.
Sanskrit māram + jaha

Example

tamonudaṃ pāragataṃ mahesiṃ,
taṃ pattipattaṃ vasimaṃ anāsavaṃ,
visan'taraṃ taṇhakkhaye vimuttaṃ,
taṃ ve muniṃ antimadehadhāriṃ,
mārañ'jahaṃ brūmi jarāya pāraguṃ.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
mārāmisa

nt. Mara's bait; lit. Mara's meat ✗

Root √mar･1 *e (die)

puññaṃ vā pana attano,
sa ve vissāsam'ācikkhi,
satthā arahati mānanan'ti.

AN 3.101 loṇakapallasuttaṃ
mārī

māruta

masc. wind ✗
māretar

masc. killer [√mar] ✗
māreti

pr. (+acc) kills; murders; lit. causes to die [√mar + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of marati, trans (+acc)
Meaning kills; murders; lit. causes to die
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 *e (die)
Base √mar + *e > māre (caus)
Construction māre + ti
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mārayati
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

seṭṭhi, sace me dhītā vijāyissati, tāya naṃ saddhiṃ nivesetvā seṭṭhiṭṭhānassa sāmikaṃ karissāmi. sace me putto vijāyissati, māressāmi nan'ti cintetvā taṃ gehe kāresi.

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu

tiṇalat'ādigahanacchanne caṅkame caṅkamanto andhakāravelāyaṃ uragādike pāṇe akkamitvā vā māreti, tehi vā daṭṭho dukkhaṃ āpajjatī'ti gahanacchannatā tatiyo doso.

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā
māretuṃ

inf. (+acc) to kill; to murder; lit. to cause to die [√mar + *e + tuṃ] ✓

Grammar inf of māreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning to kill; to murder; lit. to cause to die
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 *e (die)
Base √mar + *e > māre (caus)
Construction māre + tuṃ
Phonetic Change a > ā
Synonym ghātetuṃ
Sanskrit mṛ
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

daharakālato paṭṭhāya hi naṃ mārāpento'va seṭṭhi māretuṃ n'āsakkhi, kiṃ akkharasamayaṃ sikkhāpessati?

DHPa 1.2.1 sāmāvatīvatthu
māretvā

abs. (+acc) having had killed; having murdered; lit. having caused to die [√mar + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of māreti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having had killed; having murdered; lit. having caused to die
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 *e (die)
Base √mar + *e > māre (caus)
Construction māre + tvā
Phonetic Change a > ā
Sanskrit mṛ
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

kosalarājā mahantena balen'āgantvā bārāṇasiṃ gahetvā taṃ rājānaṃ māretvā tassa aggamahesiṃ attano aggamahesiṃ akāsi

UDa 2.8 suppavāsā suttavaṇṇanā
mārenta

prp. killing [√mar] ✗
māresi

aor. killed, caused to be killed [√mar] ✗
māla

masc. circular enclosure, round yard ✗
mālaka

masc. circular enclosure, round yard ✗
mālakāra

masc. florist; garland maker; wreath maker [mālā + kāra] ~

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning florist; garland maker; wreath maker
Construction mālā + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mālā + kāra)
Synonym mālākāra
Sanskrit mālākāra
mālatī

fem. great-flowered jasmine ✗
mālavaṇṇaka

nt. garlands and beauty products; (comm) garlands, perfumes and cosmetics [māla + vaṇṇaka] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning garlands and beauty products; (comm) garlands, perfumes and cosmetics
Construction māla + vaṇṇaka
Compound dvanda (māla ca vaṇṇaka ca)
Commentary (THIa) mālavaṇṇakan'ti mālañ'c'eva gandhavilepanañ'ca.
Sanskrit mālā + varṇaka

Example

kāsikasukhumāni dhāraya,
abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇakaṃ,
kañcanamaṇimuttakaṃ bahuṃ,
vividhaṃ ābharaṇaṃ karomi te.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
mālavant

adj. with a garland, having a wreath [mālā] ✗
mālā 1

fem. garland; wreath ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning garland; wreath
Synonym āveḷā
Commentary (MNa) mālā'ti yaṃkiñci pupphaṃ.
Sanskrit mālā

Examples

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

AN 4.85 tamotamasuttaṃ
mālā 2

fem. (gram) inflection paradigm; lit. garland ~

Grammar fem
Meaning (gram) inflection paradigm; lit. garland
Sanskrit mālā
mālākathā

fem. talk about garlands; discussion about flower wreaths [mālā + kathā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning talk about garlands; discussion about flower wreaths
Construction mālā + kathā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mālānaṃ + kathā)
Sanskrit mālā + kathā

Example

seyyath'idaṃ, rājakathaṃ corakathaṃ mahāmattakathaṃ senākathaṃ bhayakathaṃ yuddhakathaṃ annakathaṃ pānakathaṃ vatthakathaṃ sayanakathaṃ mālākathaṃ gandhakathaṃ ñātikathaṃ yānakathaṃ

DN 9.1 poṭṭhapādasuttaṃ, poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
mālākamma

nt. (of interior decoration) floral pattern; lit. wreath work [mālā + kamma] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning (of interior decoration) floral pattern; lit. wreath work
Construction mālā + kamma
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mālāyo + kamma)
Sanskrit mālā + karman

Example

ālokasandhiparikammāyā'ti vātapānaparikammāya setavaṇṇaṃ kāḷavaṇṇaṃ gerukaparikammaṃ mālākammaṃ latākammaṃ makaradantakaṃ pañcapaṭikaṃ.

VIN 2.5.2.9 mahallakavihārasikkhāpadaṃ
mālākāra

masc. florist; garland maker; wreath maker [mālā + kāra] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp
Meaning florist; garland maker; wreath maker
Construction mālā + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mālā + kāra)
Synonym mālakāra
Sanskrit mālākāra

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nānāpupphānaṃ mahāpuppharāsi, tam'enaṃ dakkho mālākāro vā mālākār'antevāsī vā vicittaṃ mālaṃ gantheyya.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ

so araññato āgacchante mālākāre disvā thokaṃ thokaṃ phāṇitakhaṇḍaṃ datvā uḷuṅkena pānīyaṃ adāsi, te c'assa ek'ekaṃ pupphamuṭṭhiṃ adaṃsu.

JAa 4 cūḷaseṭṭhi jātakavaṇṇanā
mālākārantevāsī

masc. florist's assistant; garland maker's apprentice [mālākāra + antevāsī] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning florist's assistant; garland maker's apprentice
Construction mālākāra + antevāsī
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mālākārassa + antevāsī)
Sanskrit mālākāra + antevāsin

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, nānāpupphānaṃ mahāpuppharāsi, tam'enaṃ dakkho mālākāro vā mālākār'antevāsī vā vicittaṃ mālaṃ gantheyya.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
mālākita

adj. wearing garland one has made [mālā + kita] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wearing garland one has made
Construction mālā + kita
Commentary (VINa) mālākite'ti katamāle mālādhare, kusumamālāpaṭimaṇḍite'ti attho.
mālāgaccha

masc. flowering plant ✗
mālāgandhavilepana

masc. garlands, perfumes and oils [mālā + gandha + vilepana] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning garlands, perfumes and oils
Construction mālā + gandha + vilepana
Compound dvanda (mālā ca gandha ca vilepana ca)
Commentary (SNa) mālāgandhavilepanan'ti vaṇṇagandh'atthāya mālaṃ, sugandhabhāv'atthāya gandhaṃ, vaṇṇagandh'atthāya vilepanañ'ca dhārentena.
Sanskrit mālā + gandha + vilepana

Examples

so ca hoti dubbaṇṇo duddasiko okoṭimako bavhābādho kāṇo vā kuṇī vā khañjo vā pakkhahato vā, na lābhī annassa pānassa vatthassa yānassa mālāgandhavilepanassa seyyāvasathapadīpeyyassa.

AN 4.85 tamotamasuttaṃ

dujjānaṃ kho etaṃ, mahārāja, tayā gihinā kāmabhoginā puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantena kāsikacandanaṃ paccanubhontena mālāgandhavilepanaṃ dhārayantena jātarūparajataṃ sādiyantena, ime vā arahanto, ime vā arahattamaggaṃ samāpannā'ti.

SN 3.11 sattajaṭilasuttaṃ
mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhāna

nt. using garlands, perfumes, oils, adornments and decorations [mālā + gandha + vilepana + dhāraṇa + maṇḍana + vibhūsana + ṭhāna] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning using garlands, perfumes, oils, adornments and decorations
Construction mālā + gandha + vilepana + dhāraṇa + maṇḍana + vibhūsana + ṭhāna
Compound kammadhāraya (mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsana + ṭhāna)
Commentary (DNa) mālā'ti yaṃ kiñci pupphaṃ. gandhan'ti yaṃ kiñci gandhajātaṃ. vilepanan'ti chavirāgakaraṇaṃ. tattha piḷandhanto dhāreti nāma, ūnaṭṭhānaṃ pūrento maṇḍeti nāma, gandhavasena chavirāgavasena ca sādiyanto vibhūseti nāma. ṭhānaṃ vuccati kāraṇaṃ. tasmā yāya dussīlyacetanāya tāni mālādhāraṇ'ādīni mahājano karoti, tato paṭivirato'ti attho.
Sanskrit mālā + gandha + vilepana + dhāraṇa + maṇḍana + vibhūṣaṇa + sthāna

Example

mālā-gandha-vilepana-dhāraṇa-maṇḍana-vibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo.

DN 1.2 brahmajālasuttaṃ
mālāguṇa

masc. garland, wreath of flowers ✗

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
mālāguḷaparikkhitta

adj. engaged to be married; betrothed; lit. encircled with a wreath of flowers [mālāguḷa + parikkhitta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning engaged to be married; betrothed; lit. encircled with a wreath of flowers
Construction mālāguḷa + parikkhitta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mālāguḷena + parikkhitta)
Variant mālāguṇaparikkhitta
Commentary (MNa) antamaso mālāguṇaparikkhittā'pī'ti yā sabb'antimena paricchedena, esā me bhariyā bhavissatī'ti saññāya tassā upari kenaci mālāguṇaṃ khipantena mālāguṇamattenā'pi parikkhittā hoti.
Sanskrit mālāguṇa + parikṣipta

Example

yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
mālācumbaṭaka

masc. chaplet of flowers ✗
mālādāma

masc. string of flowers ✗
mālādhara

adj. wearing a garland of flowers ✗
mālādhārī

adj. wearing a wreath ✗
mālānānālaṅkāra

masc. garlands and various adornments [mālā + nānālaṅkāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning garlands and various adornments

Sanskrit mālā + nānā + alaṃkāra

Example

so kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā hatthīnaṃ sahabyataṃ upapajjati. so tattha lābhī hoti annassa pānassa mālānān'ālaṅkārassa.

AN 10.177 jāṇussoṇisuttaṃ
mālāpuṭa

masc. container of flowers ✗
mālābhārī

adj. wearing a wreath ✗
mālāmissa

adj. plaited with garlands; lit. mixed with garlands [mālā + missa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning plaited with garlands; lit. mixed with garlands
Construction mālā + missa
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mālāya + missa)
Commentary (VINa) mālāmissā'ti vassikapupph'ādīhi missetvā tīhi kesavaṭṭīhi vinandhitvā katā, avinaddho'pi vā kevalaṃ pupphamissako kesakalāpo idha, veṇī'ti veditabbo.
Sanskrit mālā + miśra

Example

veṇī nāma suddhakesā vā, suttamissā vā, mālāmissā vā, hiraññamissā vā, suvaṇṇamissā vā, muttāmissā vā, maṇimissā vā.

VIN 1.2.2 kāyasaṃsaggasikkhāpadaṃ
mālāvaccha

masc. flowering tree; floral shrub [mālā + vaccha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning flowering tree; floral shrub
Construction mālā + vaccha
Compound kammadhāraya (mālā + vaccha)
Commentary (VINa) mālāvacchan'ti taruṇapuppharukkhaṃ, taruṇakā hi puppharukkhā'pi pupphagacchā'pi mālāvacchā tv'eva vuccanti
Sanskrit mālā + vṛkṣa

Example

pāpasamācāro'ti mālāvacchaṃ ropeti'pi ropāpeti'pi, siñcati'pi siñcāpeti'pi, ocināti'pi ocināpeti'pi, gantheti'pi ganthāpeti'pi.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
mālāvilepana

nt. (adorning oneself with) garlands and oils ✗
mālika

adj. wearing garlands; wreathed in flowers [mālā + ika] ✓

Grammar adj, from mālā
Meaning wearing garlands; wreathed in flowers
Construction mālā + ika
Derivative taddhita (ika)
Synonym mālī
Sanskrit mālika

Examples

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ

brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchā bhūmakā kāmaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā udak'orohakā aggiparicārakā. te mataṃ kālaṅ'kataṃ uyyāpenti nāma saññāpenti nāma saggaṃ nāma okkāmenti.

SN 42.6 asibandhakaputtasuttaṃ
mālinī

adj. wearing garlands; wreathed in flowers [mālā + ī + inī] ✓

Grammar adj, fem nom sg of mālī
Meaning wearing garlands; wreathed in flowers
Construction mālā + ī + inī
mālī + inī
Sanskrit mālin

Example

alaṅ'katā suvasanā,
mālinī candan'ussadā,
majjhe mahāpathe nārī,
turiye naccati naṭṭakī.

majjhe mahāpathe nārī,

masc. personal name of an arahant monk ✗

fem. name of a laywomen ✗
māluṅkyaputta

masc. name of a monk ✗
māluta

masc. wind; breeze ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning wind; breeze
Commentary (THIa) mālut'eritā'ti vātena sañcalitā
Sanskrit maruta

Examples

upasanto uparato,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato,
dhunāti pāpake dhamme,
dumapattaṃ'va māluto'ti.

TH 2 mahākoṭṭhikattheragāthā

kusumitasikharā ca pādapā,
abhigajjant'iva mālut'eritā,
kā tuyhaṃ rati bhavissati,
yadi ekā vanam'ogahissasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
mālutajātaka

nt. Jātaka 17 (JA 17) ✗

kusumitasikharā ca pādapā,
abhigajjant'iva mālut'eritā,
kā tuyhaṃ rati bhavissati,
yadi ekā vanam'ogahissasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
māluvapatta

nt. leaf of the parasitic creeper [māluvā + patta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning leaf of the parasitic creeper
Construction māluvā + patta
māluvā

fem. name of a parasitic creeper; Camel’s Foot Creeper; Bauhinia vahlii ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning name of a parasitic creeper; Camel’s Foot Creeper; Bauhinia vahlii
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phanera_vahlii
Sanskrit mālu

Examples

yassa accantadussīlyaṃ,
māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ,
yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

DHP 162 attavaggo

manujassa pamattacārino,
taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya,
so plavatī hurā huraṃ,
phalam'icchaṃ'va vanasmi vānaro.

DHP 334 taṇhāvaggo
māluvābīja

nt. seed of a parasitic creeper [māluvā + bīja] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning seed of a parasitic creeper
Construction māluvā + bīja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (māluvāya + bīja)
Sanskrit mālu + bīja

Example

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
māluvābījahetu

ind. because of the seed of a parasitic creeper [māluvābīja + hetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of the seed of a parasitic creeper
Construction māluvābīja + hetu
Compound abyayībhāva (māluvābīja + hetu)
Sanskrit mālu + bīja + hetu

Example

yañ'c'āhaṃ māluvābījahetu dukkhā tibbā kharā kaṭukā vedanā vedayāmī'ti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
māluvālatā

fem. parasitic creeper; strangling creeper [māluvā + latā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning parasitic creeper; strangling creeper
Construction māluvā + latā
Compound kammadhāraya (māluvā + latā)
Sanskrit mālulatā

Examples

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, sālo vā dhavo vā phandano vā tīhi māluvālatāhi uddhasto pariyonaddho anayaṃ āpajjati, byasanaṃ āpajjati, anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ

s'āssa māluvālatā taruṇā mudukā lomasā vilambinī, sā taṃ sālaṃ upaniseveyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
māluvāsipāṭikā

fem. seed pod of a parasitic creeper [māluvā + sipāṭikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning seed pod of a parasitic creeper
Construction māluvā + sipāṭikā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (māluvāya + sipāṭikā)
Commentary (MNa) māluvāsipāṭikā'ti dīghasaṇṭhānaṃ māluvāpakkaṃ
Sanskrit mālu + sṛpāṭikā (beak)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse māluvāsipāṭikā phaleyya. atha kho taṃ, bhikkhave, māluvābījaṃ aññatarasmiṃ sālamūle nipateyya. atha kho, bhikkhave, yā tasmiṃ sāle adhivatthā devatā sā bhītā saṃviggā santāsaṃ āpajjeyya.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
mālūra

masc. marmelos tree ✗
mālya

nt. garland ✗
māvuso

sandhi. don’t friend!; do not brother! [mā + āvuso] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + masc
Meaning don’t friend!; do not brother!
Construction mā + āvuso
Sanskrit mā + āyusmanto

Example

so samaṇ'uddeso bhikkhūhi evam'assa vacanīyo, m'āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa evaṃ avaca, mā bhagavantaṃ abbhācikkhi, na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṃ, na hi bhagavā evaṃ vadeyya

VIN PAT PC 70 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ
māsa 1.1

masc. month [√mā + sa] ✓

Grammar masc, from miṇāti
Meaning month
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā + sa
Derivative kita (sa)
Notes or from mā "moon"
Sanskrit māsa
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Examples

māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

DHP 70 bālavaggo

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ṭhite majjh'anhike kāle marīcikā phandati.

SN 22.95 pheṇapiṇḍūpamasuttaṃ
māsa 1.2

nt. month [√mā + sa] ✓

Grammar nt, from miṇāti
Meaning month
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā + sa
Derivative kita (sa)
Notes more commonly masculine
Sanskrit māsa
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Example

yo hi koci, bhikkhave, ime cattāro satipaṭṭhāne evaṃ bhāveyya satta māsāni, tassa dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā.

MN 10 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
māsa 2.1

masc. bean ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning bean
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phaseolus_vulgaris
Sanskrit māṣa

Example

tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso muñcitvā paccavekkheyya ime sālī ime vīhī ime muggā ime māsā ime tilā ime taṇḍulā'ti

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
māsaka 1

masc. coin of low value; lit. small bean [māsa + ka] ~

Grammar masc, dimin of māsa
Meaning coin of low value; lit. small bean
Construction māsa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Commentary (VINa) tadā rājagahe vīsatimāsako kahāpaṇo hoti, tasmā pañcamāsako pādo.
Sanskrit māṣaka
māsaka 2

adj. with a value of one māsaka; lit. small bean [māsa + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, dimin of māsa
Meaning with a value of one māsaka; lit. small bean
Construction māsa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Sanskrit māṣaka

Example

coro nāma yo pañcamāsakaṃ vā atirekapañcamāsakaṃ vā agghanakaṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyati. eso coro nāma.

VIN 1.1.2 dutiyapārājikaṃ
māsaḍḍha

masc. half a month; fortnight ✗

Meaning months and fortnights
Construction māsa + aḍḍhamāsa + ā
māsaḍḍhamāsa + ā
māsaddhamāsa

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning month and fortnight; lit. month half month
Construction māsa + addhamāsa
māsaparamatā

fem. maximum of one month; one month at the most [māsa + paramatā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning maximum of one month; one month at the most
Construction māsa + paramatā
Compound kammadhāraya (māsa + paramatā)
Sanskrit māsa + paramatā

Example

māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabban'ti māsaparamatā nikkhipitabbaṃ.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
māsaparamaṃ

ind. for a month at the most; for a maximum of one month [māsa + parama + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of māsaparama
Meaning for a month at the most; for a maximum of one month
Construction māsa + parama + aṃ
māsaparama + aṃ
Commentary (VIN 1.4.1.3) māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabban'ti māsaparamatā nikkhipitabbaṃ.
Sanskrit māsa + paramam

Example

no c'assa pāripūri, māsaparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā taṃ cīvaraṃ nikkhipitabbaṃ ūnassa pāripūriyā satiyā paccāsāya. tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya satiyā'pi paccāsāya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 3 akālacīvarasikkhāpadaṃ
māsamuṭṭhi

fem. handful of beans [māsamuṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning handful of beans
Construction māsamuṭṭhi
māsasata

nt. one hundred months [māsa + sata] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning one hundred months
Construction māsa + sata
Compound digu (māsā + satāni)
Sanskrit māsa + śata

Example

dvādasa kho pana, bhikkhave, māsasatāni jīvanto catuvīsati'y'eva addhamāsasatāni jīvati, aṭṭhaddhamāsasatāni hemantānaṃ, aṭṭhaddhamāsasatāni gimhānaṃ, aṭṭhaddhamāsasatāni vassānaṃ.

AN 7.74 arakasuttaṃ
māsasūpa

masc. bean dahl; bean curry [māsa + sūpa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning bean dahl; bean curry
Construction māsa + sūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (māsa + sūpa)
Commentary (VINa) muggasūpo māsasūpo'ti ettha kulatth'ādīhi katasūpā'pi saṅgahaṃ gacchanti'y'evā'ti mahāpaccariyaṃ vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit māṣa + sūpa

Example

sūpo nāma dve sūpā, muggasūpo, māsasūpo. hatthahāriyo samasūpako piṇḍapāto paṭiggahetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaññ'eva bahuṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo
māsācita 1

nt. heap of beans [māsa + ācita] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning heap of beans
Construction māsa + ācita
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (māsānaṃ + ācita)
Synonym muggarāsi
Commentary (MNa) mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti māsabhattaṃ bhuttassa kucchi viya māsapūritapasibbako viya tintamāso viya cā'ti attho. (ANa) mās'ācitakaṃ maññe'ti ettha pana mās'ācitaṃ nāma tintamāso. yathā tintamāso garuko hoti, evaṃ garuko'ti adhippāyo.
Notes see māsācita 2
Sanskrit māsa + ācita

Examples

ahaṃ kho gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya caranto alatthaṃ lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pāripūriṃ. tassa me kāyo garuko akammañño mās'ācitaṃ maññe. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
māsācita 2

adj. pregnant; lit. accumulated over months [māsa + ācita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning pregnant; lit. accumulated over months
Construction māsa + ācita
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (māsena + ācita)
Synonym gabbhī, gabbhinī
Notes see māsācita 1
Sanskrit māsa + ācita

Examples

ahaṃ kho gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya caranto alatthaṃ lūkhassa vā paṇītassa vā bhojanassa yāva'd'atthaṃ pāripūriṃ. tassa me kāyo garuko akammañño mās'ācitaṃ maññe. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.

AN 8.80 kusītārambhavatthusuttaṃ

tena kho pana samayena māro pāpimā āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa kucchigato hoti koṭṭham'anupaviṭṭho. atha kho āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa etadahosi, kiṃ nu kho me kucchi garugaro viya mās'ācitaṃ maññe'ti.

MN 50 māratajjanīyasuttaṃ
māsātikkanta

adj. (kept) more than a month; lit. exceeding a month [māsa + atikkanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (kept) more than a month; lit. exceeding a month
Construction māsa + atikkanta
Commentary (VINt) mās'ātikkantan'ti akālacīvare uppanne ūnassa pāripūriyā saṅghagaṇ'ādito satiyā paccāsāya māsam'ekaṃ parihāro labbhati, taṃ māsaṃ atikkantaṃ.
māsānatikkanta

adj. not (kept) more than a month; lit. not exceeding a month [māsa + anatikkanta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning not (kept) more than a month; lit. not exceeding a month
Construction māsa + anatikkanta
māsika 1

adj. occurring monthly, once a month [√mā] ✗
māsika 2

adj. x months old [√mā] ✗
māsiya

adj. consisting of months; with months [√mā] ✗
māse māse

idiom. month after month; lit. in month in month ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + masc
Meaning month after month; lit. in month in month
Sanskrit māse + māse

Examples

māse māse kus'aggena,
bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ,
kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

DHP 70 bālavaggo

māse māse sahassena,
yo yajetha sataṃ samaṃ,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ,
muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo,
yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

DHP 106 sahassavaggo
māso seso

idiom. (+gen) one month remaining (of); one month left (of) ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + adj (+gen)
Meaning one month remaining (of); one month left (of)
Commentary (VINa) māso seso gimhānan'ti catunnaṃ gimhamāsānaṃ eko pacchimamāso seso.
Sanskrit māsa + śeṣa

Examples

māso seso gimhānan'ti, bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ, addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.

VIN PAT NP 24 vassikasāṭikasikkhāpadaṃ

tatth'āyaṃ samayo diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo

VIN PAT PC 57 nahānasikkhāpadaṃ
māssu

sandhi. don't!; you must not! [mā + ssu] ~

Grammar sandhi, ind + ind
Meaning don't!; you must not!
Construction mā + ssu
māhaṃ 1

sandhi. (+aor) may I not [mā + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron, neg (+aor)
Meaning may I not
Construction mā + ahaṃ
Sanskrit mā + aham

Examples

jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16

m'āhaṃ, nāgita, yasena samāgamaṃ, mā ca mayā yaso.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
māhaṃ 2

sandhi. (+aor) I never [mā + ahaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + pron (+aor)
Meaning I never
Construction mā + ahaṃ
Notes mistake for nāhaṃ?
Sanskrit mā + aham

Example

ahañ'hi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi, n'atthi attakāro, n'atthi parakāro'ti. m'āhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, evaṃvādiṃ evaṃdiṭṭhiṃ addasaṃ vā assosiṃ vā.

Synonym mahita, sammata
Sanskrit māhita
Sanskrit Root √mah √maṅh 1, 10 (be great)
māhissati

fem. name of a town ✗
māhu

sandhi. may there not be; don’t let there be [mā + ahu] ✓

Grammar sandhi, ind + aor, neg
Meaning may there not be; don’t let there be
Construction mā + ahu
Sanskrit mā + bhū

Examples

yaṃ pubbe taṃ visosehi,
pacchā te m'āhu kiñcanaṃ,
majjhe ce no gahessasi,
upasanto carissasi.

SNP 66 jatukaṇṇi māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 11

kāmaṃ kho pana m'āhu paro loko, hotu nesaṃ bhavataṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ saccaṃ vacanaṃ, atha ca panāyaṃ bhavaṃ purisapuggalo diṭṭh'eva dhamme viññūnaṃ pāsaṃso, sīlavā purisapuggalo sammādiṭṭhi atthikavādo'ti.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
māḷa

masc. house; hall; pavilion ✓

Grammar masc, dial
Meaning house; hall; pavilion
Commentary (ANt) māḷo ekakūṭasaṅgahito anekakoṇavanto patissayaviseso.
Non IA māḍam "house" (Tamil)
Sanskrit māḍa

Examples

sabbe saṅgamma mantetvā,
māḷaṃ kubbanti satthuno,
ekatthambhaṃ alabhantā,
vicinanti brahāvane.

APA 14 ekatthambhika therāpadānaṃ

tena kho pana samayena sambahulānaṃ therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṃ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayam'antarākathā udapādi, vuttam'idaṃ, āvuso, bhagavatā pārāyane metteyyapañhe.

māḷaka

masc. small hall; lodge ~

Non IA māḍam "house" (Tamil)

mi

ve. (gram) mi; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person singular ✓

Grammar ve, masc
Meaning (gram) mi; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person singular
Sanskrit mi

Examples

482, 508. dā'd'antass'aṃ mi mesu.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 482

asa'icc'etāya dhātuyā mi ma'icc'etesaṃ vibhattīnaṃ mhi mh'ādesā honti vā, dhātv'antassa lopo ca. amhi, amha, asmi, asma.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 492
mikāra

ve. (gram) mi suffix; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person singular [mi + kāra] ✓

Grammar ve, masc, comp
Meaning (gram) mi suffix; verbal ending of the present tense 1st person singular
Construction mi + kāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mi + kāra)
Sanskrit mi + kāra

Example

akāro dīgham'āpajjate hi mi ma'icc'etesu vibhattīsu. gacchāhi, gacchāmi, gacchāma, gacchāmhe. mikāraggahaṇena hivibhattimhi akāro kvaci na dīgham'āpajjate. gacchahi.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 478
miga 1

masc. deer ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning deer
Sanskrit mṛga

Examples

migo yathā seri sucittakānane,
rammaṃ giriṃ pāvus'ābbhamāliniṃ,
anākule tattha nage ramissaṃ,
asaṃsayaṃ citta parābhavissasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati suṃsumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
miga 2

masc. animal; beast ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning animal; beast
Synonym pasu
Sanskrit mṛga

Example

sīho'ti attānaṃ samekkhiyāna,
amaññi kotthu migarāj'āham'asmi,
tath'evaso siṅgālakaṃ anadi,
ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanāde'ti.

migajāta

masc. type of deer; species of deer; (comm) herd of deer [miga + jāta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp

Construction miga + jāta

Example

MN 25 nivāpasuttaṃ
migajāla

masc. name of an arahant monk; lit. deer trap [miga + jāla] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of an arahant monk; lit. deer trap
Construction miga + jāla
Commentary (THa) kā uppatti? ayam'pi purimabuddhesu kat'ādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ visākhāya mahāupāsikāya putto hutvā nibbatti, migajālo'ti'ssa nāmaṃ ahosi.

migajālattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 217 (TH217) ✗
migajālavagga

masc. Chapter 7 of the Saḷāyatanasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 4 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
migataṇhikā

fem. mirage ✗
migadāya 1

masc. name of a park outside Bārāṇasī; lit. deer park [miga + dāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a park outside Bārāṇasī; lit. deer park
Construction miga + dāya
Compound kammadhāraya (miga + dāya)
Sanskrit mṛgadāva

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye.

AN 6.61 majjhesuttaṃ

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena pañcavaggiye bhikkhū bārāṇasiyaṃ viharante isipatane migadāye.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
migadāya 2

masc. name of a park outside Susumāragira; lit. deer park [miga + dāya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a park outside Susumāragira; lit. deer park
Construction miga + dāya
Compound kammadhāraya (miga + dāya)
Commentary (MNa) migadāye'ti taṃ vanaṃ migapakkhīnaṃ abhayadinnaṭṭhāne jātaṃ, tasmā migadāyo'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit mṛgadāva

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.

migapotakajātaka

nt. Jātaka 372 (JA 372) ✗
migabandhaka

masc. deer catcher; deer trapper [miga + bandhaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning deer catcher; deer trapper
Construction miga + bandhaka
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mige + bandhaka)
Commentary (THIa) migabandhakā'ti māgavikā
Sanskrit mṛga + bandhaka

Example

orabbhikā sūkarikā,
macchikā migabandhakā,
corā ca vajjhaghātā ca,
ye c'aññe pāpakammino,
dak'ābhisecanā te'pi,
pāpakammā pamuccare.

THI 65 puṇṇātherīgāthā
migabhūta 1

adj. become like deer [miga + bhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning become like deer
Construction miga + bhūta
migabhūta 2

adj. born as a deer; lit. become deer [miga + bhūta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning born as a deer; lit. become deer
Construction miga + bhūta
migamada

masc. musk ✗
migamātukā

fem. hare-deer; hoofed animal of the size of a cat (Sinh mīninnā) ✗
migarāja

masc. king of the beasts; lord of the animals; epithet of a lion [miga + rāja] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning king of the beasts; lord of the animals; epithet of a lion
Construction miga + rāja
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (migānaṃ + rāja)
Commentary (SNa) migarājā'ti migagaṇassa rājā. (ANa) migarājā'ti sabbamigagaṇassa rājā.
Sanskrit mṛgarāja

Example

sīho'ti attānaṃ samekkhiyāna,
amaññi kotthu migarāj'āham'asmi,
tath'evaso siṅgālakaṃ anadi,
ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanāde'ti.

DN 24.5 pāthikasuttaṃ
migalakkhaṇa

nt. auspicious marks of deer ✗
migalaṇḍika

masc. name of a monk; lit. deer dung [miga + laṇḍikā + a] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monk; lit. deer dung
Construction miga + laṇḍikā + a
migalaṇḍikā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Commentary (VINa) migalaṇḍiko'ti tassa nāmaṃ
migaludda

masc. deer hunter [miga + ludda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning deer hunter
Construction miga + ludda
Compound kammadhāraya (miga + ludda)
Sanskrit mṛga + lubdha

Example

migaluddo pure āsiṃ,
araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ,
tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.

APA 523 tiṇamuṭṭhidāyaka therāpadānaṃ
migaluddaka

masc. deer hunter; huntsman [miga + luddaka] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning deer hunter; huntsman
Construction miga + luddaka
migaluddakapetavatthu

nt. Petavatthu 32 (PV 32) ✗
migava 1

masc. hunter; huntsman [miga + va] ~

Grammar masc, agent, from miga
Meaning hunter; huntsman
Construction miga + va
Derivative taddhita (va)
Synonym ludda, luddaka
Sanskrit mṛgavyādha
migava 2

nt. hunting [miga] ✗
migasaṅgha

masc. herd of deer [miga + saṅgha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning herd of deer
Construction miga + saṅgha
Compound kammadhāraya (miga + saṅgha)
Variant migasaṃgha
Sanskrit mṛga + saṃgha

Examples

tass'eva kho pana, bhikkhave, mahato migasaṅghassa koci'd'eva puriso uppajjeyya atthakāmo hitakāmo yogakkhemakāmo. so yv'āssa maggo khemo sovatthiko pītigamanīyo taṃ maggaṃ vivareyya, pidaheyya kummaggaṃ, ūhaneyya okacaraṃ, nāseyya okacārikaṃ.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

eko'va indo asure jināti,
eko'va seno hanti dije pasayha,
eko'va byaggho migasaṅghapatto,
varaṃ varaṃ hanti balañ'hi t'ādisaṃ.

migasirattheragāthā

fem. Theragāthā 151 (TH151) ✗
migasūkarā

masc. deer and pigs [miga + sūkara + ā] ~

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning deer and pigs
Construction miga + sūkara + ā
migasūkara + ā
Sanskrit mṛga + sūkara
migā

fem. doe [miga + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, from miga
Meaning doe
Construction miga + ā
Derivative taddhita (ā)
Sanskrit mṛgī

Example

sārattā kāmabhogesu,
giddhā kāmesu mucchitā,
atisāraṃ na bujjhanti,
migā kūṭaṃ'va oḍḍitaṃ,
pacchā'saṃ kaṭukaṃ hoti,
vipāko hissa pāpako'ti.

SN 3.6 appakasuttaṃ
migāra

masc. name of a wealthy layman ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning name of a wealthy layman
Commentary (ANa) migāro rohaṇeyyo'ti rohaṇaseṭṭhino nattāraṃ migāraseṭṭhiṃ sandhāy'evam'āha.
Sanskrit mṛgāra (bsk)

Example

acchariyaṃ, bhante, abbhutaṃ, bhante! yāva aḍḍho c'āyaṃ, bhante, migāro rohaṇeyyo yāva mahaddhano yāva mahābhogo'ti. kīva aḍḍho pan'ugga, migāro rohaṇeyyo, kīva mahaddhano, kīva mahābhogo'ti?

AN 7.7 uggasuttaṃ
migāranattar

masc. Migāra's grandson [migāra + nattar] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning Migāra's grandson
Construction migāra + nattar
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (migārassa + nattar)
Commentary (ANa) migāranattā'ti migāraseṭṭhino nattā. (VINa) sāḷho'ti tassa nāmaṃ, migāramātuyā pana nattā hoti, tena vuttaṃ migāranattā'ti
Sanskrit migāra + naptṛ, napāt

Example

atha kho sāḷho ca migāranattā sāṇo ca sekhuniyanattā yen'āyasmā nandako ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ nandakaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdiṃsu.

AN 3.67 sāḷhasuttaṃ
migāramātā

fem. Migāra's mother; epithet of Visākhā ✗
migāramātupāsāda

masc. name of a monastery outside Sāvatthī, built by Visākhā; lit. Migāra's Mother’s Hall [migāra + mātu + pāsāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a monastery outside Sāvatthī, built by Visākhā; lit. Migāra's Mother’s Hall
Construction migāra + mātu + pāsāda
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (migāramātuyā + pāsāda)
Commentary (MNa) pubb'ārāme migāramātupāsāde'ti pubb'ārāmasaṅkhāte vihāre migāramātuyā pāsāde.
Sanskrit migāra + mātā + prāsāda

Examples

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubb'ārāme migāramātupāsāde

UD 45 uposathasuttaṃ

sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi, āyām'ānanda, yena pubb'ārāmo migāramātupāsādo ten'upasaṅkamissāma divāvihārāyā'ti.

AN 6.43 nāgasuttaṃ
migāraseṭṭhi

masc. Migāra the millionaire ✗
migālopajātaka

nt. Jātaka 381 (JA 381) ✗
miginda

masc. king of beasts, lion ✗
migī

fem. doe, hind [miga] ✗
micchatta 1

nt. falsehood [micchā] ✗
micchatta 2

nt. wrongness ✗
micchattaniyata

adj. with inevitable results from wrongness [micchatta + niyata] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with inevitable results from wrongness
Construction micchatta + niyata
micchattavagga

masc. Chapter 3 of the Maggasaṃyuttaṃ, Book 5 of the Saṃyutta Nikāya ✗
micchattasutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 45.21 (SN45.21) ✗
micchattasutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.103 (AN10.103) ✗
micchā 1

ind. false; untrue; wrong ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning false; untrue; wrong
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit mithyā

Examples

yañ'ca sāmaṃ ñātaṃ tañ'ca atidhāvanti yañ'ca loke saccasammataṃ tañ'ca atidhāvanti. tasmā tesaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ micchā'ti vadāmī'ti.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ

yadi, bhante nāgasena, tathāgatena bhaṇitaṃ, abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāyā'ti, tena hi, pūjetha naṃ pūjaniyassa dhātuṃ, evaṃ karā saggamito gamissathā'ti yaṃ vacanaṃ, taṃ micchā.

MIL 4.3.7 buddhapūjanapañho
micchā carati 1

idiom. misbehaves; behaves wrongly; acts incorrectly [micchā + carati] ~

Grammar idiom, ind + pr
Meaning misbehaves; behaves wrongly; acts incorrectly
Construction micchā + carati
Sanskrit mithyā + carati
micchā carati 2

idiom. commits adultery; misbehaves sexually; lit. behaves wrongly [micchā + carati] ~

Grammar idiom, ind + pr
Meaning commits adultery; misbehaves sexually; lit. behaves wrongly
Construction micchā + carati
Sanskrit mithyā + carati
micchā 2

ind. wrongly; falsely; incorrectly; improperly ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning wrongly; falsely; incorrectly; improperly
Antonym sammā
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit mithyā

Examples

mātari pitari c'āpi,
yo micchā paṭipajjati,
tathāgate vā sambuddhe,
atha vā tassa sāvake,
bahuñ'ca so pasavati,
apuññaṃ t'ādiso naro.

AN 4.4 dutiyakhatasuttaṃ

methunam'anuyuttassa,
mussate v'āpi sāsanaṃ,
micchā ca paṭipajjati,
etaṃ tasmiṃ anāriyaṃ.

SNP 45 tissametteyyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 7
micchāājīva 1

adj. with wrong livelihood; having a wrong mode of living [micchā + ājīva] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with wrong livelihood; having a wrong mode of living
Construction micchā + ājīva
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + ājīva)
Antonym sammājīva, sammāājīva
Variant micchājīva
Sanskrit mithyā + ājīva

Examples

pare micchāājīvā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāājīvā bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāājīvassa purisapuggalassa sammāājīvo hoti parikkamanāya, micchāvāyāmassa purisapuggalassa sammāvāyāmo hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchāājīva 2

masc. wrong livelihood; wrong mode of living [micchā + ājīva] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrong livelihood; wrong mode of living
Construction micchā + ājīva
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + ājīva)
Antonym sammājīva, sammāājīva
Variant micchājīva
Sanskrit mithyā + ājīva

Example

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
micchāājīvapaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong livelihood; due to a wrong mode of living [micchāājīva + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong livelihood; due to a wrong mode of living
Construction micchāājīva + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchāājīva + paccayā)
Antonym sammāājīvapaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + ājīva + pratyayāt

Example

sammāājīvassa, bhikkhave, micchāājīvo nijjiṇṇo hoti, ye ca micchāājīvapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāājīvapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchākammanta 1

masc. wrong action; wrong behaviour [micchā + kammanta] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrong action; wrong behaviour
Construction micchā + kammanta
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + kammanta)
Antonym sammākammanta
Sanskrit mithyā + karmānta

Examples

katamo ca, bhikkhave, micchākamm'anto? pāṇ'ātipāto, adinn'ādānaṃ, kāmesumicchācāro, ayaṃ, bhikkhave, micchākamm'anto.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
micchākammanta 2

adj. undertaking wrong action; with wrong behaviour [micchā + kammanta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning undertaking wrong action; with wrong behaviour
Construction micchā + kammanta
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + kammanta)
Antonym sammākammanta
Sanskrit mithyā + karmānta

Examples

pare micchākammantā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammākammantā bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāvācassa purisapuggalassa sammāvācā hoti parikkamanāya, micchākammantassa purisapuggalassa sammākammanto hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchākammantapaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong action; due to wrong behaviour [micchākammanta + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong action; due to wrong behaviour
Construction micchākammanta + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchākammanta + paccayā)
Antonym sammākammantapaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + karmānta + pratyayāt

Example

sammākammantassa, bhikkhave, micchākammanto nijjiṇṇo hoti, ye ca micchākammantapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammākammantapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchāgahaṇa

nt. wrong behaviour ✗
micchācāra

masc. misconduct; lit. wrong behaviour [micchā + cāra] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning misconduct; lit. wrong behaviour
Construction micchā + cāra
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + cāra)
Sanskrit mithyācāra

Example

kāmesumicchācāro akusalaṃ

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ
micchācārapaccayā

ind. dependent on misconduct; due to misconduct [micchācāra + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on misconduct; due to misconduct
Construction micchācāra + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchācāra + paccayā)
Sanskrit mithyācāra + pratyayāt

Example

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ...sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena kāmesu micchācārī hoti, kāmesu micchācārapaccayā ca dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
micchācārī

adj. (+loc) who misbehaves oneself (regarding); who behaves wrongly (with) [micchā + cārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning who misbehaves oneself (regarding); who behaves wrongly (with)
Construction micchā + cārī
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + cārī)
Sanskrit mithyā + ācārin

Example

kāmesumicchācārī hoti. yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittā'pi, tathārūpāsu cārittaṃ āpajjitā hoti

AN 10.176 cundasuttaṃ
micchācārīsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.266 (AN4.266) ✗
micchājīva

masc. wrong livelihood [micchā + ājīva] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrong livelihood
Construction micchā + ājīva
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + ājīva)
Antonym sammājīva, sammāājīva
Variant micchāājīva
Sanskrit mithyā + ājīva

Example

yam'pi bhikkhave tathāgato purimaṃ jātiṃ purimaṃ bhavaṃ purimaṃ niketaṃ pubbe manussabhūto samāno micchājīvaṃ pahāya sammāājīvena jīvikaṃ kappesi

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
micchāñāṇa

nt. wrong understanding; incorrect knowledge [micchā + ñāṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wrong understanding; incorrect knowledge
Construction micchā + ñāṇa
Commentary (SNa) micchāñāṇenā'ti micchāpaccavekkhaṇena
Sanskrit mithyā + jñāna
micchāñāṇapaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong understanding; due to incorrect knowledge [micchāñāṇa + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong understanding; due to incorrect knowledge
Construction micchāñāṇa + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchāñāṇa + paccayā)
Antonym sammāñāṇapaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + jñāna + pratyayāt

Example

sammāñāṇissa, bhikkhave, micchāñāṇaṃ nijjiṇṇaṃ hoti, ye ca micchāñāṇapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāñāṇapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchāñāṇī

adj. with incorrect understanding; with wrong wisdom [micchā + ñāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with incorrect understanding; with wrong wisdom
Construction micchā + ñāṇī
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + ñāṇī)
Antonym sammāñāṇī
Commentary (MNa) ettha ca micchāñāṇan'ti pāpakiriyāsu upāyacintāvasena pāpaṃ katvā sukataṃ mayā'ti paccavekkhaṇākārena ca uppanno moho veditabbo, tena samannāgatā puggalā micchāñāṇī.
Sanskrit mithyā + jñānin

Examples

pare micchāñāṇī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāñāṇī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāñāṇissa purisapuggalassa sammāñāṇaṃ hoti parikkamanāya, micchāvimuttissa purisapuggalassa sammāvimutti hoti parikkamanāya.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchādassana 1

nt. wrong view; false belief; lit. wrong seeing [micchā + dassana] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning wrong view; false belief; lit. wrong seeing
Construction micchā + dassana
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + dassana)
Commentary (DNt) micchādassanenā'ti attadiṭṭhisaṅkhātena micch'ābhinivesena.
Sanskrit mithyā + darśana
micchādassana 2

adj. who has wrong view; who holds a false belief; lit. wrong seeing [micchā + dassana] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who has wrong view; who holds a false belief; lit. wrong seeing
Construction micchā + dassana
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + dassana)
Synonym micchādiṭṭhika
Sanskrit mithyā + darśana
micchādiṭṭhi 1

fem. wrong view; incorrect belief [micchā + diṭṭhi] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wrong view; incorrect belief
Construction micchā + diṭṭhi
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + diṭṭhi)
Antonym sammādiṭṭhi
Synonym diṭṭhi
Commentary (MNa) micchā pāpikā viññugarahitā etesaṃ diṭṭhī'ti micchādiṭṭhī, kammapathapariyāpannāya n'atthi dinnan'tiādivatthukāya, micchattapariyāpannāya aniyyānikadiṭṭhiyā ca samannāgatā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi

Examples

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi pubbaṅ'gamā hoti? micchādiṭṭhiṃ, micchādiṭṭhī'ti pajānāti, sammādiṭṭhiṃ, sammādiṭṭhī'ti pajānāti, s'āssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ

atthāya vata me buddho,
nadiṃ nerañjaraṃ agā,
yass'āhaṃ dhammaṃ sutvāna,
micchādiṭṭhiṃ vivajjayiṃ.

TH 203 nadīkassapattheragāthā
micchādiṭṭhi 2

adj. having wrong view; with incorrect belief [micchā + diṭṭhi] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having wrong view; with incorrect belief
Construction micchā + diṭṭhi
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + diṭṭhi)
Antonym sammādiṭṭhi
Commentary (MNa) micchā pāpikā viññugarahitā etesaṃ diṭṭhī'ti micchādiṭṭhī, kammapathapariyāpannāya n'atthi dinnan'tiādivatthukāya, micchattapariyāpannāya aniyyānikadiṭṭhiyā ca samannāgatā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi

Examples

pare micchādiṭṭhī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammādiṭṭhī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa sammādiṭṭhi hoti parikkamanāya, micchāsaṅkappassa purisapuggalassa sammāsaṅkappo hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchādiṭṭhika

adj. who has wrong view; who holds a false belief [micchā + diṭṭhi + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, comp, from micchādiṭṭhi
Meaning who has wrong view; who holds a false belief
Construction micchā + diṭṭhi + ka
micchādiṭṭhi + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + diṭṭhika)
Antonym sammādiṭṭhika
Synonym micchādassana
Commentary (MNa) micchādiṭṭhiko'ti akusaladassano. (ITIa) micchādiṭṭhikā'ti viparītadassanā.
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + ka

Examples

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu gahananissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, pāpabhikkhu micchādiṭṭhiko hoti, antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato hoti.

AN 3.51 mahācorasuttaṃ

saṭhassa sāṭheyyaṃ appahīnaṃ hoti, māyāvissa māyā appahīnā hoti, pāpicchassa pāpikā icchā appahīnā hoti, micchādiṭṭhikassa micchādiṭṭhi appahīnā hoti

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
micchādiṭṭhikakula

nt. family with wrong view ✗
micchādiṭṭhikammasamādāna

adj. undertaking action based on wrong view; performing deeds due to wrong beliefs [micchādiṭṭhi + kamma + samādāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning undertaking action based on wrong view; performing deeds due to wrong beliefs
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + kamma + samādāna
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (micchādiṭṭhiyā + kammasamādāna)
Commentary (VINa) micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā'ti micchādiṭṭhivasena samādinnanānāvidhakammā, ye ca micchādiṭṭhimūlakesu kāyakammādīsu aññe'pi samādapenti.
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + karman + samādāna

Example

ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṃ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapannā.

AN 10.21 sīhanādasuttaṃ
micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānahetu

ind. because of undertaking actions based on wrong view [micchādiṭṭhikammasamādāna + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning because of undertaking actions based on wrong view
Construction micchādiṭṭhikammasamādāna + hetu
micchādiṭṭhikasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.118 (AN5.118) ✗
micchādiṭṭhikasutta 2

nt. Itivuttaka 70 (ITI 70) ✗
micchādiṭṭhigata

adj. immersed in wrong view; holding a wrong belief; lit. gone into wrong view [micchādiṭṭhi + gata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning immersed in wrong view; holding a wrong belief; lit. gone into wrong view
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + gata
Compound dutiyā tappurisa > bahubbīhi (micchādiṭṭhaṃ + gata)
Variant micchādiṭṭhihata
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + gata

Example

arakkhitena kāyena,
micchādiṭṭhigatena ca,
thinamiddhā 'bhibhūtena,
vasaṃ mārassa gacchati.

UD32 uddhatasuttaṃ
micchādiṭṭhipaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong view; due to incorrect belief [micchādiṭṭhi + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong view; due to incorrect belief
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + paccayā
Antonym sammādiṭṭhipaccayā
Commentary (SNa) micchādiṭṭhipaccayāpī'ti diṭṭhisampayuttā vedanā'pi vaṭṭati. diṭṭhiṃ upanissayaṃ katvā uppannā kusal'ākusalavedanā'pi vaṭṭati vipākavedanā'pi.
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + pratyayāt

Examples

so evaṃ pajānāmi, micchādiṭṭhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, sammādiṭṭhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ ... micchāsamādhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, sammāsamādhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, chandapaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, vitakkapaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, saññāpaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ

SN 45.11 paṭhamavihārasuttaṃ

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ...sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena micchādiṭṭhi hoti, micchādiṭṭhipaccayā ca dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ
micchādiṭṭhiparama

adj. with wrong view as the utmost; with incorrect belief as the supreme [micchādiṭṭhi + parama] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with wrong view as the utmost; with incorrect belief as the supreme
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + parama
Commentary (ANa) micchādiṭṭhiparamānī'ti micchādiṭṭhi paramā etesan'ti micchādiṭṭhiparamāni. pañca hi ānantariyakammāni mahāsāvajjāni nāma, tehi'pi micchādiṭṭhi'y'eva mahāsāvajjatarā'ti adhippāyo. kasmā? tesañ'hi paricchedo atthi. cattāri hi ānantariyakammāni niraye nibbattāpentī'ti vuttāni.
micchādiṭṭhipahānasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 35.165 (SN35.165) ✗
micchādiṭṭhimūlaka

adj. rooted in wrong view [micchādiṭṭhi + mūlaka] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning rooted in wrong view
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + mūlaka
micchādiṭṭhivasena

ind. due to wrong view [micchādiṭṭhi + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to wrong view
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + vasena
micchādiṭṭhivūpasamapaccayā

ind. due to the subsiding of wrong view [micchādiṭṭhi + vūpasama + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the subsiding of wrong view
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + vūpasama + paccayā
Commentary (SNa) micchādiṭṭhivūpasamapaccayā'ti micchādiṭṭhivūpasamo nāma sammādiṭṭhi. tasmā yaṃ sammādiṭṭhipaccayā vedayitaṃ vuttaṃ, tadeva micchādiṭṭhivūpasamapaccayā veditabbaṃ.
micchādiṭṭhisamādāna

adj. believing in wrong views; accepting wrong theories; lit. taking up wrong beliefs [micchādiṭṭhi + samādāna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning believing in wrong views; accepting wrong theories; lit. taking up wrong beliefs
Construction micchādiṭṭhi + samādāna
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (micchādiṭṭhiṃ + samādāna)
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + samādāna

Examples

alajjitāye lajjanti,
lajjitāye na lajjare,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā,
sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 316 nirayavaggo

abhaye bhayadassino,
bhaye c'ābhayadassino,
micchādiṭṭhisamādānā,
sattā gacchanti duggatiṃ.

DHP 317 nirayavaggo
micchādiṭṭhisutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 22.154 (SN22.154) ✗
micchādiṭṭhisutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 4.273 (AN4.273) ✗
micchādiṭṭhihata

adj. afflicted with wrong view; beaten by wrong view; hammered by wrong view [micchā + diṭṭhi + hata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with wrong view; beaten by wrong view; hammered by wrong view
Construction micchā + diṭṭhi + hata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (micchādiṭṭhiyā + hata)
Variant micchādiṭṭhigata
Sanskrit mithyādṛṣṭi + hata

Example

anicce niccasaññino,
dukkhe ca sukhasaññino,
anattani ca attā'ti,
asubhe subhasaññino,
micchādiṭṭhihatā sattā,
khittacittā visaññino.

AN 4.49 vipallāsasuttaṃ
micchādhamma

masc. wrongdoing; (comm) homosexuality [micchā + dhamma] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrongdoing; (comm) homosexuality
Construction micchā + dhamma
Commentary (DNa) micchādhammo'ti purisānaṃ purisesu itthīnañ'ca itthīsu chandarāgo.
micchādhammapareta

adj. afflicted with immorality; suffering from perversity [micchādhamma + pareta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning afflicted with immorality; suffering from perversity
Construction micchādhamma + pareta
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (micchādhammena + pareta)
Commentary (ANa) micchādhammaparetā'ti avatthupaṭisevanasaṅkhātena micchādhammena samannāgatā.
micchāpaṭipajjamāna

prp. behaving wrongly; acting improperly [micchā + paṭipajjamāna] ~

Grammar prp, comp vb
Meaning behaving wrongly; acting improperly
Construction micchā + paṭipajjamāna
Commentary (ANa) micchāpaṭipajjamāno'ti micchāpaṭipattiṃ paṭipajjamāno.
Sanskrit mithyā + pratipadyamāna
micchāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu

ind. due to wrong practice [micchāpaṭipatta + adhikaraṇa + hetu] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to wrong practice
Construction micchāpaṭipatta + adhikaraṇa + hetu
micchāpaṭipatti

fem. wrong practice; following wrong road [micchā + paṭipatti] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wrong practice; following wrong road
Construction micchā + paṭipatti
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + paṭipatti)
Antonym sammāpaṭipatti
Sanskrit mithyā + pratipatti

Example

asussūsā aparipucchā paññāya paripantho, ananuyogo apaccavekkhaṇā dhammānaṃ paripantho, micchāpaṭipatti saggānaṃ paripantho

AN 10.73 iṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ
micchāpaṭipadā

fem. wrong course; wrong path of action [micchā + paṭipadā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning wrong course; wrong path of action
Construction micchā + paṭipadā
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + paṭipadā)
Antonym sammāpaṭipadā
Sanskrit mithyā + pratipadā

Example

tatra, bhikkhave, yam'idaṃ taramānassa bhāsitaṃ, sadukkho eso dhammo saupaghāto saupāyāso sapariḷāho, micchāpaṭipadā.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
micchāpaṭipanna

adj. practising wrongly; going the wrong way; lit. gone along wrongly [micchā + paṭipanna] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning practising wrongly; going the wrong way; lit. gone along wrongly
Construction micchā + paṭipanna
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + paṭipanna)
Antonym sammāpaṭipanna
Sanskrit mithyā + pratipanna

Examples

micchāpaṭipanno tvam'asi, aham'asmi sammāpaṭipanno. sahitaṃ me, asahitaṃ te. purevacanīyaṃ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṃ pure avaca. adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo, cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito'si, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī'ti.

SN 56.9 viggāhikakathāsuttaṃ

yesaṃ kesañci bhavasaṃyojanaṃ appahīnaṃ, sabbe te sadukkhā saupaghātā saupāyāsā sapariḷāhā micchāpaṭipannā'ti, iti vadaṃ itth'eke apasādeti.

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ
micchāpaṇihita

adj. badly directed; wrongly orientated; at a wrong angle [micchā + paṇihita] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning badly directed; wrongly orientated; at a wrong angle
Construction micchā + paṇihita
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + paṇihita)
Antonym sammāpaṇihita
Sanskrit mithyā + praṇihita

Examples

diso disaṃ yaṃ taṃ kayirā,
verī vā pana verinaṃ,
micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ,
pāpiyo naṃ tato kare.

DHP 42 cittavaggo

micchāpaṇihitaṃ kho, mahāli, cittaṃ hetu, micchāpaṇihitaṃ cittaṃ paccayo pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyāti.

AN 10.47 mahālisuttaṃ
micchāpaṇihitatta

nt. fact of being badly directed; fact of being wrongly orientated; fact of being at a wrong angle [micchā + paṇihita + tta] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp, from micchāpaṇihita
Meaning fact of being badly directed; fact of being wrongly orientated; fact of being at a wrong angle
Construction micchā + paṇihita + tta
micchāpaṇihita + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Antonym sammāpaṇihitatta
Commentary (SNa) micchāpaṇihitattā, bhikkhave, diṭṭhiyā'ti kammassakatapaññāya c'eva maggabhāvanāya ca micchā ṭhapitattā, appavattitattā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mithyā + praṇihita +
micchābhāva

masc. wrong state of being [micchā + bhāva] ~

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning wrong state of being
Construction micchā + bhāva
micchābhāvadassanatthaṃ

ind. to show the wrong state of being; lit. for the purpose of showing the wrong state [micchābhāva + dassana + atthaṃ] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning to show the wrong state of being; lit. for the purpose of showing the wrong state
Construction micchābhāva + dassana + atthaṃ
micchāmagga

masc. wrong road; false path [micchā + magga] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrong road; false path
Construction micchā + magga
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + magga)
Sanskrit mithyā + mārga

Example

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
micchāvāca

adj. speaking wrongly; with bad speech; badly spoken [micchā + vācā + a] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning speaking wrongly; with bad speech; badly spoken
Construction micchā + vācā + a
micchāvācā + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Antonym sammāvāca
Sanskrit mithyā + vācā

Examples

pare micchāvācā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāvācā bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāvāc'assa purisapuggalassa sammāvācā hoti parikkamanāya, micchākammantassa purisapuggalassa sammākammanto hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchāvācā

fem. wrong speech [micchā + vācā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wrong speech
Construction micchā + vācā
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + vācā)
Antonym sammāvācā
Sanskrit mithyā + vācā

Examples

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ

iti pubb'eva kho panassa susīlyaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti, dussīlyaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ, ayañ'ca micchādiṭṭhi micchāsaṅkappo micchāvācā ariyānaṃ paccanīkatā asaddhammasaññatti attukkaṃsanā paravambhanā.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
micchāvācāpaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong speech [micchāvācā + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong speech
Construction micchāvācā + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchāvācā + paccayā)
Antonym sammāvācāpaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + vācā + pratyayāt

Example

sammāvāc'assa, bhikkhave, micchāvācā nijjiṇṇā hoti, ye ca micchāvācāpaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāvācāpaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchāvācāsutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.119 (AN5.119) ✗

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāājīvassa purisapuggalassa sammāājīvo hoti parikkamanāya, micchāvāyāmassa purisapuggalassa sammāvāyāmo hoti parikkamanāya

masc. wrong effort; incorrect endeavour [micchā + vāyāma] ✓

Meaning wrong effort; incorrect endeavour

Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + vāyāma)

Sanskrit mithyā + vyāyāma

Example

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
micchāvāyāmapaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong effort; due to incorrect endeavour [micchāvāyāma + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong effort; due to incorrect endeavour

Sanskrit mithyā + vyāyāma + pratyayāt
