sammāvāyāmassa, bhikkhave, micchāvāyāmo nijjiṇṇo hoti, ye ca micchāvāyāmapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāvāyāmapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchāvāyāmasutta

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.120 (AN5.120) ✗
micchāvimutti 1

fem. wrong liberation; incorrect deliverance [micchā + vimutti] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wrong liberation; incorrect deliverance
Construction micchā + vimutti
micchāvimutti 2

adj. having incorrect liberation; with wrong emancipation [micchā + vimutti] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having incorrect liberation; with wrong emancipation
Construction micchā + vimutti
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + vimutti)
Antonym sammāvimutti
Commentary (MNa) micchāvimuttī'ti avimuttā'y'eva samānā, vimuttā mayan'ti evaṃsaññino, avimuttiyaṃ vā vimuttisaññino. tatr'āyaṃ vacan'attho, micchā pāpikā viparītā vimutti etesaṃ atthī'ti micchāvimuttī.
Sanskrit mithyā + vimukti

Examples

pare micchāvimuttī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāvimuttī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāñāṇissa purisapuggalassa sammāñāṇaṃ hoti parikkamanāya, micchāvimuttissa purisapuggalassa sammāvimutti hoti parikkamanāya.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchāvimuttipaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong liberation; based on incorrect deliverance [micchāvimutti + paccayā] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong liberation; based on incorrect deliverance
Construction micchāvimutti + paccayā
Antonym sammāvimuttipaccayā
micchāsaṅkappa 1

masc. wrong intention; wrong notion; wrong idea; wrong concept [micchā + saṅkappa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wrong intention; wrong notion; wrong idea; wrong concept
Construction micchā + saṅkappa
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + saṅkappa)
Antonym sammāsaṅkappa
Sanskrit mithyā + saṃkalpa

Examples

asāre sāramatino,
sāre c'āsāradassino,
te sāraṃ n'ādhigacchanti,
micchāsaṅkappagocarā.

DHP 11 yamakavaggo

kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi pubbaṅ'gamā hoti? micchāsaṅkappaṃ, micchāsaṅkappo'ti pajānāti, sammāsaṅkappaṃ, sammāsaṅkappo'ti pajānāti, s'āssa hoti sammādiṭṭhi.

MN 117 mahācattārīsakasuttaṃ
micchāsaṅkappa 2

adj. having wrong intention; with wrong notions; with wrong ideas [micchā + saṅkappa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning having wrong intention; with wrong notions; with wrong ideas
Construction micchā + saṅkappa
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + saṅkappa)
Antonym sammāsaṅkappa
Commentary (MNa) micchāsaṅkappā'ti ayāthāvāniyyānikākusalasaṅkappā
Sanskrit mithyā + saṃkalpa

Examples

pare micchāsaṅkappā bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāsaṅkappā bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchādiṭṭhissa purisapuggalassa sammādiṭṭhi hoti parikkamanāya, micchāsaṅkappassa purisapuggalassa sammāsaṅkappo hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchāsaṅkappagocara

adj. ranging in wrong notions; in the field of incorrect concepts [micchāsaṅkappa + gocara] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning ranging in wrong notions; in the field of incorrect concepts
Construction micchāsaṅkappa + gocara
Compound kammadhāraya (micchāsaṅkappa + gocara)
Antonym sammāsaṅkappagocara
Commentary (DHPa) te sāran'ti te pana taṃ micchādiṭṭhiggahaṇaṃ gahetvā ṭhitā kāmavitakk'ādīnaṃ vasena micchāsaṅkappagocarā hutvā sīlasāraṃ, samādhisāraṃ, paññāsāraṃ, vimuttisāraṃ, vimuttiñāṇadassanasāraṃ, paramatthasāraṃ, nibbānañ'ca n'ādhigacchanti.
Sanskrit mithyā + saṃkalpa + gocara

Example

asāre sāramatino,
sāre c'āsāradassino,
te sāraṃ n'ādhigacchanti,
micchāsaṅkappagocarā.

DHP1 yamakavaggo
micchāsaṅkappapaccayā

ind. due to wrong intention; caused by having the incorrect concept [micchāsaṅkappa + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to wrong intention; caused by having the incorrect concept
Construction micchāsaṅkappa + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchāsaṅkappa + paccayā)
Antonym sammāsaṅkappapaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + saṃkalpa + pratyayāt

Example

sammāsaṅkappassa, bhikkhave, micchāsaṅkappo nijjiṇṇo hoti, ye ca micchāsaṅkappapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāsaṅkappapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

AN 10.106 nijjarasuttaṃ
micchāsati 1

adj. with incorrect present moment awareness; with imperfect memory [micchā + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with incorrect present moment awareness; with imperfect memory
Construction micchā + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + sati)
Antonym sammāsati
Sanskrit mithyā + smṛti

Examples

pare micchāsatī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha sammāsatī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, cunda, vihiṃsakassa purisapuggalassa avihiṃsā hoti parikkamanāya ... micchāsatissa purisapuggalassa sammāsati hoti parikkamanāya, micchāsamādhissa purisapuggalassa sammāsamādhi hoti parikkamanāya

MN 8 sallekhasuttaṃ
micchāsati 2

fem. wrong mindfulness; incorrect present moment awareness; imperfect memory [micchā + sati] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning wrong mindfulness; incorrect present moment awareness; imperfect memory
Construction micchā + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (micchā + sati)
Antonym sammāsati
Sanskrit mithyā + smṛti

Example

kummaggo'ti kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭh'aṅgikassetaṃ micchāmaggassa adhivacanaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, micchādiṭṭhiyā micchāsaṅkappassa micchāvācāya micchākammantassa micchāājīvassa micchāvāyāmassa micchāsatiyā micchāsamādhissa.

MN 19 dvedhāvitakkasuttaṃ
micchāsatipaccayā

ind. dependent on wrong mindfulness; due to incorrect present moment awareness [micchāsati + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on wrong mindfulness; due to incorrect present moment awareness
Construction micchāsati + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (micchāsati + paccayā)
Antonym sammāsatipaccayā
Sanskrit mithyā + smṛti + pratyayāt

Example

sammāsatissa, bhikkhave, micchāsati nijjiṇṇā hoti, ye ca micchāsatipaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti te c'assa nijjiṇṇā honti, sammāsatipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.

Sanskrit mithyā + samādhi + pratyayāt

Example

so evaṃ pajānāmi, micchādiṭṭhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, sammādiṭṭhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ ... micchāsamādhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, sammāsamādhipaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, chandapaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, vitakkapaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ, saññāpaccayā'pi vedayitaṃ

miñja 1

nt. kernel; grain ~

Meaning kernel; grain
Synonym miñjā
Sanskrit miñjā, majjan
miñja 2

nt. marrow [miñja] ✗
miñja 3

nt. pith [miñja] ✗
miñjā

fem. kernel; grain ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning kernel; grain
Synonym miñja
Sanskrit miñjā, majjan

Example

dvattikkhattuṃ kho bhavaṃ gotamo mukhe ālopaṃ samparivattetvā ajjhoharati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā asambhinnā kāyaṃ pavisati, na c'assa kāci odanamiñjā mukhe avasiṭṭhā hoti, ath'āparaṃ ālopaṃ upanāmeti.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
miḍḍhi

fem. shelf, plinth ✗
miṇana

nt. measurement [√mā] ✗
miṇanta

prp. measuring, weighing, balancing [√mā] ✗
miṇāti

pr. measures, weighs, balances [√mā] ✗
miṇi

aor. measured, weighed, balanced [√mā] ✗
miṇituṃ

inf. (+acc) to measure, to weigh, to balance [√mā] ✗
miṇitvā

abs. having measured, having weighed, having balanced [√mā] ✗
miṇīyati

pr. is measured, is balanced [√mā] ✗
mita 1

pp. measured; balanced; limited [√mā + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of miṇāti
Meaning measured; balanced; limited
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā > mi + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym amita
Sanskrit mita
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Example

ūn'ūdaro mita-āhāro,
app'icchassa alolupo,
sadā icchāya nicchāto,
aniccho hoti nibbuto.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
mita 2

pp. of value; in measure; worth as much as; lit. measured [√mā + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of miṇāti
Meaning of value; in measure; worth as much as; lit. measured
Root Family √mā
Root √mā･5 nā (measure)
Construction √mā > mi + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change ā > i (Kacc 502, 493)
Antonym amita
Commentary (SNa) sahassena samaṃ mitā'ti sahassena saddhiṃ mitā, sahassa dānasadisā hoti.
Sanskrit mita
Sanskrit Root √mā 2, 3, 4 (measure)

Example

appasm'eke pavecchanti,
bahun'eke na dicchare,
appasmā dakkhiṇā dinnā,
sahassena samaṃ mitā'ti.

SN 1.32 maccharisuttaṃ
mitacintijātaka

nt. Jātaka 114 (JA 114) ✗
mitabhāṇī

adj. who speaks in moderation; who is measured in speech [mita + bhāṇī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who speaks in moderation; who is measured in speech
Construction mita + bhāṇī
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mitaṃ + bhāṇī)
Sanskrit mita + bhāṇin

Example

porāṇam'etaṃ atula,
n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ,
nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti,
n'atthi loke anindito.

DHP 227 kodhavaggo
mitāhāra

adj. moderate in food; limited in eating; with lean diet; lit. measured food [mita + āhāra] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning moderate in food; limited in eating; with lean diet; lit. measured food
Construction mita + āhāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mita + āhāra)
Sanskrit mitāhāra

Examples

allaṃ sukkhaṃ vā bhuñjanto,
na bāḷhaṃ suhito siyā,
ūn'ūdaro mit'āhāro,
sato bhikkhu paribbaje.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā

ūn'ūdaro mit'āhāro,
app'icchassa alolupo,
sadā icchāya nicchāto,
aniccho hoti nibbuto.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
mitta 1

masc. friend [√mitt + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning friend
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym amitta
Sanskrit mitra
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Examples

mitte bhajassu kalyāṇe,
suddhājīve atandite,
paṭisanthāravuty'assa,
ācārakusalo siyā,
tato pāmojjabahulo,
dukkhass'antaṃ karissati.

DHP 376 bhikkhuvaggo

yādisaṃ kurute mittaṃ,
yādisaṃ c'ūpasevati,
sa ve t'ādisako hoti,
sahavāso hi t'ādiso.

ITI 76 sukhapatthanāsuttaṃ

nt. friend [√mitt + a] ~

Meaning friend
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

adj. making friends [mitta + kara] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning making friends
Construction mitta + kara

Meaning who wants a friend; who is looking for an ally

saṃvijjant'īdha puggale,
so mitto mittakāmena,
bhajitabbo tathāvidho'ti.

mittakula

Meaning friendly family; family of friends
Construction mitta + kula

Sanskrit mitra + kula

Example

SN 35.87 channasuttaṃ
mittatā

fem. friendship [√mitt + a + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from mitta
Meaning friendship
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a + tā
mitta + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Synonym mittavatā
Sanskrit maitratā
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

uṭṭhānaṃ anālasyaṃ bhogānaṃ āhāro, maṇḍanā vibhūsanā vaṇṇassa āhāro, sappāyakiriyā ārogyassa āhāro, kalyāṇamittatā sīlānaṃ āhāro

AN 10.73 iṭṭhadhammasuttaṃ
mittato 1

masc. from a friend [√mitt + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of mitta
Meaning from a friend
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a + to
mitta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Commentary (VINa) ñātakehi me cīvar'atthāya pesitaṃ, mittehi pesitaṃ, te āgatā cīvare dassantī'ti evaṃ ñātito vā mittato vā paccāsā hoti.
Sanskrit mitrāt
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Examples

uppajjeyyā'ti uppajjeyya saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ

satiyā paccāsāyā'ti paccāsā hoti saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.

VIN 1.4.1.3 tatiyakathinasikkhāpadaṃ
mittato 2

masc. as a friend [√mitt + a + to] ✓

Grammar masc, abl sg of mitta
Meaning as a friend
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a + to
mitta + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Antonym amittato
Commentary (MNa) mittato'pi naṃ saddaheyyā'ti mitto me ayan'ti saddaheyya.
Sanskrit mitrāt
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

tassa so gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā mittato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, suhajjato'pi naṃ saddaheyya, tasmiñ'ca vissāsaṃ āpajjeyya.

SN 22.85 yamakasuttaṃ
mittadubbhitā

mittadūbhī

adj. who betrays his friends, treacherous person ✗
mittaddu

masc. who betrays his friends, treacherous person ✗
mittapatirūpaka

adj. false friend ✗
mittabheda

masc. breaking of friendship or alliance ✗
mittavatā

fem. friendship [√mitt + a + vant + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from mittavant
Meaning friendship
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt + a + vant + tā
mittavant + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Synonym mittatā
Sanskrit mitravattā
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa evaṃ icchati, aho vat'āyaṃ na mittavā assā'ti! taṃ kissa hetu? na, bhikkhave, sapatto sapattassa mittavatāya nandati.

Meaning due to the attainment of a (spiritual) friend; because of gaining a (good) companion; lit. friend attainment coming

Example

mittasampadam'āgamma,

vijjā vimutti vasībhāvo,
sabbam'etena labbhati.

mittasampadam'āgamma,

mittāmaccakaraṇīya

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning obligation to friends and colleagues; responsibility to friends and companions
Construction mittāmacca + karaṇīya
mittāmaccā

masc. friends and colleagues; friends and companions [mitta + amacca + ā] ✓

Grammar masc pl, comp
Meaning friends and colleagues; friends and companions
Construction mitta + amacca + ā
mittāmacca + ā
Compound dvanda (mittā ca amaccā ca)
Sanskrit mitra + amātya

Examples

kodhanaṃ, bhikkhave, purisapuggalaṃ kodh'ābhibhūtaṃ kodhaparetaṃ, ye'pi'ssa te honti mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, te'pi ārakā parivajjanti kodh'ābhibhūtaṃ.

AN 7.64 kodhanasuttaṃ

tam'enaṃ mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā jātam'eva naṃ saṅghāṭikaṃ kareyyuṃ, saṅghāṭikattam'eva samādapeyyuṃ, ehi tvaṃ, bhadramukha, saṅghāṭiko hohi, saṅghāṭikassa te sato saṅghāṭidhāraṇamattena abhijjhālussa abhijjhā pahīyissati

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā

idiom. friends, colleagues, family and blood relatives [mitta + amaccā + ñāti + sālohitā] ✓

Grammar idiom, masc + masc
Meaning friends, colleagues, family and blood relatives
Construction mitta + amaccā + ñāti + sālohitā

Examples

labheyya nu kho so coro coraghātesu, āgamentu tāva bhavanto coraghātā, amukasmiṃ me gāme vā nigame vā mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā, yāvāhaṃ tesaṃ uddisitvā āgacchāmī'ti

DN 23.5 pāyāsisuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, puriso sallena viddho assa savisena gāḷh'ūpalepanena. tassa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā bhisakkaṃ sallakattaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyyuṃ.

mittāmittajātaka 1

nt. Jātaka 197 (JA 197) ✗

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ
mithu 1

Meaning mutually; reciprocally; each other

Root √mith×1 a (pair)
Construction √mith + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit mithas
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Examples

te vādakāmā parisaṃ vigayha,
bālaṃ dahantī mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
vadanti te aññasitā kath'ojjaṃ,
pasaṃsakāmā kusalā vadānā.

SNP 46 pasūrasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 8

na v'āham'etaṃ tathiyan'ti brūmi,
yam'āhu bālā mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhim'akaṃsu saccaṃ,
tasmā hi bālo'ti paraṃ dahanti.

mithubheda

masc. broken alliance; internal dissension [mithu + bheda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning broken alliance; internal dissension
Construction mithu + bheda
Compound kammadhāraya (mithu + bheda)
Commentary (DNa) eko, iminā akathitaṃ amussa, amunā akathitaṃ imassā'ti vadantānaṃ pisuṇavācānaṃ vasena bhinnānaṃ manussānaṃ aññam'aññabheden'eva nassissatī'ti attho.
Sanskrit mitrabheda

Example

pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti, aggito vā udakato vā mithubhedā vā'ti.

DN 16.8 mahāparinibbānasuttaṃ
midaṃ

sandhi. this [[m] + idaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, letter + pron
Meaning this
Construction [m] + idaṃ
Phonetic Change +m
Synonym yidaṃ
Sanskrit idam

Example

ubhayena m'idaṃ maraṇam'eva,
n'āmaraṇaṃ pacchā vā pure vā,
paṭipajjatha mā vinassatha,
khaṇo vo mā upaccagā.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
middha

nt. drowsiness; sluggishness; lit. stiffness ✓

Grammar nt, abstr
Meaning drowsiness; sluggishness; lit. stiffness
Synonym thina, thīna
Commentary (ANa) thinaṃ cittagelaññaṃ, middhaṃ cetasikagelaññaṃ. thinañ'ca middhañ'ca thinamiddhaṃ.
Sanskrit middha

Examples

ahaṃ middhena pakato,
vihārā upanikkhamiṃ,
caṅkamaṃ abhiruhanto,
tatth'eva papatiṃ chamā.

TH 187 bhaguttheragāthā

thīnamiddhaṃ pahāya vigatathīnamiddho viharati

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
middhavigata

adj. devoid of drowsiness; lit. stiffness gone away [middha + vigata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoid of drowsiness; lit. stiffness gone away
Construction middha + vigata
Compound kammadhāraya (middha + vigata)
Sanskrit middha + vigata

Example

no ce te evaṃ viharato taṃ middhaṃ pahīyetha, tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, ālokasaññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi, yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti middhavigatena cetasā apariyonaddhena sappabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi.

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ
middhasukha

nt. pleasure of dozing; pleasure of sleeping [middha + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning pleasure of dozing; pleasure of sleeping
Construction middha + sukha

Commentary (ANa) middhasukhan'ti niddāsukhaṃ.
Sanskrit middha + sukha

Examples

paṭibuddhena ca te, moggallāna, khippaññ'eva paccuṭṭhātabbaṃ na seyyasukhaṃ na passasukhaṃ na middhasukhaṃ anuyutto viharissāmī'ti

AN 7.61 pacalāyamānasuttaṃ

yo kho, nāgita, na'y'imassa nekkhammasukhassa pavivekasukhassa upasamasukhassa sambodhasukhassa nikāmalābhī assa akicchalābhī akasiralābhī ... so taṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ middhasukhaṃ lābhasakkārasilokasukhaṃ sādiyeyyā'ti.

AN 5.30 nāgitasuttaṃ
middhī

adj. drowsy; sluggish; sleepy; lit. stiff [middha + ī] ✓

Grammar adj, from middha
Meaning drowsy; sluggish; sleepy; lit. stiff
Construction middha + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Synonym thīna
Sanskrit middhin (bsk)

Example

middhī yadā hoti mahagghaso ca,
niddāyitā samparivattasāyī,
mahāvarāho'va nivāpapuṭṭho,
punappunaṃ gabbham'upeti mando.

midhekacce

Meaning some here
Construction [m] + idha + ekacce
Phonetic Change +m
Synonym ittheke
Sanskrit m + iha + ekatya

Example

atha kho āyasmā ānando uttiyaṃ paribbājakaṃ etadavoca, tenah'āvuso uttiya, upamaṃ te karissāmi. upamāya m'idh'ekacce viññū purisā bhāsitassa atthaṃ ājānanti.

Meaning here a certain; in this case a
Construction [m] + idha + ekacco
Phonetic Change +m
Commentary (ANa) yena m'idh'ekacco mātugāmo'ti yena idh'ekaccā itthī.
Sanskrit m + iha + ekatya

Example

ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena m'idh'ekacco mātugāmo dubbaṇṇā ca hoti durūpā supāpikā dassanāya, daliddā ca hoti appassakā appabhogā appesakkhā ca?

Example

kusaggen'udakam'ādāya,
samudde udakaṃ mine,

dibbakāmāna santike.

JA 537 mahāsutasomajātakaṃ
miyyati 1

pr. (+abl) is killed (by); dies (from) [√mar + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of marati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning is killed (by); dies (from)
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 īya (die)
Base √mar + īya > marīya > miyya (pass, irreg)
Construction miyya + ti
Phonetic Change mar > mī (Kacc 505, 482)
Synonym byāpajjati, marati
Variant mīyati
Sanskrit mriyate
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,
oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati,
atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6

jara mara'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ jīra jiyya miyy'ādesā honti vā. jīrati, jīranti, jiyyati, jiyyanti, miyyati, miyyanti, marati, maranti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 505
miyyati 2

pr. is killed; dies [√mar + īya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of marati, intrans
Meaning is killed; dies
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 īya (die)
Base √mar + īya > marīya > miyya (pass, irreg)
Construction miyya + ti

Synonym byāpajjati, marati
Variant mīyati
Sanskrit mriyate
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Examples

kāye visaṃ na kamati,
satthāni na ca hanti me
udake'haṃ na miyyāmi,
āyāgassa idaṃ phalaṃ.

APA 40 āyāgadāyaka therāpadānaṃ

jara mara'icc'etesaṃ dhātūnaṃ jīra jiyya miyy'ādesā honti vā. jīrati, jīranti, jiyyati, jiyyanti, miyyati, miyyanti, marati, maranti.

n'ābhāsamānaṃ jānanti,
missaṃ bālehi paṇḍitaṃ,
bhāsamānañ'ca jānanti,
desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ.

missayati

Grammar abs of misseti, trans (+acc)
Meaning having mixed; having combined
Root Family √miss
Root √miss･8 *e (mix, mingle)
Construction √miss + itvā
Commentary (VINa) ekena'pi kosiy'aṃsunā missitvā'ti tiṭṭhatu attano rucivasena missitaṃ, sace'pi tassa karaṇaṭṭhāne vāto ekaṃ kosiyaṃsuṃ ānetvā pāteti, evam'pi missetvā katam'eva hotī'ti.

Sanskrit miśr
Sanskrit Root √miśr √mikṣ 1, 10 (mix)

Example

kārāpeyyā'ti ekena'pi kosiy'aṃsunā missitvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ. paṭilābhena nissaggiyaṃ hoti.

VIN 1.4.2.1 kosiyasikkhāpadaṃ
missībhāva

Grammar masc, abstr, comp
Meaning mixing; mingling; association; lit. mixed state
Construction missa > missī + bhāva
Phonetic Change a > ī before √bhū
Compound kammadhāraya (missa + bhāva)
Antonym amissībhāva
Synonym saṃsagga
Commentary (VIBH) missībhāvo'ti sabbakiccānaṃ sahakaraṇaṃ.
Sanskrit miśra + bhava

Example

ye vā pan'assa te honti atthakāmā hitakāmā phāsukakāmā yogakkhemakāmā mātā vā pitā vā bhātā vā bhaginī vā mittā vā amaccā vā ñātisālohitā vā, yā tehi saddhiṃ asaṅgati asamāgamo asamodhānaṃ amissībhāvo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, piyehi vippayogo dukkho.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa, paṭhamakaṇḍa

pr. is killed; dies [√mar + īya + ti] ✓

appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ,

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
mīyamāna

prp. (+instr) being killed (by); dying (from) [√mar + īya + māna] ✓

Grammar prp of mīyati, pass, intrans (+instr)
Meaning being killed (by); dying (from)
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 īya (die)
Base √mar + īya > marīya > mīya (pass, irreg)
Construction mīya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change mar > mī (Kacc 505, 482)
Antonym amīyamāna
Commentary (MNa) mīyamāno'ti maramāno.
Sanskrit mriyamāṇa
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

sītassa purakkhato uṇhassa purakkhato ḍaṃsamakasa-vāt'ātapa-sarīṃsapa-samphassehi rissamāno khuppipāsāya mīyamāno, ayam'pi, bhikkhave, kāmānaṃ ādīnavo sandiṭṭhiko, dukkhakkhandho kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ kāmānam'eva hetu.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
mīyi

aor. died; was killed [√mar + īya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of mīyati, pass, intrans
Meaning died; was killed
Root Family √mar
Root √mar･1 īya (die)
Base √mar + īya > marīya > mīya (pass, irreg)
Construction mīya + i
Phonetic Change mar > mī (Kacc 505, 482)
Variant miyyi
Sanskrit amāri
Sanskrit Root √mṛ 1 (die)

Example

maraṇadhammaṃ mā mīyī'ti n'atthi koci pāṭibhogo, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā devo vā māro vā brahmā vā koci vā lokasmiṃ

AN 4.182 pāṭibhogasuttaṃ
mīḷha

nt. excrement; dung; urine [√mih + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, from mihati
Meaning excrement; dung; urine
Root Family √mih
Root √mih･1 a (urinate, excrete)
Construction √mih + ta > mīḍha > mīḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Variant miḷha
Sanskrit mīḍha
Sanskrit Root √mih 1 (urinate)

Example

āvuso, āgantuka kuṭumbikassa te gehe bhattaṃ bhuñjanato varataraṃ mīḷhaṃ khādituṃ... kuṭumbikena dinnasāṭakanivāsanato varataraṃ naggena vicarituṃ

DHPa 1.5.11 jambukatthera vatthu
mīḷhakasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 17.5 (SN17.5) ✗
mīḷhakā

fem. female dung-beetle [√mih + ta + kā] ✓

Grammar fem, from mīḷha
Meaning female dung-beetle
Root Family √mih
Root √mih･1 a (urinate, excrete)
Construction √mih + ta > mīḍha > mīḷha + kā
mīḷha + kā
Derivative taddhita (kā)
Phonetic Change t > ḍ > ḷ
Commentary (SNa) mīḷhakā'ti gūthapāṇakā.
Sanskrit mīḍha +
Sanskrit Root √mih 1 (urinate)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
mīḷhapabbata

masc. mountain of excrement, hill of dung ✗
mīḷhasukha

nt. filthy pleasure; lit. excrement comfort [mīḷha + sukha] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning filthy pleasure; lit. excrement comfort
Construction mīḷha + sukha
Compound kammadhāraya (mīḷha + sukha)
Synonym asucisukha
Variant miḷhasukha
Commentary (ANa) mīḷhasukhan'ti asucisukhaṃ.
Sanskrit mīḍha + sukha

Examples

MN 139 araṇavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

mukula

nt. bud [makula] ✗

Grammar nt
Meaning mouth
Sanskrit mukha

Examples

yo nindiyaṃ pasaṃsati,
taṃ vā nindati yo pasaṃsiyo
vicināti mukhena so kaliṃ,
kalinā tena sukhaṃ na vindati.

mukha 5

nt. cause; means; way; (comm) door; source ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning cause; means; way; (comm) door; source
Synonym nidāna
Commentary (SNPa) kiṃ parābhavato mukhan'ti evaṃ āgatānaṃ amhākaṃ brūhi parābhavato purisassa kiṃ mukhaṃ, kiṃ dvāraṃ, kā yoni, kiṃ kāraṇaṃ, yena mayaṃ parābhavantaṃ purisaṃ jāneyyāmā'ti attho.
Sanskrit mukha

Examples

asantassa piyā honti,
sante na kurute piyaṃ,
asataṃ dhammaṃ roceti,
taṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.

Examples

VIN 2.5.7.10 kaṇṭakasikkhāpadaṃ
mukhya

adj. chief, foremost, most important ✗
mugga

masc. mung beans [√mud + ga] ✓

Grammar masc, from mudu
Meaning mung beans
Root Family √mud
Root √mud･1 a (be soft, happy)
Construction √mud > mug + ga
Derivative kita (ga)
Phonetic Change d > g
Sanskrit mudga
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso muñcitvā paccavekkheyya ime sālī ime vīhī ime muggā ime māsā ime tilā ime taṇḍulā'ti

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhāreyyaṃ, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
muggapaṭibhasta

nt. bag of mung beans; (comm) broken mung beans [mugga + paṭibhasta] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning bag of mung beans; (comm) broken mung beans
Construction mugga + paṭibhasta
Commentary (MNt) taṇḍulapaṭibhastānī'ti taṇḍulakhaṇḍāni. muggapaṭibhastakaḷāyapaṭibhastesu'pi es'eva nayo.
muggamatta

adj. size of a mung bean [mugga + matta] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning size of a mung bean
Construction mugga + matta
muggamuṭṭhi

fem. handful of mung beans [muggamuṭṭhi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning handful of mung beans
Construction muggamuṭṭhi
muggayūsa

masc. mung bean broth; mung soup [mugga + yūsa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mung bean broth; mung soup
Construction mugga + yūsa
Compound kammadhāraya (mugga + yūsa)
Sanskrit mudgayūṣa

Example

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, etadahosi, yaṃnūn'āhaṃ thokaṃ thokaṃ āhāraṃ āhāreyyaṃ, pasataṃ pasataṃ, yadi vā muggayūsaṃ, yadi vā kulatthayūsaṃ, yadi vā kaḷāyayūsaṃ, yadi vā hareṇukayūsan'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ

masc. club; mace; mallet ~

Synonym musala

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning blow with a mallet
Construction muggara + pahāra

masc. heap of beans [mugga + rāsi] ~

Meaning heap of beans
Construction mugga + rāsi
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (muggānaṃ + rāsi)
Synonym māsācita
Sanskrit mudga + rāśi
muggasūpa

masc. mung dahl; mung bean sauce [mugga + sūpa] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mung dahl; mung bean sauce
Construction mugga + sūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (mugga + sūpa)
Commentary (VINa) muggasūpo māsasūpo'ti ettha kulatth'ādīhi katasūpā'pi saṅgahaṃ gacchanti'y'evā'ti mahāpaccariyaṃ vuttaṃ.
Sanskrit mudga + sūpa

Example

sūpo nāma dve sūpā, muggasūpo, māsasūpo. hatthahāriyo samasūpako piṇḍapāto paṭiggahetabbo. yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sūpaññ'eva bahuṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.

VIN 2.7.3 khambhakatavaggo
muggasūpiya

adj. like mung dahl; like mung bean sauce [mugga + sūpa + iya] ~

Grammar adj, comp, from muggasūpa

Construction mugga + sūpa + iya
muggasūpa + iya

Sanskrit mudga + sūpika
muṅgusa

masc. mongoose ✗

mucalindamūla

nt. foot of a Mucalinda tree [mucalinda + mūla] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning foot of a Mucalinda tree
Construction mucalinda + mūla
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mucalindassa + mūla)
Commentary (UDa) mucalindavaggassa paṭhame mucalindamūle'ti ettha mucalindo vuccati nīparukkho. so niculo'tipi vuccati, tassa samīpe. keci pana mucalo'ti tassa rukkhassa nāmaṃ, taṃ vanajeṭṭhakatāya pana mucalindo'ti vuttan'ti vadanti.
Sanskrit mucilinda + mūla

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā uruvelāyaṃ viharati najjā nerañjarāya tīre mucalindamūle paṭhamābhisambuddho. tena kho pana samayena bhagavā satt'āhaṃ ekapallaṅkena nisinno hoti vimuttisukhapaṭisaṃvedī.

UD11 mucalindasuttaṃ
mucalindavagga

masc. Chapter 2 of the Udāna (UD 11-20) ✗
mucalindasutta

nt. Udāna 11 (UD 11) ✗
muccati 1.1

pr. (+abl) is free (from); becomes free (from); is released (from) [√muc + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of muñcati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning is free (from); becomes free (from); is released (from)
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)
Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction mucca + ti
Phonetic Change y > c
Sanskrit mucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Examples

na antalikkhe na samuddamajjhe,
na pabbatānaṃ vivaraṃ pavissa,
na vijjatī so jagatippadeso,
yatthaṭṭhito mucceyya pāpakammā.

DHP 127 pāpavaggo

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ, mahāvaggo 5
muccati 1.2

pr. (+instr) becomes free (by); is freed (by); is released (by) [√muc + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of muñcati, intrans (+instr)
Meaning becomes free (by); is freed (by); is released (by)
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)
Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction mucca + ti
Phonetic Change y > c
Sanskrit mucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Examples

kenassu bajjhatī loko,
kissa vinayāya muccati,
kissassu vippahānena,
sabbaṃ chindati bandhanan'ti.

SN 1.69 icchāsuttaṃ

icchāya bajjhatī loko,
icchāvinayāya muccati,
icchāya vippahānena,
sabbaṃ chindati bandhanan'ti.

SN 1.69 icchāsuttaṃ
muccati 1.3

pr. (+abl) runs freely (from); is released (from); lit. is free [√muc + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass of muñcati, intrans (+abl)
Meaning runs freely (from); is released (from); lit. is free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)
Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction mucca + ti
Phonetic Change y > c
Sanskrit mucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Examples

n'āhaṃ taṃ passāmi samaṇaṃ vā brāhmaṇaṃ vā, saṅghiṃ gaṇiṃ gaṇ'ācariyaṃ, api arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ paṭijānamānaṃ, yo mayā vādena vādaṃ samāraddho na saṅkampeyya na sampakampeyya na sampavedheyya, yassa na kacchehi sedā mucceyyuṃ.

MN 35 cūḷasaccakasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, aggivessana, dantebhi dantam'ādhāya jivhāya tāluṃ āhacca cetasā cittaṃ abhiniggaṇhato abhinippīḷayato abhisantāpayato kacchehi sedā muccanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
muccati 1.4

pr. stands freely; lit. is free [√muc + ya + ti] ~

Grammar pr, pass of muñcati, intrans
Meaning stands freely; lit. is free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ya (release, free)

Construction mucca + ti
Phonetic Change y > c
Sanskrit mucyate
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)
muccati 2.1

pr. thickens; turns; sours [√mucch + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans
Meaning thickens; turns; sours
Root Family √mucch
Root √mucch･1 a (thicken, fixate)
Base √mucch + a > muccha > mucca (irreg)
Construction mucca + ti
Commentary (DHPa) sajjukhīraṃ vā'ti taṃ khaṇaṃ'y'eva dhenuyā thanehi nikkhantaṃ abbhuṇhaṃ khīraṃ na muccati na pariṇamati. idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, yathā idaṃ sajjukhīraṃ taṃ khaṇaññ'eva na muccati na pariṇamati na pakatiṃ vijahati.
Sanskrit mūrchati
Sanskrit Root √mūrch √murch 1 (thicken)

Example

na hi pāpaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ,
sajju khīraṃ'va muccati,
ḍahantaṃ bālam'anveti,
bhasmacchanno'va pāvako.

muccitukāma

adj. wanting to escape; desiring to get away; wanting to be free [muccituṃ + kāma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning wanting to escape; desiring to get away; wanting to be free
Construction muccituṃ + kāma
Compound tuṃpaccaya tappurisa (muccituṃ + kāma)
Sanskrit muc + kāma

Example

so taṃ parisaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamati. so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca muccitu'kāmo gacchati.

MN 91 brahmāyusuttaṃ

Base √muc + ya > mucca (pass)
Construction mucca + ituṃ

Commentary (MNa) muccitukāmo'ti ekacco hi paṭisaṃmuñcitvā gacchati, vegena anubandhitabbo hoti.

so taṃ parisaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā pakkamati. so n'ātisīghaṃ gacchati, n'ātisaṇikaṃ gacchati, na ca muccitu'kāmo gacchati.

muccitvā

abs. having become free [√muc] ✗
mucchati

pr. becomes unconscious or infatuated, faints [√mucch] ✗
mucchana

nt. fainting, unconsciousness, infatuation [√mucch] ✗
mucchanā

fem. fainting, unconsciousness, infatuation [√mucch] ✗
mucchanīya

ptp. entrancing; enchanting; bewitching; lit. to be fixated on [√mucch + anīya] ✓

Grammar ptp of mucchati

Construction √mucch + anīya
Derivative kicca (anīya)
Sanskrit mūrch
Sanskrit Root √mūrch √murch 1 (thicken)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, rañño vā rājamahāmattassa vā vīṇāya saddo assutapubbo assa. so vīṇāsaddaṃ suṇeyya. so evaṃ vadeyya, ambho, kassa nu kho eso saddo evaṃrajanīyo evaṃkamanīyo evaṃmadanīyo evaṃmucchanīyo evaṃbandhanīyo'ti?

SN 35.246 vīṇopamasuttaṃ
mucchanta

prp. becoming unconscious or infatuated [√mucch] ✗

Grammar fem, abstr, from mucchati (+loc)
Meaning infatuation (with); obsession (with); extravagant passion (for); lit. thickening
Root Family √mucch
Root √mucch･1 a (thicken, fixate)
Construction √mucch + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Commentary (MNa) mucchākaraṇavasena mucchā.
Sanskrit mūrchā

Example

yo ca nesaṃ kāmesu kāmacchando kāmasneho kāmamucchā kāmapipāsā kāmapariḷāho, so ca ajjhattaṃ na suppahīno hoti, na suppaṭippassaddho ... abhabbā'va te ñāṇāya dassanāya anuttarāya sambodhāya.

mucchi

tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ gadhitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

SN 2.25 jantusuttaṃ
mucchitvā

abs. having become unconscious or infatuated [√mucch] ✗
mucchiya

ger. becoming unconscious or infatuated [√mucch] ✗
muñcaka

adj. who releases, emitting [√muc] ✗
muñcati 1

pr. (+acc) releases; lets go; lit. frees [√muc + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning releases; lets go; lit. frees
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Base √muc + ṃa > muñca
Construction muñca + ti
Sanskrit muñcati
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

muñca pure muñca pacchato,
majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū,
sabbattha vimuttamānaso,
na punaṃ jātijaraṃ upehisi.

DHP 348 taṇhāvaggo
muñcati 2

pr. (+dat) gets angry (with); lit. releases [√muc + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+dat)
Meaning gets angry (with); lit. releases
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Base √muc + ṃa > muñca
Construction muñca + ti
Sanskrit muñcati
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

na brāhmaṇassa pahareyya,
n'āssa muñcetha brāhmaṇo,
dhī brāhmaṇassa hantāraṃ,
tato dhī y'assa muñcati.

DHP 389 brāhmaṇavaggo
muñcati 3

pr. (+acc) (of speech) emits; let's loose; lit. frees [√muc + ṃa + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning (of speech) emits; let's loose; lit. frees
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Base √muc + ṃa > muñca
Construction muñca + ti
Sanskrit muñcati
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

attānaṃ na dade poso,
attānaṃ na pariccaje,
vācaṃ muñceyya kalyāṇaṃ,
pāpikañ'ca na mocaye'ti.

muñcanta 2

prp. (+acc and +abl) loosening, delivering, sending off, giving up [√muc] ✗
muñcamāna

prp. releasing, loosening, delivering, sending off, emitting, giving up [√muc] ✗
muñcāpesi

muñci

aor. released, loosened, delivered, sent off, emitted, gave up [√muc] ✗

muñcituṃ

inf. (of an arrow) to release; to shoot [√muc] ✗
muñcitvā 1

abs. (+acc) having released; having let go [√muc + ṃa + itvā] ✓

Grammar abs of muñcati, trans (+acc)

Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)

Synonym vissajjetvā

Examples

seyyathā'pi bhikkhave makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati taṃ muñcitvā aññaṃ gaṇhati

SN 12.61 assutavāsuttaṃ

bhante, idaṃ udakaṃ dārakassa sīse āsiñcāmā'ti āpucchitvā, tena hi āsiñcathā'ti vutte tathā akāsi. sā devatā tāva'd'eva taṃ muñcitvā gantvā leṇadvāre aṭṭhāsi.

DHPa 2.26.21 pabbhāravāsī tissatthera vatthu
muñcitvā 2

Grammar abs of muñcati, trans (+acc)
Meaning having opened; having untied (a bag); lit. having released

Construction muñca + itvā

tam'enaṃ cakkhumā puriso muñcitvā paccavekkheyya ime sālī, ime vīhī ime muggā ime māsā ime tilā ime taṇḍulā'ti

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ
muñciya

ger. releasing, loosening, delivering, sending off, emitting, giving up [√muc] ✗
muñcīyati

pr. is freed or released [√muc] ✗
muñja 1

masc. grass used for thatching roofs, basketmaking and for ropes; Saccharum Muñja ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning grass used for thatching roofs, basketmaking and for ropes; Saccharum Muñja
Web Link https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saccharum_munja
Sanskrit muñja

Examples

saññācikā nāma sayaṃ yācitvā purisam'pi puris'atthakaram'pi goṇam'pi sakaṭam'pi vāsim'pi parasum'pi kuṭhārim'pi kudālam'pi nikhādanam'pi vallim'pi veḷum'pi muñjam'pi pabbajam'pi tiṇam'pi mattikam'pi.

VIN 1.2.6 kuṭikārasikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, mahārāja, puriso muñjamhā īsikaṃ pavāheyya. tassa evam'assa ayaṃ muñjo, ayaṃ īsikā, añño muñjo, aññā īsikā, muñjamhā tv'eva īsikā pavāḷhā'ti.

DN 2.25 sāmaññaphalasuttaṃ
muñja 2

nt. fish [muñja] ✗
muñjakesa

adj. with a mane like muñja grass ✗
muñjatiṇa

nt. muñja grass [muñja + tiṇa] ~

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning muñja grass
Construction muñja + tiṇa
muñjapabbajabhūta

adj. (entwined) like muñja grass and reeds [muñja + pabbaja + bhūta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning (entwined) like muñja grass and reeds
Construction muñja + pabbaja + bhūta
Compound kammadhāraya (muñjapabbaja + bhūta)
Commentary (ANa) muñjapabbajabhūto'ti muñjatiṇaṃ viya pabbajatiṇaṃ viya ca bhūto, t'ādiso jāto.
Sanskrit muñja + balbaja + bhūta

Example

taṇhaṃ vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi jāliniṃ saritaṃ visaṭaṃ visattikaṃ, yāya ayaṃ loko uddhasto pariyonaddho tant'ākulakajāto gulāguṇṭhikajāto muñjapabbajabhūto apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ saṃsāraṃ n'ātivattati.

AN 4.199 taṇhāsuttaṃ
muñjamaya

adj. made of muñja grass [muñja + maya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning made of muñja grass
Construction muñja + maya
Sanskrit muñja

Example

kocchaṃ nāma, vākamayaṃ vā usīramayaṃ vā muñjamayaṃ vā pabbajamayaṃ vā anto saṃveṭhetvā baddhaṃ hoti.

VIN 2.5.2.4 paṭhamasenāsanasikkhāpadaṃ
muṭṭha

pp. forgotten; confused; lost [√mus + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of mussati
Meaning forgotten; confused; lost
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)
Construction √mus + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change st > ṭṭh
Antonym upaṭṭhita
Synonym pamuṭṭha
Sanskrit mṛṣ
Sanskrit Root √mṛṣ 1, 4 (not heed)

Example

rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā,
piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto,
sārattacitto vedeti,
tañ'ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ
muṭṭhasacca

nt. forgetfulness ✗
muṭṭhasati

adj. unmindful; forgetful; muddle-minded; lit. forgotten memory [muṭṭha + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unmindful; forgetful; muddle-minded; lit. forgotten memory
Construction muṭṭha + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (muṭṭha + sati)
Antonym upaṭṭhitasati
Variant muṭṭhassati
Sanskrit mṛṣita + smṛti

Example

upaṭṭhitasatiss'āyaṃ dhammo n'āyaṃ dhammo muṭṭhasatissa

AN 8.30 anuruddha mahāvitakkasuttaṃ
muṭṭhassacca

nt. lack of awareness; loss of mindfulness [muṭṭha + sati + ya] ~

Grammar nt, abstr, comp
Meaning lack of awareness; loss of mindfulness
Construction muṭṭha + sati + ya
muṭṭhassati + ya
Derivative taddhita (ya)
muṭṭhassati

adj. unmindful; forgetful; muddle-minded; lit. forgotten memory [muṭṭha + sati] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning unmindful; forgetful; muddle-minded; lit. forgotten memory
Construction muṭṭha + sati
Compound kammadhāraya (muṭṭha + sati)
Antonym upaṭṭhitassati
Variant muṭṭhasati, muṭṭhassatī
Commentary (SNa) muṭṭhassatino'ti naṭṭhassatino sativirahitā, idha kataṃ ettha pamussanti.
Sanskrit mṛṣita + smṛti

Examples

ye'me, bho gotama, puggalā ... kusītā hīnavīriyā muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, na tehi bhavaṃ gotamo saddhiṃ saṃvasati.

MN 107 gaṇakamoggallānasuttaṃ

n'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, muṭṭhassatissa asampajānassa ānāpānassatiṃ vadāmi. tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, citte citt'ānupassī tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
muṭṭhassatiasampajānasandosahetu

ind. due to the defilement of being unmindful and not clearly aware [muṭṭhassati + asampajāna + sandosahetu] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning due to the defilement of being unmindful and not clearly aware
Construction muṭṭhassati + asampajāna + sandosahetu
Sanskrit mṛṣita + smṛti + asamprajāna + saṃdosa + hetu

Example

ye kho keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā araññavanapatthāni pantāni sen'āsanāni paṭisevanti, muṭṭhassatiasampajānasandosahetu have te bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā akusalaṃ bhayabheravaṃ avhāyanti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ
muṭṭhassatisutta 1

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 37.13 (SN37.13) ✗
muṭṭhassatisutta 2

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.210 (AN5.210) ✗
muṭṭhassatī

masc. who is forgetful; who is unmindful; lit. forgotten memory [muṭṭha + sati + ī] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning who is forgetful; who is unmindful; lit. forgotten memory
Construction muṭṭha + sati + ī
muṭṭhassati + ī
Derivative taddhita (ī)
Sanskrit mṛṣita + smṛti
muṭṭhi 1

masc. fist ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning fist
Synonym pāṇidaṇḍa
Sanskrit muṣṭi

Examples

muṭṭhīhi'pi yujjhanti, raṅgamajjhe'pi saṅghāṭiṃ pattharitvā naccakiṃ evaṃ vadanti, idha, bhagini, naccassū'ti, nalāṭikam'pi denti, vividham'pi anācāraṃ ācaranti.

VIN 1.2.13 kuladūsaka sikkhāpadaṃ

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, satti tiṇhaphalā. atha puriso āgaccheyya, ahaṃ imaṃ sattiṃ tiṇhaphalaṃ pāṇinā vā muṭṭhinā vā paṭileṇissāmi paṭikoṭṭissāmi paṭivaṭṭessāmī'ti.

muṭṭhi 2

fem. handful; bunch ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning handful; bunch
Synonym hattha
Sanskrit muṣṭi

Example

migaluddo pure āsiṃ,
araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ,
tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.

APA 523 tiṇamuṭṭhidāyaka therāpadānaṃ

masc. handbook, pocketbook ✗
muṭṭhimalla

masc. wrestler, boxer ✗
muṭṭhiyuddha

nt. boxing ✗
muṇḍa 1

adj. bald; bald-headed; shaven [√muṇḍ + a] ✓

Grammar adj, from muṇḍati
Meaning bald; bald-headed; shaven
Root Family √muṇḍ
Root √muṇḍ･1 a (be bald, shave)
Construction √muṇḍ + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym muṇḍaka, muṇḍika
Sanskrit muṇḍa
Sanskrit Root √muṇḍ 1 (cut)

Examples

muṇḍo virūpo abhisāpam'āgato,
kapālahattho'va kulesu bhikkhasu,
yuñjassu satthuvacane mah'esino,
itissu maṃ citta pure niyuñjasi.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā

rukkhamūlaṃ'va nissāya,
muṇḍo saṅghāṭipāruto,
paññāya uttamo thero,
upatisso'va jhāyati.

TH 259 sāriputtattheragāthā
muṇḍa 2

adj. void of vegetation, bare [√muṇḍ] ✗
muṇḍaka 1

adj. bald; bald-headed; shaven [√muṇḍ + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, derog, dimin of muṇḍa
Meaning bald; bald-headed; shaven
Root Family √muṇḍ
Root √muṇḍ･1 a (be bald, shave)
Construction √muṇḍ + a + ka
muṇḍa + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Synonym muṇḍa, muṇḍika
Commentary (MNa) muṇḍakā'tiādīsu muṇḍe muṇḍā'ti samaṇe ca samaṇā'ti vattuṃ vaṭṭeyya, ime pana hīḷentā muṇḍakā samaṇakā'ti āhaṃsu.
Sanskrit muṇḍaka
Sanskrit Root √muṇḍ 1 (cut)

Example

evam'ev'ime muṇḍakā samaṇakā ibbhā kiṇhā bandhupād'āpaccā, jhāyino'smā jhāyino'smā'ti pattakkhandhā adhomukhā madhurakajātā jhāyanti pajjhāyanti nijjhāyanti apajjhāyanti.

Examples

UD 69 udapānasuttaṃ

addasā kho aggikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ dūrato'va āgacchantaṃ. disvāna bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, tatr'eva, muṇḍaka, tatr'eva, samaṇaka, tatr'eva, vasalaka tiṭṭhāhī'ti.

SN 41.9 acelakassapasuttaṃ
muṇḍesi

aor. shaved [√muṇḍ] ✗
muta 1

pp. sensed; perceived; known; (comm) smelled; tasted or touched [√mun + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of munāti
Meaning sensed; perceived; known; (comm) smelled; tasted or touched
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Antonym amuta
Commentary (VIN 2.5.1.1) mutaṃ nāma ghānena ghāyitaṃ, jivhāya sāyitaṃ, kāyena phuṭṭhaṃ.
Sanskrit mata
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

yadattanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ,
diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tadeva so tattha samuggahāya,
nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.

SNP 43 paramaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 5

ucc'āvacā hi paṭipadā,
samaṇena pakāsitā,
na pāraṃ diguṇaṃ yanti,
na'y'idaṃ ekaguṇaṃ mutaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
muta 2

nt. what is sensed; what is perceived; what is known [√mun + ta] ✓

Grammar nt, from munāti
Meaning what is sensed; what is perceived; what is known
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Antonym amuta
Sanskrit mata
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

yato kho te bāhiya diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati tato tvaṃ bāhiya na tena

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

udabindu yathā'pi pokkhare,
padume vāri yathā na limpati,
evaṃ muni n'opalimpati,
yadidaṃ diṭṭhasutaṃ mutesu vā.

SNP 44 jarāsuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 6
mutatta

masc. who knows; enlightened being; lit. understood self [muta + atta] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning who knows; enlightened being; lit. understood self
Construction muta + atta
Commentary (SNa) mut'attā'ti evaṃ samecca abhisamecca vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya paṭivijjhitvā mut'attā pariññātattabhāvā paṇḍitā caranti viharanti.
mutamatta

adj. merely the sensed; only what is perceived; only the known; lit. sensed amount [muta + matta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning merely the sensed; only what is perceived; only the known; lit. sensed amount
Construction muta + matta
Compound kammadhāraya (muta + matta)
Sanskrit mata + mātra

Examples

ettha ca te, māluṅkyaputta, diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissati.

SN 35.95 mālukyaputtasuttaṃ

tasmā't'iha te, bāhiya, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, diṭṭhe diṭṭhamattaṃ bhavissati, sute sutamattaṃ bhavissati, mute mutamattaṃ bhavissati, viññāte viññātamattaṃ bhavissatī'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ
mutavāditar

masc. (+loc) who speaks about the sensed (as); who states what one has perceived (as) [muta + vāditar] ✓

Grammar masc, agent, comp (+loc)
Meaning who speaks about the sensed (as); who states what one has perceived (as)
Construction muta + vāditar
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (mutaṃ + vāditar)
Antonym amutavāditar
Sanskrit mata + vaditṛ

Examples

diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā, ime kho, āvuso, cattāro vohārā tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena samma'd'akkhātā.

MN 112 chabbisodhanasuttaṃ

aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, ariyavohārā. katame aṭṭha? adiṭṭhe adiṭṭhavāditā, asute asutavāditā, amute amutavāditā, aviññāte aviññātavāditā, diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā.

AN 8.68 ariyavohārasuttaṃ
mutavādī

adj. (+loc) who speaks about the sensed (as); who states what one has perceived (as) [muta + vādī] ~

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning who speaks about the sensed (as); who states what one has perceived (as)
Construction muta + vādī
Antonym amutavādī
muti

fem. opinion; thought; belief [√mun + ti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from munāti
Meaning opinion; thought; belief
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + ti
Derivative kita (ti)
Phonetic Change nt > t
Synonym diṭṭhi
Sanskrit mati
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

na vedagū diṭṭhiyā na mutiyā,
sa mānam'eti na hi tammayo so,
na kammunā no'pi sutena neyyo,
anūpanīto sa nivesanesu.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
mutiṅgasadda

masc. sound of a drum ✗
mutiṇga

masc. small drum ✗
mutimant

adj. intelligent; clever; wise; lit. having knowing quality [√mun + ti + mant] ✓

Grammar adj, from muti
Meaning intelligent; clever; wise; lit. having knowing quality
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + ti + mant
muti + mant
Derivative taddhita (mant)
Synonym ñāṇī, dhīra, nipaka, pañña, paññava, paññavant, paññāṇavant, paññāvant, paṇḍita, viññū, sapañña, sappañña
Sanskrit matimat
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

antagū'si pāragū dukkhassa,
arahā'si sammāsambuddho khīṇ'āsavaṃ taṃ maññe.
jutimā mutimā pahūtapañño,
dukkhass'antakaraṃ atāresi maṃ.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
mutīmā

adj. intelligent; clever; wise; lit. having thought quality [√mun + ti + mant + ā] ✓

Grammar adj, masc nom sg of mutimant
Meaning intelligent; clever; wise; lit. having thought quality
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + ti + mant + ā
muti + mant + ā
Phonetic Change nt > t
with metrically lengthened ī
Variant mutimā
Sanskrit matimat
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

sandiṭṭhiyā c'eva vīvadātā,
saṃsuddhapaññā kusalā mutīmā,
na tesaṃ koci parihīnapañño,
diṭṭhī hi tesam'pi tathā samattā.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
mutta 1.1

nt. urine ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning urine
Synonym passāva, meha
Sanskrit mūtra

Examples

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo, assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttaṃ … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
mutta 2.1

pp. (+abl) released (from); freed (from); liberated (from); let loose (from) [√muc + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of muñcati (+abl)
Meaning released (from); freed (from); liberated (from); let loose (from)
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction √muc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Synonym nissaṭa, vippamutta
Sanskrit mukta
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Examples

sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetu yam'ahaṃ bhagavato dhammaṃ sutvā eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto vihareyyan'ti. upādiyamāno kho, bhikkhu, baddho mārassa, anupādiyamāno mutto pāpimato'ti.

SN 22.63 upādiyamānasuttaṃ

yo ca pubbe pamajjitvā,
pacchā so nappamajjati,
so'maṃ lokaṃ pabhāseti,
abbhā mutto'va candimā.

DHP 172 lokavaggo
mutta 2.2

pp. (+abl) (of illness) recovered (from); lit. freed [√muc + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of muñcati (+abl)
Meaning (of illness) recovered (from); lit. freed
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction √muc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Synonym vuṭṭhita
Sanskrit mukta
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

so'mhi eta'r'ahi tamhā ābādhā mutto

MN 39 mahāassapurasuttaṃ
mutta 2.3

adj. quick; rapid; swift; lit. free [√muc + ta] ✓

Grammar pp of muñcati, in comps
Meaning quick; rapid; swift; lit. free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction √muc + ta
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change c > t
Antonym yutta
Synonym lahu, lahuka, sīgha
Commentary (ANt) pucchān'antaram'eva sīghaṃ byākātuṃ asamatthatāya no muttappaṭibhānam'assā'ti no muttappaṭibhāno.
Sanskrit mukta
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

cattāro'me, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ. katame cattāro? yuttappaṭibhāno, no muttappaṭibhāno, muttappaṭibhāno, no yuttappaṭibhāno, yuttappaṭibhāno ca muttappaṭibhāno ca, n'eva yuttappaṭibhāno na muttappaṭibhāno

AN 4.132 paṭibhānasuttaṃ
muttakaraṇa

nt. male or female organ ✗
muttakarīsa

nt. urine and excrement [mutta + karīsa] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning urine and excrement
Construction mutta + karīsa
Compound dvanda (mutta ca karīsa ca)
Sanskrit mūtra + karīṣa

Examples

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9

ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan'ti?

AN 3.36 devadūtasuttaṃ
muttakarīsakheḷasiṅghāṇikā

Meaning urine, excrement, saliva and snot
Construction muttakarīsa + kheḷa + siṅghāṇikā

fem. pearl; lit. set free [√muc + ta + ā + akā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from mutta
Meaning pearl; lit. set free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 ṃa (release, free)
Construction √muc + ta + ā + akā
muttā + akā

Synonym muttā
Commentary (THIa) kañcanamaṇimuttakan'ti kañcanena maṇimuttāhi ca yuttaṃ, suvaṇṇamayamaṇimuttāhi khacitan'ti attho.
Sanskrit muktikā
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

kāsikasukhumāni dhāraya,
abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇakaṃ,
kañcanamaṇimuttakaṃ bahuṃ,
vividhaṃ ābharaṇaṃ karomi te.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi, rāhula, āpasmiṃ sucim'pi dhovanti, asucim'pi dhovanti, gūthagatam'pi dhovanti, muttagatam'pi dhovanti, kheḷagatam'pi dhovanti, pubbagatam'pi dhovanti, lohitagatam'pi dhovanti, na ca tena āpo aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā, evam'eva kho tvaṃ, rāhula, āposamaṃ bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ

Example

AN 7.6 vitthatadhanasuttaṃ

adj. giving freely; generous; open handed [mutta + cāgī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning giving freely; generous; open handed

VIN 1.4.1.8 upakkhaṭasikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning free from social conventions; who has rejected social norms
Construction mutta + ācāra
Compound kammadhāraya (mutta + ācāra)

Examples

acelako ce'pi, kassapa, hoti, mutt'ācāro, hatth'āpalekhano ... iti evarūpaṃ addhamāsikam'pi pariyāyabhattabhojan'ānuyogam'anuyutto viharati.

DN 8.5 mahāsīhanādasuttaṃ

seyyath'idaṃ, nando vaccho, kiso saṃkicco, makkhali gosālo, etehi, bho gotama, acelakā mutt'ācārā hatth'āpalekhanā naehibhaddantikā natiṭṭhabhaddantikā na abhihaṭaṃ na uddissakataṃ na nimantanaṃ sādiyanti

muditaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. muditañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yā arati sā pahīyissati.

AN 6.13 nissāraṇīyasuttaṃ

Meaning devoted to the development of happiness (for); engaged in the cultivation of appreciation

Example

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe muditābhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
muditāsutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 46.64 (SN46.64) ✗
mudindriya

adj. with dull mental faculties; with a slow mind; lit. soft faculties [mudu + indriya] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning with dull mental faculties; with a slow mind; lit. soft faculties
Construction mudu + indriya
Compound kammadhāraya (mudu + indriya)
Antonym tikkhindriya
Commentary (MNa) yesaṃ saddh'ādīni indriyāni tikkhāni, te tikkh'indriyā. yesaṃ tāni mudūni, te mud'indriyā.
Sanskrit mṛdu + indriya

Example

addasaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, buddhacakkhunā lokaṃ volokento satte apparaj'akkhe mahāraj'akkhe, tikkh'indriye mud'indriye, svākāre dvākāre, suviññāpaye duviññāpaye, app'ekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, app'ekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
mudu 1

adj. soft; mild [√mud + u] ✓

Grammar adj, from modati
Meaning soft; mild
Root Family √mud
Root √mud･1 a (be soft, happy)
Construction √mud + u
Derivative kita (u)
Synonym saṇha, sūrata
Sanskrit mṛdu
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

karaṇīyam'atthakusalena,
yantaṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca,
sakko ujū ca sūjū ca,
suvaco c'assa mudu anatimānī.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe,
saṃpupphite meghanibhamhi kānane,
nag'antare viṭapisamo sayissaṃ,
taṃ me mudū hehiti tūlasannibhaṃ.

TH 262 tālapuṭattheragāthā
mudu 2

adj. flexible; pliable; malleable; plastic; lit. soft [√mud + u] ✓

Grammar adj, from modati
Meaning flexible; pliable; malleable; plastic; lit. soft
Root Family √mud
Root √mud･1 a (be soft, happy)
Construction √mud + u
Derivative kita (u)
Sanskrit mṛdu
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

yato kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu taṃ tadeva samāpattiṃ samāpajjati'pi vuṭṭhāti'pi, tassa mudu cittaṃ hoti kammaññaṃ. mudunā kammaññena cittena appamāṇo samādhi hoti subhāvito.

AN 9.35 gāvīupamāsuttaṃ

taṃ hoti jātarūpaṃ dhantaṃ sandhantaṃ niddhantaṃ aniddhantaṃ anihitaṃ aninnītakasāvaṃ, na c'eva mudu hoti na ca kammaniyaṃ, na ca pabhassaraṃ pabhaṅgu ca, na ca sammā upeti kammāya.

muduka

Synonym tanu, sukumāra, sukhumāla
Sanskrit mṛduka
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

dātā ca ahosi sukhumānaṃ mudukānaṃ attharaṇānaṃ pāvuraṇānaṃ khomasukhumānaṃ kappāsikasukhumānaṃ koseyyasukhumānaṃ kambalasukhumānaṃ

DN 30.10 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ

bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

muducitta

adj. receptive; impressionable; (comm) without defilements of views and conceit; lit. pliable mind [mudu + citta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning receptive; impressionable; (comm) without defilements of views and conceit; lit. pliable mind
Construction mudu + citta

Commentary (UDa) diṭṭhimān'ādisaṃkilesavigamena muducittaṃ
Sanskrit mṛdu + citta

Example

yadā bhagavā aññāsi brahmāyuṃ brāhmaṇaṃ kallacittaṃ muducittaṃ vinīvaraṇacittaṃ udaggacittaṃ pasannacittaṃ, atha yā buddhānaṃ sāmukkaṃsikā dhammadesanā taṃ pakāsesi, dukkhaṃ, samudayaṃ, nirodhaṃ, maggaṃ.

mudujātika

adj. of tender nature ✗

Meaning with soft level ground

Example

JAa 1.N.1 sumedha kathā

bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatam'addhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabimbohanāsu yāvasūriy'uggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.

muddā 1

fem. calculation; mathematics; lit. finger counting [√mud + rā] ✓

Meaning calculation; mathematics; lit. finger counting
Root Family √mud
Root √mud･1 a (be soft, happy)
Construction √mud + rā

Phonetic Change r > d
Commentary (MNa) muddā'ti aṅgulipabbesu saññaṃ ṭhapetvā hatthamuddā.
Notes (MW) a partic. branch of education ('reckoning by the fingers')
Sanskrit mudrā
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

muddha 1.1

pp. foolish; stupid; ignorant; confused; drunk; lit. fooled [√muh + ta] ✓

Meaning head

Examples

ñattaṃ bālassa jāyati,
hanti bālassa sukk'aṃsaṃ,
muddham'assa vipātayaṃ.

DHP 72 bālavaggo

sace tvaṃ na byākarissasi aññena vā aññaṃ paṭicarissasi tuṇhī vā bhavissasi pakkamissasi vā etth'eva te sattadhā muddhā phalissati

masc. peak; summit; top ✓

Grammar masc, atta group
Meaning peak; summit; top
Synonym kūṭa, matthaka
Sanskrit mūrdhan

Example

sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
yathā'pi passe janataṃ samantato,
tath'ūpamaṃ dhammamayaṃ sumedho,
pāsādam'āruyha samantacakkhu,
sok'āvatiṇṇaṃ janatam'apetasoko,
avekkhati jātijar'ābhibhūtan'ti.

VIN PAT PC 83 antepurasikkhāpadaṃ
muddhāvasitta

adj. head-anointed; consecrated; inaugurated [muddhā + avasitta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning head-anointed; consecrated; inaugurated
Construction muddhā + avasitta
Compound sattamī tappurisa (muddhani + avasitta)
Variant muddhābhisitta
Commentary (VIN 2.5.9.3) muddh'āvasitto nāma khattiy'ābhisekena abhisitto hoti.
Sanskrit mūrdhan + avasikta

Examples

bhūtapubb'āhaṃ, bhikkhu, rājā ahosiṃ khattiyo muddh'āvasitto. tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhu, rañño sato khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa caturāsītinagarasahassāni ahesuṃ kusāvatī rājadhānippamukhāni.

SN 22.96 gomayapiṇḍasuttaṃ

yo pana bhikkhu rañño khattiyassa muddh'āvasittassa anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 83 antepurasikkhāpadaṃ

mudhappasanna

adj. deluded faith; misplaced confidence [mudha + pasanna] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deluded faith; misplaced confidence
Construction mudha + pasanna
Variant muddhappasanna
mudhā 1

ind. for free; gratis; for nothing [√muh + tā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv
Meaning for free; gratis; for nothing
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh + tā
Derivative kita (tā)
Commentary (SNPa) mudhā'ti abyayena kākaṇikamattam'pi byayaṃ akatvā.
Sanskrit mudhā (useless)
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

ye suppayuttā manasā daḷhena,
nikkāmino gotamasāsanamhi,
te pattipattā amataṃ vigayha,
laddhā mudhā nibbutiṃ bhuñjamānā,
idam'pi saṅghe ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ,
etena saccena suvatthi hotu.

SNP 13 ratanasuttaṃ,
cūḷavaggo 1
mudhā 2

ind. for nothing; for no purpose; uselessly [√muh] ✗
munāti

pr. (+acc) knows; understands [√mun + nā + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, trans (+acc)
Meaning knows; understands
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Base √mun + nā > munā
Construction munā + ti
Synonym avabujjhati, ājānāti, jānāti, pajānāti, bujjhati, vedeti
Sanskrit manute

Examples

pāpāni parivajjeti,
sa munī tena so muni,
yo munāti ubho loke,
muni tena pavuccati.

DHP 269 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

kī'icc'evam'ādito dhātugaṇato nāpaccayo hoti kattari. kiṇāti, jināti, dhunāti, munāti, lunāti, punāti.

kaccāyana ākhyātakappa 449
muni 1

Meaning monk; sage; seer; hermit; silent sage

Sanskrit muni
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

evaṃ diṭṭhā hi sā mayā,
rajjanti'pi virajjanti,
tattha kiṃ jiyyate muni.

TH 179 sāṭimattiyattheragāthā

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

TH 179 sāṭimattiyattheragāthā
muninda

masc. great sage ✗
munisutta

nt. Sutta Nipāta 1.12 (SNP 12) ✗
munī

masc. monk; sage; seer; hermit; silent sage [√mun + i] ✓

Grammar masc, masc nom sg, irreg form of muni
Meaning monk; sage; seer; hermit; silent sage
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun + i
muni > munī
Derivative kita (i)
Phonetic Change with metrically lengthened ī
Synonym isi, brāhmaṇa
Variant muni
Sanskrit muni
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

pāpāni parivajjeti,
sa munī tena so muni,
yo munāti ubho loke,
muni tena pavuccati.

DHP 269 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

accī yathā vātavegena khittā,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ,
evaṃ munī nāmakāyā vimutto,
atthaṃ paleti na upeti saṅkhaṃ.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6
muyhati

pr. (+loc) is deluded (by); is fooled (by); is deceived (by) [√muh + ya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, pass, intrans (+loc)
Meaning is deluded (by); is fooled (by); is deceived (by)
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + ya > muyha (pass)
Construction muyha + ti
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit muhyati
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

rajanīye rajjati, dussanīye dussati, mohanīye muyhati, kuppanīye kuppati, madanīye majjati.

AN 5.81 rajanīyasuttaṃ
muyhana 1

nt. being deluded; being fooled; being deceived [√muh + ya + ana] ~

Grammar nt, act, from muyhati, pass
Meaning being deluded; being fooled; being deceived
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + ya > muyha (pass)
Construction muyha + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change hy > yh (metathesis)
Sanskrit muhyana
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)
muyhana 2

nt. forgetfulness, infatuation [√muh] ✗
muyhamāna

prp. forgetting, becoming dull, infatuating [√muh] ✗
muyhi

aor. forgot, became dull, infatuated [√muh] ✗
muyhitvā

abs. having forgotten, having become dull, having infatuated [√muh] ✗
muraja

masc. tambourine ✗
murumurāyati

pr. bites up with a cracking sound ✗
murumuru

ind. munching sound; nom-nom (made when eating) [muru + muru] ✓

Grammar ind, onom
Meaning munching sound; nom-nom (made when eating)
Construction muru + muru

Example

bhante pubbe dīpino eḷake khādanti ahaṃ pana eḷake dīpino anubandhitvā murumurū'ti khādante addasaṃ

JAa 77 mahāsupina jātakavaṇṇanā

musati cakkhūni

idiom. dazzling; eye-popping ✗
musala 1

masc. mace; club; truncheon ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning mace; club; truncheon
Synonym daṇḍa, muggara
Sanskrit musala

Example

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

Meaning pestle; grinder; pounder

Meaning pick

Meaning function of a pestle

musalamantaraṃ

ind. across a mace; near a club [musalaṃ + antara + aṃ] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp, acc sg of musalamantara
Meaning across a mace; near a club
Construction musalaṃ + antara + aṃ
musalamantara + aṃ
Commentary (DNa) na eḷakam'antaran'ti ummāraṃ antaraṃ katvā diyyamānaṃ na gaṇhati. kasmā? ayaṃ maṃ nissāya antarakaraṇaṃ labhatī'ti. daṇḍamusalesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Sanskrit musala + antaram

Example

te na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhanti na eḷakam'antaraṃ na daṇḍam'antaraṃ na musalam'antaraṃ na dvinnaṃ bhuñjamānānaṃ na gabbhiniyā na pāyamānāya na puris'antaragatāya

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
musalī

adj. with a pestle in hand ✗
musā 1

ind. lie; falsehood [√mus + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg
Meaning lie; falsehood
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)
Construction √mus + ā
Antonym saccaṃ, amusā
Notes see SCPN §2
Sanskrit mṛṣā
Sanskrit Root √mṛṣ 1, 4 (not heed)

Examples

yam'āhu saccaṃ tathiyan'ti eke,
tam'āhu aññe tucchaṃ musā'ti,
evam'pi vigayha vivādayanti,
kasmā na ekaṃ samaṇā vadanti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12

evam'eva kho, rāhula, yassa kassaci sampajānamusāvāde n'atthi lajjā, n'āhaṃ tassa kiñci pāpaṃ akaraṇīyan'ti vadāmi. tasmā't'iha te, rāhula, hassā'pi na musā bhaṇissāmī'ti.

MN 61 ambalaṭṭhika rāhulovādasuttaṃ
musā 2

ind. falsely; untruthfully [√mus + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg
Meaning falsely; untruthfully
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)
Construction √mus + ā
Antonym saccaṃ, amusā
Synonym abhūtena
Commentary (DNa) musā'ti musāvādena.
Sanskrit mṛṣā
Sanskrit Root √mṛṣ 1, 4 (not heed)

Examples

ajānam'evaṃ āvuso avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi, tucchaṃ musā vilapin'ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 4 uttarimanussadhammasikkhāpadaṃ

sampajānamusāvāde pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 1 musāvādasikkhāpadaṃ
musā 3

ind. false; untrue; untruthful [√mus + ā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, instr sg
Meaning false; untrue; untruthful
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)
Construction √mus + ā
Antonym saccaṃ, amusā
Commentary (MNa) musā'ti nāsanakā. (MNt) visaṃvādan'aṭṭhena vā musā.
Sanskrit mṛṣā
Sanskrit Root √mṛṣ 1, 4 (not heed)

Example

aniccā, bhikkhave, kāmā tucchā musā mosadhammā. māyākatam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, bālalāpanaṃ.

MN 106 āneñjasappāyasuttaṃ
musā bhaṇati

idiom. lies; tells lies ✓

Grammar idiom, ind + pr
Meaning lies; tells lies
Sanskrit mṛṣā + bhaṇati

Examples

santi, gahapatayo, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino ... pāṇam'atipātayato, adinnaṃ ādiyato, sandhiṃ chindato, nillopaṃ harato, ekāgārikaṃ karoto, paripanthe tiṭṭhato, paradāraṃ gacchato, musā bhaṇato, karoto na karīyati pāpaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ

theyyaṃ na kāre na musā bhaṇeyya,
mettāya phasse tasathāvarāni,
yadāvilattaṃ manaso vijaññā,
kaṇhassa pakkho'ti vinodayeyya.

SNP 54 sāriputtasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 16
musāvāda

masc. lying; false speech [musā + vāda] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning lying; false speech
Construction musā + vāda
Compound abyayībhāva (musā + vāda)
Antonym saccavācā
Commentary (MNa) ayathāsabhāvaṃ musāvādaṃ karoti, sā musāvādo'ti veditabbā.
Sanskrit mṛṣāvāda

Examples

yo pāṇam'atipāteti,
musāvādañ'ca bhāsati,
loke adinnam'ādiyati,
paradārañ'ca gacchati.

DHP 246 malavaggo

pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinn'ādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti

AN 3.80 gandhajātasuttaṃ
musāvādapaccayā

ind. dependent on lying; due to false speech [musāvāda + paccayā] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning dependent on lying; due to false speech
Construction musāvāda + paccayā
Compound abyayībhāva (musāvāda + paccayā)
Sanskrit mṛṣāvāda + pratyayāt

Examples

idha, bhikkhave, ekacco ... sahā'pi dukkhena sahā'pi domanassena musāvādī hoti, musāvādapaccayā ca dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

MN 46 mahādhammasamādānasuttaṃ

ahañ'c'eva kho pana musāvādī assaṃ, attā'pi maṃ upavadeyya musāvādapaccayā, anuviccā'pi maṃ viññū garaheyyuṃ musāvādapaccayā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā musāvādapaccayā.

DHP 176 lokavaggo

taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gāmaṇi, idh'assa puriso pāṇ'ātipātī adinn'ādāyī kāmesumicchācārī musāvādī pisuṇavāco pharusavāco samphappalāpī abhijjhālu byāpannacitto micchādiṭṭhiko.

Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)

Construction mussa + ti

aṭṭhakavaggo 7

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, tasmiṃ samaye mussat'eva bhagavantaṃ ārabbha sati, mussati dhammaṃ ārabbha sati, mussati saṅghaṃ ārabbha sati.

muhutta

masc. moment; second [muhu + tta] ✓

Grammar masc, from muhu
Meaning moment; second
Construction muhu + tta
Derivative taddhita (tta)
Synonym thoka
Sanskrit muhūrta

Examples

tato aparena samayenā'ti yasmiṃ khaṇe samudāciṇṇaṃ hoti taṃ khaṇaṃ taṃ layaṃ taṃ muhuttaṃ vītivatte.

VIN 1.1.4 catutthapārājikaṃ
muhuttampi

sandhi. even for a moment; just for an instant [muhuttaṃ + api] ✓

Meaning even for a moment; just for an instant
Construction muhuttaṃ + api
Sanskrit muhūrta + api

Example

VIN PAT PC 77 sañciccasikkhāpadaṃ
muhuttaṃ

Meaning for a moment; for a second
Construction muhu + tta + aṃ
muhutta + aṃ
Sanskrit muhūrta

Examples

muhuttam'api ce viññū,
paṇḍitaṃ payirupāsati,
khippaṃ dhammaṃ vijānāti,
jivhā sūparasaṃ yathā.

yo hi, gahapati, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharanto muhuttam'pi ārogyaṃ paṭijāneyya, kimaññatra bālyā?

VIN 2.5.2.1 bhūtagāmasikkhāpadaṃ
mūla 1

nt. (of a tree) root; base; foot [√mūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (of a tree) root; base; foot
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Antonym agga
Sanskrit mūla, mūra
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Examples

kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti,
kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati,
kodhassa visamūlassa,
madhur'aggassa devate,
vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti,
tañ'hi jhatvā na socatī'ti.

SN 1.71 chetvāsuttaṃ

surāmerayapānañ'ca,
yo naro anuyuñjati,
idh'eva'm'eso lokasmiṃ,
mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.

DHP 247 malavaggo
mūla 2

nt. source; origin; root [√mūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning source; origin; root
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym nidāna
Sanskrit mūla, mūra
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Examples

yass'ānusayā na santi keci,
mūlā ca akusalā samūhatāse,
so bhikkhu jahāti orapāraṃ,
urago jiṇṇam'iva tacaṃ purāṇaṃ.

SNP 1 uragasuttaṃ
uragavaggo 1

upadhi dukkhassa mūlan'ti, iti viditvā nirupadhi upadhisaṅkhaye vimutto upadhismiṃ vā kāyaṃ upasaṃharissati cittaṃ vā uppādessatī'ti, n'etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
mūla 3

nt. money; cash; capital; moola [√mūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning money; cash; capital; moola
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Synonym pābhata, rūpiya
Sanskrit mūla, mūra
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Example

seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

AN 6.57 chaḷabhijātisuttaṃ
mūla 4

nt. (vinaya) (of a legal procedure) beginning; start [√mūl + a] ✓

Grammar nt
Meaning (vinaya) (of a legal procedure) beginning; start
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mūla, mūra
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Example

saṅghādiseso'ti saṅgho'va tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ deti, mūlāya paṭikassati, mānattaṃ deti, abbheti, na sambahulā, na ekapuggalo. tena vuccati, saṅghādiseso'ti.

VIN 1.2.1 sukkavissaṭṭhisikkhāpadaṃ
mūla 5

adj. original; first; primary [√mūl + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps
Meaning original; first; primary
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit mūla, mūra
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Example

tato ce uttari nikkhipeyya satiyā'pi paccāsāyā'ti tadah'uppanne mūlacīvare paccāsācīvaraṃ uppajjati, das'āhā kāretabbaṃ.

mūlaka 1

adj. (+nom) rooted in; originating in; stemming from; because of [√mūl + a + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from mūla (+nom)
Meaning rooted in; originating in; stemming from; because of
Root Family √mūl
Root √mūl･1 a (support)
Construction √mūl + a + ka
mūla + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Antonym amūlaka
Sanskrit mūlaka
Sanskrit Root √mūl 1 (be rooted)

Examples

evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ye keci kusalā dhammā, sabbe te appamādamūlakā appamādasamosaraṇā, appamādo tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati.

AN 10.15 appamādasuttaṃ

bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā bhagavaṃnettikā bhagavaṃpaṭisaraṇā. sādhu vata, bhante, bhagavantaṃ'y'eva paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho. bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī'ti.

mūlajāta

adj. (+loc) deeply rooted (in); lit. grown roots [mūla + jāta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp (+loc)
Meaning deeply rooted (in); lit. grown roots
Construction mūla + jāta
Compound kammadhāraya (mūla + jāta)
Commentary (MNa) mūlajātā'ti sot'āpattimaggavasena sañjātamūlā. sot'āpattimaggo hi saddhāya mūlaṃ nāma.
Sanskrit mūla + jāta

Examples

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, uṇṇābhassa brāhmaṇassa tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā daḷhā asaṃhāriyā samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṃ.

SN 48.42 uṇṇābhabrāhmaṇasuttaṃ

yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi tathāgate saddhā niviṭṭhā hoti mūlajātā patiṭṭhitā, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, ākāravatī saddhā dassanamūlikā

Examples

khettāni viceyya kevalāni,
dibbaṃ mānusakañ'ca brahmakhettaṃ,
sabbakhettamūlabandhanā pamutto,
khettajino tādi pavuccate tathattā.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
mūlabīja

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning plant which propagates from the root; root propagation; lit. root seed
Construction mūla + bīja
Compound pañcamī tappurisa (mūlā + bīja)

Sanskrit mūla + bīja

Examples

pañc'imāni, bhikkhave, bījajātāni. katamāni pañca? mūlabījaṃ, khandhabījaṃ, aggabījaṃ, phalubījaṃ, bījabījaññ'eva pañcamaṃ.

SN 22.54 bījasuttaṃ

mūlabījaṃ nāma, haliddi, siṅgiveraṃ, vacā, vacattaṃ, ativisā, kaṭukarohiṇī, usīraṃ, bhaddamūttakaṃ, yāni vā pan'aññāni'pi atthi mūle jāyanti, mūle sañjāyanti, etaṃ mūlabījaṃ nāma.

AN 3.102 paṃsudhovakasuttaṃ
mūsi

masc. rat; mouse; lit. stealer [√mus + *i] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning rat; mouse; lit. stealer
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･1 a (steal)
Construction √mus > mūs + *i
Derivative kita (*i)
Phonetic Change u > ū
Synonym mūsika, mūsikā
English Cognate mouse
Sanskrit mūṣa
Sanskrit Root √muṣ 6, 9 (steal)

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, biḷāro sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīre ṭhito ahosi mudumūsiṃ maggayamāno, yadā'yaṃ mudumūsi gocarāya pakkamissati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā khādissāmī'ti.

SN 20.10 biḷārasuttaṃ
mūsika

masc. rat; mouse; lit. stealer [√mus + *ika] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning rat; mouse; lit. stealer
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･1 a (steal)
Construction √mus > mūs + *ika

Phonetic Change u > ū
Synonym mūsi, mūsikā
English Cognate mouse
Sanskrit mūṣika
Sanskrit Root √muṣ 6, 9 (steal)

Examples

appamāṇo buddho, appamāṇo dhammo, appamāṇo saṅgho, pamāṇavantāni sarīsapāni. ahivicchikā satapadī, uṇṇanābhī sarabū mūsikā, katā me rakkhā katā me parittā, paṭikkamantu bhūtāni.

AN 4.67 ahirājasuttaṃ

seyyathā'pi nāma ulūko rukkhasākhāyaṃ mūsikaṃ maggayamāno jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.

fem. mouse; rat [√mus] ✗
mūḷha 1

masc. foolish person; deluded man; madman [√muh + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of muyhati
Meaning foolish person; deluded man; madman
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh + ta > mūḍha > mūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym amūḷha
Sanskrit mūḍha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Examples

tattha katamā cha gehasitā upekkhā? cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā uppajjati upekkhā bālassa mūḷhassa mandassa puthujjanassa anodhijinassa avipākajinassa anādīnavadassāvino assutavato puthujjanassa.

MN 137 saḷāyatanavibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yadapi, bhikkhave, moho tadapi akusalamūlaṃ. yadapi mūḷho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tadapi akusalaṃ.

AN 3.70 akusalamūlasuttaṃ
mūḷha 2

masc. who is lost; who is disoriented; (comm) who has lost one's bearings [√muh + ta] ✓

Grammar masc, pp of muyhati
Meaning who is lost; who is disoriented; (comm) who has lost one's bearings
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh + ta > mūḍha > mūḷha
Derivative kita (ta)
Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym amūḷha
Commentary (SNa) mūḷhassā'ti disāmūḷhassa.
Sanskrit mūḍha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya, cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī'ti.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ
mūḷha 3

Meaning foolish; deluded; insane; lit. fooled

Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)

Phonetic Change u > ū
t > ḍ > ḷ
Antonym amūḷha
Synonym vipallattha
Sanskrit mūḍha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

mūḷharūpa

adj. foolish; stupid; (comm) empty; lit. deluded kind [mūḷha + rūpa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning foolish; stupid; (comm) empty; lit. deluded kind
Construction mūḷha + rūpa
Compound kammadhāraya (mūḷha + rūpa)
Synonym avicakkhaṇa, duppañña, duppaññajātika, dummedha, dummedhī, bāla, bālavant, mogha
Commentary (DHPa) mūḷharūpo'ti tuccharūpo.
Sanskrit mūḍha + rūpa

Example

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

DHP 268 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
mūḷhosi

sandhi. you are insane!; you are deluded!; you are confused! [mūḷho + asi] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pr
Meaning you are insane!; you are deluded!; you are confused!
Construction mūḷho + asi
Sanskrit mūḍha + asi

Example

coro'si bālo'si mūḷho'si theno'sī'ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

VIN PAT PA 2 adinnādānasikkhāpadaṃ
me 1

pron. myself; me (object) ✓

Grammar pron, 1st acc sg of ahaṃ
Meaning myself; me (object)
Variant maṃ, mamaṃ
Sanskrit ma, mām

Examples

dv'āhaṃ sakkaṃ apucchissaṃ,
na me byākāsi cakkhumā,
yāvatatiyañ'ca devīsi,
byākarotī'ti me sutaṃ.

SNP 70 mogharāja māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 15

kacci nu kho me attā sīlato na upavadatī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ

AN 10.48 dasadhammasuttaṃ
me 2

pron. by me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st instr sg of ahaṃ
Meaning by me
Variant mayā
Sanskrit mayā

Examples

paññā c'eva sati yañ'ca
nāmarūpañ'ca mārisa,
etaṃ me puṭṭho pabrūhi,
katth'etaṃ uparujjhati.

SNP 56 ajita māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 1

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati assapuraṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

MN 40 cūḷāssapurasuttaṃ
me 3

pron. to me; for me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st dat sg of ahaṃ
Meaning to me; for me
Variant mama, mayhaṃ, mamaṃ
Sanskrit mahyam, me

Examples

atthaṅ'gato so uda vā so n'atthi,
udāhu ve sassatiyā arogo,
taṃ me munī sādhu viyākarohi,
tathā hi te vidito esa dhammo.

SNP 61 upasīva māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 6

osāne'tv'eva byāruddhe,
disvā me aratī ahu,
ath'ettha sallam'addakkhiṃ,
duddasaṃ hadayanissitaṃ.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15
me 4

pron. from me ✓

Grammar pron, 1st abl sg of ahaṃ
Meaning from me
Variant mayā
Sanskrit mat

Example

yato kho ahaṃ, aggivessana, oḷārikaṃ āhāraṃ āhāresiṃ odanakummāsaṃ, atha me te pañca bhikkhū nibbijja pakkamiṃsu, bāhulliko samaṇo gotamo, padhānavibbhanto, āvatto bāhullāyā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
me 5

pron. my; mine ✓

Grammar pron, 1st gen sg of ahaṃ
Meaning my; mine
Variant mama, mamaṃ, mayha, mayhaṃ
Sanskrit mama, me

Examples

yassa n'atthi idaṃ me'ti,
paresaṃ v'āpi kiñcanaṃ,
mamattaṃ so asaṃvindaṃ,
n'atthi me'ti na socati.

SNP 53 attadaṇḍasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 15

saṅkhārā ca h'idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissaṃsu, na'y'idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesun'ti.

SN 22.59 anattalakkhaṇasuttaṃ
me 6

pron. when I; since I ✓

Grammar pron, 1st gen sg of ahaṃ, gen abs
Meaning when I; since I
Variant mama, mayhaṃ, mamaṃ
Sanskrit mama, me

Examples

ko sujjhati muccati bajjhatī ca,
ken'attanā gacchati brahmalokaṃ,
ajānato me muni brūhi puṭṭho,
bhagavā hi me sakkhi brahmajjadiṭṭho,
tuvañ'hi no brahmasamo'si saccaṃ,
kathaṃ upapajjati brahmalokaṃ jutima.

SNP 31 māghasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 5

tasmā't'iha te, gahapati, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, āturakāyassa me sato cittaṃ anāturaṃ bhavissatī'ti. evañ'hi te, gahapati, sikkhitabban'ti.

masc. cloud; rain cloud; rain [√migh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning cloud; rain cloud; rain
Root Family √migh

Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit megha

Examples

nag'antare viṭapisamo sayissaṃ,
taṃ me mudū hehiti tūlasannibhaṃ.

Sanskrit meghya
Sanskrit Root √migh √mih 1 (urinate)

mettaṃ, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. mettañ'hi te, rāhula, bhāvanaṃ bhāvayato yo byāpādo so pahīyissati.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
metta 2

Example

virūpakkhehi me mettaṃ,

mettaṃ kaṇhāgotamakehi ca.

Examples

AN 10.44 kusinārasuttaṃ

tatr'āpi te, phagguna, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, na c'eva me cittaṃ vipariṇataṃ bhavissati, na ca pāpikaṃ vācaṃ nicchāressāmi, hit'ānukampī ca viharissāmi mettacitto, na dos'antaro'ti.

Examples

mānasaṃ bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ,
