asambādhaṃ averamasapattaṃ.

KHP 9 karaṇīya mettasuttaṃ

evam'eva kho, bhikkhave, khattiyakulā ce'pi agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti, so ca tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ āgamma, evaṃ mettaṃ karuṇaṃ muditaṃ upekkhaṃ bhāvetvā labhati ajjhattaṃ vūpasamaṃ.

mettācetovimutti

fem. liberation of the mind by friendliness; emancipation of the heart by benevolence [mettā + cetovimutti] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, comp
Meaning liberation of the mind by friendliness; emancipation of the heart by benevolence
Construction mettā + cetovimutti
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mettāya + cetovimutti)
Commentary (ANa) mettā hi kho me cetovimuttī'ti ettha paccanīkadhammehi vimuttattā tikacatukkajjhānikā mettā'va mettācetovimutti nāma.

Examples

nissaraṇañ'h'etaṃ, āvuso, byāpādassa yadidaṃ mettācetovimuttī'ti .

AN 6.13 nissāraṇīyasuttaṃ

Examples

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe mettābhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ

rāgacaritassa bhagavā puggalassa asubhakathaṃ katheti, dosacaritassa bhagavā puggalassa mettābhāvanaṃ ācikkhati, mohacaritassa bhagavā puggalassa uddese paripucchāya kālena dhammassavane kālena dhammasākacchāya garusaṃvāse niveseti

NIDD1 tuvaṭṭakasuttaniddeso
mettābhāvanānuyogamanuyutta

adj. devoted to the development of friendliness; engaged in the cultivation of benevolence [mettā + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning devoted to the development of friendliness; engaged in the cultivation of benevolence
Construction mettā + bhāvanā + anuyogaṃ + anuyutta
Compound alutta dutiyā tappurisa (mettābhāvanānuyogaṃ + anuyutta)
Sanskrit maitrī + bhāvanā + anuyoga + anuyukta

Example

santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe mettābhāvan'ānuyogam'anuyuttā viharanti, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

MN 118 ānāpānassatisuttaṃ
mettābhāvanāsutta

nt. Itivuttaka 27 (ITI 27) ✗
mettāyati

pr. (+acc) has goodwill towards; is kind (to) [√mitt + āya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, deno of mettā, trans (+acc)
Meaning has goodwill towards; is kind (to)
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 āya (be friendly)
Base √mitt + *ā + āya > mettāya (deno)
Construction mettāya + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Sanskrit maitrāyati
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

ekam'pi ce pāṇam'aduṭṭhacitto,
mettāyati kusalī tena hoti,
sabbe ca pāṇe manasānukampī,
pahūtamariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

AN 8.1 mettāsuttaṃ
mettāyanā

fem. friendly feeling [√mitt] ✗
mettāyanta

prp. feeling friendly [√mitt] ✗
mettāyi

aor. felt friendly [√mitt] ✗
mettāyitvā

abs. having felt friendly [√mitt] ✗
mettāvagga

masc. Chapter 1 of Aṭṭhakanipāta, Aṅguttara Nikāya 8.1-10 ✗
mettāvatā

fem. goodwill; friendship [√mitt + *ā + vant + tā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, from mettāvant
Meaning goodwill; friendship
Root Family √mitt
Root √mitt･1 a (be friendly)
Construction √mitt > mett + *ā + vant + tā
mettāvant + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (ANa) mettāvatāyā'ti mettāyuttāya pāricariyāya. satta hi sekhā tathāgataṃ mettāvatāya paricaranti, khīṇ'āsavo pariciṇṇasatthuko.
Sanskrit maitratā
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

nibbāne ca santadassāvī bhavissāmi, anusayā ca me samugghātaṃ gacchissanti, kiccakārī ca bhavissāmi, satthā ca me pariciṇṇo bhavissati mettāvatāyā'ti.

AN 6.103 ukkhittāsikasuttaṃ
mettāvasena

ind. by means of friendliness [mettā + vasena] ~

Grammar ind, adv, comp
Meaning by means of friendliness
Construction mettā + vasena
mettāvihārika

adj. who is friendly; who is kind; who practises mettā meditation; lit. living in friendliness [mettā + vihārika] ~

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning who is friendly; who is kind; who practises mettā meditation; lit. living in friendliness
Construction mettā + vihārika
mettāvihārī 1

adj. friendly; kind; lit. living with friendliness [mettā + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning friendly; kind; lit. living with friendliness
Construction mettā + vihārī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mettāya + vihārī)
Synonym abyāpajja, avera, metta, sakhila
Commentary (DHPa) mettāvihārī'ti mettākammaṭṭhāne kammaṃ karonto'pi mettāvasena tikacatukkajjhāne nibbattetvā ṭhito'pi mettāvihārī'y'eva nāma. (APAa) sinehalakkhaṇāya mettāya pharitvā viharanti, attabhāvaṃ pavattentī'ti mettāvihārino
Notes see mettāvihārī 2
Sanskrit maitrī + vihārin

Example

mettāvihārī yo bhikkhu,
pasanno buddhasāsane,
adhigacche padaṃ santaṃ,
saṅkhār'ūpasamaṃ sukhaṃ.

DHP 368 bhikkhuvaggo
mettāvihārī 2

adj. living in a state of friendliness; dwelling in kindness; who practices mettā meditation; lit. living with friendliness [mettā + vihārī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning living in a state of friendliness; dwelling in kindness; who practices mettā meditation; lit. living with friendliness
Construction mettā + vihārī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mettāya + vihārī)
Commentary (DHPa) mettāvihārī'ti mettākammaṭṭhāne kammaṃ karonto'pi mettāvasena tikacatukkajjhāne nibbattetvā ṭhito'pi mettāvihārī'y'eva nāma. (APAa) sinehalakkhaṇāya mettāya pharitvā viharanti, attabhāvaṃ pavattentī'ti mettāvihārino
Notes see mettāvihārī 1
Sanskrit maitrī + vihārin

Examples

etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvikānaṃ upāsikānaṃ mettāvihārīnaṃ yadidaṃ sāmāvatī.

AN 1.261 sattamavaggo

evaṃ, bhante. sutaṃ m'etaṃ, bhante, brahmā mettāvihārī'ti. taṃ me idaṃ, bhante, bhagavā sakkhidiṭṭho, bhagavā hi, bhante, mettāvihārī'ti.

MN 55 jīvakasuttaṃ
mettāsahagata

adj. filled with goodwill; full of friendliness [mettā + sahagata] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning filled with goodwill; full of friendliness
Construction mettā + sahagata
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mettāya + sahagata)
Sanskrit maitra + sahagata

Examples

so mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

MN 7 vatthasuttaṃ

idh'āvuso, bhikkhu mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṃ, tathā tatiyaṃ, tathā catutthaṃ.

VIN PAT PA 1 methunadhammasikkhāpadaṃ

virato methunā dhammā,
hitvā kāme paropare,
aviruddho asāratto,
pāṇesu tasathāvare.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

abrahmacariyā virameyya methunā,

AN 3.71 uposathasuttaṃ

disvāna taṇhaṃ aratiṃ ragañ'ca,
n'āhosi chando api methunasmiṃ,
kim'ev'idaṃ muttakarīsapuṇṇaṃ,
pādā'pi naṃ samphusituṃ na icche.

methunadhamma

masc. sexual intercourse; sexual activity; copulation [methuna + dhamma] ✓

Meaning sexual intercourse; sexual activity; copulation
Construction methuna + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (methuna + dhamma)

Examples

methunadhammo nāma yo so asaddhammo gāmadhammo vasaladhammo duṭṭhullaṃ odak'antikaṃ rahassaṃ dvayaṃdvayasamāpatti, eso methunadhammo nāma.

VIN 1.1.1 paṭhamapārājikaṃ, santhatabhāṇavāro

duṭṭhullā nāma vācā vaccamagga-passāvamagga-methunadhammappaṭisaṃyuttā vācā.

VIN 1.2.3 duṭṭhullavācāsikkhāpadaṃ

Meaning expellable offence of sexual intercourse

asubhasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato methunadhammasamāpattiyā cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

AN 4.159 bhikkhunīsuttaṃ

kaccāyana samāsakappa 327
methunupasaṃhita

meda

Construction √mid > med + *a
Derivative kita (*a)

DN 22.5 mahāsatipaṭṭhānasuttaṃ

yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ āpo āpogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, pittaṃ semhaṃ pubbo lohitaṃ sedo medo … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā āpodhātu.

MN 62 mahārāhulovādasuttaṃ
medaka

masc. fat; lard; drippings [√mid + *a + ka] ✓

Sanskrit medaka
Sanskrit Root √mid 4, 6 (be fat)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
medakathālikā 1

fem. pot of lard; bowl of fat; cup of drippings [medaka + thālikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning pot of lard; bowl of fat; cup of drippings
Construction medaka + thālikā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (medakassa + thālikā)
Commentary (ANa) medakathālikan'ti medakathālikā vuccati sūnakārakehi yūsanikkhaman'atthāya tattha tattha katachiddā thālikā.
Sanskrit medaka + sthāla, sthālaka (bsk)

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhante, puriso medakathālikaṃ parihareyya chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, imaṃ kāyaṃ pariharāmi chidd'āvachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ.

AN 9.11 sīhanādasuttaṃ
medakathālikā 2

fem. name of a acrobat; (comm) name of a male acrobat with a female name; lit. pot of lard [medaka + thālikā] ✓

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning name of a acrobat; (comm) name of a male acrobat with a female name; lit. pot of lard
Construction medaka + thālikā
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (medakassa + thālikā)
Commentary (SNa) medakathālikā'ti evaṃ itthiliṅgavasena laddhanāmaṃ.
Sanskrit medaka + sthāla, sthālaka (bsk)

Example

bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, caṇḍālavaṃsiko caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ ussāpetvā medakathālikaṃ antevāsiṃ āmantesi, ehi tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā mama uparikhandhe tiṭṭhāhī'ti.

SN 47.19 sedakasuttaṃ
medavaṭṭi

fem. lump of fat; lit. fat roll [meda + vaṭṭi] ~

Grammar fem, comp
Meaning lump of fat; lit. fat roll
Construction meda + vaṭṭi
medavaṇṇa

adj. of the colour of fat ✗
medaḷumpa

nt. name of a Sakyan town ✗
medāḷupa

nt. name of a Sakyan town ✗
medinī

fem. earth ✗
medeti

pr. (+acc) fattens up; puts on weight [√mid + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of √mid, trans (+acc)
Meaning fattens up; puts on weight
Root Family √mid
Root √mid･3 *e (be fat)
Base √mid + *e > mede (caus)
Construction mede + ti
Phonetic Change i > e
Commentary (MNa) medentī'ti jātamedaṃ karonti.
Sanskrit medayati, mindayati
Sanskrit Root √mid 4, 6 (be fat)

Example

te imaṃ kāyaṃ balaṃ gāhenti nāma, brūhenti nāma, medenti nāmā'ti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
medha

masc. sacrifice; offering to the gods; lit. harm [√medh + a] ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning sacrifice; offering to the gods; lit. harm
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (hurt, harm)
Construction √medh + a
Derivative kita (a)
Sanskrit medha
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Example

assamedhaṃ purisamedhaṃ,
sammāpāsaṃ vājapeyyaṃ niraggaḷhaṃ,
mahāyaññā mah'ārambhā,
na te honti mahapphalā.

SN 3.9 yaññasuttaṃ
medhaga

masc. argument; dispute; differences [√medh + aka] ✓

Grammar masc, from medhati
Meaning argument; dispute; differences
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (hurt, harm)
Construction √medh + aka > aga
Derivative kita (aka)
Phonetic Change k > g
Synonym kathojja, kalaha, viggaha, vivāda
Variant medhaka
Sanskrit methana
Sanskrit Root √mith 1 (alternate, altercate)

Examples

pare ca na vijānanti,
mayam'ettha yamāmase,
ye ca tattha vijānanti,
tato sammanti medhagā.

DHP 6 yamakavaggo

vinicchaye ṭhatvā sayaṃ pamāya,
uddhaṃ sa lokasmiṃ vivādam'eti,
hitvāna sabbāni vinicchayāni,
na medhagaṃ kubbati jantu loke'ti.

SNP 50 cūḷabyūhasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 12
medhasa

adj. having wisdom; with intelligence; with discernment [√medh + as + a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from medhā
Meaning having wisdom; with intelligence; with discernment
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (be wise)
Construction √medh + as + a
medhas + a
Derivative taddhita (a)
Sanskrit medhas
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

Examples

sambādhe vata okāsaṃ,
avindi bhūrimedhaso,
yo jhānam'abujjhi buddho,
paṭilīnanisabho munī'ti.

SN 2.7 pañcālacaṇḍasuttaṃ

appamatto pamattesu,
suttesu bahujāgaro,
abal'assaṃ'va sīgh'asso,
hitvā yāti sumedhaso.

DHP 29 appamādavaggo
medhā

fem. wisdom; intelligence [√medh + ā] ✓

Grammar fem, abstr, in comps
Meaning wisdom; intelligence
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (be wise)
Construction √medh + ā
Derivative kita (ā)
Synonym paṇḍiccā, buddhi, mati
Sanskrit medhā
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

Examples

tasmā have lokavidū sumedho,
lok'antagū vusitabrahmacariyo,
lokassa antaṃ samitāvi ñatvā,
n'āsiṃsatī lokam'imaṃ parañ'cā'ti.

AN 4.45 rohitassasuttaṃ

dummedhehi pasaṃsā ca,
viññūhi garahā ca yā,
garahāva seyyo viññūhi,
yaṃ ce bālappasaṃsanā.

TH 245 godattattheragāthā
medhāvinī

fem. intelligent woman; wise woman; who has good judgement [√medh + ā + vī + inī] ✓

Grammar fem, agent, from medhāvī
Meaning intelligent woman; wise woman; who has good judgement
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (be wise)
Construction √medh + ā + vī + inī
medhāvī + inī
Derivative taddhita (inī)
Sanskrit medhāvinī
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

Example

itthī'pi hi ekacciyā,
seyyā posa janādhipa,
medhāvinī sīlavatī,
sassudevā patibbatā.

SN 3.16 mallikāsuttaṃ
medhāvī

masc. intelligent man; wise man; who has good judgment; lit. who has wisdom [√medh + ā + vī] ✓

Grammar masc, from medhā
Meaning intelligent man; wise man; who has good judgment; lit. who has wisdom
Root Family √medh
Root √medh×1 a (be wise)
Construction √medh + ā + vī
medhā + vī
Derivative taddhita (vī)
Commentary (SNa) medhāvī'ti ṭhān'uppattikapaññāsaṅkhātāya medhāya samannāgato.
Sanskrit medhāvin
Sanskrit Root medhā - (wisdom)

Examples

nidhīnaṃ'va pavattāraṃ,
yaṃ passe vajjadassinaṃ,
niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ,
t'ādisaṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhaje,
t'ādisaṃ bhajamānassa,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyo.

DHP 76 paṇḍitavaggo

anupubbena medhāvī,
thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe,
kammāro rajatass'eva,
niddhame malamattano.

DHP 239 malavaggo
meraya

masc. (fermented) liquor e.g. wine and beer ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning (fermented) liquor e.g. wine and beer
Commentary (VIN 2.5.6.1) merayo nāma pupph'āsavo phal'āsavo madhv'āsavo guḷ'āsavo sambhārasaṃyutto. (VINa) surā nāma piṭṭhakiṇṇapakkhittā, nāḷiker'ādīnam'pi rasena katā surātv'eva saṅkhyaṃ gacchati, tassā'y'eva kiṇṇapakkhittāya maṇḍe gahite merayotv'eva saṅkhyaṃ gacchatī'ti vadanti.
Sanskrit maireya

Examples

surāmerayapāne pācittiyaṃ.

VIN PAT PC 51 surāpānasikkhāpadaṃ

na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.

MN 36 mahāsaccakasuttaṃ
meru

masc. mythical mountain at the centre of the universe ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning mythical mountain at the centre of the universe
Variant neru, sineru
Commentary (THIa) meruṃ laṅghetum'icchasi caturāsītiyojanasahass'ubbedhaṃ sinerupabbatarājaṃ laṅghayitvā aparabhāge ṭhātu'kāmo'si
Sanskrit meru

Example

apathena payātum'icchasi,
candaṃ kīḷanakaṃ gavesasi,
meruṃ laṅghetum'icchasi,
yo tvaṃ buddhasutaṃ maggayasi.

THI 71 subhājīvakambavanikātherīgāthā
melana

nt. gathering, meeting ✗
mesa

masc. ram ✗
mesadda

masc. word "me" ✗
mesi

Grammar sandhi, pron + pr
Meaning by me you are
Construction me + asi
Sanskrit mayā + asi

Example

sabbattha te citta vaco kataṃ mayā,
bahūsu jātīsu na me'si kopito,
ajjhattasambhavo kataññutāya te,
dukkhe ciraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kate.

SN 34.1 samādhimūlakasamāpattisuttaṃ
mokkhaka

adj. who releases [√mokkh] ✗
mokkhacikā

fem. somersault; rolling ✓

Grammar fem
Meaning somersault; rolling
Commentary (MNa) mokkhacikan'ti samparivattakakīḷā, ākāse vā daṇḍakaṃ gahetvā bhūmiyaṃ vā sīsaṃ ṭhapetvā heṭṭhupariyabhāvena parivattanakīḷanan'ti vuttaṃ hoti.

Example

sa kho so, bhikkhave, kumāro vuddhim'anvāya indriyānaṃ paripākam'anvāya yāni tāni kumārakānaṃ kīḷāpanakāni tehi kīḷati, seyyath'idaṃ, vaṅkakaṃ ghaṭikaṃ mokkhacikaṃ ciṅgulakaṃ patt'āḷhakaṃ rathakaṃ dhanukaṃ.

MN 38 mahātaṇhāsaṅkhayasuttaṃ
mokkhati

pr. (+abl) is freed (from); is liberated (from); is emancipated (from) [√mokkh + a + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, intrans (+abl)
Meaning is freed (from); is liberated (from); is emancipated (from)
Root Family √mokkh
Root √mokkh･1 a (be freed)
Base √mokkh + a > mokkha
Construction mokkha + ti
Synonym pamokkhati
Notes originally desid of √muc. √muc + sa > moksa + ya > mokkha
Sanskrit mokṣate
Sanskrit Root √mokṣ 1, 10 (release)

Example

dūraṅ'gamaṃ ekacaraṃ,
asarīraṃ guh'āsayaṃ,
ye cittaṃ saṃyamessanti,
mokkhanti mārabandhanā.

tasmiṃ samaye satthā pavattitavaradhammacakko anupubben'āgantvā anāthapiṇḍikena mahāseṭṭhinā catupaṇṇāsakoṭidhanaṃ vissajjetvā kārite jetavanamahāvihāre viharati mahājanaṃ saggamagge ca mokkhamagge ca patiṭṭhāpayamāno.

moggalāna

masc. name of a classical Pāḷi grammar; Moggallānabyākaraṇaṃ [muggala] ✗
moggalla

masc. name of a minister [muggala + *ya] ~

Grammar masc, from muggala
Meaning name of a minister
Construction muggala > moggala + *ya
Derivative taddhita (*ya)
Phonetic Change u > o
moggallāna 1

masc. name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. descendent of Muggala [muggala + *yāna] ✓

Grammar masc, from muggala
Meaning name of a monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in psychic power; lit. descendent of Muggala
Construction muggala > moggala + *yāna
Derivative taddhita (*yāna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym mahāmoggalāna, mahāmoggallāna
Variant moggalāna
Commentary (AN 1.190) etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ iddhimantānaṃ yadidaṃ mahāmoggallāno (UDa) mahāmoggallāno'ti pūjāvacanaṃ. guṇavisesehi mahanto moggallāno'ti hi mahāmoggallāno.
Sanskrit maudgalyāyana

Example

idh'āvuso moggallāna, bhikkhu cittaṃ vasaṃ vatteti, no ca bhikkhu cittassa vasena vattati. so yāya vihārasamāpattiyā ākaṅkhati pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ viharituṃ, tāya vihārasamāpattiyā pubb'aṇhasamayaṃ viharati.

MN 32 mahāgosiṅgasuttaṃ
moggallāna 2

masc. family name; lit. descendent of Muggala [muggala + *yāna] ✓

Grammar masc, from muggala
Meaning family name; lit. descendent of Muggala
Construction muggala > moggala + *yāna
Derivative taddhita (*yāna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (VINa) mahāmoggallāno'ti mahā ca so guṇamahantatāya moggallāno ca gottenā'ti mahāmoggallāno.
Sanskrit maudgalyāyana

Example

evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye. tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno magadhesu kallavāḷaputtagāme pacalāyamāno nisinno hoti.

mogha

adj. useless; pointless; futile; ineffective; unprofitable; vain; lit. empty [√muh + *gha] ✓

Grammar adj, from muyhati
Meaning useless; pointless; futile; ineffective; unprofitable; vain; lit. empty
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh > moh + *gha
Derivative kita (*gha)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym amogha
Synonym anatthasaṃhita, aphala, natthāvaha, niratthaka, mūḷharūpa, sampha
Commentary (MNa) moghan'ti tucchaṃ.
Sanskrit mogha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Examples

na tena thero so hoti,
yen'assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa,
moghajiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

DHP 260 dhammaṭṭhavaggo

tassa ce, bhikkhave, kulaputtassa evaṃ uṭṭhahato ghaṭato vāyamato te bhogā n'ābhinipphajjanti. so socati kilamati paridevati urattāḷiṃ kandati, sammohaṃ āpajjati, moghaṃ vata me uṭṭhānaṃ, aphalo vata me vāyāmo'ti

MN 13 mahā dukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
moghajiṇṇa

adj. grown old in vain; waste of old age; useless old man; foolish old man [mogha + jiṇṇa] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning grown old in vain; waste of old age; useless old man; foolish old man
Construction mogha + jiṇṇa
Compound kammadhāraya (mogha + jiṇṇa)
Commentary (DHPa) moghajiṇṇo'ti anto therakarānaṃ dhammānaṃ abhāvena tucchajiṇṇo nāma
Sanskrit mogha + jīrṇa

Example

na tena thero so hoti,
yen'assa palitaṃ siro,
paripakko vayo tassa,
moghajiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

DHP 260 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
moghapurisa

masc. fool; worthless man; useless person; stupid person; lit. empty man [mogha + purisa] ✓

MN 105 sunakkhattasuttaṃ
moghamaññanti

sandhi. "anything else is wrong"; "anything else is stupid" [moghaṃ + aññaṃ + iti] ✓

Meaning "anything else is wrong"; "anything else is stupid"
Construction moghaṃ + aññaṃ + iti
Sanskrit mogha + anya + iti

Example

ahañ'c'eva kho pana ajānanto apassanto ek'aṃsena ādāya vohareyyaṃ, idam'eva saccaṃ, mogham'aññan'ti, na m'etaṃ assa patirūpaṃ.

MN 60 apaṇṇakasuttaṃ
moghamaññaṃ

sandhi. anything else is wrong; anything else is stupid [moghaṃ + aññaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, adj + pron
Meaning anything else is wrong; anything else is stupid
Construction moghaṃ + aññaṃ
Sanskrit mogha + anya

Example

iti yathā yathā naṃ tesu tesu janapadesu sañjānanti tathā tathā thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati, idam'eva saccaṃ, mogham'aññan'ti.

mocayati

pr. (+acc) unleashes; lets loose; lit. causes to free [√muc + *aya + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of muñcati, trans (+acc)
Meaning unleashes; lets loose; lit. causes to free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 *aya (release, free)
Base √muc + *aya > mocaya (caus)
Construction mocaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit mocayati
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Examples

kim'atthakāmo na dade,
kiṃ macco na pariccaje,
kiṃsu muñceyya kalyāṇaṃ,
pāpikaṃ na ca mocaye'ti.

SN 1.78 kāmasuttaṃ

attānaṃ na dade poso,
attānaṃ na pariccaje,
vācaṃ muñceyya kalyāṇaṃ,
pāpikañ'ca na mocaye'ti.

SN 1.78 kāmasuttaṃ
mocayi

aor. (+acc) unleashed; let loose; lit. caused to free [√muc + *aya + i] ~

Grammar aor of mocayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning unleashed; let loose; lit. caused to free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 *aya (release, free)
Base √muc + *aya > mocaya (caus)
Construction mocaya + i
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit muc
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)
mocāpana

nt. causation of one's freedom, deliverance [√muc] ✗
mocāpeti

pr. causes to be released [√muc] ✗
mocita

pp. delivered, set free, released [√muc] ✗
mociya

ger. delivering, setting free, releasing [√muc] ✗
moceti

pr. (+acc) releases; sets free [√muc + *e + ti] ✓

Grammar pr, caus of muñcati, trans (+acc)
Meaning releases; sets free
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 *e (release, free)
Base √muc + *e > moce (caus)
Construction moce + ti
Synonym ussajjati, osajjati, ossajjati, parimoceti
Sanskrit mocayati
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

so taṃ lepaṃ upasaṅkamitvā hatthena gaṇhāti. so tattha bajjhati. hatthaṃ mocessāmī'ti dutiyena hatthena gaṇhāti.

SN 47.7 makkaṭasuttaṃ
mocetuṃ

inf. (+acc) to deliver, to set free, to release [√muc] ✗
mocetvā

abs. (+acc) having set free; having released [√muc + *e + tvā] ✓

Grammar abs of moceti, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning having set free; having released
Root Family √muc
Root √muc･2 *e (release, free)
Base √muc + *e > moce (caus)
Construction moce + tvā
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ussajjitvā
Sanskrit muc
Sanskrit Root √muc 6 (release)

Example

sace vo, dhanena attho, khippaṃ maṃ bandhanā mocetvā sīsaṃ nhāpetvā ahatavatthāni acchādetvā gandhehi vilimpāpetvā pupphāni pilandhāpetvā ṭhapethā'ti.

JAa 48 vedabba jātakavaṇṇanā
mocenta

aor. delivered, set free, released [√muc] ✗

n > ṇ

Sanskrit mauna +
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)
motabba

ptp. could be sensed; should be perceived; can be known; lit. to be sensed [√mun + *tabba] ✓

Meaning could be sensed; should be perceived; can be known; lit. to be sensed

Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun > mon + *tabba

Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit mantavya
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato ... mutvā motabbaṃ, mutaṃ na maññati, amutaṃ na maññati, motabbaṃ na maññati, motāraṃ na maññati

AN 4.24 kāḷakārāmasuttaṃ
modaka

masc. globular sweet-meat [√mud] ✗
modati

Meaning is happy; is glad; is pleased; enjoys oneself

Root √mud･1 *a (be soft, happy)

Sanskrit modate
Sanskrit Root √mud 1 (be merry)

Examples

idha modati pecca modati,
katapuñño ubhay'attha modati,
so modati so pamodati,
disvā kammavisuddhim'attano.

DHP 16 yamakavaggo

parasambhatesu bhogesu,
vasavattī'va modare,
diṭṭhe dhamm'esa vipāko,
samparāye ca suggatī'ti.

modana

nt. rejoicing, enjoyment [√mud] ✗

fem. rejoicing, enjoyment [√mud] ✗

prp. rejoicing [√mud] ✗

kittito me mahāmuni,
buddhassa vaṇṇaṃ kittetvā,
kappaṃ saggamhi mod'ahaṃ.

nt. silence [√mun + *a] ✓

Sanskrit mauna
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

na monena munī hoti,
mūḷharūpo aviddasu,
yo ca tulaṃva paggayha,
varam'ādāya paṇḍito.

DHP 268 dhammaṭṭhavaggo
mona 2

nt. sage-hood; sagacity; sainthood [√mun + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from munāti
Meaning sage-hood; sagacity; sainthood
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun > mon + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym muni, moṇatā, moneyya
Sanskrit mauna
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

yo ca jānaṃ saṃyat'atto,
jānaṃ na bahu bhāsati,
sa munī monam'arahati,
sa munī monam'ajjhagā'ti.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

ek'āsanassa sikkhetha,
samaṇ'ūpāsanassa ca,
ekattaṃ monam'akkhātaṃ,
eko ce abhiramissasi,
atha bhāhisi dasadisā.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11
mona 3

nt. wisdom; knowledge; sagacity; sapience [√mun + *a] ✓

Grammar nt, from munāti
Meaning wisdom; knowledge; sagacity; sapience
Root Family √mun
Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Construction √mun > mon + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNa) monan'ti catumaggañāṇaṃ, tañ'hi munātī'ti monaṃ, catusaccadhamme jānātī'ti attho.
Sanskrit mauna
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

yadā ca attanā vedi,
muni monena brāhmaṇo,
atha rūpā arūpā ca,
sukhadukkhā pamuccatī'ti.

UD 10 bāhiyasuttaṃ

na mānakāmassa damo idh'atthi,
na monam'atthi asamāhitassa,
eko araññe viharaṃ pamatto,
na maccudheyyassa tareyya pāran'ti.

SN 1.9 mānakāmasuttaṃ
monapatta

adj. attained silence; (or) attained sainthood; (comm) attained understanding [mona + patta] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning attained silence; (or) attained sainthood; (comm) attained understanding
Construction mona + patta
Compound dutiyā tappurisa (monaṃ + patta)
Commentary (MNa) monapattassā'ti ñāṇapattassa.
Sanskrit mauna + prāpta

Example

nisabhassa appameyyassa,
gambhīrassa monapattassa,
khemaṅ'karassa vedassa,
dhammaṭṭhassa saṃvutattassa,
saṅgātigassa muttassa,
bhagavato tassa sāvako'ham'asmi.

MN 56 upālisuttaṃ
monapatha

masc. ways of sage-hood; pathways of monkhood; (comm) path of wisdom [mona + patha] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning ways of sage-hood; pathways of monkhood; (comm) path of wisdom
Construction mona + patha
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (monassa + patha)
Commentary (SNPa) monapathesū'ti ñāṇapathesu
Sanskrit mauna + patha

Example

yaṃ me kaṅkhitam'aññāsi,
vicikicchā maṃ tārayi namo te,
muni monapathesu pattipatta,
akhila ādiccabandhu sorato'si.

SNP 32 sabhiyasuttaṃ
monissati

fut. (+acc) will know; will understand [√mun + nā + ssa + ti] ✓

Grammar fut munāti, irreg, trans (+acc)
Meaning will know; will understand

Root √mun･5 nā (think, know)
Base √mun + nā + ssa > monissa (fut, irreg)
Construction monissa + ti
Sanskrit maniṣyāmi
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Example

tvañ'ca me maggam'akkhāhi,
añjasaṃ amatogadhaṃ,
ahaṃ monena monissaṃ,
gaṅgāsoto'va sāgaran'ti.

TH 144 valliyattheragāthā
moneyya

Meaning sage-hood; sagacity; sainthood

Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym muni, moṇatā, mona
Sanskrit mauneya
Sanskrit Root √man 8 (think)

Examples

anagāriy'upetassa,
bhikkhācariyaṃ jigīsato,
muni pabrūhi me puṭṭho,
moneyyaṃ uttamaṃ padaṃ.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

moneyyaṃ te upaññissaṃ,
dukkaraṃ durabhisambhavaṃ,
handa te naṃ pavakkhāmi,
santhambhassu daḷho bhava.

SNP 37 nālakasuttaṃ
mahāvaggo 11

moneyyasutta 1

nt. Aṅguttara Nikāya 3.123 (AN3.123) ✗
moneyyasutta 2

nt. Itivuttaka 67 (ITI 67) ✗
momuha

adj. very foolish; completely confused; totally deluded; entirely stupid [√muh + ya + a] ✓

Grammar adj, intens of moha
Meaning very foolish; completely confused; totally deluded; entirely stupid
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + √muh + ya > momuha (intens)
Construction momuha + a
Derivative kita (a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit momuhya
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Examples

jiṇṇo'ham'asmi abalo vītavaṇṇo,
nettā na suddhā savanaṃ na phāsu,
m'āhaṃ nassaṃ momuho antarāva,
ācikkha dhammaṃ yam'ahaṃ vijaññaṃ,
jātijarāya idha vippahānaṃ.

SNP 71 piṅgiya māṇava pucchā
pārāyanavaggo 16

no ce kira diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena,
sīlabbaten'āpi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā,
asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
maññām'ahaṃ momuham'eva dhammaṃ,
diṭṭhiyā eke paccenti suddhiṃ.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
momuhato

ind. as very foolish; as completely confused; as totally deluded; as entirely stupid [√muh + ya + a + to] ✓

Grammar ind, adv, abl sg of momuha, intens
Meaning as very foolish; as completely confused; as totally deluded; as entirely stupid
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + √muh + ya > momuha (intens)
Construction momuha + a + to
momuha + to
Derivative taddhita (to)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit momughāt
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

diṭṭhiñ'ca nissāya anupucchamāno,
samuggahītesu pamoham'āgā,
ito ca n'āddakkhi aṇum'pi saññaṃ,
tasmā tuvaṃ momuhato dahāsi.

mandattā momūhattā paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, pāpiccho icchāpakato paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, paribhavaṃ paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati, aññātu'kāmo paraṃ pañhaṃ pucchati

AN 5.165 pañhapucchāsuttaṃ
mora

masc. peacock; (comm) any bird [mayūra] ✓

Grammar masc, onom, from mayūra
Meaning peacock; (comm) any bird
Construction mayūra > mora
Phonetic Change ayū > o (contaction)
Commentary (ANa) moro vā kaṭṭhaṃ pātetī'ti ... moraggahaṇena ca idha sabbapakkhiggahaṇaṃ adhippetaṃ, tena yo koci pakkhī'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Sanskrit mora, mayūra

Examples

tattha ca me, brāhmaṇa, viharato mago vā āgacchati, moro vā kaṭṭhaṃ pāteti, vāto vā paṇṇakasaṭaṃ ereti.

MN 4 bhayabheravasuttaṃ

app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.

DN 30.21 lakkhaṇasuttaṃ
mosa 2.1

adj. untrue; false; deceitful [√mus + *a] ✓

Grammar adj, in comps, from mussati
Meaning untrue; false; deceitful
Root Family √mus
Root √mus･3 ya (lie, forget)
Construction √mus > mos + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym ataccha, asatī, mosadhamma, vitatha, samosa
Sanskrit mṛṣā
Sanskrit Root √mṛṣ 1, 4 (not heed)

Example

etaṃ dukkhan'ti ñatvāna,
mosadhammaṃ palokinaṃ,
phussa phussa vayaṃ passaṃ,
evaṃ tattha vijānati,
vedanānaṃ khayā bhikkhu,
nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
mosadhamma

adj. deceptive; deceitful; false; lit. untrue nature [mosa + dhamma] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning deceptive; deceitful; false; lit. untrue nature
Construction mosa + dhamma
Compound kammadhāraya (mosa + dhamma)
Antonym amosadhamma
Synonym mosa
Commentary (MNa) mosadhammā'ti nassanasabhāvā, khettaṃ viya vatthu viya hiraññasuvaṇṇaṃ viya ca na paññāyittha, katipāhen'eva supinake diṭṭhā viya nassanti na paññāyanti. tena vuttaṃ mosadhammā'ti
Sanskrit mṛṣā + dharma

Examples

tassa sā vimutti sacce ṭhitā akuppā hoti. tañ'hi, bhikkhu, musā yaṃ mosadhammaṃ, taṃ saccaṃ yaṃ amosadhammaṃ nibbānaṃ.

MN 140 dhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ

yena yena hi maññanti,
tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
tañ'hi tassa musā hoti,
mosadhammañ'hi ittaraṃ.

SNP 38 dvayatānupassanāsuttaṃ
mosana

nt. theft [√mus] ✗
mosalla

adj. worthy of being slain (with clubs), punishable [musala] ✗
mosavajja

nt. lie; untruth; false speech [mosa + vajja] ✓

Grammar nt, comp
Meaning lie; untruth; false speech
Construction mosa + vajja
Compound kammadhāraya (mosa + vajja)
Synonym abhūta, alika
Sanskrit mṛṣāvāda

Examples

māno hi te brāhmaṇa khāribhāro,
kodho dhūmo bhasmani mosavajjaṃ,
jivhā sujā hadayaṃ jotiṭhānaṃ,
attā sudanto purisassa joti.

SN 7.9 sundarikasuttaṃ

mosavajje na nīyetha,
sampajāno saṭhāni na kayirā,
atha jīvitena paññāya,
sīlabbatena n'āññam'atimaññe.

SNP 52 tuvaṭakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 14
moha 1

masc. illusion; delusion; hallucination [√muh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from muyhati
Meaning illusion; delusion; hallucination
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh > moh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym amoha, vītamoha
Commentary (SNa) muyhanalakkhaṇo moho'ti.
Sanskrit moha, mogha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Examples

lobho akusalamūlaṃ doso akusalamūlaṃ moho akusalamūlaṃ idaṃ vuccat'āvuso akusalamūlaṃ.

MN 9 sammādiṭṭhisuttaṃ

saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā,
paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā,
saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ,
te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

SNP 47 māgaṇḍiyasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 9
moha 2

masc. deception; deluding [√muh + *a] ✓

Grammar masc, from muyhati
Meaning deception; deluding
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 ya (be deluded, confused)
Construction √muh > moh + *a
Derivative kita (*a)
Phonetic Change u > o
Antonym amoha, vītamoha
Sanskrit moha, mogha
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

yañ'ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno, tañ'ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo. evañ'ca pana, bhikkhave, āropetabbo. byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
mohakkhandha

masc. mass of delusion [moha + khandha] ~

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning mass of delusion
Construction moha + khandha
mohakkhaya

masc. wearing away of delusion; extinction of stupidity [moha + khaya] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning wearing away of delusion; extinction of stupidity
Construction moha + khaya
Compound chaṭṭhī tappurisa (mohassa + khaya)
Sanskrit moha + kṣaya

Examples

katamā ca, bhikkhave, pariññā? rāgakkhayo, dosakkhayo, mohakkhayo, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, pariññā

SN 22.106 pariññeyyasuttaṃ

yathā'pi pabbato selo,
acalo suppatiṭṭhito,
evaṃ mohakkhayā bhikkhu,
pabbato'va na vedhatī'ti.

UD 24 sāriputtasuttaṃ
mohagāmitā

fem. state of being motivated by delusion; state of being driven by ignorance; lit. going by delusion state [moha + gāmī + tā] ~

Grammar fem, abstr, comp, from mohagāmī
Meaning state of being motivated by delusion; state of being driven by ignorance; lit. going by delusion state
Construction moha + gāmī + tā
mohagāmī + tā
Derivative taddhita (tā)
Commentary (VINa) chandagāmitā … bhayagāmitā pāpentī'ti ete chandagāmino ca … bhayagāmino cā'ti evaṃ chandagāmitāya'pi … bhayagāmitāya'pi pāpenti, yojentī'ti attho.
Sanskrit moha + gāmin +
mohagāmī

adj. motivated by delusion; driven by ignorance; lit. going by delusion [moha + gāmī] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning motivated by delusion; driven by ignorance; lit. going by delusion
Construction moha + gāmī
Compound tatiyā tappurisa (mohena + gāmī)
Sanskrit moha + gāmin

Example

chandagāmino ca bhikkhū, dosagāmino ca bhikkhū, mohagāmino ca bhikkhū, bhayagāmino ca bhikkhū t'ādisikāya āpattiyā ekaccaṃ pabbājenti, ekaccaṃ na pabbājentī'ti.

VIN PAT SA 13 kuladūsakasikkhāpadaṃ
mohaggi

Construction moha + aggi

Sanskrit moha, mogha + agni

Example

kena ādittaṃ? rāg'agginā, dos'agginā, moh'agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan'ti vadāmi.

AN 3.35 hatthakasuttaṃ

dosaṃ vineyya viharanto na dosajaṃ kammaṃ karissasi kāyena vācāya manasā. mohaṃ vineyya viharāhi. mohaṃ vineyya viharanto na mohajaṃ kammaṃ karissasi kāyena vācāya manasā.

DHP 358 taṇhāvaggo

MN 113 sappurisasuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evaṃ hoti, kosu nāma me dhammo ajjhattaṃ appahīno yena me ekadā lobhadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, dosadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti, mohadhammā'pi cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhantī'ti.

MN 13 mahādukkhakkhandhasuttaṃ
mohana 1

nt. deluding; confusing; stupefying; bewildering [√muh + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, act, from moheti, caus
Meaning deluding; confusing; stupefying; bewildering
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 *e (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + *e > mohe (caus)
Construction mohe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change u > o
Notes see nandana 2
Sanskrit mohana
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

accharāgaṇasaṅghuṭṭhaṃ,
pisācagaṇasevitaṃ,
van'antaṃ mohanaṃ nāma,
kathaṃ yātrā bhavissatī'ti.

SN 1.46 accharāsuttaṃ
mohana 2

nt. (things which cause) delusion; stupor; infatuation; bewilderment; lit. deluding [√muh + *e + ana] ✓

Grammar nt, from moheti, caus
Meaning (things which cause) delusion; stupor; infatuation; bewilderment; lit. deluding
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 *e (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + *e > mohe (caus)
Construction mohe + ana
Derivative kita (ana)
Phonetic Change u > o
Sanskrit mohana
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

satto guhāyaṃ bahun'ābhichanno,
tiṭṭhaṃ naro mohanasmiṃ pagāḷho,
dūre vivekā hi tathāvidho so,
kāmā hi loke na hi suppahāyā.

SNP 40 guhaṭṭhakasuttaṃ
aṭṭhakavaggo 2
mohanaka

adj. playing dumb; pretending not to know; being confused [√muh + *e + ana + ka] ✓

Grammar adj, from mohana, caus
Meaning playing dumb; pretending not to know; being confused
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 *e (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + *e > mohe (caus)
Construction mohe + ana + ka
mohana + ka
Derivative taddhita (ka)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (KVa) idaṃ tasmiṃ mohanake pācittiyan'ti yo evaṃ āropite mohe puna moheti, tasmiṃ mohanake puggale idaṃ pācittiyaṃ veditabbaṃ, na anāropite moheti attho.
Sanskrit mohana +
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamānena na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī'ti, idaṃ tasmiṃ mohanake pācittiyaṃ.

Base √muh + *aya > mohaya (caus)
Construction mohaya + ti
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym moheti
Sanskrit mohayati
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)
mohayamāna

prp. (+acc) confusing; misleading; misguiding; deceiving [√muh + *aya + māna] ~

Grammar prp of mohayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning confusing; misleading; misguiding; deceiving
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 *aya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + *aya > mohaya (caus)
Construction mohaya + māna
Derivative kita (māna)
Phonetic Change u > o
Commentary (SNa) devānaṃ'y'eva mohayamānā'ti devānaṃ cittaṃ mohayantā.
Sanskrit mohayamāna
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)
mohayi

aor. (+acc) confused; misled; misguide [√muh + *aya + i] ✓

Grammar aor of mohayati, caus, trans (+acc)
Meaning confused; misled; misguide
Root Family √muh
Root √muh･3 *aya (be deluded, confused)
Base √muh + *aya > mohaya (caus)
Construction mohaya + i
Phonetic Change u > o
Synonym amohayi
Notes mā mohayī "don't mislead"
Sanskrit amūmuhat
Sanskrit Root √muh 4 (be crazed)

Example

paroparaṃ ariyadhammaṃ viditvā,
mā mohayī jānam'anomavīriya,
vāriṃ yathā ghammani ghammatatto,
vāc'ābhikaṅkhāmi sutaṃ pavassa.

adj. bound be delusion; fettered by illusion; lit. with delusion as bond [moha + sambandhana] ✓

Grammar adj, comp
Meaning bound be delusion; fettered by illusion; lit. with delusion as bond
Construction moha + sambandhana
Commentary (UDa) tattha mohasambandhano loko, bhabbarūpo'va dissatī'ti ... so'pi mohasambandhano mohena paliguṇṭhito attahit'āhitaṃ ajānanto hite na paṭipajjati, ahitaṃ dukkh'āvahaṃ bahuñ'ca apuññaṃ ācināti.
Sanskrit moha, mogha + sambandha

Example

mohasambandhano loko,
bhabbarūpo'va dissati,
upadhibandhano bālo,
tamasā parivārito,
sassato'riva khāyati,
passato n'atthi kiñcanan'ti.

VIN 2.5.8.3 mohanasikkhāpadaṃ
mohetvā

abs. having deceived, having befooled, having deluded [√muh] ✗
mohesi

aor. (+acc) deceived, befooled, deluded [√muh] ✗
moḷi 1

masc. tuft of hair left after shaving the head ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning tuft of hair left after shaving the head
Synonym cūḷā
Commentary (SNa) moḷiyasīvako'ti sīvako'ti tassa nāmaṃ. cūḷā pan'assa atthi, tasmā moḷiyasīvako'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit mauli

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho moḷiyasīvako paribbājako yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ
moḷi 2

masc. crown of the head ✓

Grammar masc
Meaning crown of the head
Synonym cūḷā
Sanskrit mauli

Example

santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, n'atthi kāmesu doso'ti. te kāmesu pātabyataṃ āpajjanti. te kho moḷibaddhāhi paribbājikāhi paricārenti.

MN 45 cūḷadhammasamādānasuttaṃ
moḷibaddha

Meaning (of hair) tied in a topknot; bound up in a bun

santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṃvādino evaṃdiṭṭhino, n'atthi kāmesu doso'ti. te kāmesu pātabyataṃ āpajjanti. te kho moḷibaddhāhi paribbājikāhi paricārenti.

moḷiyaphagguna

Meaning name of a monk
Construction moḷiya + phagguna
Commentary (MNa) moḷiyaphagguno'ti moḷī'ti cūḷā vuccati ... sā tassa gihikāle mahatī ahosi, ten'assa moḷiyaphagguno'ti saṅkhā udapādi. pabbajitam'pi naṃ ten'eva nāmena sañjānanti.
Sanskrit maulika + phalguna

Example

tena kho pana samayena āyasmā moḷiyaphagguno bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ ativelaṃ saṃsaṭṭho viharati.

MN 21 kakacūpamasuttaṃ
moḷiyaphaggunasutta

nt. Saṃyutta Nikāya 12.12 (SN12.12) ✗
moḷiyasīvaka

masc. name of a wandering ascetic; lit. Tufted Tailor [moḷiya + sīvaka] ✓

Grammar masc, comp
Meaning name of a wandering ascetic; lit. Tufted Tailor
Construction moḷiya + sīvaka
Compound kammadhāraya (moḷiya + sīvaka)
Commentary (SNa) moḷiyasīvako'ti sīvako'ti tassa nāmaṃ. cūḷā pan'assa atthi, tasmā moḷiyasīvako'ti vuccati.
Sanskrit maulika + sīvaka

Example

ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. atha kho moḷiyasīvako paribbājako yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.

SN 36.21 sīvakasuttaṃ
myāyaṃ 1

sandhi. by me this [me + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning by me this
Construction me > my + ayaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit mayā + ayam

Examples

upamā kho my'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, katā atthassa viññāpanāya. ayaṃ c'ev'ettha attho, samatittiko telapatto'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya etaṃ satiyā adhivacanaṃ.

SN 47.20 janapadakalyāṇīsuttaṃ

tassa mayhaṃ, bhikkhave, etadahosi, adhigato kho my'āyaṃ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.

MN 26 pāsarāsisuttaṃ
myāyaṃ 2

sandhi. of me this [me + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning of me this
Construction me > my + ayaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit mahyam + ayam

Example

seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, mīḷhakā gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa. purato c'assa mahāgūthapuñjo. sā tena aññā mīḷhakā atimaññeyya, aham'hi gūth'ādī gūthapūrā puṇṇā gūthassa, purato ca my'āyaṃ mahāgūthapuñjo'ti.

SN 12.67 naḷakalāpīsuttaṃ
myāyaṃ 3

sandhi. for me this [me + ayaṃ] ✓

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning for me this
Construction me > my + ayaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Sanskrit mahyāya + ayam

Examples

so evaṃ pajānāti, uppannā kho my'āyaṃ sukhā vedanā. sā ca kho paṭicca, no appaṭicca. kiṃ paṭicca? imam'eva kāyaṃ paṭicca.

SN 36.7 paṭhamagelaññasuttaṃ

tassa evaṃ hoti, yo kho my'āyaṃ puggalo iṭṭho kanto manāpo, taṃ pare iṭṭhena kantena manāpena samudācarantī'ti. so tesu pemaṃ janeti. evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, pemā pemaṃ jāyati.

AN 4.200 pemasuttaṃ
myāyaṃ 4

sandhi. to me this [me + ayaṃ] ~

Grammar sandhi, pron + pron
Meaning to me this
Construction me > my + ayaṃ
Phonetic Change e > y (Kacc 17, 19)
Commentary (SNa) my'āyan'ti mayhaṃ atthāya ayaṃ
Sanskrit mahyāya + ayam
mhita

nt. smile; chuckle; lit. smiled [√mih + ita] ~

Grammar nt, pp of √mih
Meaning smile; chuckle; lit. smiled
Root Family √mih
Root √mih×1 a (smile, chuckle)
Construction √mih > mh + ita
Derivative kita (kita)
Phonetic Change mih > mh (contraction)
Variant mihita
English Cognate smile
Sanskrit smita
Sanskrit Root √smi 1 (smile)
